Following his presidential years Roosevelt wanted to "be a boy again" so he ventured into a harrowing experience traveling an unmapped river in South America.  His son Kermit was urged by his mother to go along to "look out for father."  Kermit postponed his marriage to accompany his dad but this trip down what came to be known as "The River of Doubt" was one in which survival became very questionable.  This trip more so lives up to the book's title as "Roosevelt the Explorer" since they were literally in uncharted waters which saw things get so bad that Roosevelt resigned himself to not surviving the trip.An interesting anecdote takes place in a hotel where Roosevelt was drinking coffee.  When he was asked if he wanted another cup he asked the name of the coffee company.  When told it was Maxwell House he said he not only would like another cup but that the coffee was "good to the last drop."  This accolade immediately became the motto of Maxwell-House coffee and remains so to this day.If you enjoy hunting you will enjoy the section of the book that takes place in Africa.  The section in South America will appeal to armchair explorers.  You wouldn't have wanted to be on this trip.

Author Jonah Keri has provided us with a well-written volume on the late Montreal Expos.  Baseball history needed a book on this franchise and the author has come through with a book that is a worthy addition to your baseball library.  This book covers the birth of the team which joined the National League along with the San Diego Padres in 1969 while playing in Jarry Parc which would be a stretch to call a minor-league park.I found the book especially interesting because I organized a bus tour to Montreal for Little Leaguers in 1975 and 1980 so we got to experience both the ambiance of Jarry Parc and the sterility of Olympic Stadium.The author amply covers both the good and bad years effectively along with the difficulties involving ownership and lack of revenue sharing and big television contracts that team have now which enable them to survive which the Expos did not have the advantage of.  The Expos never lacked for stars and super stars with names such as Gary Carter, Rusty Staub, Andre Dawson, Vladiimir Guerrero, Pedro Martinez, and others which the author sprinkles with anecdotes.The author laments the loss of the Expos in Montreal which have now become the Washington Nationals.but holds out a slim hope that Montreal may once again become a major league team.  Milwaukee lost the Braves following the 1965 season and regained a team in 1970 when the Seattle Pilots transferred to Milwaukee in 1970 so perhaps some day Montreal may some day become big league once more.  The Montreal Expos had a brief run at the major league level and this book does a good job in covering their history.

Author C. Alexander Hortis has written an engaging account of the history of the mafia in New York City while debunking a number of myths that have arisen through the years.  The mob was on the verge of extinction during the decade of the 1910s but then saw a resurgence with the advent of prohibition.  With its repeal in 1933 the mafia became involved in labor unions, the sport of boxing, waterfront shipping, nightclubbing, the numbers racket, and narcotics.  Mobsters supposedly liked to deny they were involved with dope but the truth speaks otherwise.The truth about mobsters is that they really are nobodies wanting to be somebody and the oath of omerta is, and always has been, a myth.  They will speak to save their own skin and will always feel paranoid about their brothers in crime knowing that "I'd better get him before he gets me."I especially enjoyed the last two chapters which involved the assassination of "The Lord High Executioner", "The Mad Hatter" himself, Albert Anastasia in the barbershop of the Park Sheraton Hotel in October of 1957.  It has been presented in other books that two of the Gallo brothers were involved in this "hit" but author Hortis has other beliefs.  He mentions Steve Grammauta as the lead gunman but neglects to mention anyone else.  Perhaps we shall never know.  This event led to the conclave that took place in November in Apalachin, New York, at the home of Joseph Barbara Senior.  This, also, was a very interesting chapter in which, oddly enough, the oath of omerta held as the mobsters denied they'd done anything wrong in getting together to wish their friend Joesph Barbara well while a few others came up with some laughable excuses.  A number of the mobsters made a fiasco of the event by scattering through the woods to avoid the law but the authorities had absolutely nothing to hold them on.When the news of Apalachin reached the public F. B. I. Director J. Edgar Hoover finally admitted the reality regarding the mafia which he had vigorously denied the existence of.  Nobody likes to be proven wrong and Hoover had to publicly admit what he may have believed but couldn't face up to.  This, perhaps, was the most profitable outcome of the clandestine meeting of the mafia nabobs get-together as far as the authorities were concerned.The book contains a number of photographs, most of them small, in  addition to charts which the reader may or may not find interesting.  Much of America's history is infamous and this book on the New York City mobsters through 1957 is a must for your crime library.

Author Gil Bogen wrote a previous biography entitled "Tinker, Evers, and Chance--A Triple Biography" in 2003.  Although you may have read this wonderful book you may feel it not necessary to read a new separate biography on "Johnny Evers--A Baseball Life" by Dennis Snelling.  I would suggest you also include author Snelling's book in your baseball library as well.This is more than a biography on Evers but also provides the reader into insight of what baseball was like at the turn of the 20th century.  Much has been made of Franklin P. Adams' poem entitled "Baseball's Sad Lexicon" being responsible for the inclusion of Tinker, Evers, and Chance in the Baseball Hall of Fame but the author in no way attempts to sway the reader regarding any of the three  in the Baseball Hall of Fame.Evers spent his "salad" years with the Chicago Cubs and Boston Braves.  The Cubs bowed to the Chicago White Sox Hitless Wonders in the 1906 World Series and then defeated the Detroit Tigers in the World Series in 1907 and 1908.  The infamous base-running gaffe by Fred Merkle of the Giants is amply covered as well.  Evers was fortunate to have Hank O'Day as the umpire at second base for that game because it was O'Day who was the umpire at second in a previous game involving Evers when a runner was not called out for not continuing on to touch the base in a similar situation.  Any other umpire would not have called Merkle out.Evers, along with his shortstop partner "Rabbit" Maranville were the infield sparkplugs that led the Boston Braves to upset McGraw's Giants for the National League pennant in 1914 and then swept Connie Mack's Philadelphia Athletics in the World Series.  At least for me, the games the author includes in this book are presented in an interesting way whereas all too often baseball books get carried away with a play-by-play rendition that can become boring.Johnny Evers did not live an easy life.  The pressures he applied to himself in regard to winning, attempting to keep his business solvent, rehabilitating his broken leg, the break-up of his marriage, the death of his young daughter, and dealing with guilt he felt for his best friend losing his life in an automobile accident in which Evers was driving, along with his own driven personality which often led to ejections from games eventually led to Evers experiencing a mental breakdown.  Evers won a Chalmers automobile for being the MVP but he never drove an automobile after his friend was killed.  Instead Evers had his brother Joe drive him around.The book also includes photos I have never seen in other baseball books.  Johnny Evers deserves his own biography and we can thank author Dennis Snelling for providing us with this new biography of "The Trojan" or "The Crab."

I have been using iPads since tablets first came out and had very little knowledge with android, so this IRULU tablet was definitely out of the ordinary for me.  After owning two iPads, I wasn't very optimistic about me loving this tablet or even liking it, but I was shocked at the quality of it.  Once I learned a bit about android and how they work and reading the instructions, I was geared up to fully test out this tablet.  It's a thick tablet that is white on the back and the screen on the front is outlined in black. It's longer than my iPad, but slimmer and more narrow as well. It's comfortable to use and not too heavy to carry.One of the things I love most about my apple products is their touch screen sensitivity is spot on, and this tablet was just as fast clicking on things, I didn't have to sit and wait for a page to load, it was almost Instant.  I don't have to press repeatedly to get the screen to recognize my tap either.  It's definitely not the speed of my iPad but it is pretty nice and works well.  I use it to watch videos on YouTube, general browsing on the web, or checking my Facebook. I was a bit sad that I couldn't get some apps to run on there and since I'm still learning the ropes of an android I'm sure I can find a way to watch on my favorite apps. I don't do much game playing so I can't account for how well it works for playing games.I love the clarity of the screen and how large it is.  It is great for watching since the screen is so long.  I have used it watching Netflix and YouTube.  I like that it has internal memory of 16GB and expandable storage with a Micro SD.  The tablet also has 1GB ram which I think is an improvement from many of the cheaper tablets that do not have as much (RAM affects the speed performance of the tablet).One of my favorite features on this tablet is that I can connect my Bluetooth headphones to it.  The Bluetooth on the tablet is amazing for me!!! I love watching late at night and since I don't have a TV in my bedroom, I use the tablet now instead of my phone and I obviously don't want to wake up my husband or kids, so I can place the tablet on a tablet stand and use my Bluetooth headset without being tethered to a headset that isn't Bluetooth capable.The tablet also has a front facing camera of 0.3 MP and a back camera with 2 MP. I won't be using the tablet for photos, but if I wanted to, the resolution isn't as great as id like. Although having two cameras isn't common for a tablet that low budget tablet.Along with all of the mentioned attributes, the tablet also has a mini HDMI out to connect to the TV, GPS capabilities, cables that support numerous features on the tablet.I am sad to say that with all the great features that the tablet includes, that it somehow slipped through my fingers and fell to the ground, only about a foot, onto hardwood flooring. I was so worried about it happening and then it did, the screen cracked the tablet now has a crack on the corner. I am still able to use the tablet, just wish that it came with some kind of case that you could use since it's a budget tablet, you'd have trouble finding a case for it.  Otherwise I'm very impressed with the functionality of the tablet.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I'm a fashionista at heart and I love clothes.  I have two closets full and well, I can't sort through them as easily as I used to be able to, so I often go through purging the old items when I get in new clothing.  I have dozens of different types of hangers in my closet and some are wooden, some have slots for tank tops, and some even have grips to keep shirts from slipping, but quite honestly don't work all that well. I hate when I'm searching in my closet and something slips and falls off the hanger.  With these hangers, I won't be having that issue any longer.The hangers come in a pack of 50, they're great quality and very sturdy. They're non-slip, very thin, and save a ton of room in my closet.  I hung so many different articles of clothing on here and each one fit so perfectly.  From fur coats, evening gowns with heavy beading, little black dresses, to casual tops and pants with no issues.  The pants part doesn't sag to get pulled down like plastic or metal hangers do.  They velvet held up even my off shoulder tops and dresses and didn't let them slide off like my old hangers did.My evening gowns stay on and I don't even need to use the string inside for clothing for keeping them in place. I will definitely be purchasing a few more sets of these hangers for my husbands closet as well.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this because i loved thee sequin sleeves on it.  I ordered a large and it fits well, almost a bit snug, not like the photo.  If I had sized up to an XL l think I would've gotten a better fit.  The fabric is a good quality, thick, and soft that has a stretch to it.  The part on the elbows has sequins on it, but the sequins aren't lined by the material of the shirt.  Instead its a really itchy material that makes it very uncomfortable to wear. Maybe when I shed a few pounds I'll be happier with the shirt, right now I still love it just wish I had gotten a size larger.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this for my sister who wears a size XS/S and got the medium as suggested by the size chart, but I wish I had gone up in size even more to maybe the large. A big garbage truck strolling down our street gets the kids so excited, and I knew they would love this WolVol 4 Channel Electric Remote Control Take Apart Garbage Truck Toy with Lights and flip top can. I have REALLY oily hair and have had so much trouble over the years getting volume in my hair.  I have tried volumizing sprays, volumizing shampoos, etc. and nothing worked well for me.  It would work for the time that I styled my hair, but overtime throughout the day, it would be as if I didn't use any products whatsoever.  I have never used dry shampoo before and was unsure of the results I would get or how it even worked.  After reading the directions, I sprayed it into my hair when it was oily and needed a wash to see if it would give it a fresh look.  After spraying it, I ran my fingers through my hair to distribute the dry shampoo everywhere and then styled it.  It worked well and gave me a better look, it didn't exactly look as clean as an actual wash with shampoo, but it did work well and volumized my hair really well.  I could see this being an excellent product for camping, someone who is unable to get up and take showers often like the elderly.  It also has a great scent to it, a light lavender scent that makes my hair smell good too.The conditioner I used on only the ends of my hair as I do with regular shampoo.  In my opinion, the conditioner is not something I would use regularly since my hair is already oily and shiny on its own, I don't need an extra conditioner.  If someone has dry, dull hair, the conditioner would be great to use in addition with the shampoo. Overall, this is an excellent duo of products which work really well.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

i love the look of the sweater knit dress, but I've never had one before.  I was expecting a bit of a thicker material when I hear the words sweater knit but its actually a thin sweater like material.  I was actually hoping to wear this dress for the fall with a cute jean jacket, but its a bit too thin for that so I'll be leaving it for the winter.  Its a beautiful dress, and looks exactly as pictured, at midi length beneath the knee.  I'm normally a large and it fits me since it has a really good stretch to it, but it does cling to your body and shows every curve.  I definitely need to wear shape wear when wearing this dress.  Its a ribbed looking sweater material and a medium grey speckled color.  The dress has a keyhole in the neckline and is strapless.  The dress is very feminine and pretty, I love how it looks on when I have my shape wear on.  I also recommend wearing some kind of slip beneath it because it is a bit see through in some areas, and in all honesty, I think it looks better on me with the slip since ti doesn't directly cling to me, I have something beneath that give it a smoother look. Overall, this is a sexy, feminine, and well made dress, a bit thinner than expected in material, but still beautiful!Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I am on a quest to lose weight after having baby number three.  I'm a fashionista at heart and love clothing and accessories, so working out can't be any different for me, or I will lose interest in wanting to go to the gym.  I can dress myself fashionably and pull over this slim fit hoodie over my workout attire on my way to the gym.  Its a nice quality and warm material that isn't bulky or thick like traditional hoodies.  The neckline is a v-neck, which is a nice difference from most hoodies as well.  Unlike most hooded shirts, this one does not have a drawstring around the the trim of the hoodie, which I love.  Since, I'm a mom to a little baby, extra handing cords, threads or drawstrings are something I try to avoid right now.The pullover hoodie is so comfortable to wear, it fits perfectly but if you want a loose fit, size up.  I wanted mine fitted as it showed here and ordered my normal size, but be sure to read their size chart to ensure you're getting the proper size for your measurements. It is perfect for this fall weather we have been having here in the Midwest lately.  I love the hoodie and how stylish it looks in comparison to a traditional hooded sweater.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love the shark steam mop! This is the second shark I've owned and I'm still a happy customer! The steam mop was really easy to set up and assemble on my own without needed directions. The bottom base has a reservoir for water, that when plugged in, will warm up and then release from the bottom to steam clean the floors. I use this on my hardwood floors as well as my ceramic tile.  If you pump the handle up and down a bit it will create more steam for the hard to clean areas on the floor. I love the mop and have been using it often.  Only thing is that it only comes with one mop pad.  I would've loved an extra one but it didn't have one with it.Purchased win my own money. A review was not required.

Ever have a nosey coworker, friend, or family member that you don't want reading your texts or seeing who is calling you.  If so, this case is perfect for you! If you step away for a couple of seconds and they try to snoop, you can hear it being quickly slammed shut and you have caught them! Ok, on a more serious note, the case functions well, the exterior of the case is a leather material with a front logo. The inside of the cover feels like a suede material.  The phone it's clamps into a plastic shell that holds your phone in place.  All ports and buttons of my iPhone 6 are accessible with the case.  The case is also supposed to fold into a stand when placed horizontally, so far I haven't been able go get it to stand up as the photos show, hopefully as I break in the case more it will no longer be an issue for me.  Overall, this is wonderful case and fits my phone well.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I have a belly after having 3 kids and was afraid these high waist stretchy leggings would not look nice one me.  I  expecting them to be more of a liquid legging, but they're not they're a shiny thin fabric with a zippered waist.  I also was a bit weary of the one size, since I am not stick thin, I was afraid they would be too tight, they're actually quite comfortable.  They're not see through like some of the other leggings I have, but they're not thick and warm either.  They actually helped cinch my waist a bit and were really nice on.  I did wear a longer top so the zipper didn't show too much, but it didn't matter much to me about the zipper.  Also, I wore high waist under garments, the zipper can be cold and uncomfortable against my skin, so I wore something to cover it up and make it more comfortable to wear.  Overall these are a nice pair of leggings,  I wouldn't say they're the best quality, but they definitely look nice and fit well on me.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

We have so many Legos in our house that I constantly step on them doing the crazy dance across the living room holding my foot from stepping on one.  With that said, I'm still a sucker for Legos myself and love building things with my kids.  I wasn't exactly sure these would be the authentic Lego brand but they certainly were.  They came in a set of 100 which is a great addition to our Lego collection.  My kids have been playing with these Legos non stop since they came in.  The Legos come in an assortment of different colors, sizes, and shapes.  As stated before, they are indeed authentic and have the Lego logo written on the round raised "peg" like part on the Lego bricks.We have spent hours playing with them, they fit right into our existing collection of Legos.  I like that there are many round pieces in the assortment we received.  My children love building cars, fake stick figures, and bicycles, so these round pieces really come in handy. I have no pictures in my house since we just moved in not too long ago.  I needed to get some family pictures up in our home to be decorative while allowing up to have photos of our family up on our walls.  I have a very modern and sleek style to my home and was worried that this may be a cheap wooden frame like some of the ones I have owned over the years that break easily and need replacing often.  This certainly isn't the case.  The black wood frame have 7 slots that each holds a 4x6 photo perfectly.  They don't slide out or shift from the frame since each slot is separate from the other and they aren't flat next to one another, which I am so happy with.  The frame is VERY sturdy and well made.  It has the hanging hooks in the back on each end of the frame to allow you to hang it up either horizontally or vertically.  Its a great way to fit a bunch of pictures onto one frame without cluttering up your wall.  I am very happy with the quality and how beautiful the frame is.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

As a parent to three children, I know all too well the mess that can become of my kids clothing after a meal.  Especially the messier meals such as spaghetti, that my kids request at least once a week.  I don't normally use bibs with my older toddlers, they don't want to feel like a baby, so these bibs with sleeves are the perfect solution.  They think they're wearing another shirt that when they're done I can easily remove it.The bibs come in a pack of two that are different colors.  One of the bibs is blue while the other bib is yellow.  They have sleeves which I love since my oldest son loves wiping his dirty face on his sleeves.  They tie in the back by the neck like an apron.  I don't tie them tight just in a bow to keep it on while they're eating their meals.  There is a pocket at the bottom of the bib that is supposed to work as a food catcher.  I have not found this to work well, so my kids use it as a little pocket to put their little toys in while they are eating.I have also used these as a smock to keep them clean when finger painting.  The cleanup was so much easier and I was able to wash their hands and then remove the bibs and clean them.  The best part...No dirty clothing covered in paint when wearing these bibs.  I can't believe I never used a bib with sleeves before this.  I highly recommend this for any parent of an infant or young toddler.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My son is not crawling just yet, he is 4 months old, but he's very active.  He has been rolling around from stomach to back, and will be only a matter of time until he figures out how to go about doing back to stomach, then crawling.  In my old house where my older children grew up in, we had carpeting, so crawling wasn't a concern for them.  We moved a few months ago and our home is all hardwood and the kitchen is ceramic.  There is only one room in our home with carpeting.  When I saw these knee pads, I thought they were a bit funny looking at first, but then quickly realized they're going to be quite useful in our new home for him.The knee pads come in a pack of three sets (6 knee pads in total), with each set being a different color.  One set is blue, another is green, and the third set is pink.  I tested them out on the palms on my hands to see how padded they are.  They are comfortable and protected my skin and palms  when I tested them while crawling on my hands and knees.  I do wish they had gender options to allow me to choose boy colors, or girl colors or even a more gender neutral tone to them.  I have not washed them but these would be something I would hand wash and let them air dry.  They are like a sock material and are breathable material to not irritate his baby skin. I will definitely update my review once my son is crawling and used them for some time, for now i'm extremely happy with these knee pads and their quality.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

From a car accident years back, I have been left with back and hip pain.  I use a pillow behind my back when sitting because my lower back gets a lot of pain in.  I placed this in the chair I normally sit on and it helps me so much when sitting up.  I do a lot of my housework like cutting up salads and prepping for dinner.  Standing is hard on my back, so sitting is more helpful for me and now I have the lumbar support cushion.  Its a breathable mesh lumbar cushion that helps alleviate back pain.I liked that I can take it with me wherever since its portable and small that it doesn't take up much room.  Its also very comfortable and well made.  It is a memory foam pillow covered with a breathable mesh fabric.  The lumbar pillow doesn't get hot or irritating behind you, its very soft and squishy and conforms to your back when behind you.  The mesh cover is a zippered removable cover that I can take it off and wash it when it needs.  I do not recommend washing the pillow itself since it is memory foam.  I love this lumbar pillow and how much it helps my back.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Seems like everywhere I turn in my house I see a minion toy, comforter, pillow, or something minions!  When I saw the minion USB flash drive wearing a super hero Captain American costume, it only seemed natural that I had to have it too. My boys think its the coolest little thing that the minion can even work on mommy and daddy's computer.  The flash drive is a 4GB USB, I have had no problems using it on my Windows 8 computer and laptop.  I saved a few pictures on the flash drives and opened them on a different computer, they opened fairly quickly without any error messages or empty files.  While I'd love a larger capacity with the flash drive, the 4GB will be fine for transferring small files and photos from one computer to the next.  For larger files I have an external hard drive that I can save and store files and photos on.  My husband also uses it sometimes for his work when needing to print something up he can save it on the flash drive until he is ready to print it up.  Its a fun and unique way to store or transfer files.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My kids love slinky's and always get them tangled up and I'm out buying a new set of them.  I usually head to the dollar store, but the ones my dollar store carries now are metal, and with toddlers, I didn't feel they were as safe to play with as the plastic ones.  I searched numerous stores and didn't find any good quality ones that weren't made of sharp plastic at the ends.  Naturally, I searched on Amazon and I found this pack of three.  First, I was extremely happy that they came three in a pack.  I have two toddlers and a newborn, obviously the newborn wont be needing one, so I had a back up in case one of my toddlers tangled theirs up.  The slinky's are indeed the original Slinky Jr. brand, the set came in the three colors exactly as pictured: Red, Green, and Blue.  Again, my kids were beyond excited since their favorite colors are red and blue.They have been playing with the slinky for about a month, while they've tangled a bit, nothing to were they were extremely ruined and I couldn't fix.  The plastic is thick and good quality, not cheap dollar store plastic.  They're so much fun to watch them fall down the stairs, my boys have such a laugh with them.  The quality is great and love that its a pack of three.  It was a bit of a fight to let myself purchase these at nearly a $10 price point when I've primarily purchased Slinky's or off brand ones from the dollar store, but the quality definitely is worth the extra dollars.  My boys are so happy with their slinky's, making me a happy mommy!  Great buy and I'll be back buying more around Christmas time for stocking stuffers!!This was a personal purchase with my own money, I was in no way obligated to leave a review.

This cardigan is much prettier in person!  I got the Mocha in an XL and it fits comfortably.  I normally wear a large, but I always like to size up for my cardigans and jackets because i'm very busty.  The cardigan is a nice, soft, stretchy material that is 94% rayon and 6% spandex.  It's lightweight and not thick and bulky which I love because I tend to get hot rather quickly and don't like having a huge thick cardigan on.  It has a tie waist that is attached onto the cardigan, exactly at my waist.  The tie is the perfect length and not too short or too long.  It adds a beautiful style, depending on how you tie it, to the front of the cardigan.  The sleeve length is a bit long for me, I don't have really long arms or chubby arms, but I don't mind the extra fabric, it does come to the middle of my hand and keeps my hands warn as well.  The front fabric on the cardigan drapes down in a really pretty asymmetrical style and the back falls straight without any bunching up like the front does.  The cardigan is made of quality fabric, its very flattering and hides my midsection, while giving me curves in the right places.  It comes down to the middle of my thigh from front and back.  Even though its a lightweight cardigan, it is also very warm for the fall months.  It was a bit wrinkled from the package, but a quick steam and I was ready to go!  I paired my mocha colored cardigan with dark wash jeans, a black tank top and over the knee black and brown boots.  I love dressing up for fall and this is a great addition to my fall wardrobe!Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I'm a sucker for maxi dresses and love the way they fit on me.  I have been purchasing more of them lately and was excited to try this one one. I am trying to lose weight, so this will definitely be worn more next year when the summer rolls around again and I've lost more weight.The material is very soft and comfortable, it has two thin spaghetti straps to hold up the dress. I love the charcoal grey color with the white stripes. It's very flattering on and making me feel really feminine. It does reach at my ankles so either size up or wear really cute shoes!Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Such a thick and great quality pie plate!  During this time of year (fall) I love making apple and pumpkin pie! In fact I'm the designated pie maker for Thanksgiving because everyone knows how much I love making them.  This pie pan is a clear glass bowl.  On the rim it has a beautiful rim that has a wavy look to it.  I placed it in my oven to bake my pie and didn't even have to line it with an aluminum pie pan like some of my other pans.It was really easy to scoop out a slice and not have it get stuck on. Like any other parent of toddlers, I have an abundance of toddler plates that either have worked great or just sit in the cabinet and not get used.  Of course my sons both love the character plates that are usually plastic with some decal on it.  Well after multiple uses and cleaning by hand as well as the dishwasher, the decal bubbles up and starts go rip off.  What exactly is under there to make that decal adhesive, I have no idea? Is it safe for my toddler? Probably not, so I end up tossing them out.These plates are made of silicone with three sections. One larger section that is one half of the plate for the main course and two smaller sections that are the other half of the plate that are perfect for sides or dipping sauces. The plates come in a pack of three and are different colors The rims on the sides of the plates come up and keep things from falling out so easily. They're a bit heavier to handle then their plastic plates but these are definitely much better quality and perfect for my toddler boys to bring to the sink when they're done with their food. The plates wipe off and clean easily and can be placed in the dishwasher for easy cleaning.  We love these plates and it worked out perfectly that we have three kids and they are in a pack. They're also stackable which takes up less space in our cabinets, what more could I ask for? Overall, great plates that will last much longer than the plastic ones!Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I hate clutter so much, I have been organizing my shopping bags by putting them in a bigger bag for storage and hanging it behind my pantry door.  It wasn't "pretty" but it worked for the time being.  I kept saying I needed to find an alternative solution for these grocery bags and kept forgetting when I would be at the store.  This oval organizer has saved me from a door handle full of clutter.  I was able to fit so many bags in here that I was really impressed that the suction cups held up the organizer as well as it did.  I wasn't sure that I'd find a place to put the organizer since it is a bit bulky.  I certainly didn't want it suctioned it onto my refrigerator, or anywhere open to the public.  I tried the wall and they didn't stick (no surprise, but I tried!), so I tried the inside of my kitchen cabinets, and to my surprise it actually suctioned really well on the inside of the cabinet.  I did have to move some things aside for it to fit in without knocking things down or pushing them away.The Oval Organizer was easy to assemble.  I did think it could've been sturdier, but I still love it and works for exactly what I need it for, storing plastic shopping bags.  There are a variety of different hole sizes and you can pull from any slot not just the top.  This would also make a great way to store your light weight scarves.  You can easily see the colors and fabrics through the slots and pick which one you'd like.  Overall, I'm very happy with this organizer and how it helps me contain my clutter better than my DIY was helping me.  I have had this inside of my kitchen cabinet for a few days, and it has yet to fall off or loosen its suction even with opening and closing the cabinet multiple times.  This is such a useful organizer and can be used for so many different things, you honestly can't go wrong with this, you will LOVE it!Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My husband loves drinking shakes after his workouts.  This shaker bottle is perfect for him to grab and go.  It has a rubberized grip that he says is great.  It also features a flip that secures closes and opens by simply tugging on it.  its an all black blender bottle that is slightly see through with the NutraFx logo on the front in gold. My husband is a residential appraiser, he often has to take measurements of houses to ensure that the measurements are accurate.  Sometimes people update their homes and are up not updated in the system.  When a lender is giving out a mortgage, or doing a refinance, they often want to do an appraisal.  Depending on the scope of work they're looking for, my husband needed a good quality measuring tape.  I had bought a 25 foot one and it wasn't long enough, my mistake.  So he asked me to find a longer measuring tape that was also an engineer tape.  I set out on Amazon and found this measuring tape.  It accurately measures up to 33 feet and recoils back great.  It has a lock feature if he wants to lock the tape at his measurement until he can write it down.One downside is if any dirt or grime gets inside the tape, the recoil is affected by it. Just be sure to keep it clean and away from dirt and grime and you'll be very happy with this measuring tape.  The neon color of the tape is also highly visible in the night, although he isn't usually measuring houses parameters in the dark.  It has all the proper markings for an engineers tape and he's very happy with it.**Purchased this with my own money, I was in no way obligated to review this. All thoughts and opinions are honest and unbiased.

This makeup brush set is one of the best that I own.  The bristles are so soft, yet give me a great application.  They do smell a bit like plastic which they mention as soon as you open the package.  Its easy to get rid of the smell by cleaning them before your first application.  I guess I may have been lucky and actually got 11 pieces in my set, I got an extra eye brush.  The brush set was easy to wash but the bristles did take long to dry.  They're handle is thick which I like, and no bristles fell out when I washed them.  The handles are black and silver and the bristles are black and grey.  I used them for liquid and powder foundation on different applications and I was able to achieve flawless applications with both liquid and powder.  I do use additional brushes to get my full face of makeup put on.  I'm a bit picky with my brushes and my application.  If you're looking for a full face brush set, you might want to add a few other brushes in the mix, like an eyebrow brush and a better blush brush. The quality is fantastic, and better than I expected.  These are not only great for personal use, but also professional use and would hold up really well.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

When I got pregnant with my oldest son, I started to get bloated and retaining water.  My hands and feet would swell so horribly that even wearing my wedding bridal set was becoming uncomfortable.  That didn't stop me from wearing it, although I wish it did.  I ended up having my rings cut, and haven't gotten them fixed more than 4 years later.  I wanted to still wear a band or something on my finger, I was so used to wearing a ring that it felt so odd to have a bare finger.  I wore a band until recently when one of my diamonds fell out, talk about not having luck!I fell in love with this bridal set the second I laid eyes on it.  The picture looked beautiful and I couldn't wait to see it in person and wear it.  My real diamond wedding ring is also 1.5 ct with stones on the band, so I was able to see the size comparison which is perfect.  The center store is really pretty and glistens so beautifully.  The photos on here really don't show its elegance and beauty.  The ring has stones on the band on the top half of the ring.  The stones on the band are on all sides, the top and both sides, so whichever way you move your hand, you will have a beautifully, shining ring.  The bottom half is plain with no stones or design, but the gold plated ring shines without having any stones on it at all.  The bottom of the ring is also a bit flat towards the inside of your hand, which in my opinions makes it more comfortable then my real diamond ring.  The band has a little bit of a indentation on it that allows the ring with the center stone fit into it perfectly.  The ring to an untrained eye looks very real and "believable".  If I didn't know it was a CZ ring set, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference if it was real or not.  It is and 18kt gold plated ring with rhodium to keep from tarnishing.  It is simply beautiful and I am so excited to finally be able to wear a bridal set again.  One day I'll actually get my ring fixed, but until then, I'll happily wear these rings and none will be the wiser.  If you're one that is likely to lose jewelry, not wanting to wear your real jewelry on vacation, or just someone who would rather save money on a ring and splurge on a new home or your honeymoon, I highly recommend this beautiful set.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I normally carry a cross body purse for everyday use.  While I love how lightweight the cross body bags are, they lack room for me to put more than my wallet and keys inside.  This leaves me with few necessities that I'd like to have on hand.This purse is big but not huge.  It's a normal sized tote bag with a nice leather tan finish.  There are two thin straps that allow you to wear on your arm, shoulder or carry by the handles. The inside of the bag is spacious with lots of room for much more things than just my keys and wallet.  I can toss in a few beauty products for touch ups throughout the day without hoping to make the zipper bust open like I do with my cross body bags.  The top of the bag has a zipper closure.  I own a similar designer brand purse that looks similar but the top has a magnetic closure.  The zipper works well, doesn't get stuck and slides with ease.  This far exceeds the magnetic button and how it helps me by having a zipper. If my purse tips over in the car I don't worry about finding everything that's fallen out.There are also a few pockets inside the bag for extra organization.  Overall, I truly love this bag in terms of size and functionality!Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My boys are ages 2 and 4 and are the typical kids who love having their night lights to keep "monsters" away.  Regardless the numerous times I have told them that monsters don't exist, the dark is scary to them and so we use night lights to show them there isn't anything scary in their room.  The Abco Tech ocean wave night light projector is so cool.  My kids love the light and how cool it looks.  The projector gives an image of an ocean like effect onto the ceiling.  It projects the ocean image with movement alternating colors of red, blue, and green, as well as a mix of the three colors.  You're able to choose the setting that you would like and it will stay active for an hour, so no need to get up and turn it back on.  My kids usually fall asleep within the first 15-20 minutes of being in bed.  The unit is white with a clear cover to allow it to project.The projector is really nice on its own, it doesn't necessarily have to be used in a child's bedroom.  This could be used for relaxation as well and I can also plug in my iPhone with the AUX cable provided and the internal speakers in the projector will play music. I play some soothing music and can lay down and relax or meditate.  I like to play the ocean sounds to give the effect of a real ocean or wave sound.  Its really soothing and a great night light projector.  It covers a good portion of the ceiling and some of the side of the wall since its usually on a table or nightstand and not in the center of the room.  My sons room ceiling could probably be covered entirely with the projector if it was centered in the middle of the room.One downfall would be that the cord is fairly short.  I could of course use an extension cord, but I hate having extra wire and cluttering up a room.  The projector can also be used with batteries, but I usually use an outlet, I wouldn't have enough batteries to keep this on for as long as we do.  I haven't tried that feature yet, but its a great option in the events of a power outage, we wont have kids who are terrified at night.  The lights are beautiful and captivating.  My sons love this and so do I, on the rare occasions that I'm able to use it.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I have been using a shower chair for quite a few years.  Ever since I was in a major car accident, standing or walking for long periods of time are hard on me.  We recently moved and my shower chair unfortunately broke in our move. My old chair was a chair style and a bit bigger and bulkier.  To replace it, I got this shower stool.  It doesn't have a back support which I didn't think was a big deal since I'm not usually in the shower for hours.  The stool was extremely easy to assemble on my own with no help from anyone. It comes in three big pieces, two legs and the stool chair. The legs adjust to your desired height to make it comfortable for you.  The chair is much smaller and easier to take in and out of the bathtub. It has helped me a ton with not being able to stand for long periods of time and I'm in the shower.  It is much safer for me to use in the shower and I don't have to worry about getting tired from standing and toppling over, which has happened.  The top of the shower stool is white and the legs are metal with rubber grips on the bottom to keep it from slipping.  It's also very easy to clean with warm soapy water and a rinse.Not only is this a great help for me when i'm in the shower, my sons, who are toddlers, also love this stool.  My husband gives them haircuts, and they always want to sit on mommy's stool to get their haircut.  This is a much better way to get them to want a haircut compared to them running around not wanting one at all, which used to be the case.  I can adjust the height of the chair to be suitable for them to hop off and on and be at a good height for my husband to also be able to cut their hair.Overall, this chair is perfect, small, and easy to clean.  I couldn't ask for a better shower stool! I highly recommend it for anyone with back, and leg problems as well as pregnant women.  I wish I had this stool during all my pregnancies to sit and get my feet up for once! Great product!Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I am large busted and have a lot of trouble finding comfortable bras.  I'm a 38D/DD depending on how "full" I am the cup size grows.  I went according to the size chart and ordered a L/XL, which fit me perfectly.  I am currently nursing my 3 month old son and this bra is extremely comfortable as well as supportive.  I got the black bra and it is perfect for nursing both during day and night.  I personally prefer to not wear a bra at night which is horrible when nursing and hurts so bad, but all of the nursing bra's I own weren't comfortable to wear during the night so I opted to not wear one, until now.The bra has a eye and hook closure in the back that is wide and comfortable and not just a thin strap in the back.  The nursing bra is also a stretchy fabric that makes it perfect for early on breastfeeding when your breast size changes drastically.  The straps have a hook like most nursing bras to open the panel and allow for nursing.  One thing I didn't like is that its a one panel bra, so once its unhooked, you're left a bit exposed.  Its hard to nurse publicly with the bra because of the one panel.  The bra also has no padding, so you're a bit exposed in that department as well.  Your nipple does show through a bit when you're wearing this bra.  Personally I use this bra at home and at night, so this isn't a huge issue for me.  The bra is very comfortable and a nice breathable material even during the summer months.  I really love the fabric and quality of this bra, I just wish it had a bit of padding to give me a bit more coverage.Another thing that completely amazed me was that the bra came with reusable heart shaped breast pads as well as some disposable ones. I did not see that mentioned but was great to be able to use in the bra to help hide the nipple. They also provided a sample nipple cream and I loved all of them. They put great care into their products and loved being able to test out their other products as well with the freebie samples they provided.Promotional discount provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

One thing that many know about lightening cables is no matter how well I take care of my cables, one day, the ends begin to slowly rip apart until they're no longer usable.  I have been using my current lightening cable until it was hanging off a thread, literally! My husband kept telling me I was going to get shocked by the cable, but I didn't have one.  Well now I can say that I have three to replace that one cable that was barely hanging on.  My husband is no longer worried that I will electrocute myself with my old cable.  I have tried all three cables and each one of them charges my phone to a full charge within the same amount of time as my other original cable did.  The cables are a good length at 3 feet and don't tangle up.  They look like many of the other cables that are a plastic cord with a USB on one end and an 8 pin lightening cable on the other end.  Good quality and no error message with them since they're apple certified cables.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I love this two layer lunch box! It has two sides, one for a larger portion meal such as a sandwich.  This larger area had a cover that snaps into place. Now it's definitely not waterproof or sealed shut so I don't recommend anything like soups or with a liquid in them to be used inside this lunch box.  The other side of the lunch box has no cover but two separate compartments. One compartment is larger and is 2/3 of the container and the other compartment is 1/3 of the container.When packing lunch I can place everything in one container which is so convenient and keeps me from packing multiple containers. The lunch box folds to be a large cube.  It holds a good amount of food for lunch including snacks and sides. I like that I can just pop it into the top rack of the dishwasher when done and have a clean lunch box ready for the next day.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

Im very OCD and love things to keep my home organized.  I am fortunate enough to have two kitchens in my home. One in the basement as well as my main kitchen.  The basement kitchen is actually a smaller kitchenette but I have all of my necessities down there since we spend lots of time down there as well.  My larger canister set is in my main kitchen, so I needed something to have in my basement.This ceramic mason jars by vikalis are wonderful! They're about the size of a mug, not too big and don't take up much room on my countertop.  The are perfect size for my kitchenette and also match my colorful theme down there.  The set comes with 4 jars with each lid being a different color: red, blue, green, and purple.One thing I love about this jar set is that they have a chalk board painted onto them.  I can easily label them with the chalk provided inside each little jar.  The chalk writes well onto the chalk paint and makes the jars look so organized with its contents written on the front of the jar.  It's easy to wipe off.  They're perfect size for my kitchenette, I love them!Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

I'm an absolute perfectionist and neat freak!! I hate having my things unorganized, especially when traveling.  My friends and family tease me for being OCD, I think it makes me live easier.  I can find exactly what I'm looking for in a matter of seconds, and let's face it, even I'm paying to be on vacation, I'm not looking to waste any time.This organizer is every near freaks best friend!  Different pockets and pouches for things such as oral care, hair brushes, makeup, makeup brushes, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion.  The organizer has a hanger hook at the top to hang in your closet or even over the shower head to have all your items with you.This organizer holds a substantial about of products and it's made extremely well from the hanger hook down to all the zippers made structurally well.  I also like that the organizer folds down easy when not in use to keep it from taking up room in ur closet.Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

My son is three months old and has already begun teething.  He is constantly putting his hands in his mouth and gnawing on anything that can give him relief.  I love wearing jewelry and with an infant it's not really possible, they tend to grab and pull with all their force.  Their grip is pretty strong so I alway fear they'll snap my fine jewelry items, so I don't wear them anymore.  I still love costume jewelry that I wouldn't care if they broke, until I found teething jewelry.  Fashionable and functions for a dual purpose of helping my son teethe.This silicone baby teething necklace is great quality and beautiful looking.  It is an ivory and mint green color necklace with a matching mint bracelet.  The necklace beads are knotted individually to keep them from pinching a baby between each bead and also from unraveling all the beads.  It is a very strong and sturdy necklace and seems unlikely that a baby can tear of ruin it.  The bracelet is just as great and I can even take it off and hand it to him to hold and teethe with.I love that they're safe for baby chewing, BPA free, and that I can toss them into the dishwasher to be cleaned and sanitized for the next use.  Great set and looks beautiful!Complimentary sample provided in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.

It seems like a great product, when it works. Unfortunately that's only once, for two of them I've had. The first one I got only worked once, then the UV light would no longer illuminate, since the first day. I could monitor it draining the batteries on my fluke, slowly, until they went well below 1v from 1.62v - no UV.. The second one I got would light up everytime I closed the lid, however it would never stop. It would keep the UV light on until the batteries died, which was about 2hrs (instead of the ~5min it should run for). Essentially every single time I wanted to use this I had to replace the batteries.. I don't think I'll try for a third, I've already wasted 10x AAA batteries testing and trying to get these to work as expected. There's a lot of DOA's and early failures for this unit, perhaps it's a recent manufacturing change, I don't know. They need to fix their QC or engineering of this product/manufacturing process. I gave it two stars *extremely* generously, because IF it does work - it's probably? great.

When I originally purchased this off Amazon they had the wrong item in stock and three times shipped me a 26700-312-LED microscope stand.. However I think they corrected this problem now (and updated the listing), I ended up returning all of them and ordering directly from the manufacture.The 26502-LED is awesome! I replaced an older 90led magnifying lamp I had that the LED circuitry died on and I definitely like this more for several reasons :1) It has an actual brand name.2) It has a one year warranty (the other had none).3) The LED's are SIGNIFICANTLY brighter. This one I measured at 9.2w, the other was 5.8w.4) The LED is a much more pure white color temperature @ 4786k. The other is noticably more bluish probably around 5500-6000k.5) The lens seems higher quality, the "edges" dont seem as distorted (apart from their convex nature) as the other one.6) It comes with a free swing away 5x diopter lens that sits on top the main 5x lens, which doubles the magnification. This is extremely useful for reading fine print on IC's.7) All parts are replaceable from a manufacture who ships within 24hrs. Clamps, LED lights, power supply, etc.8) The top does NOT get as hot as the other one after a few hours of use, uses an external dc adapter.9) The clamp is a bit stronger holding (although read below).10) It has an open slot towards the front end of the magnifying lamp that aids in quick and easy pulling and moving around.The only thing I really don't like about this and from what I can tell it's true with all magnifying clamp lights. Is the clamp itself. This is a metal clamp with a plastic jacket over the top. The screw that applies pressure can easily bend the 1/8" metal theyre using as a base, which doesnt really allow you to get a "max" tightness. As a result in extreme extended positions there is some movement of the clamp. If it were me I wouldve designed a wider clamp with two screws instead of one and a thicker metal that didnt bend as easy. Maybe some day I'll get around to modding it.I'm an engineer and intend to use this nearly everyday, so I definitely think it was worth the extra money for the extra quality.

I bought this then shortly after received a Contigo Autoseal West Loop Stainless Steel Travel Mug with Open-Access Lid as a gift.Comparing the two this one has it's pros: -This keeps coffee hot a good 1+ hours longer then the Contigo, lasting a good 4-6hrs depending on external temperature, how often it's opened, and the temperature of the liquid. If you like to let your coffee cool down before drinking it - poor it in a different mug first! -It also fits under my Keurig K60/K65 Special Edition Single Serve Coffee Maker without problem, where the 20oz Autoseal does not (I'm sure the 16oz Contigo would fit no problem). -The base of this is narrower at 2 1/2in, vs the 2 7/8 of the Autoseal, which might matter if you have small cup holders. -It seals tight and never leaks, just like the Autoseal. Never had a problem with either.It also has it's cons: -The lid on this one is awkward, it's smooth with nothing really to grab on to, and has an extremely tight fit. Opening it takes more hand strength then a coffee mug ever should. The Auto seal has a rubber edge on the lid and an oblong button protruding that gives you great grip for easy opening. -The open/close mechanism on the lid requires you to kid of stick your pointer finger in  the lid and push it, then move your hand back to a natural drinking grip. The Autoseal has a thumb button so you don't have to move your hand out of a natural drinking position to open/close it, making it easier and more comfortable. -The autoseal is 20oz where this model is only available in 16oz. -More difficult to take the lid apart and clean it thoroughly then the Autoseal, in my opinion.So it definitely is a great mug and depending on your needs may or may not be the better option. I prefer the Autoseal usually, however this gets used by someone in our house very frequently.

These gloves are great! I've worn them everyday this winter when going outside pretty much. When I go to my car, work or grocery store, I have these on. They're very warm and very comfortable. I can wear them down to probably 10-20f by themselves, without needing another glove on top (unless I'm outside for very long periods of time without any activity). They're not great in high winds, but the wool in them makes them very warm otherwise.The touch screen pointer and thumb are very useful, and I've never had any issues using a small touch screen (like a phone) likewise works well with car head unit touchscreen, alarm panel touchscreen, tablets, etc. The size was a bit off I think: I usually wear a small and even with Outdoor Research Sensor gloves small fit me well - however with these I had to return the small for a medium. The fingers were too short for my fingers, but otherwise fit decently. I've had a few other glove liners and these are probably the warmest I have (although more thick), they fit well underneath Mechanix and Youngstown gloves, and give you the extra warmth you need to work down to 0. I definitely recommend these for anyone wanting a daily winter glove that's not bulky and works with touch devices.

This was a fun concept, and other chemical type education sets are generally a good educational toy. This however provided little education, and left us with a cheap not-so-impressed feeling. The test tube holder itself is rather flimsy and not useful. The tests themselves are cheap, like gelatin crystals and food coloring, hydrophobic sand, dinosaur sponge you put in water to grow, fake snow mixing, and color dye on beads. My son loved them, but we also went through all of them in about 3 days (trying to drag it out as long as possible). Then the fun was over, the experiments aren't repeatable/reusable, and my son really learned nothing. The instructions were sometimes vague and incorrect, and the short explanation paragraphs didn't really help explain why such reactions occur. My 5 year old son did like it a lot though, mainly because of the idea and simplicity of it, I guess I was just hoping for more.

I bought these mainly to put in emergency kits, and to keep around the house when the power goes out (frequently). These so far have worked great. They burn evenly and completely, all the ones I've timed have lasted anywhere from 3.75-4.5hrs. We have some cheaper tealights left that we got  from targets, and they dont last anywhere near as long (they arent filled to the top with wax). I'd say 2 - 3hrs is a stretch for the cheap ones. A couple of these are also enough to provide some heat in a small tent or car, I keep a dozen in a ziplock in my car bag. I definitely recommend these as a cheap for long burning candles.

This the best screen protector I've ever come across, hands down. I've been using screen protectors for over 5 years, starting with the G1. I've probably gone through 5-10x a year, most were really cheap ones from China. I always figured all screen protectors were made the same, so why pay more? THEY ARE NOT!  After I got my S4, I picked up some [Neo HD Crystal] JL31.6 Samsung Galaxy S4 Screen Protector - Premium Japanese Film - 3 Pack - Lifetime Replacement - Verizon, AT&T, Sprint, T-Mobile, International, and Unlocked - Screen Protector Cover for Galaxy S IV SIV i9500 2013 Model. I went through all 3 (I think one failed to apply correctly), within 4 months. When I tried to find information to claim on the "lifetime warranty" I found it was impossible to contact the manufacturer.. Then I found these..1) These apply so much easier then any other screen protector I've had. Usually about 1 in 3 at best of the "cheap" screen protectors fail to get applied correctly. Either for a piece dust that you cannot work out, an air bubble that cant be worked out, etc. These apply smoothly with almost no air bubbles, and if there are any they push out so easily. It's really amazing the difference in applications between these and all other screen protectors I've ever seen.2) This is much thicker then most cheap screen protectors. Yet crystal clear and very touch sensitive. This gives a much better layer of screen protection. I have had a scratch get through a cheap/thin protector on my N1. I do not worry about that with these.3) This doesn't come up on the corners or under the bottom home button. Cheap protectors frequently have problems with small runs like under the home button, or sharp corners up top by the speaker bar. This adheres perfectly. I have a tight fitting car dock, that will occasionally peel up a corner of the screen protector if I don't pay attention when putting it in. I can easily just push it back down with this screen protector and it re-adheres no problem - another thing you won't see with cheap protectors.4) Lifetime warranty that is easy to claim. Me and my wife both have S4, after we scratched a couple protectors and wanted to replace them after a couple months, we emailed the manufacturer and they very painlessly sent us out another 3 pack the next day. No fuss, no excuses needed, amazing service.Out of probably dozens of different screen protectors I've ever tried - I will never try another again. These are simply the best in every way, and couldn't imagine saving a few bucks to get a cheaper one (especially when you work out the lifetime replacement over the course of a couple years). I cannot highly recommend these enough!

This is the best handheld crank radio/flashlight and cell phone charger I've seen. The following are some of it's better features:-It seems very durable and well built to withstand some abuse. Even though it primarily just sits around in my emergency kit, if I do have to rely on it in a tough situation I trust it to stay in one piece.-The outer shell is rubberized and it is fully waterproof.-3 LED flashlight can light up a 10ft circle about 30ft away no problem.-AM/FM radio picks up channels clear, has an extendable antenna.-NOAA weather bands for emergency broadcasts-Small plastic clip on end so you can hang it up somewhere.-Large solar panel on one side for charging the internal battery.-Hand crank charging for the internal battery.-USB port charging for the internal battery.-3.5mm output for charging devices.-Includes micro usb, mini usb, and usb female ports for charging devices-backlit LCD control panel that displays radio channel, volume, battery charge.-access port for the battery pack for quick replacementCharging performance:-About 30s of winding will get you 15 minutes of light-About 30s of winding will get you about 10minutes of radio-About 2hrs of sunlight will get you 15minutes of LED light (variable based on direct, clouds, etc)-Takes about 1-2hrs to charge the internal batteries via the USB port-If you want to charge your phone - charge this first. IE crank it for 5-10 minutes, or let it sit outside in at least 8hrs of sunlight. Afterwards plug it into your phone and give it 5-10 minutes to transfer the charge. I was able to get about 10% battery off an older blackberry after a good battery charge via the solar panel in about 8hrs outside. I didn't have much luck getting my S4 to recognize this as a charger.I don't really have any cons to state, this performed and functioned exactly as well as I hoped. I definitely recommend this unit, especially for the price.

Got this for my 5 year old son. It's  a fun little cheap toy. Fairly simple design, it comes with a sheep and you can catapult it with it's tail. DreamWorks has a bunch of dragon figures and this was our first, will probably pick up more next holiday season.

This is very handy tape. Works great on a car (or in a car emergency kit), on a bicycle, helmet, tractor, mailbox, signs, shoes, etc. It does OKAY on backpacks, if the fabric flexes a lot it will come off. It does not do well on thinner fabrics or clothing. If you're looking for an all purpose reflective tape, look no further, this is the best (brightest, especially at long distances) that I've seen yet.

This is by far the best wheel cleaner I've ever used. I've used both Meguiar's, Mother's and Chemical Guys. They all worked decently, I tend to prefer the Meguiar's Hot Rims over the rest; however it doesn't come close to how well this works. With 4 piston brembo calipers and hawk hps pads, my Evo's brakes spew out a TON of dust onto my wheels. It's a constant battle to keep them somewhat clean. If I let it sit on there too long and gather more road gunk, it was impossible to get off with Meguiar's (or anything else) alone, and would require scrubbing (sometimes with a harsh/dangerously hard bristled) brush. Not anymore! This cuts through caked on rims even after a couple months of horrible neglect.You might need to use two passes with it, depending how hard caked the gunk is. My advise is:-First spray the wheels with my meguiars soap and pressure wash them to get off as much as possible before applying this.-If you have a light cleaning (usually less then a couple weeks for my car), then you can get by with spraying two rims at a time. If you're going to have to scrub some of the gunked on mess it's probably best to do one rim at a time. Spray your rim(s) generously getting in your inner rim if possible, your lug nuts, etc.-The liquid will come out kind of greenish and then turn an orangish/redish as it breaks down brake dust. It has a very strong (like cat urine) odor that you just have to get used to.-Let it sit on there for a couple of minutes (usually don't want more then 5). You don't want it to dry on the rim, although having accidentally done this - it washed off no problem.-If it's a light cleaning you can probably get by with just pressure washing it clean at this point, although to make sure you get all parts of the rims I usually go over it with Griot's Garage 15704 Micro Fiber Wheel Wand, (Pack of 2). If the caked on mess requires harder scrubbing I'd recommend something like autogeek's "speed master wheel brush".This bottle usually last about 16 individual wheel cleanings. It makes it the most expensive option out there, but by far the best and safest! It is acid free and ph balanced, and is specifically designed to be safe on all rims. I use this on BBS, Enkei, and WedsSports rims that cost over 1000-1500/per, all the time. I have no worry that this can in any way danger them. A lot of other products out there can be a hit or miss, and especially if you have refinished rims it can be very risky. My BBS are refinished and so far this has not worn it off or damaged them whatsoever. If you're looking for a bit cheaper solution, there's Sonax 230500 Yellow Wheel Cleaner to use as a refill. You can also checkout autogeek, depending on their sales, coupon codes, and shipping situation - you can usually find a better deal there.

I bought these for tool bags, and was not disappointed. They're very thick and durable canvas that has been thrown around in trucks and cars with tools in them, drug across work sites, and so far has not shown any wear. The zipper is durable and does not split open or have any difficulty zipping up. The larger one is 14x5.5x6in, the smaller is 12x4.5x5.5in. They fold/collapse flat and can easily be stored. These are an excellent bag for the price, hard to beat 2/10$.

This isn't an overly high quality outfit. However since we only needed to use it on Halloween night and one other halloween party, I saw no need to waste additional money. For the 12-16hrs this was probably on - it held up fine. Had no problem with the durability of it. I got the size Small for my (just turned) 5 year old and it seemed to fit him well. The cape was a bit long however and we ended up taking it off when walking around the streets after a while (so it didn't drag on wet ground). The mask is only a 1/2 mask but that's not really a problem. It has shoe covers, the belt and chest computer are just printed on nothing fancy. Obviously doesn't come with gloves or the light saber. The material is what you would expect for a 15-20$ costume, it's very thin and see through - you'll most likely want something underneath it. It does have a very cheap feel to it, I wouldn't buy it if you wanted a costume that would last you several halloweens or one that looks like it cost more then 20$. For the price it is - and all others I saw in this price range (the ones locally were the same quality but about twice as expensive), this is a good deal.

I bought this pink bottle for my sister to carry around in her car/purse. I've bought a couple of the dual packs in black for myself over the years, and they've all held up fine. They have roughly a 4 year shelf life. I test fired a bottle after about 4 years that had been sitting in my car the whole time (through extreme heats and cold), and it fired no problem. To note: most compressed gasses recommend not storing in temperature above 120, cars in parking lots in the summer here can definitely get much hotter then that. It also recommends not letting it get below freezing, but mine definitely saw temperatures down to -20f. To date, I've never had any pepper spray stored in any of my cars fail or vent. I don't necessarily recommend it, as the manufacturers obviously don't, just stating it's held up in non-recommended environments no problem.This shoots a pretty chunky stream of pepper spray about 6-8feet. Good for up close and precise situations. I've never had to rely on pepper spray in a threatening situation, but I do keep one in each of my cars, and I keep a couple bottles around the house (larger Sabre bottles) for intruders. This bottle has a simple slide lock and seems secure enough for one to keep in their pocket or purse without fear of accidental discharge. I definitely recommend Sabre Pepper spray.

Comes with a fairly sharp blade. No shaving sharp, but enough to cut open most things as an EDC. 440 Stainless is a decent metal for a cheap blade, it's fairly resistant to rusting/corrosion and sharpens up pretty easily. However it dents and dulls pretty easily as well. Either way this is a great cheap knife for someone who doesn't have to use it all the time, and is just for light duty tasks. It made a great gift. When I bought this a few months ago it was for a "pink camo" knife, and it came in orange, so I'm glad the at least updated the description.

I bought this for a gift for my sister. This is a great multi-tool to carry around in your car. It is very strong and solidly built. It seems as durable as the Gerber one I have. The knife and saw are sharp as well. I definitely recommend this for the price, it's hard to beat.

I hated how whenever I went somewhere and went to sat down (car, restaurant, work, theatre, etc) the first thing I'd do is take out my wallet and tuck it between my legs or put it on the table - just because I couldn't stand sitting on it. Finally I don't need to! This wallet is so thin, I can sit on it at work, out to eat, and it not really bother me. I still occasionally do remove it, but I think that's more of habit. I find myself VERY frequently not realizing it's still in my back pocket, where that NEVER happened to me with my previous leather.This wallet empty and not compressed at the end is less than 0.25" thick. My old Dockers "small" leather bifold - 0.75" thick. Fully packed with about the same contents, my leather wallet was about 1-1.25" thick, where this is about 0.5". That 0.5" is a fully stocked wallet, everything I need.In my wallet I usually carry :4x credit cardsDrivers LicenseWork IDStudent IDpicture of the kidsMitsubishi Roadside assistance card3x Insurance cards1x Check5-10x BillsAll can easy and very comfortably be fit into this wallet. This wallet has 4x card slots, one with a window for a license. In each card slot you can easily fit 3, perhaps 4 cards that allow easy removal. The billfold section has a divider (that to be honest they could probably loose and shave off another mm in the size). The quality and stitching of this wallet seems to be well done. After 6 months of assaulting it, there's no sign of wear, fading, stitching coming undone, or any foreseen problems.My "slim" Dockers leather wallet did have more storage potential. It could hold about 18x cards, plus had 3 slots behind the card flaps. The problem with it is in between every card slot was a thick piece of leather end. Thick leather binding and stitching everywhere just made it unnecessarily obese (like most leather wallets). This is all nylon construction, seems to be just as durable, and at a significant size reduction!I definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good thin wallet they can actually carry around and sit on without feeling like there's a brick in your back pocket.
These are almost knee high, not quite though. They fit my wife good, they don't seem to stretch out that far. They are her favorite warm pair of winter socks.

Bought this as a gift for my wife on her new Impreza. It looks great, two upper hole mounts which is great. The bottom is a bit thick obviously, you'll need to make sure you place your state/county tags higher up then usual so they're easily readable. Or just throw this on the front plate. Seems to be sturdy though, has stood up about 6 months, 15k miles, and a pretty rough winter without any issue.

I was looking for a double wall insulated drinking cup mainly for cold drinks in a hot and humid home. I got tired of sweat and constantly nasty/sticky coasters. I went through a couple glass versions, the Ozeri and Bodum. Both were very weak and ended up breaking rather quick. They both did work well at keep drinks cool and glasses sweat free though. A buddy of mine recommended these - as he had been using for years. He threw one hard against the floor to demonstrate and it just bounced. I was sold.In comparison to the Ozeri and Bodum : It keeps drinks colder MUCH longer. I can keep a handful of icecubes somewhat solid for 4hrs in this cup at ambient indoor temperatures. In relation to sweating - it does sweat a bit more then the Ozeri did for some reason, maybe it's because I couldn't compare them side by side since I broke all the Ozeri before I had a chance. As far as durability there's no question these will stand up to just about anything. And if they ever do break - Tervis will replace them for free. I know someone who had one fall off his truck at ~60mph, it broke clean in two pieces, he called Tervis and they sent him a new one no problem.These are great if you have kids, clumsy adults, guests, and if you like keeping your drinks cold and your furniture sweat-ring free! They are a bit pricey considering they're just plastic. However these are definitely 4 cups I intend to have for a lifetime. Maybe I can justify buying another 4 in a year.I can't highly recommend these enough!

This is the best thermal paste I've ever come across. It can be difficult to apply and manage sometimes, but if you get it on there correctly - it should yield you the best thermal reduction results.I usually like to microwave a cup of hot water and get it near boiling, then throw this in there for a few minutes. It comes out and spreads a lot better when it's warmed up. After it's warmed up I like applying  a small "square" in the middle and maybe just a few dabs around the sides to make sure the whole top will be covered. A lot of people just do a blind round bead in the middle, but I've taken off plenty of heatsinks done by this method where the paste was not completely covering the chip cover, and in a lot of cases causing it to overheat. Usually with the bead I see either too much where it squeezes over the sides, or not enough where corners or edges have none on it.After you get the hang of applying this it does seem to have a "curing" period, after a day you should start to see your temperatures drop by at least a few degrees. I usually keep a tube of this and ArcticSilver on hand. This for any of my personal builds, chipsets, cpus, gpu's, etc. I usually apply this to anything I buy that comes with heatsink, even if I plan on using the original cooler. Then the ArcticSilver is good for any cheap build I'm doing for someone else. The price of this does make it somewhat prohibitive - you'll get a good 10-15 applications out of this tube maybe. Usually it's about 2-3x as expensive as ArcticSilver 5. However depending on what you're using it on, you should see at least 3-5c temperature reduction at idle (which is a lot - especially when squeezing overclocks), and slightly more at max load. Of course your results will vary based on your chip, case, cooling method, etc.

This is a great exerciser to keep your fingers (really your hand muscles) in good shape.
