Or do the large compound exercises that put your endocrine system into fat-burning mode.Think of 7-Keto DHEA as a multiplier. If you make some changes in your diet, they will be more effective when you use this supplement. Similarly, if you have been doing isolation exercises on machines at the gym and change to doing large compound exercises such as squats, your results will be more significant if you are using 7-Keto DHEA.There is no magic potion in a bottle, and there are no shortcuts. Building a leaner body is much like building a faster car. Changing from isolation exercises to large, compound exercises is like dropping in a bigger engine. Adding 7-Keto DHEA to the program is like adding a turbocharger.If you want a leaner physique, try this supplement and see how it works for you.

The title of this book intrigued me. But the book falls short of what it promises. It's still worth reading, and for some people it could be life-changing. Mostly, those would be people whose days are consumed by fighting one problem after another. If you're such a person, get this book.For everyone else, this book is probably not going to be very helpful. Though I had originally expected it to be a source of great insight, it wasn't. Perhaps my expectations were unduly raised when I read the well-written introduction. Speaking of which, I found it odd that the author stated later in the book that people generally don't read introductions and then went on to reiterate some points from the introduction. If he really felt this way, he should have made those points in the text and not in the introduction.Where I found the value in this book was in Part One of the three parts. The other two parts didn't seem grounded in reality, nor did they provide anything that struck me as substantive.A key concept Mr. Blake makes clear is that you need to adjust your thinking such that you are for something rather than against something. One of his examples is "weight loss," by which most users of the term actually mean "fat loss." This is no minor difference. People who focus on weight necessarily do not focus on body composition. So they follow Covey's example of doing the wrong things.But why focus on loss at all? Focusing on "losing" the fat puts you in a mindset of restricting your diet rather than optimizing it. During the winter, my body fat is usually around 6%. In summer, it's at 5%. This isn't because I "lose fat" but because I make positive optimization decisions that result in a slightly higher ratio of lean mass to fat. For someone with a bothersomely big belly, I suggest you stop thinking about "losing the gut" and start thinking about chiseling those abs.This same mental alignment works for any endeavor I can think of, yet I find that people tend to prefer fighting something than building something. Do you want to "quit smoking" or do you want nice skin, pleasant breath, and good stamina? Which way is more motivating?So getting the reader to understand the power of that alignment and providing some insight on how to make it standard operating procedure is what I see as the thrust of Part One. I like the way Mr. Blake gets this across.It's different from the mindless "think positive" advice that has you writing affirmations (lies) on little slips of paper or lying to yourself in the mirror at the start of every day. Self-deception can make you feel better, but it brings you no closer to solution. The caveat to that is if you're in a negative state such as depression, then this gambit can help you proceed more confidently. However, Mr. Blake's approach strikes me as really the one to use. It's the approach I typically use. After reading the first three chapters, I decided to use this approach consistently.I also like his tips on keeping your mind from being sabotaged by others. In particular, he was spot on regarding watching the news. I don't do the news, period. The content is typically wrong, nearly always negative, and seldom relevant to the life of the viewer, listener, or reader. By not exposing your mind to this pollution, you are already a leg up.Finished with Part One, I turned to Part Two. This is where the disappointment began. The premise here is you need to have a daily period set aside for what amounts to tapping into "the force." Mr. Blake wrongly ties this into Einstein's formula for mass and energy, a mistake that simple calculations will show to be a mistake. But even without the calculations, the causation he assumes just does not arise from this equation.He also goes on the redefine terms used in completely different contexts. For example, he says the Cohen brothers have it backwards in their portrayal of the matrix. In saying such a thing, Mr. Blake completely misses the point of the movie and completely misses the underlying problem with the Great Lies we are told by those in power.If Mr. Blake wants to say he's tapping into the matrix of nature or the universe or whatever, that's fine. But just because the word matrix is used in other contexts does not mean it's used incorrectly or that everyone is talking about the same thing. Mr. Blake's matrix and the one in the Matrix movies can co-exist without any conflict. Simply choose a different word to describe one or the other.When I finished Part Two, the author had not convinced me that I need to set aside 20 minutes a day to zone out, chill out, connect with nature, etc. Mr. Blake provided no evidence for the effectiveness of this, other than anecdote and a reliance on the idea that correlation equals causation. So it was with "you let this reader down" that I embarked upon Part Three.The title of Part Three is "Transforming Ideas into Achievements." I finished Part III not having found this subject addressed in any meaningful way. The basic concept is "wish for it, and it will come." So much serendipity here, and yet again a reliance on  idea that correlation equals causation.Upon finishing the book, I went back to the cover. What immediately struck me was the subtitle is not accurate. Pick up any map, and what do you see? Detail! This book, as its title states, is about three steps. It is not about the entire journey. The gap between thinking of an idea and making it happen is often filled with thousands of steps. Those are not discussed in the book. In no way is this a map to anything.I don't think Mr. Blake provided three simple steps. I think he provided one not so simple step, and that is the step of getting your head on straight. Does anybody not struggle with this, other than those who simply don't do it? Getting this right on a consistent basis is surely beneficial. But look at all of the famous and successful people who are nowhere close to this. If you think a little, you can probably work up a list of people who have this down pat but are struggling financially. I think it is one tool in a larger toolbox.Part One was about getting the correct mentality. Maybe the other two parts were about keeping that mentality in place. If you have a ritual for that purpose, whether it be spitting over your shoulder or communing with nature for 20 minutes a day, there's what I got out of part Two. In Part Three, the anecdotes seemed to point all toward recognizing opportunity when it comes a knockin'.This book runs 239 pages, including the introduction and the conclusion.

These earbuds fit with reasonable comfort, and come with six sets of rubber tips. Nobody should have any problem getting a snug, comfortable fit with these. They also come with a handsome, soft-sided, zippered case. A nice touch, especially if you want to travel with spare rubber tips.I've owned many earbuds, over the years. This is one of the few that doesn't have the tangling cord problem. Kudos to Acoustic Research! This particular problem sometimes makes knots that are inordinately difficult to undo and the repeated annoyance can become quite frustrating. As an electrical engineer, I can tell you that Acoustic Research solved this issue the same way Samsung did. Instead of going cheap on the cord so that it tangles and/or breaks, they used a suitably thick cord.Not only that, there are two strain reliefs in the cord. I've seen many sets that don't have even one. So, this is a product designed to tolerate the occasional "Oops" where the cord snags on something as you walk past or your MP3 player suddenly takes a tumble.Wrapping the cord around your MP3 player does reduce the tangling problem, but it also shortens the life of the cord. So it's not really a solution. It's good to see that this manufacturer actually cared that users have things to do in life other than untangle earbud cords. They also seem to care that people don't like forking over money to replace earbuds they bought recently.I generally do not listen to music (the content adds little or nothing to my character, knowledge, or value as a human being), and don't use my MP3 player for that. What I use my MP3 player for is the brainbuilding experience of listening to nonfiction audio books, and the experience has the effect of continually being in university. But instead of sitting through classroom lectures, I learn while doing housework, yardwork, and driving down the highway (among other activities). Famous fitness guru Bill Phillips listens to audio books while on his recumbent bike.Because I don't listen to music and because I respect my inner ear parts (I've had them for a long time and have grown fond of them), the sound coming to them from my MP3 player is at normal conversation level. So I didn't crank the volume to max to test for distortion. That is not, to me, a relevant test. The earphones perform well for their intended use.With any earbuds, the issue of sound quality must be addressed in a review. For me, it's a matter of clearly delivering voice. I compared these earbuds to another model during my review evaluation, and these did slightly better.

What impressed me immediately upon opening the package was how cool the canister looks. I also looked at the ingredients and was pleasantly surprised. So, Axe shave gel and I got off to a good start.See also my Review of Remington Alpahagel.I was a little put off by the fragrance. To me, any fragrance in a skin care product is a sign of contamination. The ingredients label does not identify what this fragrance is. In most skin care products, the fragrance is some health-damaging chemical cocktail. But in most skin care products, the entire product is some health-damaging chemical cocktail.Most of Alphagel's ingredients read like a laundry list of things you WANT to put on your skin; water and sunflower seed oil are near the top.After several days of using this, I didn't experience any skin irritation or allergy issues. While that's not a conclusive sign that the product is safe to use, most other products immediately cause my body's defenses to go to DEFCON 5.Most "skin care" products, including shaving products, are loaded with toxins and reek of various chemicals that allegedly "smell good." I use plain soap when showering, and was pleased to come across this particular shaving gel. I think any dermatologist would approve, as would specialists in endocrinology, toxicology, and pathology. Using products like this is an important part of eliminating the need for medical care and its associated misery and financial costs.It's interesting that most Americans think they are using soap, when in fact they are using a chemical-laden detergent that is harsh on their skin and puts who knows what into their bloodstream. Shaving products are similarly corrupted these days. For good information on soap and good soap products, check out Hawaiian Bath and Body. This is a great little company and I know the owners personally.With the Alphagel I reviewed, it's easy to control how much you use. Just swipe your finger across the tube opening and you have enough to put a comforting film on your face prior to shaving. With the Axe shave gel, you have to just barely tap the dispenser button. Else, you'll get enough foam for several shaves. Did I say foam, not gel? Yes, that is correct. This resembles traditional shaving foam, because foam is what you get out of the container.Another difference between these two products is you can easily see how much of the alphagel you have becuse the container is transparent. But like our federal government, the container of the Axe foaming gel lacks transparency. For the government, this is a hugely negative thing. For the shaving gel, it's not a big deal. It's just a product container difference. I think all of us are capable of giving the container a little shake to feel how much is left.One advantage the Axe has over the Alphagel is you can easily see how much is on your skin. I like that. I also like the way this feels on my skin, and the fact that it easily rinses out of my razor. I'm using one of those 220-blade (or however many they stick in there now, maybe it's 4 or 5 really) razors, which I plan to abandon after I use up the inordinately expensive blades that have to be replaced just as often as the reasonably priced ones.With some shaving products, you need a power washer system to rinse the shaving product out of the turbines, combines, or whatever they are calling these mega multi blade shaver heads these days.Nor did Axe do the childproof container thing (that's actually code for "open-proof"). Executives of companies that permit the packaging of their products in such a way that the hapless consumer must use a chainsaw and three varieties of prybars just to open the container do not deserve their mult-million dollar bonuses. When even the Fire Department gives up after breaking a set of Jaws of Life on the stupid package, it might be a hint that the packaging needs to be re-engineered.Fortunately, the folks at Axe considered the fact that consumers might buy their product because they actually want to use it. So they packaged it in a consumer-friendly way. I think what's inside the package is pretty darn good, too.

The truth is that if you looking to permanently remove inches of fat from you waist there are no easy fixes or substitutions for a good diet and regular exercise.Wearing a waist trimmer alone will not remove fat without also making changes to your diet and level of exercise. What the waist belt does is create an illusion of weight loss. If you wear this during an exercise session and work up a good sweat, you might find yourself 5 to 10 pounds lighter afterwards and your stomach may look a little smaller due to the water loss but it is not permanent weight loss. I call this weight loss an illusion because it is just water weight and it will shortly return once you start to hydrate yourself.Sweat belts like these are commonly used by wrestlers and other athletes to bring down their weight for weigh ins. Some professional wrestlers actually have suits made of this stuff and they wear them in the sauna before weigh-ins. These belts work great for this purpose and after a hour of exercise, my stomach and the inside of the belt are both soaked in sweatThe waist trimmer belt is of quality construction. I have been using the belt for a solid month during exercise and while doing yard work and I find it is comfortable to wear and it works great as a back brace. After a hour plus of mowing the lawn I would usually have a sore lower back but I had no pain at all after moving while wearing this belt. For this reason alone, the belt is worth 5 stars to me.The only negative thing I have to say about the green waist trimmer belt is that when I received it, it had a faint petroleum-like odor from the neoprene. I needed to air out the belt for a couple days before I could use it. After using it for a couple weeks, the odor was completely gone.* I received this free in exchange for my unbiased review.

If there is one thing I love it is mini LED flashlights. I find they come in handy and I own quite a few. I keep one on my keychain, one in my car, one at my desk at work, and one in every room in my house. You never know when a situation will arise that needs some illumination.It should be no surprise that I jumped at the chance to add another mini LED  flashlight to my collection when XFIL offered me their 9 LED Metal Encased Flashlight free in exchange for an unbiased review.This flashlight is a winner...It is compact and very lightweight making it perfect for my keychain.  For a mini flashlight it is very bright. It is as bright, if not brighter than other led mini flashlights I own. It is bright enough to illuminate a small to mid sized room nicely.Lastly, it is powered by 3 AAA batteries which are not included.If you don't already own a min LED flashlight, I highly recommend considering this one for your keychain.

I love ginger tea so I am delighted to have been selected to sample, for free, Kazu's 100% Certified Organic Ginger Root Tea in exchange for my unbiased review. The tea has a subtle but distinctive ginger taste that is delicious and has a wonderful aroma.I love drinking ginger tea on cold mornings and nights because it really warms the belly. I also run to the ginger tea when I have an upset stomach or gas pains. Ginger aids digestion and helps the muscles in my stomach to relax and soothe my upset stomach. It also does a great job providing relief from gas pains.Drinking ginger tea on a daily basis is also a great way to lose weight. Ginger contains thermogenic agents that increases your metabolism and helps to burn off stored body fat.Whatever your reason for drinking this tea... enjoy but don't over do it because studies have shown that too much of this good thing may have undesirable side effects like diarrhea, heartburn, headaches, sleeplessness, and/or a racing heartbeat. I drink 2 - 3 cups a day of this potent tea and never experienced any of these issues.One other warning to individuals with gallstones... Ginger is best avoided by those suffering from gallstones because it increases the secretion of bile and if taken in large amount it could trigger a gallbladder attack.

If you can only own one piece of exercise equipment, choose a decent jump rope. Seriously, you can get a great full body workout by just using your jump rope.Some of the benefits of jumping rope are:01 Weight Loss - Forget about fad diets and supplements that promise weight loss without any change in your lifestyle. The most effective and healthy way to lose weight is physical activity. It doesn't matter what you do... run, walk, swim, jump rope, bike or frolic in the cornfield. Just move your body, work up a sweat, and get your breathing and heart rate up. You can burn roughly 300 calories by jumping rope for just 30 minutes.02 Increased Cardiovascular Fitness - Forgot about those insane 15 minute workouts. Low to moderate exercises that you can sustain for extended periods of time are best for cardiovascular health. Walking and jumping rope are two excellent ways to strengthen your cardiovascular system and increase your endurance.03 Increased Muscle Tone - Jumping rope is a full body workout. It works muscles in both your upper and lower body. Think about what muscles you are working when you are jumping rope... your calves, thighs, arms and shoulders. There are jumping variations that also give the muscles in your chest, back, and abs a good workout. It is also a great way to increase bone density with less impact on your joints than running.04 Relieves Tension and Stress05 It Is a Portable Workout - You can easily take a jump rope with you anywhere. Take it to work and go outside and jump rope for a half hour during your lunch.06 It Is Inexpensive - You are not going to find another piece of gym equipment that gives you a full body workout for less than the cost of a jump rope.Anoeky offers a plastic jump rope at a reasonable price. The jump rope is 9.8 feet long, has comfy foam handles and can be adjusted to your height with a little bit of effort.The box says it is adjustable but there are no instructions on how to adjust it so I will explain. First you need to pop off the the black caps on the end of the handles. I couldn't get them off with my fingers so I used the edge of a flat head screwdriver to pop them off. Next you pull the desired amount rope through the metal clip towards you and then tighten the metal clip to hold the position of the rope. I needed to use pliers to tighten the metal clip. Finally, tuck the excess rope into the hollow handles and put the caps back on.Have fun jumping rope and remember to wear a comfortable pair of shoes while jumping. Your feet will thank you.*I received a free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

I like to organize and label things so I was pretty excited to be offered these Chalkboard Labels and Liquid Chalk Marker for free in exchange for my unbiased review.I wasn't too sure if these would really work as advertised but it turns out they do and I'm loving them. No more having to go through the trouble of peeling off old traditional labels and using goo gone to clean off the sticky residue on the glass jars or plastic containers before labeling them again for something new.Now I just need to put one of these new labels on the container and use the included liquid chalk marker to label it. When I want to reuse the container for something new, I just wipe away the writing with a damp cloth and write something else on it. Simple as that.The set comes with twelve sheets of labels with six labels per sheet. That is seventy-two 2" x 3" labels. I found they easily peeled off the white backing paper and stick securely to my plastic and glass containers. They also peel off the containers easily when I want to reposition or remove the label.

The lid set comes with five suction lids of varying sizes (4in, 6in, 8in, 10in and 12in). I was expecting "traditional" snap lids made of food grade silicone rather than plastic so I was a little surprised by the look of these lids. When I first saw them I thought there was no way these would suction on to a bowl or mug, let alone be able to stay on tight enough to lift the bowl like shown in the listing photos.I was wrong...I have been using these lids at home and at work for the last three weeks and I am very impressed by this handy gadget. One thing I have been using these for is to cover bowls full of leftovers. First off, it has been saving me some bucks by not having to use saran wrap or aluminum foil to cover the bowls. More importantly, these actually work. The lids suction so tightly on to the bowls and I am able to carry the bowls to the fridge by the handle on the lid. I could not believe it.This little feature is really handy when I have my morning and afternoon tea at work. At work I have to use the microwave to boil water for my tea and then carry the hot mug to my desk. It may not sound like a big deal but it is to me because I tend to spill. Now I can just put on a lid and use it to carry my mug. It hasn't come loose yet and I no long suffer spills and third degree burns.One other thing about these lids that impressed me is how easily the lids come off the bowls. The suction is so tight that I thought you would have to be a circus strongman to get the lids off. That is not the case, the lids peel off the bowls without any effort at all.One caveat about these lids is that they will only work with bowls or cups with round openings and without pouring lips. The company should work on another set of lids for square and rectangular shaped bowls.These Silicone Suction Lids from Qooware are something I never thought about ever needing but now that I have been using them, I don't know how I ever got along without them.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

I cook with ginger quite a bit so I am delighted to have been selected to sample, for free, Kazu's 100% Organic Certified Ginger Root Powder in exchange for my unbiased review. The ginger is pure and very potent and a little goes a long way. It has excellent taste and aroma. Plus... it is organic.Ginger is a very common and delicious ingredient in Indian and Asian dishes. I find that ginger matches well with chicken dishes, sweet potatoes, and carrots. I also use ginger to flavor plain rice pilaf, as a topping on my frozen yogurt, and to flavor gingerbread.In addition to its culinary uses, ginger powder has other benefits people may not be aware of...01 Relieve Stomach Aches - Ginger aids digestion and helps the muscles in your stomach to relax. I will take two teaspoons of the ginger powder and a pinch of brown sugar and mix the two together in an eight ounce glass of carrot juice. It warms my belly and helps my upset stomach. It also works well for relief from gas pains.02 Soothe Arthritis - Ginger is known for its anti-inflammatory properties and can be used to soothe arthritis pain. You can easily make a tea from the powder by adding two tablespoons to a cup of water and bring it to a boil. I don't have arthritis but a co-worker of mine does and swears by this.03 Promotes Weight Loss - Drinking a cup of ginger tea every day is a great way to lose weight. Mix a teaspoon of the ginger powder into a cup of hot water and add a little honey for a delicious belly warming tea for weight loss. Ginger contains thermogenic agents that increases your metabolism and helps to burn off stored body fat.04 Skin Care - Ginger has anti-inflammatory and anti-bacterial properties that aids in unclogging pores and killing off acne causing bacteria. You can use a mix of ginger and milk powder to make a paste for your skin. Apply the paste to your face and neck and let it sit for twenty minutes before washing it off. My wife will apply a facial moisturizer afterwards. Do this once a week to prevent breakouts.Before you go cooking or self-medicating with ginger, please note that in large doses ginger can thin blood and inhibit blood clotting, cause heartburn and diarrhea, and can cause heart palpitations. I have never experienced any of these issues but wanted to mention it and stress the importance of not over doing a good thing. If you follow your recipes, you shouldn't have any issues.I have been using this ginger two to three times a week for the last three weeks and I highly recommend this top notched ginger from Kazu.

The wife and I recently bought a tandem bike and I spent the last weekend tricking out our bicycle built for two with this LED Bike Light Set.Pros:01. Easy To Install - The headlight is actually a LED flashlight with an adjustable zoom focus. It slides into a notch in the cradle that clamps down on my bike.  Installing the bike headlight is very easy and no tools are needed. Installing the rear bike light is also easy and no tools are needed. Just find a post on the back of the bike and strap the rear light to it. Simple.02. Sturdy and Weatherproof - The headlight stays locked in the cradle very securely and the cradle itself stays clamped tightly on the bikes front post. The rear light stays on my rear post tightly. Both stayed in place during a two-hour bike ride so I have no worries about either coming loose. Both lights and the cradle are all weatherproof. I wouldnt submerge them in water but it will survive if you are caught in a rain shower during your bike ride.03. Easy To Use - The headlight is just like using a flashlight. You just need to click the button at the end of the light once to turn it on. Simple. I usually use the light in its normal setting for maximum light coverage but you can also twist the head of the light into a tighter and brighter beam of light that is helpful when looking in smaller areas. If you click the button twice in quick succession you will activate the blinking strobe mode. Working the rear light is also easy. You just need to click the red button to turn the light on and keep pressing it to toggle through solid, fast strobe, and slow strobe modes.04. Bright - You will be able to see where you are going at night as well as be seen by motorists. The headlight is very bright for a single LED. It is the brightest bike headlight I have ever owned. The rear light is also very bright.05. Rechargeable Batteries - The bike light set comes with two 2500mAh 18650 rechargeable batteries and a 18650 battery charger. The headlight is powered by one rechargeable battery and lasts for about six hours before needing a charge. There is also a AAA battery holder so you have the option of powering the light with three AAA batteries but why use expensive disposable batteries? The rear light is powered a CR2032 cell battery. These are not rechargeable and cost about five bucks but there are four included in the set.06. BONUS Stuff - The headlight is a flashlight. I slide it out of the cradle when I'm not biking and use it as a handheld flashlight. I love flashlights so I find this to be a sweet bonus. I also found the inclusion of the batteries and the charger a nice bonus.Overall, the price is a bargain for this quality bike light set. I have seen headlights alone that are the same price as this set but not even close in quality.I highly recommend the Sunspeed Waterproof Rechargeable LED Bike Light Set.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

I have always used cotton washcloths and have never heard of washcloths made from bamboo. I was curious about these natural bamboo washcloths. How much softer than cotton could they really be? After all, a washcloth is a washcloth. Right?Wrong.The first thing I noticed about these bamboo washcloths from the Motherhood Collection is how plush they are. I don't know how they compare to other bamboo washcloths but they are markedly softer than any of my premium cotton ones. They feel incredible on my skin. If I close my eyes and you brush one of these across my cheek, I wouldn't be able to tell the difference between these and a cashmere sweater.The luxurious feel of these washcloths are enough for me to highly recommend them but there is more...These eco-friendly washcloths are naturally antibacterial, hypoallergenic, and free of dyes, chemicals, and toxins making them perfect for anyone with sensitive skin.*I received these free in exchange for my unbiased review.

Here are my thoughts about the Exosqueeze Stainless Steel Lemon and Lime Squeezer after using it daily for a the last two weeks...01 Excellent Quality - In this price range, I have not seen many squeezers as well made as this one. The squeezer is stainless steel and has a heavy duty feel. I expect this squeezer will last a long time.02 Easy To Use - I have no issues working with this squeezer. I especially like the non-slip silicone handles which are easier to grip and more comfortable to hold than my old squeezer.03 Good Size - This is marketed as a lemon and lime squeezer but it is big enough for me to squeeze the juice out of mandarin oranges too.04 No More Seeds  I have been enjoying seed free orange and lemon juice thanks to this squeezer. This is a big selling point for me because I hate seeds in my drinks.05 Easy To Clean - I love that the squeezer is dishwasher safe. I Just rinse it off and pop it in the dishwasher.06 Satisfaction Guaranteed - The Exosqueeze Squeezer comes with a 30 day money back guarantee.I am satisfied with this squeezer and highly recommend it.*I received this free in exchange for my unbiased review.

I've purchased this 2 pack at Harbor Freight Tools for 1.99 with a coupon. They are small,lightweight, and don't look like much. This coupled with the cheap price made me a little hesitant to buy them. I figured they were probably junk but for a buck each, I'd give them a shot. Boy was I wrong! I'm glad I bought these and bought more. I love them and here's why....I've bought larger and more heavy duty led flashlights for much more money and the led lights would usually burn out within 6 months with very little use. Not a problem with these minis. I've got about 8 of these. Some are now a couple years old and they all still work and not a single led bulb has blown out.For a mini flashlight these are very bright. It is bright enough to illuminate a small to mid sized room nicely. They are as bright, if not brighter than larger led flashlights I've owned. They are powered by 3 AAA batteries which are included.I highly recommend these if you can get these at a good price.

My wife and I just installed raised garden beds this spring. The sunny area of our yard where we needed to put the garden beds is also the darkest area of the yard at night. It is also in a quiet and secluded spot on the side of our garage. This is a bad combination because there is little to deter critters from getting into our garden. To solve our little problem we installed this solar powered LED landscape light.Pros:01. The unit is easy to assemble and setup. You just attach the stake to the spotlight and stick it in the ground. Turn the unit on and it is ready to go.02. The unit has four bright white LED bulbs that have been doing a good job deterring critters looking for a late night snack from getting in my flower and garden beds. I leave the unit on low and it comes on at dusk and goes off when first light reaches the solar panel. The LED bulbs do dim throughout the evening but it is still enough light to cover my garden.Results will vary based on lighting conditions but for best results position the solar panel to get maximum sun expose and don't forget to peel of the film from the solar panel. I keep my unit in the sunniest area of my yard and then move it to the garden when I get home from work and have been happy with the results.03. It may not be as consistently bright as an electric spotlight but I'm saving money by using solar power and it is meeting my needs just fine.Cons:1. The one thing I don't like is the stake that connects to the spotlight does not lock that tightly into place. That unit stays attached to the stake when it is left alone but I am moving it every day. When I tug it out of the ground it always separates and I need to dig out the stake. If you are having the same issue, here is a tip... I attached some duct tape to reinforce the connection and it has been working great.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

If you can only own one piece of exercise equipment, choose a decent jump rope. Seriously, you can get a great full body workout by just using your jump rope.Some of the benefits of jumping rope are:01 Weight Loss - Forget about fad diets and supplements that promise weight loss without any change in your lifestyle. The most effective and healthy way to lose weight is physical activity. It doesn't matter what you do... run, walk, swim, jump rope, bike or frolic in the cornfield. Just move your body, work up a sweat, and get your breathing and heart rate up. You can burn roughly 300 calories by jumping rope for just 30 minutes.02 Increased Cardiovascular Fitness - Forgot about those insane 15 minute workouts. Low to moderate exercises that you can sustain for extended periods of time are best for cardiovascular health. Walking and jumping rope are two excellent ways to strengthen your cardiovascular system and increase your endurance.03 Increased Muscle Tone - Jumping rope is a full body workout. It works muscles in both your upper and lower body. Think about what muscles you are working when you are jumping rope... your calves, thighs, arms and shoulders. There are jumping variations that also give the muscles in your chest, back, and abs a good workout. It is also a great way to increase bone density with less impact on your joints than running.04 Relieves Tension and Stress05 It Is a Portable Workout - You can easily take a jump rope with you anywhere. Take it to work and go outside and jump rope for a half hour during your lunch.06 It Is Inexpensive - You are not going to find another piece of gym equipment that gives you a full body workout for less than the cost of a jump rope.Micogo offers two nice wire jump ropes at a very reasonable price. The jump ropes are 8 feet long and can be adjusted to your height with locking mechanisms. It literally takes seconds to make the adjustment. I think this feature is great because it allows people of varying heights to be able to easily use the jump ropes.Have fun jumping rope and remember to wear a comfortable pair of shoes while jumping. Your feet will thank you. *I received a free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

ChoiceMMed's digital scale is head and shoulders above my plain old white dial scale and is a welcome addition to the master bathroom.First, it is aesthetically pleasing and really adds class to the bathroom. I love the sleek design of the scale and the tempered glass. One bad thing about the glass is that it easily attracts fingerprints and dust. Fortunately it easily wipes right off the glass.Second, I love that this is digital and not another dial scale. No more fussing with the dial to get the red needle to line up perfectly with zero. No more having to look at the scale dead on to get an accurate weight. All I need to do with ChoiceMMed's scale is step on the scale and get an instant reading.The third and most important thing about the digital scale is that it is accurate. When I first stepped on the scale, I was aghast by the readout. The first thing I said to my wife is "this is a beautiful scale but it is wildly inaccurate". She brought up a couple of her hand weights to test out the scale's accuracy. The three pound hand weight didn't register at all. The five pound hand weight did turn on the scale and the reading was spot on.After coming with terms with being twenty pounds heavier than I thought, muscle weighs more than fat I told myself, I weighed myself ten times in a row to see if I would get the same results. Nine of the ten readings were exactly the same. One reading was off from the others by a variance of less than a 1/2 pound. Not bad at all.A few more things to note:I first tried the scale with it on the bathroom rug and I only weighed seventy pounds. I don't know the science behind it but the scale must be on a hard flat surface in order to get an accurate reading.The scale is for individuals that weigh up to 396 pounds.The scale is powered by two AAA batteries which are included.*I received this free in exchange for my unbiased review.

When I entered into manhood, my Uncle Alfredo shared with me that great virility is a dual-edged sword and must be wielded with great responsibility.I listened carefully to my uncle because I knew he was not as lucky as I to have someone share this cautionary advice with him. You see, as a young man he and his virility traveled the perilous road of amore. When you travel such a road, you need to think about protection and Im not talking about latex. What I speak of is known as the cornicello or little bull horn. When you have had as many spurned lovers as Uncle Alfredo, you most definitely need to wear one to ward off the evil eye.I was hoping to get a necklace with a 3 inch cornicello so I can display my virility to the world while protecting myself from the evil eye. My wife had other ideas so what I got instead, free in exchange for this unbiased review, is the Bamoer cubic zirconia white Gold plated round halo pendant necklace.When I first saw this necklace, I knew my wife would love it. My wife prefers small dainty jewelry and, as I predicted, she loves this necklace.The circular pendant is beautiful with a very classy looking design making it perfect for that big night out. It also looks great with jeans and a sweater so it works for more casual outings as well. The stones maybe cubic zirconia but they have nice clarity and really sparkle.The only negative thing I found with the necklace is the chain. It seems a little too delicate to me and seems to be prone to knotting. It isn't a big deal to my wife though. She says these are the types of chains you get in this price range and the knots are easy to undo so that is not an issue for her.If you are in the market for inexpensive jewelry, you can't go wrong with this necklace. It is a high quality piece and is much nicer than necklaces I've seen in this price range.

The XFIL Adjustable Zoom Focus LED Flashlight is a nice addition to my growing collection of flashlights.The flashlight is made of plastic and is very light to carry around or hang on my belt.This flashlight is pretty bright considering its size and it only has a single LED bulb. I have brighter mini LED flashlights but this one is bright enough to illuminate a small to mid sized room quite nicely.The one feature this flashlight has, that my others do not, is the adjustable zoom focus. I usually use the flashlight in its normal setting for maximum light coverage but it is nice to have the option to change the light to a tighter and brighter beam of light for reading small print or looking in smaller areas.The flashlight does not come with instructions so I'm going to explain how to operate the zoom feature. When I first turned it on, for some reason I thought I should rotate the head of the flashlight to adjust the focus. I was turning and turning and the light didn't change. After a few minutes, I realized you need to pull out the lens covering in order to change the light to a smaller and brighter beam of light.Finally, the flashlight is powered by 3 AAA batteries which are not included.*I received this free in exchange for my unbiased review.

I love to burn essential oils to freshen up the house and to enhance my moods so I jumped at an offer to receive the Amir Essential Oil Diffuser free in exchange for an unbiased review.I burn a lot of essential oil. I like to start my morning off by burning peppermint oil. I find the cool peppermint scent a very refreshing and invigorating way to kick of the day. At night I burn lavender in order to relax and quickly fall asleep. The scent of lavender really does help me get a deep restful sleep. I also burn tea tree throughout the day during cold/flu season and I will burn eucalyptus to help alleviate sinus issues due to colds or allergies.I would burn the oil in the two piece ceramic diffusers that typically come with cheap aromatherapy kits. I found these ceramic diffusers to be a pain. You place a tea light candle in the bottom one and put drops of oil in the top one. It is simple enough to use and they work well at first. The top piece where you put the oil is a pain to clean and it eventually ends up cracking from the constant exposure to heat. I then would continue to use the bottom one for the candle and above it I would place a piece of aluminum foil with the oil. This method worked well for a while until one night the oil ignited and started burning the foil. Fortunately, I was still awake and the diffuser was placed in the bathroom with nothing around it to catch fire so it burned fast and quick. It is scary to think of what could have happened. Needless to say, I dont burn essential oils like this anymore.Im really like the Amir Essential Oil Diffuser. It is easy to use, easy to care for, and most importantly SAFE.Pros:01 Easy To Use  It is as simple as adding water, adding a few drops of essential oil, and turning it on.02 Attractive  The unit is far more attractive than my old ceramic diffusers. A cool feature is that the diffuser will change colors. It will rotate through seven different colors on its own or you can choose one stationary color (there are seven colors you can pick from and two lighting modes: bright or subtle). You can also opt for no light at all with the click of a button. I find it relaxing to watch the colors change in a dark room.03 Moisturizes Too  In the winter and summer, I usually run a vaporizer in the bedroom to combat dry air. I think it is great this can effectively diffuse essential oil into the room and put a little moisture into the air as well.04 SAFE  Fire bad. Im glad I dont need an open flame to burn my oils anymore. The unit also has an auto off feature. When the water gets low, the unit turns itself off. This is great for me because I will use it a bedtime and I can just fall asleep without worrying about the unit overheating or the house burning down around me.Cons:None.Ive been using this non-stop for the last three weeks and havent run into any issues yet. I will update the review if I encounter any problems.

Ive been using my four pack of ice ball makers from Teikis to make cranberry juice spheres for my orange juice and lemonade. The perfectly shaped 2.5" diameter spheres melt at a nice slow rate and keep my drinks colder longer.The ice ball molds are easy enough to use and the flexible silicone makes it easy to pop out the spheres without any struggles.The ice ball molds are made from FDA approved food grade silicone and are 100% BPA free. I like that these are dishwasher safe and easy to clean. I also like that these are four individual molds with flat bottoms because it makes it easier for me to find places to put these in a crowded freezer.I suggest giving these a try. Teikis stands by their product and offers a 100% money back guarantee so you have nothing to lose. There is also a two year warranty against defects.*I received this free in exchange for my unbiased review.

I have been using Acadia's Spikey Massage Balls daily and they have provided me great relief from tired and sore muscles.I sit at a computer for 8+ hours a day and the arm that I use to handle my mouse gets pretty sore on some days. I have been using the ball to massage my forearm throughout the day at work. I hold the ball in one hand and I role it up and down my forearm for about 60 seconds to ease the pain. It really helps.I also have been using the balls at work to soothe my tired and sore feet. I slide off my shoe and roll my bare feet over the massage balls. I'll also do this at home while watching television. It feels great. My wife loves to massage her feet with these as well.The set includes a 2.8",3.5",and 3.9" ball so you should find one that is the perfect size for you. There is some give when I squeeze them which is fine with me. The balls can be inflated if you desire extra firmness.Included with the balls are three reflexology charts (two for the feet and one for the hand) printed on a 8.5" x 11" sheet of semi-gloss paper. This is a nice touch.Another nice touch would be if these came with a carry bag but it isn't that big of a deal to me.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

I had another similar hose sprayer that I loved. It lasted five years before I accidentally dropped it. I was hosing down the car when my wife decided she wanted to have a water fight and blasted my in the face with the other hose causing me to drop the sprayer on the driveway which cracked the plastic spray dial. After burying the sprayer in the backyard, I jumped online to look for a replacement and found this sprayer from Coolife.Pros:01 Eight Spray Settings - Watering the grass, watering new seedlings, washing the car. Different jobs require different streams of water. This hose sprayer has settings for eight spray patterns: cone, jet, center, mist, shower, rinse, flat, and soaker. There is also a flow control knob to control the flow of water. Gone are the days of holding your thumb over the end of the hose to get different water streams.02 Comfortable - The shape and design of the sprayer handle and fits my hand perfectly. It also has a clip that securely holds down the trigger for hands-free watering.03 No Leaks - I've been using this for two weeks and have not experienced any leaking from the base or at the spray dial.04 Peace of Mind - There is a two year warranty against breaks and leaks.Cons:01 Plastic Trigger - The only improvement that I suggest is making the trigger out of metal like the rest of the sprayers body rather than plastic. It should be fine as long I don't drop this one on the concrete.I highly recommend this sprayer by Coolife and give it 5 stars. I will update my review and rating if the sprayer develops leaks or dies a premature death.

I tell you what, man, back in 2006 Fox released the sixth season of KOTH on dvd and shortly after that they announced that they scrapped their plans to release any more seasons of KOTH. Dang it, man, Dang it! The fans went crazy and petitioned Fox to please release KOTH but we just got ignored. That is just bad business Fox, dirty pool, Fox, dirty pool. Now listen up Fox, at Strickland the customer comes first. That is right, the customer comes first. I reckon Fox needs to be schooled on that lesson.Flash forward to 2014. After nearly nine dang years of praying for this to come out, Olive Films comes to the rescue and starts releasing KOTH on dvd. Now I read some reviews on here and I got mighty scared to buy this, I tell you what. People were saying that their screens would just go black after an episode and not return to the menu, or the dvds wouldn't play. I don't know if they got bad copies or what but the set I have plays perfectly. There are no freeze ups and my dvds go back to the main menu after each episode. Every time, man, every dang time.Yeah man, I tell ya what, man. Those dang ol' Fox flipper dvds, man. No worries, man, no worries. All 15 uncut episodes of Season 9 are on two single sided dual layered dvds. Let me break it on down for y'all:Disc One:01 A Rover Runs Through It02 Ms Wakefield03 Death Buys A Timeshare04 Yard, She Blows!05 Dale To The Chief06 The Petriot Act07 Enrique-Cilable Differences08 Mutual Of OmabwahDisc Two:09 Care-Takin Care Of Business10 Arlen City Bomber11 Redcorn Gambles With His Future12 Smoking And The Bandit13 Gone With The Windstorm14 Bobby On Track15 It Ain't Over Till The Fat Neighbor SingsVideo: The episodes are presented in a solid 1:33 transfer just like they aired. The colors pop and for the most part everything looks good. Sometimes I'll notice some jaggies in certain scenes but it isn't too dang bad or distracting.Audio: English 2.0 and Spanish 2.0. The audio is clear sounding and I have no complaints.Subtitles: EnglishExtras: Boy, I tell you what, man, this dang ol' set just has the episodes and nothing else. Dang ol' bare bones dvd. Dang it!

I was pretty excited when I was contacted by the seller to review this backpack in exchange for my unbiased review because Autumn is coming and I could really use a new backpack for hiking.The Enpassion backpack in the photos looked great but be warned, the backpack pictured and described is nothing like what I received and I am extremely disappointed. If this wasn't free, I would be furious.So why am I disappointed you ask. Let me count the ways...01 The backpack is much smaller than it appears in the photos. It looks like a kids book bag and is much too small for my frame. It does fit my wife though and she likes it. (More on that later)02 The description states there are many compartments..."You will be able to keep all your items organized with these three zippered compartments. The main pocket is large enough for all your items. The smaller pocket is great for things you would need quickly such as a map, camera or guide book. The inner zipper pocket doubles as a storage pouch and is the perfect place for credit cards, passports, cash, etc."My backpack does not have an inner pocket, zippered or otherwise. There is only the main opening and the zippered storage pouch that the backpack folds into (this is a cool feature). I should mention is that the design of the storage pouch only allows the pouch to be zipped shut when the backpack is inside it. There is another pocket on the front of the bag that I won't use because it does not have a zipper. Without one, things can easily fall out or be quietly purloined by a pair of quick hands. There are also two grey mesh pockets that are perfect for water bottles but the mesh is not tightly woven like what is pictured and I can easily see it tearing with constant use.03 The photos in the listing does not really give you an idea of how cheap the shoulder straps are. They are made of a grey mesh material and are not padded. They are not durable at all and I would not use this backpack to carry anything heavy. It might be fine for light items but if you are planning to use this as a book bag on a daily basis, I can easily see that straps ripping within one month.04 One last annoyance for me is the color scheme. I wanted all black as pictured. The backpack I received has grey mesh pockets and grey straps. Worst of all, on the front of the backpack the name of the manufacturer is boldly presented in large white text. I find that rather tacky and would not have accepted the backpack for review if I knew if was on there.I usually don't include photos with my reviews but I am with this one so buyers can see what the backpack really looks like.When I was snapping my photos, my wife came along and picked up the backpack and said she really liked it. She always can find the good in everything. I guess that explains why she is with me but I digress.She pointed out that the inside of the backpack is made of a water/moisture resistant material which makes this perfect for her to carry her wet swimsuit, swim cap, and goggles home from the pool. I have to concede that the backpack would be good for that. It could also be used to carry home sweaty workout clothes from the gym. The inside is easy to wipe down and keep clean. There are too many negatives for me to rate this higher than two stars. My wife who is using the backpack likes it and rates it four stars so I'm giving this a median rating of three stars or its okay.

The iPhone 6 Waterproof Case from Tethys offers good protection from the elements and is perfect for a day at the beach or any other activity where exposure to water, sand, snow, and/or dust is likely.Pros:01 The case is waterproof as advertised. I put tissue paper inside the case and submerged it in my tub for a half hour. I opened up the case and everything was dry. I also tossed the case in a bucket of sand to simulate dropping the phone at the beach. I opened up the case and there was no sand inside. I have no doubt this should protect my phone from water, sand, and dirt and would be a perfect case for a day at the beach or any other outdoor activity.02 In addition to being element proof, the case frame is made of hard plastic and seems rugged enough to protect my phone from a fall.03 I like the slim design of the case. It contours well to my hand unlike some of the thicker waterproof cases that feel bulky and awkward to hold.Cons:01 The case is not that easy to open or close. When I tried to open the case, I couldnt get the tab to budge using my thumb. I had to use a small screwdriver to pry open the case. When closing up the case, you need to line up everything just so and press hard around all the edges to make sure it is sealed up otherwise you could leave a gap for water to get in.02 Only Apple Headphones and Apple Lightning Charging Cables will work with the case.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

On August 18, 2015 a recall was announced  for these IKEA Patrull Nightlight/Sensors. The recall includes all three models listed: IKEA 302.411.40 Orange, IKEA 702.411.38 Pink, and IKEA 502.390.23  White.The nightlights' plastic coverings can detach and expose electrical components creating a shock hazard. IKEA issued the recall after a child in Austria tried to unplug the nightlight and received an electric shock and minor wounds to the hand.In light of the recall, I don't know why these nightlights are still being sold. If you already purchased one of these, stop using the nightlight and call IKEA toll-free at  888 966 4532 for a full refund.

I am quite pleased with my ZealSound Magic Cube Wireless Blutooth Speaker.Pros:1. Easy Setup - It took me about 30 seconds to pair this to my laptop.2. Easy to Use - It is just a matter of turning on this device and I'm streaming Pandora from my laptop with no issues.3. Good Sound - For a speaker with a 3 watt output, there is a fair about of power and the music sounds great.4. Good Range - I have the speaker about 15 feet from my laptop and it works great. I also tested this at 20 feet and 30 feet and it works from these distances as well. I have not noticed any audio dropouts yet.5. A Volume Button on the Speaker - Ive seen some Bluetooth speakers that do not have volume control buttons. The addition of a volume control buttons on the speaker is a big plus for me. There are buttons to skip forward/volume up, pause/play, and a skip backward/volume down button.Cons: None* I received this free in exchange for my unbiased review.

Summer is here and so is the heat. The central air conditioning has wreaked havoc on my sensitive skin leaving it rough and dry.Ive used grape seed oil on my skin with mixed results. It helped my dry skin somewhat but it didnt leave my skin totally soft. I figured I needed something a little tougher for the winter and summer months and moved on to almond oil. I have been using almond oil for a couple of years. I apply it to my skin daily after my evening shower and have been getting great results.Ive read about coconut oil but never tried it before as I have be happy with the almond oil. By chance, I received an offer for a free sample of Ellie's Best Fractionated Coconut Oil in exchange for an unbiased review. I gladly accepted the offer and have been using the coconut oil exclusively for the last two weeks. I have been applying it with lavender daily after my evening shower. The odorless oil quickly absorbs into my skin and does not leave it feeling greasy. It is doing a good job keeping my skin soft and smooth and also relieves the itchiness. It has only been a couple weeks so I cant say for sure if this is better than the almond oil but I am very pleased with the coconut oil so far and will continue to use it.I've read quite a few reviews where the reviewers did not receive their bonus pumps. I'm not sure what the issue was but it appears to have been corrected. I received a pump as advertised with my bottle of coconut oil.

3Cworld offers quite of few really cute decorative cases. My daughter is going through a little princess phase and this one was a big hit with my girl. She loves it. The artwork is absolutely beautiful.Artwork aside, the case is pretty basic, It is really easy to install your phone in it. The iPhone 6 slides right into the case with ease. The case is made of thin hard plastic that doesn't provide much in the way of protection if you drop your phone so handle with care. In all fairness, the big selling point of this case is more about art and style anyway than it is about protection. 3Cworld includes a screen protector and cleaning cloth with the case.If you are in the market for a beautiful inexpensive basic case this may be the one for you.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review.

I work in an office and spend a good portion of my day at a computer. The arm of the hand that I use to operate my mouse gets sore after long periods so I thought I'd give these arm compression sleeves a try.I tend to avoid purchasing clothing online because sizing can vary so much from manufacturer to manufacturer and I dont want to deal with the hassle of returning things that dont fit. I was a little worried about what size to get but the sizing chart provided by the company is accurate and the sleeves are a perfect fit.In addition to being a perfect fit, the sleeves are comfortable to wear for extended periods of time. They stay on tight and provide excellent compression throughout my work day and workouts. (I have also been using the full arm sleeves when lifting weights and have noticed less muscle soreness the next morning.)The compression sleeves are made well and all the stitching is tight. I like that the sleeves are made of 15% spandex and 85% nylon rather than being 100% neoprene like some other compression sleeves. These sleeves do not have a bad odor like neoprene sleeves that tend to smell really funky. These are pretty easy to care for too. They can be machine washed on cold and tumble dried on low.I found these sleeves are the perfect solution to my problem. The sleeves provide enough compression on my arm to solve my issue and Im on the computer now for hours and no more soreness.Now I need to find something like this to help put compression on my achilles tendon when I run.

My wife and I swim for recreation and exercise. We are not professional swimmers. That being said, we both agree these are very nice swim goggles for the money and perfectly suit our needs.Pros:01 The most important thing that I look for in swim goggles is a good waterproof seal. The seal on these goggles suction tightly around my eyes but is still comfortable to wear. The suction is so good that I really have to give these a tug to take them off. I've been using these for a week now and have not experienced any leaks yet.02 The headstrap is adjustable and comfortable to wear.03 The lenses have an anti-fog coating that seems to work. I haven't experienced any fogging issues. The mirrored lenses also offer UV protection which is a must for outdoor swimming.04 The goggles come with a pair of ear plugs and a nose clip.05 The goggles come with a hard plastic storage/carrying case.Cons: NoneI received a pair of JollySports swimming goggles free in exchange for an unbiased review.

The weather has finally warmed up and Im looking forward to trips to the beach. It seems like the question of where to store my things always arises. Ideally, I want to keep my things in a place that will keep them dry and free of sand. Somehow, my stuff always ends up stuffed in the toe of my shoes. The 3Cworld Waterproof Pouch gives me a great place to keep my phone, wallet, keys and other possessions safe from the elements.The translucent blue PVC plastic pouch has two very tight ziploc style seals. These are not cheap seals that close with a glide of the finger and open just as easily. It really took me some effort to close the seals and pull them open. The second seal is right above the first and folds over the first for extra protection. That interior closure is kept shut by a flap. The velcro that closes the flap could be a little stronger but it keeps the flap shut. The flap is meant to face outwards but I wear it with the flap facing me so it is pressed against my body for added protection.I could tell by looking that the pouch is waterproof but I decided to test it out before using it with my phone. I put tissue paper inside the pouch and submerged it in my tub for a half hour. I opened up the pouch and the tissue paper was dry. I also tossed the pouch in a bucket of sand to simulate dropping the phone at the beach. I opened up the pouch and there was no sand inside. I have no doubt that whether I choose to wear my new waterproof pouch or stuff it in my shoe, my things will stay dry and free of sand. It is perfect for a day at the beach or any other outdoor activity.* I received this free sample in exchange for my unbiased review

I love to burn essential oils to freshen up the house and to enhance my moods so I jumped at an offer to receive the iHomeSet Essential Oil Diffuser free in exchange for an unbiased review.I burn a lot of essential oil. I like to start my morning off by burning peppermint oil. I find the cool peppermint scent a very refreshing and invigorating way to kick of the day. At night I burn lavender in order to relax and quickly fall asleep. The scent of lavender really does help me get a deep restful sleep. I also burn tea tree throughout the day during cold/flu season and I will burn eucalyptus to help alleviate sinus issues due to colds or allergies.I would burn the oil in the two piece ceramic diffusers that typically come with cheap aromatherapy kits. I found these ceramic diffusers to be a pain.  You place a tea light candle in the bottom one and put drops of oil in the top one. It is simple enough to use and they work well at first. The top piece where you put the oil is a pain to clean and it eventually ends up cracking from the constant exposure to heat. I then would continue to use the bottom one for the candle and above it I would place a piece of aluminum foil with the oil. This method worked well for a while until one night the oil ignited and started burning the foil. Fortunately, I was still awake and the diffuser was placed in the bathroom with nothing around it to catch fire so it burned fast and quick. It is scary to think of what could have happened. Needless to say, I dont burn essential oils like this anymore.Im really glad I was contacted about the iHomeSet Essential Oil Diffuser. It is easy to use, easy to care for, and most importantly SAFE.Pros:01 Easy To Use  It is as simple as adding water, adding a couple drops of essential oil, and turning it on.02 Attractive  The unit is far more attractive than my old ceramic diffusers. I like the faux wood appearance and it looks nice on my nightstand. Another cool feature is that the plastic top of the diffuser will change colors. Dont worry, It is not like a flashing neon sign. The colors are subtle and I find it relaxing to watch in the dark. You can also choose one stationary color or opt for no light at all with the click of a button.03 Moisturizes Too  In the winter and summer, I usually run a vaporizer in the bedroom to combat dry air. I think it is great this can effectively diffuse essential oil into the room and put a little moisture into the air as well.04 SAFE  Fire bad. Im glad I dont need an open flame to burn my oils anymore. The unit also has an auto off feature. When the water gets low, the unit turns itself off. This is great for me because I will use it a bedtime and I can just fall asleep without worrying about the unit overheating or the house burning down around me.Cons:01 Some people have complained they have a hard time opening this but I found it is pretty easy to open. Just a twist and it is open. Ive been using this non-stop for the last three weeks and havent run into any issues yet. I will update the review if I encounter any problems.

The Director of my business unit is a pretty nice guy but lately he seems to be going through some strange mid-life crisis.One day he came into work wearing a Justin Bieber style wig. The whole company (aka The Hive) knows he is bald but out of fear of losing their jobs they all pretend the wig is his natural hair.The next week he stopped carrying a briefcase and starts wearing a backpack to work. He is often seen running from meeting to meeting with his backpack on. He turns up at our standup meetings with his backpack slung around one arm. He wears it everywhere. The Hive share a collective mind and, lo and behold, the next week 99.9% of the company are running around with backpacks. Things got crazy and my Manager called me into his office and started asking me why I dont wear a backpack. He really put the pressure on. It was like a CIA interrogation sans the water-boarding. Three hours later I am given an ultimatum, start being a team player and show up to work on Monday morning wearing a backpack or else. Oh no. The dreaded or else.It was lucky for me I found this backpack. I am impressed by the quality construction of the backpack. It feels very durable and I expect it last for a long time. The backpack is covered in polka dots making it fashionable and fun as well as a practical way to carry around my stuff. On the outside of the backpack there is a zippered pocket large enough to carry my wallet, phone and/or checkbook. There is a thin deep pocket on each side of the large pocket. These are perfect to carry your pens, pencils, ruler etc. On the fully lined inside there is a large pocket and 2 small pockets. It is roomy enough for my laptop plus additional items. It is also good for your books. In addition to being functionable (fashion + function), the backpack is also comfortable. The shoulder straps are padded and I find that it is comfortable to wear.I was very excited to go to work on Monday knowing Id be the envy of the office. Sure enough, my co-workers smiled at me for getting a backpack and joining The Hive. All day all I heard was the buzzing of co-workers whispering about me. I figured the backpack was a hit. A friend took me aside and broke the news to me. It turned out my co-workers were making fun of me for wearing a girls backpack. I felt my face get red from equal parts anger and embarrassment and ran to the nearest conference room with tears streaming down my face. In my upset state, I didnt notice the Director sitting in there watching Hip-Hop videos. I only spoke with him a couple times in the past but he was very personable and nicely asked me why I was crying. After I explained the whole situation to him, he reassured me that I have a very attractive unisex backpack and asked me where I got it.The following Monday, the Director rode his Segway up and down the aisles wearing his new Casual Style Polka Dots Canvas Laptop Backpack. There was no laughing or whispering from The Hive. In fact, by the end of the week the entire Hive was wearing one.

I received a coupon in the mail from Harbor Freight Tools for a free Pittsburgh 30 ft x 1-Inch quikfind tape measure and off I ran.Being a freebie, I was expecting a poorly made, light-weight tape measure. I was wrong. This tape measure is very sturdy and the rubber wrapped case really gives it a real heavy-duty feel. The extra-thick blade alIows me to extend the tape out a good 5 feet without bending. Something on this tape that I haven't seen before is when you reach 13 inches, there is an additional reading of 1 ft, 1 right above the 13. When you reach 14 inches, the additional reading is 1 ft, 2 and so on. I thought this was a neat feature for who can't convert inches to feet on the fly. The only negative I have is that it can be a little tough to move the thumb lock. It does seem to become easier to move the more you use it and it does lock the tape into place very securely.This tape measure goes to show that the old adage, 'you get what you pay for', doesn't always hold true. It is a very welcome addition on my tool belt. I've noticed that since I've been wearing it the ladies are giving me a second glance. I've even gotten whistles and catcalls from a couple carpenters on the job.Arrh! Arrh! Arrh!

I like that the sleeves are made of 15% spandex and 85% nylon rather than being 100% neoprene like some other compression sleeves. These sleeves do not have a bad odor like neoprene sleeves that tend to smell really funky. These are pretty easy to care for too. They can be machine washed on cold and tumble dried on low.I found these sleeves are the perfect solution to my problem. I tell you what, man, back in 2006 Fox released the sixth season of KOTH on dvd and shortly after that they announced that they scrapped their plans to release any more seasons of KOTH. Dang it, man, Dang it! The fans went crazy and petitioned Fox to please release KOTH but we just got ignored. That is just bad business Fox, dirty pool, Fox, dirty pool. Now listen up Fox, at Strickland the customer comes first. That is right, the customer comes first. I reckon Fox needs to be schooled on that lesson.Flash forward to 2014. After nearly nine dang years of praying for this to come out, Olive Films comes to the rescue and starts releasing KOTH on dvd. Now I read some reviews on here and I got mighty scared to buy this, I tell you what. People were saying that their screens would just go black after an episode and not return to the menu, the dvds wouldn't play, and someone was even talking about dang tv logos at the beginning of the shows. I don't know if they got bad bootleg copies or what but the set I have plays perfectly. There are no tv logos and my dvds go back to the main menu after each episode. Every time, man, every dang time.Yeah man, I tell ya what, man. Those dang ol' Fox flipper dvds, man. No worries, man, no worries. All 22 uncut episodes are on three single sided dual layered dvds. Let me break it on down for y'all:Disc One:01 Patch Boomhauer02 Reborn To Be Wild03 New Cowboy On The Block04 The Incredible Hank05 Flirting With The Master06 After The Mold Rush07 Livin' On Reds, Vitamin C, And Propane08 Rich Hank, Poor HankDisc Two:09 Ceci N'est Pas Une10 That's What She Said11 My Hair Lady12 Phish And Wild Life13 Cheer Factor14 Dale Be Not Proud15 Apres Hank, Le DelugeDisc Three:16 Daletech17 How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love The Alamo18 Girl You'll Be A Giant Soon19 Stressed For Success20 Hank's Back21 The Redneck On Rainey Street22 Talking ShopVideo: The episodes are presented in a solid 1:33 transfer just like they aired. The colors pop and for the most part everything looks good. Sometimes I'll notice some jaggies in certain scenes but it isn't too dang bad or distracting.Audio: English 2.0 and Spanish 2.0. The audio is clear sounding and I have no complaints.Subtitles: EnglishExtras: Boy, I tell you what, man, this dang ol' set just has the episodes and nothing else. Dang ol' bare bones dvd. Dang it!

I'm a huge Deep Red fan; they produce some very visually engaging and less run-of-the-mill stuff. I'm an active snail mailer and always looking to add postal themed stamps to my collection. What I didn't pay attention to, in my haste to finalize my order at the fantastic price being offered, is that this baby is a pretty good size!So yep, it's far bigger than I was expecting so just in case you missed it too: the overall dimensions are 3-1/2" by 3-1/4" and the image produced is obviously nearly as big. Now, that's not exactly gigantic, but is important to note if you happen to not own a block large enough to accommodate it or planned on using it as just a small touch on little envelopes. But it makes for a very arresting and kinda old-timey image (lots of graining and speckles but still remains crisp) and is ideal for 4x6 (or larger) cards. Postal fans will appreciate the shout out to the Postmaster General and the raised flag. What's more fun than raising that little red flag to tell the carrier you've got something to mail?! Sadly, few practice that anymore, but, regardless, this mailbox has lots of fun post-stamping additional deco possibilities; another quality piece from Deep Red.

A very nice wood-mounted rubber stamp set. The images produced are crisp; even beginner stampers won't have an issue working with these charmers as the image is always consistent (without having to hold your your tongue just right). I really like that the newspaper stamp has a very old fashioned look but isn't overtly "scrapbook vintage" a la the more mass produced Tim Holtz stuff. (I love his stuff, just saying this isn't a set you'll see frequently duplicated or on every craft store shelf). The book stamp is technically big enough that if you had fine precision pens and were willing to write at a cool slant, you could title your mini tome. All in all, a good value and am pleased to add it to my growing collection. But mind the dimensions--these are small!

A great stamp to use for scrapbooking or penpalling or whatever paper craft project needs a melodic touch. I find stamps from this brand to be rather hit or miss, but this one is deeply etched and produces a fairly crisp image if you apply even pressure. This is a classic wood mounted rubber stamp --so you don't have to go searching for long acrylic block!As for the review that stated it was "very small and ugly", well, there's no accounting for taste so it may indeed be an unattractive option for some, but as a stamper with a fairly large collection, a 4 inch long stamp is definitely not considered undersized!  If anything, this is a touch too big for some of my card projects as it's so whoppin' long. But it was priced right and the scrolled curl makes it more visually appealing to me than just a flat bar. Fun!

I love Deep Red stamps--rarely do I ever get a dud from this brand and this one is no exception. It's foam mounted and so of course you'll need a separate block to properly use it. (When I was new to the world of stamps the whole 'acrylic block' concept sounded so weird to me...but if you're new too, just search for a block of appropriate size and really, you'll figure it out very easily and never look back).This stamp produces an image just large enough to write a few words on; if you write with a fine tip pen you can customize your clapper--a great little touch for a movie night scrapbook page or for sharing your favorite films with a snail mail pal.Cut deeply, stamps cleanly, good crisp lines. A winner!

I'm an active snail mailer and use these page protectors, in my compatible Avery binder, to store my dozens and dozens of postal stamps; trying to remember what denominations and designs I already had was becoming annoying, so his way I'm protecting the stamps and saving myself time.  Obviously a real philatelist wouldn't dream of using a system so crude, but for just a quick perusal, the page protectors turned out to be of much higher quality than I was anticipating (compared to the inelegant vinyl binder ordered at the same time). It's an absolute ideal system and the price, on my day of purchase, was rock bottom.The pages aren't too stiff or wrinkly and with 7 holes, it's likely they'll work with other brands' binders beyond Avery. They're perfectly clear, they're nicely thick but allow for easy page turning, and I've yet to experience any rips or tears. They don't curl on the ends either. Understand the size Imitations and just exactly what fits, and I don't think you'll be too disappointed.Leaving poor reviews for these pages protectors (which include accurately stated dimensions) just because they don't happen to properly fit your intended use ...is kinda unfair. I just love these things and they do exactly what they're supposed to do. They fit several sheets of paper, but for my purposes, I was more ticked to discover that very thin sheets don't fall out if the binder is turned upside down. (Something I cannot say for Avery's 'business cards' 5.5x8.5 clear insert pages).A very pleased customer indeed.

I'm an active snail mailer and use this binder, along with the Avery page protectors, to store my dozens and dozens of postal stamps; trying to remember what denominations and designs I already had was becoming annoying, so his way I'm protecting the stamps and saving myself time.  Obviously a real philatelist wouldn't dream of using a system so crude, but for just a quick perusal, this binder is absolute ideal and the price was rock bottom.Because I rarely remove pages from this binder, the fact that the rings are stiff and quite dangerously stubborn and sharp, doesn't affect me. But if you're going to be frequently inserting or removing pages, definitely spend the extra few bucks and get the 'touch' version or the more forgiving D-rings. Eeegads. How did I not lose a hand back as a second grader?I really appreciate this binder has a preview window (which was not reflected in the description) and has both a front and rear pocket; this is useful for storing slightly larger sized sheets of paper or in my case, stamp sheets that are just a hair too wide for the page protectors.The plastic is the cheap splinter-y vinyl I knew it would be. So be prepared for some peeling and discoloration if you order in white. This not archival quality, folks. But I also paid next to nothing so my expectations were low. At just one inch, you'd be surprised how much you can fit in this before it reaches capacity. Understand the limitations and what size of paper this system takes, and you won't be too disappointed.
