That is about 60 extra though and really would expect that it would come with at least the flexible hose.  All in all it is a very solid and well built cordless vacuum that is very well engineered. Very high performance indeed. I really like it and plan to keep using it for a long time. Thanks, hope this helps.Pros: Very lightweight  Works fantastic on hardwood or tiled floors  Flexible to get into very tight places  No cords!!!  Battery last a good bit it normal mode  No bags to buy. Just dump and start again  Very high quality powered brush head with carbon fiber bristlesCons: Does not work well on very low profile throw rugs or textured ones.  Does not work well in cars without the optional flexible suction hose

Ok I know it say's for women but I am a Man and I purchased this for my concealed carry. I have been looking all over for a plastic holster like this one because I work with my concealed on as a inside waist carry and sweat badly thus causing my LCP to rust and drives me crazy! I have been using a leather holster for over a year and while very comfortable it just  my sweat. So after much research I cam across this and tried to figure out why it is just for women but after looking at it I decided it looks perfect for a man to use as well and I must say yes it does!! I am very glad I purchased this for my inside waist carry because it is very comfortable even after only first day of use and no sweat issues on my LCP either. I just clip it on my inside pants no belt needed. I adjusted the tension screw until I was happy with the amount of resistance needed to pull the gun from the holster. In my opinion this is perfect for a man. Don't let the for Women fool you or discourage you from trying it. I'm glad I did. Thanks, and hope this helps.

The SOG knife is a excellent tool for any outdoors man, hunter, or fisher. Price is a little on the high end, but worth it for a great tool. The nice sharp and durable fixed blade is resilient to dulling and chipping. The knife comes a  sharp *serated*(not sure of spelled correct ) edge which is perfect for minor cutting. Light weight and balanced is one of the many nice features that is included with this knife. The sheath is full of awesome extras. Has a knife sharpening tool which is not only very convenient but works great. Also, has a flint which produces enough spark to start fire; tested it on a napkin which worked great. Finally it has a seat belt/rope cutting tool on it that worked well on thin rope.  Overall, excellent knife and very pleased with this product

I receive this phone about a week ago and have also purchased the Blu Studio Energy and love both of them. My background is coming from the Samsun# Galax# S4 and S5. I like the Galax# but always had a hard time using the keyboard for texting no mater if I used the one that came with it or downloaded one. I just could not get past that oh and the cost of one to buy outright. So I figured I would do some research and came up with this Blu brand cell phones. They are fairly new in the cell phone market kind of like HTC and others were but are now considered big brand name phones. The sound and screen quality are every bit as good as the big names out there. Oh and I bought a tempered glass screen protector and you cannot even tell it has a protector on it and does not smudge up anywhere as much with it on. I will never go back to using the peel and stick plastic screen protectors. The build quality is just as good as the Samsun# and function every bit as well and even better with the keyboard. It seems that the Blu is much more accurate so I do not get anywhere as much typos anymore. This phone has a very high quality feel to it but does not slip out of my hand as easy compared with my past Samsun# phones. The rear camera quality is excellent and even better than my Studio Energy that I also have. Now the battery life is right on par with most other smart phones with about 2 days of average use before needing to recharge. My Studio Energy I almost  always go 9-10 days on one battery charge which is insane and makes my wife with her iPhon# so mad because her's is always plugged into the wall or car outlet.  For the price point I have yet to come even close to finding a better phone that I really cannot find any flaws with. I don't think you will be disappointed with this phone or the Blu studio Energy which is very similar to this one but has a super long battery life. Either way you can't go wrong and I am had dot please when it comes to cell phones.

I received this Workshop portable vacuum and was pretty excited to receive it but unfortunatly not as impressed as some of the other reviewers have praised it. I unboxed it and every part of it feels kind of like very cheap plastic. I have had many portable vacuum's in the past to compare with some from Homedep# and Craftsman# and were in same price range but they were of much better build quality and feel. I really don't like writing a not so great review but weather I paid for it or not I try to be honest in my reviews. During my first use the wide nozzle fell apart while vacuuming my car with it. I had come to find out that it is held together with what looks like superglue. I pressed it back in but fell right back out while vacuuming. I decided to try another nozzle the crevice one and I found that I really liked that one the best anyways and it did not break.  I found that the hose was just barely long enough but it is a small diameter and cheap hose that will probably crack in a year of two use. I have had ones like this in the past. Also the suction is just ok and enough for home light home use but for sure not very strong. I really want dot like this vacuum but just too many weakness for me to recommend it. There are better options. Please remember this is just my thoughts based on my personal experience with this and past portable vacuums I have had.Pros: Very light weight  Pretty easy to maintain and use  Has vacuum and blow featureCons: Wide suction nozzle broke during first use  The main hose is small diameter and seems of low quality  For the price there are better options. Both lower price and better quality build

I placed an order for this to help my Dad with his chronic bald area near his huge oak tree this year. He has tried to get grass to grow in this area for at least 10 years now but never takes off. The area is fairly well shaded most of the day and moss sometimes is a problem growing in the soil.We went ahead and tilled the area and has been raining just about everyday for the last month it seems so nice and moist already. He went ahead and broadcasted the seed and to my surprise after about 6 days small grass shoots are appearing everywhere!!! So far so good and hope that it will continue to grow this summer. I did notice on the contents disclosure that their are probably 6 different types of grass seed in this mix so I guess if one type of seed does not do well in your area maybe another seed will? Oh and blue grass seed looks weird but if it helps retain moisture then that's all good and birds did not seem to mess with it either. All in all very pleased with this product. Hope this helps.

Well I had high hopes for this Zoysia grass seed to help get a nice yard this year but no go. I had an area that was about 30 x 40 cleared and ready for grass seed so I even used my Scotts broadcaster and used their setting to spread the seed on the prepared soil. It had rained almost everyday so the ground was still very moist and I also raked over the seed slightly and it rained the next day and next day and almost everyday for about 1.5 weeks. It has now been about 2.5 weeks and nothing so I am guessing either I did something wrong or my soil is not good for this type of seed. I should also note that many other reviewers had mentioned that they had mulch like substance mixed with their seed but my mix had crushed like little stones mixed in it. Sadly this seed did not work for me. I wish it had though. I did also buy a small pallet of Zoysia plugs from Amazon and so far they are still alive after being in the ground for 1.5 weeks but not growing yet. Oh I live in the upstate of SC. Hope this helps.

The monster toddler towel is very cute, durable, fits great. This Towel was used with my 2 year little boy and he loves the cool little monster on it. The towels material seems to be made of good quality and strong cloth. Also, the towel fits around  my son very well. Would definitely recommend to others

Perfect!! I bought this for my daughter for Easter. She has always wanted real diamonds but of course can't spend a bunch for it so this fit the bill perfectly. I was quite surprised when it arrived though as it was in only a zip lock bag and not a nice case like everyone else has said and shown. So when I gave it to her I had to dress it up some because I am not going to had her a zip lock bag with a necklace in it. The size is very nice clean and bright. The chain is small but seems to be strong enough. All in all a great purchase. Just be prepared for it to arrive in a plain old zip lock bag. Hope this helps.

I received a bag of this Scoots Turf Builder seed just in time for one of my yard projects. I had to do some excavating around the perimeter of my house and back filled it and now ready for grass. I was going to go out and buy some Rebel Fescue but I saw this and figured I would give it a try.  I had the soil already loosened so I just broadcasted the seed and lightly raked it to cover with a very thin layer of soil and it rained next day so I did not have to water it. The ground stayed damp for several days and the I totally forgot to water it but fortunately it has rained every few days here.They temperature has been is the mid 70s during the day and 50s at night so just about right. Well after about 2 weeks I am seeing green popping up everywhere so I am happy and just hope it will be established enough by summer time so it does not burn up.  I did notice that I had to slow the broadcast rate down a bit compared with any other grass seed I have ever used. I would always have mine metered for max but with this I have to back it down to about half. I have no idea unless that blue coating on the seed makes it pass through the spreader easier? Anyways I am very pleased that I have green grass again instead of brown mud. Hope this helps.

I received these GWON orange gloves and did not really expect to be wowed because I have always been let down with the quality of any Latex or Nitrile gloves be it expensive or cheap, fancy box or not. Ok so I have my own BMW repair shop and probably more than half my repairs involve repairing oil leaks so I tend to go through a lot of gloves in a short time because they either fall apart from the oil and cleaners or the get ripped when performing the repair or even worse rip when trying to put them on. Over the last 15 years I have used almost every brand latex or nitrile gloves out there it seems. I have used top dollar ones from Snap On truck like Microflex all the way down to the HB freight brand and was really recently disappointed with the Venom brand as they probably are the worst I have ever used. Well I am very pleased to say that these are by far the best gloves I have ever used in every way. This box is pretty big due to how many and how thick these gloves are. I was really surprised by the very deep textured diamond like grid built into the gloves that provide excellent grip especially when oil is present. I am able to perform most repairs with just one set of gloves and sometimes can even reuse them. These gloves are very thick and strong. I think they are actually as thick as they are advertised to be unlike just about all other brands. So far I have torn very few of these an no brake or carb cleaner seems to affect them either. Oh and the bright orange gets everyone attention.  Now I have noticed that the medium is a little smaller than I am used to and are snug. If they were any tighter I would need to move up to the large size. All in all when you compare the quality and the price this is a winner and I will buy these after I run out. Hope this helps.

many times I have my BMW customers ask me if there is anything I can do for their yellowed looking headlights short of replacing them at 1500.00 each side and I tell them about my headlight service. I have been using a wool buffing wheel for many years but you have to be very careful not to burn the plastic with the heat from the wool pad. I decided to give this foam pad a try and so glad I did. Not only do I not have any problems burning the plastic but with the mild polishing compound I do not have to work it as hard to get great results. Only thing is you have to be careful to stay away from any sharp edges as it will tend to nick the pad. All in all a great investment. Hope this helps.

I have my own BMW repair shop and have been using gloves for many many years and have seen good ones and bad ones. These have to be near the worst I have ever used right behind HB freights cheapest ones. A good deal of them rip as they are being put on. Then they are also really bad for ripping if just barely touching touching something slightly rough. They are extremely thin especially the palm area. Unfortunately I bought a case of these but at the rate I am going through them I will be needing another brand very soon. I have found the HB freight brand the expensive nitrile 6 or 9mil thick black ones to hold up the best so far. So needless to say I have been less than impressed with these. Only good thing is that they do seem to resist carb and brake cleaner fairly well. Hope this helps.

I have always been pleased with OTC brand tools in the past but this one is way off the mark and is the same tool you would buy at the flea market for 5.00. This tool came in a package that says OTC on it and that is it. The tool itself has no markings on it other than MADE In China on it. Does not even say OTC on the tool anywhere! I don't know what has happened here but not impressed with the direction OTC tools seem to be going.  The tool itself has hard plastic grips that feel vey cheap. The tool worked great the first time I used it and then I went to use it the other day and will not strip wire at all. The wire just slides out of the grips and does not strip it. I could not find any type of tension adjustment so I guess this tool is just a waste of money. I will be more careful in the future when considering to buy OTC branded tools. Hope this helps.

Ok I have my Own BMW only repair shop and as with BMW's come many challenging electrical issues so I am always using my volt meter. I do have several that I currently own and use. I have a couple of Fluke meters that are older but still work fine and then I also have a Centec and Radio Shack meter. Out of all them of course the Fluke is the best but also cost over 400.00 new and then the worst I have had would be the Radio Shack it is just poor build quality.  This Extech is below the Fluke in build quality but for sure better than all my other meters. The buttons are nice rubber feel and not cheap hard plastic. The meter is packed with all the functions I would need in a basic meter. I mainly use my meters for voltage test, voltage drop, current draw, resistance and diode checks are the most common. I rarely need an oscilloscope and my Fluke meter does not have that function either. The meter responds to measurements quickly but not instant like my Fluke but it is very accurate compared to my Fluke meters.  I really like the little yellow button that you have to press and hold for the backlight to come on. It is nice and bright and none of my other meters have this so is really nice when working under the dash with poor lighting. The hold and min max functions are surprising to have for the price point of this meter. Also included is audible sound for diode test and other functions. This meter also has a nice flip out stand to keep the meter upright and also has retainers built in for the cables to keep put while not in use. If I had to pick something that I did not care for is the cable leads are somewhat shorter than I like. A nice addition would be a rubberized case for it because I tend to have butter fingers and seem to drop everything. And yes I have already dropped this once but no damage was noticed. All in all for the price and build quality I would say for sure is a good deal. Hope this helps.

I purchased this Blu Studio Energy phone about two weeks ago to replace my Samsung Galaxy Rugby Pro that was good but was just too buggy. The battery on my old Samsung would last me an average of 2-3 days with moderate usage including calls, text, emails, internet use, and GPS. This also my Business phone for my repair shop so I get a lot of calls.  I bought this phone mainly because of it's advertised battery life and I figured if I could get more than 2-3 days I would be very happy. Wow I was really blown away when I was able to get almost 9 days on a single charge with all the above mentioned usage. I kept telling my wife everyday that went by and I was still on the same charge. By day 4 or 5 she was really getting mad at me for bringing it up everyday because she has an iPhone 5 and has to charge her battery up half way through a day to get by.  As for the rest of the phone I am really happy with the size and weight of the phone. I thought that it would be really heavy and bulky with that hugh 5000ma battery but not at all. Now no it is not as thin as a Samsung Galaxy S5 but it is welcome for me since I can hold onto it much better with the slight thickness increase.  The phone is very fast with all apps and usage and specially the internet. The only feature that is not real fast  to me is texting and it seems to lag slightly but not bad. That maybe part of my service with Cricket or the phone but not sure either way. Oh and the phone comes with a nice protective cover that I am using and a screen protector that I used then 1 day later stared seeing bubbles so I pulled it off and threw it away. After some research I found VSTN  Blu Studio Energy Glass Screen protector that is really a very thin piece of tempered glass that goes on exactly the same as the standard plastic one does. I was so blown away when I removed it and it really was a piece of glass and it applies just the same as normal and with Zero bubbles and you cannot even tell it is on because it fits so well. Another thing and maybe my imagination is the screen seems to be much more sensitive to my touch and that is a good thing.  All in all I am very very happy with this phone in everyday compared to my old Samsung Galaxy Rugby Pro. Hope this helps.

I placed an order for this to give to my 9 year old daughter to wear this Easter Sunday and wow very very nice. The bracelet came in a nice gift box that is hinged. Being a man though and my daughter anxiously waiting I was not able to open the bracelet to put on her wrist. It has a very small clasp on the side that you flip over to unlock it and I thought it would just open after that but no it does not. Took me a bit to figure out that you also had to push down on the little tab that is near the clasp and pull outward at same time to open it.. Wow I felt dumb but is double security that it won't fall off.  Now yes I did give this to my daughter but my wife loves it too so I may have to buy one for her. The feel is very good quality and is well made. Not just cheap stamped piece of metal. It looks like it should hold up very well indeed. This picture just does not do it justice. Really needs a picture of it on a ladies wrist. Hope this helps.

I decided to give these Dickies steel toes shoes a try because I have been having problems with my steel toe boots sweeting too much and feeling like a swamp in my boots and smelling like it too. I noticed before buying these that they have breathable mesh all over them so that is what I was drawn to.  Upon opening the box and pulling the shoes out I was blown away with how light they are. I had to pinch the toe to make sure it was really a steel toe shoe and it is indeed. I put them on and laced them up and the rest is history. I have been wearing them for a little over a week now and am very glad to say that my feet are not all sweaty at the end of the day and no swamp feet either. The shoes overall are very comfortable and light weight. These will not weigh you down at all.  So if you have a problem with sweaty feet or can't stand the weight of a heavy work and need steel toes then this might just be the answer for you too. Hope this helps.

Wow I knew this was portable but unreal. Unfortunately most of the people reviewing this Decoy are not hunters and were expecting a yard orniment that was 3 dimensional  and would look pretty. This is not that. This is solely for the hunter and to attract the Tom's eye's and not the humans.  This Decoy is an awesome design for portability and most hunters know you already have enough stuff to drag around and weigh you down so this is a warm welcome for me. One less thing to weigh me down or make loud sounds the better.  Now this is made of a screen printed photo on material and stretched over a collapsible frame. If you watch the attached video it will show how you simply twist and fold it then just place it in your pocket and that is it. When you are ready to set it up simply pull it out of your pocket and it folds out on it's own. Next just place in your favorite spot with the attached pole.  Now for the fun. Sit and wait. This is a very realistic Decoy and is accurate to attract a Tom. All In all for the price and portability factor this is a very well engineered product. Please only hunters review this item for hunting purposes and not a lawn decoration. Hope this helps the real hunters out there like me. Thanks

I purchased this screen protector because it says it is tempered glass. My thoughts were no way this could really be a piece of glass as a protector but to my amazement it is an extremely thin piece of tempered glass. This kit came with a cleaning wipe, a drying wipe, and a lint cloth. I followed the directions and placed the screen on and wow fits perfect and zero bubbles!!! I looked it over real good and can't even tell it has a screen protector on it.  What is even more amazing is that with the screen protector on it is more sensitive to the touch and the touch screen actually works even better with this on. I am so glad I tried this protector because I have never until now been happy with a screen protector because it either had bubbles from day one no matter how carefully I was or within days the screen protector would start lifting in the corners. Well worth the couple of extra dollars to get this one that I feel will last the life of the phone. Hope this helps.

I received this Bosch impact drill a few days ago not really knowing it's capacity but all I can say is Wow!! When I pulled this out of the box and saw how small it is my first thought was this thing cannot have any real power but I was so wrong. This Bosch impact drill is way smaller than my Porter Cable drill I have been using and way lighter too.  My first test was to try to break lug bolts loose on my BMW. I figured it would be a joke but much to my surprise it broke them loose with ease. This impact drill has 3 electronic torque settings and while it works just fine I still would prefer the old fashion twist torque settings. For me just 3 torque settings is not enough but I will probably will get used to it. Just a learning curve.  This also has a hole within the center of the 1/2 drive that accepts hex type screw driver bits and drill bits. It also comes with an adapter so you can use 1/4 drive sockets too. This is a very versatile tool that is a drill and impact wrench. Now this is 139 ft lbs torque and is almost as powerful as some light duty air powered impact wrenches so really is very impressive indeed.  The way that this unit charges is amazing to me. It is an inductive charger and all you need to do is set in on the base and charges all on its own. No battery to take off every time to charge. It will always be fully charged and ready to use this way. Charging time seems to be quick at just about an hour for the first charge.  This will for sure replace both my old drill and impact driver for most purposes. Now yes it will probably not break loose stubborn lug bolts but for every day use this will do for me at my BMW repair shop. The included carry bag is a nice bonus. All in all I am very very impressed with the only exception of the electronic torque settings. ThanksUpdate: Just discovered that using this as a drill to drive screws in a deck is awesome. The impact function ratchets the screws down with no effort and I am talking about 3 inch long screws that sometimes tend to break before seating all the way down. Works very well driving screws for sure.

I recently had a water pipe burst upstairs and ruined my hardwood floors in the kitchen so i have been pulling the flooring up and needed to find a way to remove all the adhesive on the concrete that was holding the flooring down. From ready all the reviews on this tool I thought it would be perfect for this job but just did not work well at all. The blade just slides over the top of the glue no matter the angle used. I ended up using my flat blade shovel and grinded a sharp edge on it and it actually did a decent job removing the glue. The Bully floor tool may work well in other areas but not good for removing floor glue in this case.

This was purchased for one of my BMW customers that refuses to go to the dealer or pay their prices so they came to me and I offered this brand new Bosch alternator that is exact same that was installed from factory as new but way less money without the BMW name on the box. All Bosch new alternators and starters come with a Lifetime and unlimited warranty. Now the warranty does not cover labor but have not had to ever use the warranty and have been using the Bosch alternator and starters on my customers BMW's for years with no problems. So yet another happy customer and that is just good business. Thanks and hope this helps

I purchased this for one of my Mini Cooper Customers since the price was good and was stainless steel so thought should be very good. So ok the day came to install it and looked very nice and well made but when went to fit it that was not happening. This is only for 2003 and under Mini S but yet listing stated it fits 2006 also. I contacted the seller and stated that it will fit but requires mods. So anyways I proceeded to spend an extra 2 hrs to modify and make it fit but boy what a pain and did not quote for extra labor so my loss but. Next came starting the car up and wow does it sound cheesy. It has a metal can sound to it and not at all impressive. If you like the sound of riceburner cars like the Hondas then you will probably like it. Needless to say when my customer picked up the car he was not happy at all. He said it was cheap sounding and I agreed. I purchased an additional muffler to install in the center section before the main mufflers and that helped the sound quality considerably to the point were the customer is happy. Point learned "Stay with factory parts". Thanks and hope this helps.

The Fisher Price Auto Rock'n Play Sleeper is a very convenient and compact way to let your infant sleep and play where ever you are. With the nice and easy folding with a push of a button, the sleeper becomes compact and light enough to easily place in a vehicle for transportation or set up bed side for monitoring child during the night. The auto rocking is extremely convenient in that it allows for you to hands free be providing a smooth rocking motion that soothes fussy children and settling music to ease  the worries. The materials used seem to be of high quality and durable. The price is the only thing I would say isn't the greatest. A bit on the high side, but over all a very good product.

Wow I was really surprised when I received these and they look and feel very nice and well made but that is where my excitement ended. I installed them on my wife's 2001 BMW X5 and fit nice and secure but when you use them it is just a plain mess. Both sides streak about 3 inches wide under the arm mounting point. I tried to mess with it but did not matter still huge streaks!! I removed them and put my 4 month old Duralast ones back on and they work perfect with no streaks.  Next I figured well maybe it was just the car and thought I would try them on my 2001 Ford F350. Nope!! Same exact problem with 3 inch wide streaks under the mounting point areas on my Ford too. So off they went and my old Duralast wipers went back on my truck too!  Well to wrap it up the SilBlade wipers are nice and fancy but just plain fail in the most important dept and that is they just don't clean the windshield.I cannot recommend these wipers as they seem to be poorly designed and cannot withstand any pressure that any wiper arm will put on the blade. Thanks and hope this helps.

I guess 3 out of 4 I bought work is ok for price!! I purchased a set of 2 for my 2001 BMW X5 because my bulbs were original to the car and not real bright anymore. I installed them and right side works great. Left side flashes on and back off. Have to cycle light switch on and off at least 6 times before it will stay on. Hmmm not too good but I figured for the price I would go ahead and buy another set. So I installed another one in left side and is working perfectly fine now. Oh I did test the other new bulb and works great to so I have 3 good bulbs out of 4. Not real good odds but hey I have both lights working now for 21.00 total so not complaining but be prepared just incase you run into same problem. Hope this helps. Thanks

I received this Classic Brands Cool Gel Mattress to replace my aging but still good Sterns And Foster pillow top mattress and so far I have noticed that this gel mattress is a bit more firm than my old pillow top and while it is taking some getting used to it is very comfortable. All my kids have nice memory foam mattresses and finally we do now too!! I was not surprised by the weight of it since I have dealt with heavy memory foam mattress in the past and this one is heavy too! I quickly and very carefully cut open the huge plastic rolled up mattress and it was full size and shape within minutes. You must be very careful when cutting the plastic wrap so as not to damage the fabric cover. Don't ask me how I know :-) I was very happy to find that their was no horrible oder to the new mattress but yes there was a faint new smell for a couple of days and with all new memory foam mattresses.  My wife and I have been using this mattress now for about two weeks and is very comfortable but firm too. You do not sink into it at all really. Another very nice thing about this is you do not bounce your wife around when jumping into bed like a traditional spring mattress would. That could be good or bad but I like it. So for the price point it is a better mattress than my children have but the price was no more so very good here.  If I had to state something I do not like about it is that it is a little bit firmer than I am used to but I am sure that will change in time. Thanks and hope this helps.

Wow I just received this OTC wire loom set and so glad I decided to give them a try. I am a BMW technician and they have their share of wiring issues that I have to repair. BMW's have a common problem of wiring breaking in the trunk and hatch flex conduit and the broken wires must be pulled out and repaired. In the past I have always used a coat hanger and while it worked it was not easy.  Well this OTC set is a game changer. I find that the long ones work the best for me as they are flexible and they can be used for either pushing or pulling wiring through the conduit. The tool that is used for pushing wiring through a grommet is very nice. Whenever I have an aftermarket accessory to wiring in I have to make a puncture through the firewall and this tool works perfect.  All in all yes the tool set is not super cheap but will pay for itself the first job. Oh yeah the included plastic storage case is nice enough to keep and place in my tool box. I will be using this set for many years to come. Hope this helps. Thanks

Well I was surprised when I received this Irwin tap and drill set. When I saw the picture it shows a nice closable case included but only received a blister pack that will be thrown away instead. I know it is just a piece plastic but I need to keep all my tools organized and not rolling around.Now as for the tool set it is pretty decent. I like that it comes with matched drill bits so no wondering if you have the right drill bit or not. Has been a problem for me in the past. The drill bits are of good quality and the taps and t-handle are very good quality. All in all for the price point not bad but really should have come with a case even if it had not been shown in the picture. Hope this helps.

I received this Irwin Unibit set and am loving it. I have always want a set like this but has never been in my budget. I have used these for installing spoilers on cars. I used to use regular drill bits and tape the painted surface so it does not chip the paint but with these Irwin Unibits I don't even need to put tape on the painted surface because these don't chip the paint. I love that these bits can step up progressively as needed without having to change out drill bits all the time. Now for the speed of cutting is good and do not need to put heavy pressure for it to cut well into sheet metal. The holes are beautiful and clean every time. They also cut fiberglass really well and clean. Now my only gripe is that the picture of the item has a nice plastic case and easy to get each bit out as needed but the case I received says Irwin on it but is zippered and a foam pad has cutouts for each bit but is very hard to get them out. You must use something to dig them out but you cannot use your finger. Only something small and skinny like a screwdriver will unwedge it from the case. A minor pain but they need to go back to the case in the picture. Hope this helps. Thanks

I received this pressure washer a couple of weeks ago and have not been able to use it until recently due to very cold weather but I am please well very pleased with it's overall performance. It looks weird with the hose reel but does work well. It has a little footrest built in at the base so that it will not fall over while rolling up the hose. Was pretty easy to put together about 10 minutes and was ready to go. First impression was hmmm not bad. Easy to move around unlike my gas powered 2500 psi that I also have.Ok so the hose is plenty long enough and is not too stiff and the pressure wand has a nice lock unlock to use and then we have the array of various tips to choose from. Each one works best for the appropriate job so you need to know which tip is for what purpose. The needle tip works very well for stubborn debris removal but does not cover much surface area. The fan spray tip is best for use for general cleaning of siding and concrete etc.The onboard chemical tank is a nice size and can regulate how much of it flows out and also have a built in pressure control that is variable from not much pressure to full blast. Needless to say I have been using nothing but full blast on my driveway and siding. It does a very good job cleaning but is not as powerful as my gas model at 2500 psi and only time you really need that extra pressure for me is when I am cleaning my siding that is high up near the peak at about 20ft. Otherwise the 2000 psi is plenty.My only gripe would be is the wand and having to change out various tips. I am spoiled to my gas model that is an all in one and you simply twist the end of the wand to change spray patterns and pull in and out to increase or decrease volume.All in all this is a very well built pressure washer that works very well indeed. Yes I would recommend this to anyone. Hope this helps.

This is one of the first devices I have to allow USB otg. It is only certain devices, so check to make sure yours is compatible. Not only is this an awesome 5 port charger, but the OTG access allows file access for your phone. This allows you to transfer files like moveis, music, etc. using USB, which make it faster than wifi or easier than hooking it up to your computer. Note not all devices are OTG compliant, so check to see if yours is.Beyond that, the 5 device charger is great. It will be "smart" and calculate what speed to charge your device at. Do note the 7.8 amp maximum and plan accordingly. Tablets tend to be power hungry and will easily eat up the 7.8 amp limit fast. phones, usually charge at lower amperage.Item was provided for unbiased review.

I'm glad there are finally 4-port car chargers on the market. To be honest, I never have enough ports in my car. and 4 ports is more like it. This provides enough for me and extra passengers in my car. The item is exactly as visualized, and is of good build. I expect it will be sturdy and be able to sustain 4 usb cables to charge my various devices. The item has built in protection as car electricity can be finicky and have fluctuations. It has a relatively small profile and is convenient to put anywhere in your car.Overall, a must have for the tech geek or for those with multiple devices.Item was provided for unbiased review

The human body is always fascinating. So to have a device that you can use at home to tell you your pulse ox is quite interesting. it's very small and portable. A pulse ox works by comparing two light sources against the blood and how much is absorbed. Based on that, it determines how much oxygen is bonded to hemoglobin which carries oxygen. It's really quite enlightening. I believe the normal value is around 95-100%. This allows you to see how well your body is absorbing and circulating oxygen, just like in the hospital.At the end of the day, it's nice to know that I'm alive and breathing.Item was provided for unbiased review.

One thing my old multimeter didn't have was backlighting. This makes the voltmeter a lot easier to read, especially when I use it to check something under my hood or in the utility closet. A definite upgrade. The product is well rounded, smooth without sharp edges. Everything you need is included in the box to get it up and running, be it for home improvement, vehicle improvement or science project. With some brief testing around the house, it appears to accurately report results. I'm pleased to say I have 110V power coming from my electrical outlets and my alkaline batteries are mostly fine (some have gone empty over time it seems).Overall, a handy device to have to check power whenever. Easily something to add to my toolkit.Item was provided for unbiased review.

These are a set of 3  lightweight pens which provide 2 in one feature. you have the stylus on one side, which is capacitive (something important for touchscreens today) and a medium point pen on the other side. It's convenient to use these in the cold weather when you wear gloves, as you can't really access your screen. Having a pen is always handy too as I'm writing notes to myself frequently on post its. One thing to note is that the edge of the stylus is not sharp unlike some other pens.Overall, a useful item to have since it lets you use your touch devices (phone, tablet) with relative ease.Item was provided for unbiased review

The light is easy to install, easy to use, and solar. It provides some much needed light to areas of my house that don't have easy electrical access. The light is well built to withstand the elements. You can practically install it anywhere at it is self contained, so long as it can charge using solar. The light comes with a pinhole key. What this means is that no accidental turning on or off. you use the included key to turn on the light, or to shut it off for long periods of time. This would be a good light to take when you camp, or for like the outside of an RV.Overall, its a great light and I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a strong, sturdy outdoor light.

Item is simple and easy to use. The LCD screen is backlit, making the voltage/amps easier to read. Everything you need is included straight away from the box, so it is ready to use for a science project, to test your alternator, or to measure batteries (before energizer built them into the batteries anyway). It's a solid device and seems to perform accurately based on my readings. I would add it to my toolbox.Item was provided for non-biased review.

I'm constantly amazed at my own needs for how many ports I need to charge all my devices, ipads, android tablets, nexus, iphones, where does it end? this 8 port device really suits my needs. It's small and compact, definitely better than using a strip surge protector and 8 individual chargers. The smart ports are nice as they will adjust as to how much power you need so it won't overcharge or overpower your device charging. There's a light as well to let you know something is plugged in. As I accumulate more portable devices, every one uses micro usb, and as such, I need more charging ports. This comes in handy. To me, this is a 1 person use device, but that's because I have so many devices. I'd recommend this for any technophile.Item was provided for non-biased review.

Great for measuring voltage, such as batteries, car batteries, circuits. This one is thinner in profile, making it better for pockets, and portability. It's convenient to use and everything you need is in the box.Item was provided for non-biased review.

I've had a flashlight on my keychain and a USB drive. But this product combines these two devices together. I keep a USB drive on my keychain for when I need to transfer files, or play music over USB in the car. The product is made from metal, and is solid. it's not plastic and will survive collisions with other keys on your keychain. You charge the flashlight using the USB port. That same USB port is also the memory drive, making it a good way to store your necessary files. As for the light, the small light is quite bright. It easily is good for use on a dark night or when needing a penlight. Convenient since it'll be on your keyring.Overall, a fantastic all in one device and one I'm happy to add to my keychain.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

This provides a different kind of screen protector than the typical kind. It is a glass screen protector that covers the screen. It is easier to apply than the plastic screen protectors, which just applies onto the screen (once you clean it). Once clean, peel off the back and apply the glass protector and you're done. I find that I can use the phone easier because the protector is on. I also feel like my phone is well protected. The kit comes with everything you need to apply the screen protector to your phone. With how simple this was, I don't know if I'll ever go back to plastic screen protectors.Item was provided for unbiased review

This isn't your ordinary battery pack. For one, this one was designed with stronger aesthetics than typical battery packs. Most battery packs are brick like, with corners. This battery pack, however, has rounded corners. This makes for a battery pack that is easier to slip in and out of a pocket or a purse. The biggest pro is this is 12.000 mAh, which is typically one day of battery for me, my phone, and a portable hotspot. One downside is that it only has 1 output port, but it is rated for 2.1 amp, which is a faster charge. The included cable stores away neatly when not in use. Charging time is as advertised. I had it charging while I slept and it was charged when I woke up. To check the battery level, you shake the battery and it'll show up on the 4 indicator lights how full or empty the battery is.This battery pack would be ideal for those who have a cell phone and are going on a longer trip. It is meant for a single user as it only has 1 output port. Overall, this is a well designed, well built device that is now part of my travel/day trip bag.Item was provided for unbiased review.

This is an excellent pair of headphones. It combines bluetooth with high quality audio for a great stereo system. It's completely wireless and charges via included USB cable. This allows you a complete wireless environment for your phone, or tablet. It fit nicely over my head and ears. It provided a nice audio quality. Storage is also nice as they fold for storage.Overall, it's easy to use, has good audio quality.

I've got an older car, so I don't have the fancy features of MP3 or USB. This gives me those options. I can use an SD card or a USB flash drive to keep my music updated. It works over FM radio, meaning no cables or aux cable required (something my car also doesn't have). The tricky part is finding a good FM station to transmit on without interfiling with your normal radio stations. It's pretty easy to setup and use. It is great for the car and is more efficient for me than using an mp3 player or my phone. It's easier to have music playing through this device then hooking up your phone every time.Overall, I'd recommend this to upgrade any car's audio system to bring it up to a more modern standard.Item was provided for unbiased review.

You need this if you have a type A plug on your new computer, but have type C plugs (older style). You plug this into your computer, then your device into the plug. It has a small form factor that works well to keep in your accessory bag for when you travel. since it supports usb 3.0, it should work for the foreseeable future, providing usb 3.0 speeds. This is a must if you're purchasing a new small form computer like a laptop or netbook or chromebook.Item was provided for unbiased review.

The one thing that sets this selfie stick apart from others is that it is made from lightweight aluminium. Others are made from cheaper materials such as plastic. This one actually feels decent. There's also a hand loop to keep it from going over edges (in case you drop it). There is a wireless "key" bluetooth that acts as your capture button. It is completely separate and comes with a wrist wrap. You also get a mini tripod as well. Overall, it is easy to use, feels sturdier than other brands.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

This tablet case works well to do 3 key things: protect the tablet, act as a stand, and as a keyboard. So really a 3 in 1 deal. The stand uses bluetooth to connect to the tablet (and any device really). It is easy to setup pairing to your device. The keyboard itself is decently sized. The keys are just big enough to type on, while still being compact. The case comes with a USB charging cable,Item was provided for an unbiased review.

The stand is very sturdy. It's well built and would hold an apple watch well. The tilt is great to use the watch as a clock for a desk or as a nightstand for night. There is a cutout for a charging cable, which tucks away nicely into the stand and gives you nice aesthetics.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

This 4 port charger consolidates four usb ports into one convenient stand. I already had a stand on my desk, so this replaced it so that I could use my phone for phone conferencing and what not. Additionally, I can charge my phone from a cable in the stand, making a more presentable appearance on my desk. This provides a one stop shop for 4 usb ports to charge your phone. As such, I've become one of the most popular people in the office as people come by to charge their phones. Yet, I can leave their phones behind the stand and still have a clutter free desk. The stand is good for watching movies, video chatting, or just using it to reference or read books. Provides a decent angle to keep phone standing. The box contains US 2 prong parallel plugsOverall, this provides a nice desk object for a phone stand and a 4 in one phone charger.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

When it comes to traveling, this device comes in handy. It has 5 ports labeled with how much amperage each port is meant for. This makes it convenient to setup and figure out what device should go where. Phones should be at 1amp, and talbets at 2amp (but phones will also charge at 2amp, i believe at a faster rate). The box comes with the 5 port charger and a us 2 prong cord (flat blades parallel to each other, US style). You do need to provide the USB cables, which you should have from your chargers. This device makes it easy to consolidate all your USB chargers without multiple wall outlets. It brings the USB ports forward from the wall and makes it easy to see what to plug in and where. This is perfect for a two person household with 2 phones, 2 tablets, and a spare port.Ideally, this would be a good fit for a home, or an office where you need ports to charge  up your devices.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

This makes it convenient to setup and figure out what device should go where. Phones should be at 1amp, and talbets at 2amp (but phones will also charge at 2amp, i believe at a faster rate). This is one of the best surge protectors in the market today from a functional point of view. It used to be you keep your surge protectors behind desks and just plugged in when needed. But in our mobile lifestyle, that's changed a lot now. Now we need plugs on desk for USBs and what not. This combines the best of both worlds. This is a desktop/office top surge protector. There are 2 normal plugs and 5 USB plugs. All 5 usb plugs are 2 amp, meaning you can get a fast charge for all your devices. It really is one of the most functional surge protectors I have because of these facts. Compared to some other devices out there, every port is 2amps, whereas others keep each port a different amperage. As you know, cables can get twisted, tied up so you never quite know which is which. But since these are all 2amps, it doesn't matter.There are only two 3 prong ports on this device. This is convenient for a typical office desk since most desks will have a laptop, or something you need to plug in, while still maximizing the USB ports since we are in a more mobile environment. If you need 4 outlets, there is another product by Qicent that has 4 outlets, and 5 usb, which is very similar to this device. This device is more compact because there are fewer 3-prong plugs.This is a slim, compact form that fits great on my desk so I can plug and unplug laptops, and charge phones and tablets, it's really convenient. I would recommend for anyone to have for their office or home.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

But in our mobile lifestyle, that's changed a lot now. Now we need plugs on desk for USBs and what not. This combines the best of both worlds. This is a desktop/office top surge protector. I would recommend for anyone to have for their office or home.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

This is  a fantastic charger. Compared to other chargers, the device can pick up what speed to charge your device, be it phone, tablet, or otherwise. Unfortunately, I don't have a device to test out the Qualcomm quick charge, so I was unable to test out that feature. But it certainly seems like a cool feature. But this is very handy regardless. It's great to use and have cables connected, and not have to figure out which port goes to which amperage, like with some other manufacturers.One feature that is nice is the colored ports. orange is the qualcomm quick charge port, and the other two are smart charging, meaning the charger will determine the appropriate charge to the phone. It can charge up to 2.4 amps, so any phone and even the large tablets like ipads and samung tablets which require the 2.4 amps.Overall, this is a great, handy device to have, and should be standard for anyone these days as we continue to have multiple devices that need to be charged.Item was provided for an unbiased review.

I'm sure you've seen bluetooth headsets that have a U loop for the neck. Let me tell you, those are uncomfortable. This headset is so much more comfortable. It doesn't restrict the headset on the back of your neck. It also doesn't need to hook over your ears, which are better for someone who wears glasses. This makes this one of the most comfortable bluetooth headsets I've used. They work like earbuds in a way, since you fit them into your ear.The sound quality is good. It's easy to pair to your phone. and doesn't take up much room for storage. The earbuds are quite comfortable as well. The biggest strength of this set of bluetooth headphones is that they are light, and comfortbale.Item was provided for fair and unbiased review

Item was provided for a non-biased review.This is a very well built tripod head. It has a ball bearing head which allows many different movements, something most basic tripods can't do. It has a solid, all metal construction. I feel secure using this with my DSLR. You can control X, Y, and Z direction easily. There is a leveler bubble indicator that allows you to stabilize the tripod mount and camera. It helps with leveling the camera on shoots. This is a great addition to my camera collection.

Item was provided for a non-biased review.One thing to note is that you do need a CR2 battery for this flashlight which you can get for a few bucks on amazon. The flashlight works great. It is very bright, and solidly built. I did not get a chance to test out weather proof, but judging by construction and design, it seems to be well built and would resist some liquids. I certainly didn't immerse it into water to test if it still works, but I think it would last. It's easy to use, has a push button to turn on and off.

The item was provided for a non-biased review.The device is pretty fun. It speaks to you, so you get verbal feedback when you turn the device on, when you turn it off, and when it has been paired. What makes this device different is that it verbally speaks to you. It fits really well over the ear. It also allows you to play music from your phone, something most other bluetooth devices can't do.Also, there are two ways to charge the device. Directly charging the device, or with the adapter dock, which you can leave on a desk. So even on the go, you can charge in your car, without needing some sort of special adapter. Charging in either case (dock or device) is via micro usb. So any standard charger will do. Pairing was an easy process .Just find it on your phone and it is paired.Sound quality is pretty good. I listened to some music and talked on the phone and it worked well.All in all, this is a nice device that gives you bluetooth 4.0 functionality and allows you to move around the house, listen to music, and use your phone and talk on the phone without disturbing others.

This easy to use and the sound quality is good. It syncs easily via bluetooth to your phone. It's great for working out as the earphones hook onto your ears. you can also use it to talk on the phone, in addition to listening to music. The buttons are easy to use, on/off and volume. You can control volume and forward/back music easily. These also can control phone functions if you want to make a call or use a phone. Ultimately, bluetooth technology has come a long way, and these headphones are easily one of the best in bluetooth these days where you can keep your phone safe in your pocket or bag while listening to music.

Have you ever had your phone slip and slide on those rubber mats? This isn't that. It uses a magnetic system that's attached to the back of your phone for a strong grip. Surprisingly, it works. It makes taking your phone off and putting it on a lot easier. It also utilizes space that you would never utilize, an air vent (besides for air of course). It's easy to install. Put the backing either on your cover or on the inside of your case (for aesthetics), then put the mount on the vent and you're ready to go. easy peasey. Easiest mount and works well. No clips, or any other thing.

When you've got boys, you've got kids who love pocket knives. And of course their friends do too. So my kid was the envy of everyone When looking for a knife, you want a strong blade, a sturdy handle, lightweight, and of course sharp. This comes with those qualities. The blade is strong, stainless steel. The handle is lightweight, I think out of aluminum. It comes in a nice storage pouch you can use to keep it safely tucked away until you need it. We took it out to do some prep for an upcoming camping trip and it worked just as sharply on the last cut as it did on the first cut.I would highly recommend the product for anyone looking for a pocket knife.

One thing I can say about this is that it's a pretty decent pen. When you buy a product that says tactical pen as opposed to a pen that's also a tactical item, you expect it to excel in the tactical side, instead of the pen. However, on this, it does a decent job at both. The tactical portion of the pen is mild enough so that it will not cause a security stir. If I were walking around somewhere at night and needed something to fend off an attacker, this would be something that would be useful since I don't carry any weapons.And of course, you can't forget the pen too. it has a finer style than most other ball points. In fact, I'd probably even use the pen part as a tactical weapon too, since at that point, I'd be up close with my attacker.Fortunately, I have not yet had to use the tactical pen as a defensive weapon, so i can't comment on it in "actual" use, but it seems well built and able to at least give me a few more seconds that would help me escape or disable an attacker.

Some power banks can take forever to charge. You've noticed this I'm sure if you were trying to charge your ipad with your iphone cable, you'd notice how slow it is to charge. So imagine charging a power bank the same way, especially that of a monstrous size at 12,000 mAh. For one, the device has to support a 2 amp charge, which most power banks I have do not. So the fact that this power bank has that, already puts it a step up.Ports: any standard micro usb will charge (up to 2 amps). 2 output ports, a 2 amp and a 1 amp, which allows you to charge devices like an ipad (which do well at 2.1) and phones at 1 amp. Testing the recharge, I was able to wake up to a fully recharged battery pack (which you can tell my the indicator I'll mention later) about 7 hours later.Capacity: 12,000 mah is a good power back for a full day activity. Using this, I was able to keep my portable modem and phone charged throughout a day at a local amusement park. On most phones, this should be at least 5-6 charges, which is good for an amusement park, if you use your phone in line, or give the kids a movie to watch while waiting in line. I used mine liberally throughout the day and it worked well, and was the "push" i needed above the 10,000 which died with a couple hours left in the day.Other Notes: The indicator light on this is a bit different from other chargers. The "AUKEY" logo on the battery pack serves as the light system to warn you about charging status. A red logo means low charge, a green medium, and white high charge.It's got a flashlight. Hold the power button and you get a pretty bright LED. a micro usb cable is also included in the box. Size of the device is quite small. I've got 10,000 mah that are bigger. But the long and slim battery pack I prefer since it's easier to keep in your pocket without a giant bulge. It's very slim and would be very similar in size to a cell phone.Overall, this battery pack highlights a dual USB port output, a flashlight, and a 2A input charge, giving it far faster charging times than other batteries.I was provided the power bank for an unbiased review.

So one thing that bugs the Apple side of me is the fact that i still need micro usb cables to charge battery packs. This is where this battery pack shines. This battery pack actually uses your lightening cable instead to charge. This is a huge benefit so that the apple side of me can consolidate down cables and not have to carry extra cables to just charge the battery pack.At 3600 mah, i can get about 2-3 charges from the battery pack making it useful for keeping my phone juiced through the day. I'm always on my phone, so it's handy to have. Since I already have lightening cables in my office, home, and car, it's easy to recharge this wherever I am.The device is pretty light and slim. I prefer a long slim battery vs a smaller but wider device since it slips in and out of places easily. There are LED indicator lights to help you watch your charging time and depletion time. The battery pack does not come with a charging cable. But it does have a carrying case and a suction cup device to help it stay in place.This is a must have for iPhone 5+ users.Item was received for a non-biased review

This is an interesting device which adds bluetooth to your car. I have an older car, so it lacks bluetooth. This basically adds that feature to my car. I plug it into an available USB port (which is easy to do with a cigarette lighter adapter), and then hook it into my car's line in. It works well to play crystal clear audio on my car sound system from my phone.Installation is easy. Pairing to my phone is easy and automatic after the first time.It does not act as a bluetooth microphone system, so if you take a call, you do so from your mobile phone, not through the bluetooth.I would recommend this device to those who want to add bluetooth to their car. It's less cables to have to connect every time. \Item was provided for a non-biased review.

It's been a while since i had a travel belt. I can remember back in the day it was cool to have one, ok maybe not. But now that I'm older, I definitely pay more attention to my assets when traveling abroad. This s a belt I can wear under my clothes to put my valuables in such as passports and other documents.

The item was provided for a non-biased review.The device is pretty fun. It speaks to you, so you get verbal feedback when you turn the device on, when you turn it off, and when it has been paired. What makes this device different is that it verbally speaks to you. It fits really well over the ear. It also allows you to play music from your phone, something most other bluetooth devices can't do.Also, there are two ways to charge the device. Directly charging the device, or with the adapter dock, which you can leave on a desk. So even on the go, you can charge in your car, without needing some sort of special adapter. Charging in either case (dock or device) is via micro usb. So any standard charger will do. Pairing was an easy process .Just find it on your phone and it is paired.Sound quality is pretty good. I listened to some music and talked on the phone and it worked well.All in all, this is a nice device that gives you bluetooth 4.0 functionality and allows you to move around the house, listen to music, and use your phone and talk on the phone without disturbign others.

The cable costs less than from the apple store and works just as well. Easily charges my iphone and ipad without any problems. Allows me to keep a cable in the office and one at home so I can keep my phone charged anywhere.

Style matches that of an ipod, with a shiny back.10,000 mah is a nice power bank. It basically can keep devices charged all day. I recently took mine with me on a day trip. I have an external modem for data, which I kept plugged in since it is a battery hog. I also charged my phone on and off at the same time. The power bank has 2 ports which makes it easy to charge 2 devices at once. there is a 2 A port and a 1A port. So you can charge tablets too.Charging is easy via any micro usb cable. Indicator lights indicate how much power is left or how much is left to charge depending on mode.It's pretty much as thin and small as any phone, so easy to take on the go and fits in a pocket easily.This device can easily last you a day if you are no where near power. It worked just about that much for me.

The item was provided for a non-biased review.The device is pretty fun. It speaks to you, so you get verbal feedback when you turn the device on, when you turn it off, and when it has been paired. What makes this device different is that it verbally speaks to you. It fits really well over the ear. It also allows you to play music from your phone, something most other bluetooth devices can't do.Also, there are two ways to charge the device. Directly charging the device, or with the adapter dock, which you can leave on a desk. So even on the go, you can charge in your car, without needing some sort of special adapter. Charging in either case (dock or device) is via micro usb. So any standard charger will do. Pairing was an easy process .Just find it on your phone and it is paired.Sound quality is pretty good. I listened to some music and talked on the phone and it worked well.All in all, this is a nice device that gives you bluetooth 4.0 functionality and allows you to move around the house, listen to music, and use your phone and talk on the phone without disturbign others.

I don't even know where to begin with this pocket knife. There are just so many features packed in 1 knife. It's got everything you would want if you were stranded somewhere. A compass, a blade, scissors, anything so you could MacGyver your way to survival. there are knives, screwdrivers, pliers, needle, compass, scissors, flashlight, bottle opener, and more. It's really quite convenient to have since it has every tool you could think of wanting. Great for yourself or as a gift.

This knife is sturdy, well built and small in size. Combine these three and you have a great gift or something you can keep in your outdoors kit. The knife was sharp out of the box and was easy to test out with a variety of things. It cuts rope, branches, and even an onion well. It can be used for a multi variety of things. It comes with a pouch that is durable, and makes for great storage. The knife locks when you extend it so you don't accidentally close it on your hand.This is going to make a great Christmas present for my friend who loves the outdoors.

What would you get someone who loves the outdoors? A pocket knife. This is a small easy to handle pocket knife that is strongly built and well made. It's light, portable and great to have in your backpack when you're camping. You never know when you might need a knife. It "switches" out, and is useful to have from wood, to opening cans, to just having multi use. You never know when you might need a knife for that MacGyver moment. This is great to keep in the glove box for emergencies.

This is a great travel nail clipper. For one, it's hard to get lost. But do keep in mind it has to be checked in due to the blade. The nice thing is that it doesn't get lost in my luggage. It has a nail filer, scissors, nail clipper and a blade. It's easy to use, has a nice handle for holding to cut nails. Definitely something you would want to have around for any use.

I bought a bike for christmas one year. I had many problems. I didn't have the right tools to put it together. Particularly an allen wrench. This tool solves a lot of the issues because it includes a selection of allen wrenches and other tools to help with a bike assembly and bike modifications. This allows you to make modifications for your bike whenever you need.This makes a great gift for your avid biker friend and family member. A must have for anyone who is an avid biker.

This is the kind of knife you always wanted as a boy. A pocket knife that you use when you go hunting or camping. It's great for the pocket, good to cut small branches or other things. It's good to have when outdoors for many reasons. This is a great gift for a young boy and my son loves his pocket knife.

If there's one knife I would keep on my keychain, it's this one. It's got a small profile, but not 'wimpy". It's strong, durable, and easy to use. there are a multitude of tools including cork opener, bottle opener, scissors, and knife. Each of them is easy to use and the blade is sturdy when extended.It's really great to have when on the go. Just remember to take it off your keychain before going through any building with heavy security.

Honestly, I've never thought about how to store knives. I only have a few, so they get used and washed repeatedly I almost never need to store them. But I figure it'd be nice to be able to store them somewhere without nicking the varnish on my drawers or cabinets. The block is able to hold many knives. I only have a few, so there's room for my knife collection to grow. Bamboo is pretty resilient, so I don't have to worry about carving the holder. I can put my knives safely away in a drawer when I'm not using them.

Bamboo is such an interesting material. It's grown, like wood, yet tough, like steel. It's pliable and can be used for a myriad of things. This package is a great value for 3 boards, rather than individually. The way I go through cutting boards, having 3 makes things easier. Bamboo is a great material for boards because it's resilient. It doesn't nick as easily which is better for your health and sanitation. The three boards give you some versatility to either cutting or serving. I've used the boards both as a cutting board, and as presentation dishes and they work well in either regard. I'm also tempted to try it out as a self defense mechanism, but thankfully, it hasn't come to that yet. The boards are quite solid and should hold up well.

Bamboo is such an interesting material. It's grown, like wood, yet tough, like steel. It's pliable and can be used for a myriad of things. When I just want to chop one thing, a small board is perfect. And so much easier to wash than a large board. I use this to chop up sausages for grilling, or to chop up a quick onion for a mix. The nice thing about the board is that it doesn't absorb the smells, especially when I chop onions and such, unlike my plastic boards.

Bamboo is such an interesting material. It's grown, like wood, yet tough, like steel. It's pliable and can be used for a myriad of things. The bamboo board is strong and durable. I have no qualms about using it for anything I need. This particular size works well for me as a serving dish more so than to cut. I like large boards to cut, but for this, it works well for presentation. I put out cheeses and crackers (along with knives, and other utensils). I don't have to worry about scratching my dishes since the board is sturdy. It makes for a nice rustic presentation of cheese platter. Certainly a great way to use the board.

Bamboo is such an interesting material. It's grown, like wood, yet tough, like steel. It's pliable and can be used for a myriad of things. This bamboo board is great to use in the kitchen. I like the large size since it allows me to cut ingredients, and keep them on the board until I am ready to use them. I can also use it to knead dough and other things. The board is quite hard, easy to wash, and easy to use. In fact,instead of grabbing a knife when a burglar comes in, I'd probably grab the board because it'd knock the burger flat out. It's a solid design and great for what it does.

Something most chargers were lacking is enough ports and enough power. This solves it all. I can have 3 ports charging at one time, and all at 2+ amps. That's a faster charge for every device. I always walk around with at least a work phone and a personal phone.. So my passengers never can charge since i was using a dual port. But now with a trio of ports, that solves the problem. The device is great and allows me to use my power port in the car efficiently and effectively.Of course, you can also charge tablets with the device since it has enough power to do so at a reasonable rate.
Small and great! Good for travel. Just be careful of the needles. They can get loose in the package. I added this to my travel suitcase so that I am never without the ability to mend clothes.

i love silicone because it's inert and won't react with what I'm cooking. These are all silicone and are dishwasher safe. Makes it easy to clean, use and work with. It's one of the best things I have in my kitchen.

I love fresh ground pepper. And i hate the disposable grinders. They freeze up and don't work well. Just push a button and fresh ground pepper any time. Easy to put in peppercorns, batteries and then use it for seasoning.
No smell curtain. Easy to use and install. The suction cups help keep the curtain closed. Better than what you would usually find at brick and mortar stores.

It's easy to install. Good to use for summer breeze, while keeping out bugs and insects. I install it on my front door so I can get a breeze going through my house. It's great for when I need to run in and out for errands and the magnets keep the screen closed to keep bugs out.

Great pen light. Instead of like other pen lights, this one has the lights on the clip, making it truly hands free. I can stick it in a pocket and it actually works because the lights are on the clip and not on the end of a pen. It uses AAA batteries, so easy to replace. Great for use everywhere.

Small and compact, easy to use.This is a really compact travel scale. It's imperative in today's nickle and diming age of airlines. 50 pounds means 50 pounds. I had one that used to have a hook, but was impossible for luggage to work. This one has a strap and is better. The output is in digital land easy to read. It's meant for travel so you can take it with you. You don't have to re-sort your luggage at the airport frantically. Instead, you now have a portable scale with you for any time use. This is easily something I have in my luggage every trip to ensure I avoid overages.

Easy to install. easy to use. When you have kids, they put their feet all over your car. And the dust leaves unsightly messes on the back of your chairs in the car. These kick mats make it easy to protect your car. The installation is easy. You simply put it on over the headrest of the front seats and you are protected. They are also great for when you move. I recently had some colored boxes which left marks on the back of my chair and were impossible to get out. But now that I have these, I can protect my seats from unsightly colored box marks in addition to footprints.

This is a lock that is easier to use than a fixed arm lock. It allows some rotation so that you can easily put in the combination. with a 3 digit combination, there are 999 possibilities, so you can chose your favorite 3 digit number. The "arm" is a metal wire, which feels secure. I can't cut it with scissors, so that's a plus. This lock is also TSA approved, meaning that the TSA can get into your luggage without requiring them to break the lock. It's easy to apply to my luggage. I just open it up and close the lock. I can't wait to use it on my future trip.
Simple sticker to show who protects my home.
Great for packing. Makes my luggage more organised. Work nicely to separate dirty and clean laundry. helps me back better.

This adds Bluetooth functionality to anything really. It comes with the connectors you need to hook up devices via 3.5mm audio port. You just attach it and start syncing Bluetooth with it. So for example I use mine in the car. I would hook up this device to the car stereo system (i still have a car tape player). So with that, I pair the bluetooth to my phone and the music will play over the Bluetooth that way. it is easy to pair, and easy to use. My audio quality is a bit difficult to judge because I'm using a tape and that diminishes sound, but that is due to tape. I don't have an aux port on my car, but if I did have an aux port, I'm sure it sounds great.This is a simple way to add bluetooth to your car. I'd recommend it for anyone looking to do so.

Total defense has been one of the best products I've purchased. I have bought it many times and I find it to be useful. The installation process is simple. You first type in your info and then install the product. You can do it via the included disk or download it, really simple. One feature that is also nice is that the product auto renews. That means you never will have an unprotected computer because every year, the product will auto renew for you. I've used total defense since 2013 and it is by far one of the most useful products I've bought. I've bought it for myself, my mom, my dad, my roommate, and my friends.If you are in a rush, some retailers offer a download version (sending you the code via email immediately).

Item was provided by manufacturer for review. The review represents my unbiased opinion.The belt is a true black belt. It is textured, in that there are raised pyramids on the belt. It is easy to loop through my pants around an inch and a half wide, and fits well. My size is medium pantwise, so the belt fit well. This looks well with my dress trousers. The clasp feels sturdy and I have no fear of my pants falling down.
Where Everybody knows your name.... wait... So no one told you that was, gonna be this way. Gotta love friends. Best tv show in history.
I haven't tested it in the water yet, because I don't have a water proof camera, but it works well as a camera wrist for my point and shoot.
I've been using trackpoints for years, and prefer it much more to touchpads. It's easier to use, definitely. But to each their own
Takes me back to 2000 when Survivor first premiered. Wow, that was a while ago, and survivor is still on the air. Love every minute of the show.
Well, my kids give it 5 stars at least. They love cars, so this towel was perfect for them.
Fun little movie. Was enjoyable to watch through.

Item was provided by manufacturer for review. The review represents my unbiased opinion.3 ports are better than 1. There are many chargers on the market. So what sets this one apart? Well, for one, there are 3 ports. I remember the days of just 1 port in the car. But the highlight of this charger is that each of the ports offers 2.1/2.4A. Traditional car chargers only offer 1 Amp. So you can get your device charged twice as fast. You can also charge your ipad/tablet reasonably fast now, as opposed to slow 1 amp chargers. The footprint is small, and the device feels solid. This is a welcome addition to my car, since I alone need 3 ports for all my devices.

Item was provided by manufacturer for review. The review represents my unbiased opinion.The size of this device is about the size of a nexus 5 and a bit thicker. I can get about 2-3 charges from the device, give or take for my nexus 5, on par with what's to be expected from this battery. So it's great to throw in your purse or your wallet since it is light. There is a hole you can clip the device to as well. You can clip it with a carabiner (not included) to a bag or your belt loop for those moments you need emergency power. The loop is actually pretty thick, so it wont break off easily. Its great to have in the glove compartment as well, when you need a boost of emergency power or on a camping trip since the device can be charged via solar.  The design of the device is very simplistic. There are 4 LED lights indicating status and a power button to check status or turn on a small flashlight on the side.Charging Time: Charging time took a few hours for a complete charge, with the status lights indicating the charge. Each light represents approximately 25% of the charge remaining or charging up to.The solar charging is a bit slow. The stated input is 200mah for the solar charger. One side is solar, so that would make sense. It does take a lot of solar panels to produce power, so 200 mah is not bad at all.
