It would be good for emergency power, for those instances you may get stranded in the woods, or on a camping trip without any power.Ports: There is one port for charging. The device can be charged using any standard micro usb charger.  You can use the included micro usb cable, or for apple fans a micro usb to 30 pin converter. There are 2 output ports, each at 1A. Each is covered, so the port can be protected from inclement weather. I decided it probably wasnt a good idea to test how waterproof the device is by submerging it in water (since electronics dont go in water).Highlights of this case: This is a very rugged battery pack. It has a loop so that it can be hooked anywhere with a carabiner that is included. It provides one cable with a 30-pin converter. It is great to have when you need an emergency juice up on your phone, as I seem to need one everyday around lunch. Would be great for camping and in rainy weather since the ports are protected, something I have not seen in other battery packs.

Item was provided by manufacturer for review. The review represents my unbiased opinion.This charger is easy to use. If you have an existing cable for your micro usb phone, just plug it in and put your phone on top. QI technology is awesome. Wireless touching. The con is that it may not be as energy efficient as plugging in a regular cable and you do have to find the right positioning for your device.That being said, the Nexcon device attempts to make things easier. Each manufacturer puts the QI spot in a slightly different location. For my nexus 7, it's about square center in the device. For my nexus 5, it's almost center, but offset a bit on the bottom side. So with that, it's important that the Qi charger doesn't move. The charger has a rubberized grip to ensure that. The charger itself has a light indicating if a connection is met or not. The light is red for powered on but no connection, and green solid when there is connection.The charging works well. The footprint is small so it doesnt take up much room on my nightstand. I thought the small footprint would be a problem for my tablet, but it's not. The rubberized feet hold it in place well.Overall, this is an inexpensive QI charger that works well and gets your devices charging.

The size of this device is about the size of a large wallet. It's convenient to use when you are on the go. The power pack provides 7800 mah of backup power, that's almost 5-6 full charges for most smart phones. The cables that come included are great. They light up when you use the so you know you are getting power. That's the kind of cables we need.

These are relatively thick cups that can be used for both hot and cold. Since they are paper, will decompost, so good for the environment. I Do wish they were bigger in size, so keep in mind how many ounces you can hold.
I love colored pens. they write smoothly. Great 10 pack.
Gives me the ability to hang stuff in my closet. The holes provide places to hang belts, scarves and other things. Keeps stuff more organized and off my shelves.

I've gotten so wrapped up in reading my "serious" books on history or philosophy I've forgotten what it's like to read something that makes me smile and laugh out loud.Jason Gay's Little Victories book did just that.Gay is a very talented writer and his humor is spot on for anyone that remembers life before Facebook..I was not as familiar with Gay as many other reviewers but his humor and style remind me of Dave Barry. Hopefully neither Gay or Barry is offended by that.If you are looking for a book to make you laugh and look at life's frustrating moments with a sense of humor, you will enjoy Little Victories.

These door handles completely exceeded my expectations. They are solid and well crafted and have a nice weight and heft to them. The finish on each of them is flawless and the design adds a sleek European look to any cabinet.They have the standard 3" spread and are easy to install.I am so impressed I intend to purchase more to update my entire kitchen. These are also priced below anything I have found locally.For this quality, you won't find anything better so if the style suits you, don't hesitate.

If you are a fan of Cards Against Humanity and all things politically incorrect then you will love this game. Like Cards, be sure you play this with friends who are comfortable with lots of sexual and crude humor. The acting out also adds a fun element to the game. I put this to the test with a group of college kids who absolutely loved it. But as others have mentioned, it will lose its appeal after playing a few times unless expansion packs are added. But otherwise a great party game with the right crowd.

Like many reviewers of Concussion, I am a football fan but have for years been sickened by the attitude that athletes who take severe hits then get right back in the game are somehow showing how committed they are to their team. I cringe hearing the media call these players "courageous" while fans admire them for "playing through the pain." Like steroid use, the long term effects of these injuries was the elephant in the room that the NFL was successful at ignoring. But then Dr. Bennet Omalu was assigned to perform an autopsy on former Pittsburgh Steeler Mike Webster. His results were startling and led to his studies on repetitive brain trauma and degenerative brain disease in athletes (chronic traumatic encephalopathy - known as CTE).Originally from Nigeria, Omalu was unfamiliar with America's obsession with the NFL and the billion dollar business it has become. So rather than have his findings embraced as he naively thought, he was denounced,mocked and shunned.Concussion is Omalu's story - as others have said, how David took on and ultimately beat Goliath.The story author Jeanne Marie Laskas tells is an important one but Laskas is not quite at the top of her game in telling it.Her writing does not flow as easily here - mostly in the early part of the book dealing with Omalu's background - but Concussion is a fairly quick read and I still recommend it even if you intend to see the movie.Despite the evidence, I'm skeptical that the attitude of the NFL will ever truly change but Concussion will help fans better understand CTE and what is really happening on the field the next time they watch a football game.

This is a hefty dose of collagen compared to others on the market. I have never taken collagen supplements before and do feel a difference in my joints (I'm thinking my skin is beyond hope but it's really too soon to notice a difference there at this point).As others have mentioned, be forewarned that these pills are huge and not easy to swallow. If taken as directed, you are committing to taking four pills twice a day, each time on an empty stomach. It is not pleasant but I can manage but others with a sensitive stomach or trouble swallowing may want to try another brand.The 180 count bottle is a 22 day supply if you decide to take the full dosage.Overall I like the results but hope to find something easier to swallow....

The Lenox Holiday Jewel bar set is pretty and practical and adds a festive touch for holiday entertaining. The red faceted handles are acrylic so these feel more lightweight in hand than I expected. They are also hand wash only so despite looking pretty, these would not be my everyday go-to bottle opener and corkscrew. They work for the holidays and could make a decent hostess or secret Santa gift. I say "could" because many gift exchanges now use "perceived value" as a guideline rather than a set price range. This set does not have a perceived value anywhere near the suggested retail of $50 or even the current selling price of $25. To me, these look to be in the $15-$20 price range so plan accordingly if you are considering these as a gift.

The quality Woolrich is known for comes across in every aspect of this flannel shirt. The material is a soft but sturdy 100% cotton flannel with reinforced seams. I have the red buffalo plaid and the pattern of the fabric on the front chest pockets is perfectly aligned to the pattern of the fabric on the body of the shirt, indicating a higher level of quality and attention to detail than other patch pocket shirts.I am a female and ordered this in a size small to wear with jeans and leggings. I am normally a small-medium in ladies sizes and this works well for me as an oversize tunic top.The red in this plaid is especially vibrant and the colors have held up well through several washings. Yes, you can buy less expensive shirts but they won't compare in quality to this Woolrich.

I just received these as a gift and love them! - and no, I am not a child but these make a great gift for adults or anyone interested in a nautical theme.The blocks are standard size building blocks but slightly lighter in weight since they are made with basswood.The colors are vibrant and the blocks themselves are educational - they have the standard alphabet along with the corresponding Morse code and nautical flag for each letter. Each block also has a diagram of a type of knot used in boating.I keep these on display in a decorative bowl and guests are always picking them up and playing with them - it's fun at any age to see your name spelled out with the nautical flags.The quality of these blocks is very impressive and they make a unique gift idea for children and adults alike, especially if they live by the water or own a boat.

When I saw another review that said the Fodor's Paris guide was over 400 pages, I had to check for myself since this is a very compact and easy to carry book. It is comprehensive, informative and full of maps and photos to help you plan your trip to Paris and to use as reference once you get there.I visit Paris fairly regularly and found the traveler's  information to be pretty accurate - social customs, currency, tipping, etc... My only observation is that the warnings of pickpockets around tourist destinations such as the Eiffel Tower or Louvre do not accurately convey just how bad the problem is, and not just around common tourist sites. The problem is rampant throughout the city so the warnings are not to be taken lightly.Paris is also one of the most expensive cities in the world so the price point suggestions in this or any guide are all relative so plan your budget accordingly.If you only take one book to Paris, this is the one to get. It is compact enough to carry in a purse or backpack but filled with everything you will need to know both before and during your trip.

The quality of this Lee Riders women's shirt really impressed me. The cotton fabric has a touch of spandex, which makes this virtually no-iron after washing. It also provides a nice drape to the fit, which is very flattering due to the shaped seams.It is very well constructed with a ribbed collar and small vents at the sleeves and side hem.The feel of the fabric is very soft and reminds me of a much more expensive Cutter and Buck polo that I own.I like that the cut is feminine without being too tight, which makes this perfect for casual work wear.Great quality and style at an affordable price...

The Garnier Skin Active Clearly Brighter Brightening and Smoothing Daily Moisturizer is a rich, moisturizing creme with broad spectrum SPF 15. It is dispensed via a pump bottle and absorbs nicely into the skin.There are three active ingredients listed on the packaging: Avobenzone 3%, Octisalate 5% and Octocrylene 5%. All of these are listed as sunscreens so no chemical like hydroquinone - a common ingredient in some fade and "brightening" cremes - is present.Instead, the "brightening" comes via the exfoliating nature of the antioxidant complex of vitamins C & E, pine bark essence and lipo-hydroxyl acid.I like a lot how this feels on my skin - it reminds me of a much more expensive L'Occitane moisturizer that I have been using. It dispenses easily from the pump, absorbs quickly and leaves my skin feeling smooth and velvety.I have only been using this for a few weeks and do like how my skin looks but as the side of the box indicates, the "use" for this is as a sunscreen and daily use of many moisturizers with sunscreen will help improve skin tone to some extent.But the texture and quality of this particular Garnier moisturizer is on par with department store products at a fraction of the price.

The Fellows 62MC micro-cut shredder is an excellent choice for home/home office use. Improvements over my previous shredders include the decrease in the noise level when operating. This is a noticeable and much welcome improvement. I also like that this is on wheels and can be easily moved out of the way when not in use.As for the actual shredding, the micro-cut is indeed very small. The shredding mechanism runs smoothly and despite doing some heaving shredding - 10 pages at a time repeatedly - the shredder never jammed or even seemed the least bit strained.As with other Fellows shredders I have owned, this one is sturdy and well made. For moderate shredding, this is an excellent choice.

Whether or not someone likes this book will depend on what they are hoping to get out of it. How to Have a Good Day by Caroline Webb is a pretty intense read with - no surprise - a heavy focus on behavioral science. It is well researched and cites many psychological and sociological studies to help interpret the underlying causes of happiness and satisfaction - or lack thereof - in the workplace.Webb directly addresses productivity issues in her appendix - how to be good at meetings, how to be good at email and reinvigorating your routine - but for me, her practical suggestions got lost under the weight of the science behind her studies.While I appreciate Webb's research and expertise, I think her book would have wider appeal if she balanced the scientific studies with easy to understand (and implement) steps on achieving more satisfaction in the workplace. But if you are interested in the behavioral science behind how and why people end up unhappy in a work environment, then you will gain a lot from How to Have a Good Day.

The Genuine boys long sleeve polo is very well made of a cotton/polyester blend pique fabric. It has held up well through repeated washings without any fading or any sign of loose threads. For the price, this is an excellent value.

I do not have severe or chronic rosacea but during times of stress I get flare ups. So far I have gotten decent results with Eucerin Redness Relief products but keep hoping to find something even better. Unfortunately, this is not it for me.This is a quality serum but it is a bit too heavy (almost Vaseline like) for my combination skin. For others, it may work and it does leave a silky finish to your skin. It just took a bit too long to absorb for me.My biggest disappointment is that it really hasn't made much difference in my flare ups - certainly not an improvement over the Eucerin, which is a fraction of the price.Given my results, I would be surprised if this is effective for someone with a stronger case of rosacea but you never know.Definitely a quality serum but not effective for me.

The DII millennium microfiber cleaning cloths are decent quality cloths that work for a variety of uses.The cloths I received have a very subtle tone on tone pattern and are well constructed with no loose threads around the edges.These are light to medium thickness - a step above the quality available in dollar stores for basically the same cost per cloth.I keep one on hand in several rooms in my house - they are great for everything from quick spills to dusting electronics.These are not the thickest microfiber cloths I own but they are a convenient size, a good value and work for wide variety of jobs.

This is my first introduction to JUNKO and the Kiss Him, Not Me series.This is a popular Japanese manga series about ugly duckling turned swan Kae, who becomes the object of affection for four of the most popular boys in school.Kae is "fujoshi," or a boy love fan so she tries to hide her true fantasies of her suitors as they vie for her affection. I like the characters, especially Mutsumi, who is the only one who liked Kae before her transformation.This is a cute storyline and the illustrations are excellent. There are some translation notes in the back of the book that help explain some of the Japanese terms common in BL manga. This is a nicely done translation of the first book in a popular Japanese series.

The Magic Strings of Frankie Presto is a moving, lyrical almost poetic book by Mitch Albom. Like Tuesday's With Morrie, it takes the reader along on a journey that uses music as the "higher power" in life that stirs the soul.Here, Albom follows the life of musician Frankie Presto from his birth in war-torn Spain to his move to America and rise to international fame. I missed the book notes mentioning that Albom is a lifelong musician but it was apparent from the opening chapter. This book is filled with musical references that are lilting and poetic and add a sense of magical wonder to the story.In Forrest Gump fashion, Albom intersects Frankie's life with several real life characters. The story essentially begins with Frankie's funeral and led by the narrator "Music," his life story and mysterious death is slowly revealed.I have only read two of Albom's other books - Tuesday's With Morrie and The Five Peole You Meet in Heaven - and like those books, The Magic Strings of Frankie Presto leaves the reader with a poignant sense of wonder and gently imparted wisdom on the gift of life, and yes, even death.This is a beautifully written, mesmerizing book. Like his fictional character Frankie, Albom uses his talent to touch the hearts of his readers.If you are a fan of Mitch Albom, you will love The Magic Strings of Frankie Presto. And if you are new to Albom as an author, this symphony of words is a wonderful place to start.

The Vitamin Wolrd Ultra Woman 50 Plus is a good multivitamin for women over or approaching the age of 50. This particular vitamin contains no iron - something good to know for those that need to watch their intake.The pills themselves are about the size of calcium pills. Taken as directed with water before a meal, they should go down easily for most people.It's hard to tell if these or any vitamins are working properly. I have had no adverse effects but am not feeling noticeably better either, although I am in generally good  health anyway.I don't always eat the healthiest meals, though, so taking the Ultra Woman 50 Plus gives me some peace of mind that I am getting my necessary vitamins.If the levels of ingredients are what you are looking for, this is a good choice.

This is an excellent, high quality heating blanket. As the description says, it is made of a plush velour that is very soft and cozy even without the heating element.There are dual controls - one for each side of the bed - with 10 heat levels. An automatic shut-off kicks in after 10 hours but can be manually adjusted for up to 12 hours. A surprise to me is that each control has its own AC power cord so you will need two free outlets for this blanket.Like QuirkyGirl, I also compared this to the Serta brushed microfleece heated blanket. The brushed microfleece is surprisingly soft and thick and IMHO the better value (at approx. $30 less than the plush at the time of this review). If you prefer less bulk in your bedding - or just want to save some money - get the brushed microfleece blanket. It uses the same controls and is also excellent quality. But if you want to luxuriate in the thickness of plush velour, this is the one to get.

The HP Officejet 4650 is a solid choice for home office printing needs. Set up was easy and WiFi printing worked flawlessly from laptop, iPad and various platform smartphones.Scan and copy features work as expected. I have not utilized the fax feature.WiFi printing is the default platform these days and the HP 4650 makes set up easy. Just a note - if you do set up using a printer cable the WiFi is disabled.The 4650 uses two HP 63 ink cartridges - one B&W and one color - and the printing results are professional. I am still weighing if the new instant ink program is worth it. There is pricing information on the HP website. I probably don't print enough to make it worth signing up but others may see value in it. OEM ink isn't cheap but with so many compatible cartridges on the market, you may find just replacing as you go a more economical option. But still the concept is interesting.Overall, the HP 4650 should work well for most home and small office needs.

With more than 2,200 reviews already written on these slippers, there isn't much new to add.My experience with these as well as other Tamarac shearling slippers, has been great. These are holding up well so far and past purchases are still going strong after several years of use.These slippers are well made with a sturdy sole for quick trips outside. They are a bargain for real shearling slippers - compare these to L.L. Bean - and defintely worth the splurge to get through the winter months.

With the newly released Tom Hanks/Steven Spielberg movie Bridge of Spies, I expect there will be renewed interest in the U-2 spy plane. For anyone interested in the history of the plane, this is the book for you. Author Chris Pocock has written a comprehensive and well researched look at the origins of the plane from the early years of Gary Powers to its current use. Pocock gives incredible insight into the technology of the plane and the advances that have taken place over the years. The book is also filled with a huge amount of photographs.Definitely a must have for any aviation buff..

Overall I really like the Neutrogena Healthy Skin powders. I have the translucent, the blush and the bronzer. The quality of the powders are all excellent, which is what I based my rating on. Each color in the quad is too small to use individually - the intent is to swirl your brush among all four to get a varied highlighted finish. The translucent and blush palettes work fine for that but the bronzer colors may be too deep for many Caucasian skin tones.But for overall quality, these are a good value compared to department store powders.

I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of these cloths. They are medium weight - not as thin or cheap feeling as the ones in a dollar store. I have these in two sizes - one is the standard washcloth size, which is less cumbersome for smaller jobs, and the more common hand towel size. The edges are finished with tight stitching and the cloths launder well. Both the taupe and grey colors are neutral and look nice.The variety of sizes suit just about any household job.I will be back for more....

I only just recently discovered the Solid Gold brand of dog food and so far each flavor I have tried has been a hit with my dog.Admittedly he is not a very picky eater but he seems to especially like the Solid Gold brand.I like that these are made with high quality ingredients and can be moistened with a bit of water to add some wet food to his diet.The ease of buying on Amazon is also a big time saver for me...

With a newborn less than a month old I am too tired to jump into the Huggies vs. Pampers debate. There are some in both brands that I like and work well for me.The newborn Huggies Little Snugglers are great - the elastic around the waist and legs makes for a great fit and has so far prevented any leaking.I like that I can get a comfortable and secure fit along with good protection.Being able to buy in bulk through Amazon is a time and money saver when I am in desperate need of both....

Pampers Swaddlers sensitive diapers are among the best on the market.They fit incredibly well and the wetness indicator lets you know when it's time for a chance.I have no reason to think my newborn has sensitive skin - at least not yet - but better safe than sorry so I like the Sensitve option from Pampers.These are a quality diaper from a trusted brand.

These original Swaddles are well made and designed to securely wrap your newborn. The colors in the "anchors" design are pretty but also gender neutral so they can work for either a boy or girl or for a baby shower gift where the sex is still unknown.They are beautifully boxed and work well for gift-giving.These are a medium weight fabric - perhaps a bit thinner than you might expect but this way they will work year round in a variety of climates.

I try to keep price out of the equation when leaving a product review but with the Proactiv+ Redness Relief Serum I can't help but have the cost factor into my comments. As for the product itself, when used as directed, which includes storing this in the refrigerator, it does have a cooling effect and feels good on the skin. Results were ok but nothing dramatic.I get better results with the Eucerin Redness Relief line of products and at a fraction of the cost. I was able to achieve the same cooling effect by refrigerating the Eucerin. I had not thought of that before but if you have a product you like, try refrigerating it to see if you get a cooling boost before investing in the Proactiv+.The Proactiv+ does work but not any better - and many times not as well -  as other products that are far less expensive.

I am a fan of most Annie Chun products but the seaweed crisps did not turn out to be one of my favorites..The crisps are whisper thin squares with a layer of seaweed on one side of a brown rice cracker.I thought the taste ok - not something I would rush out to buy for myself but these are gluten and cholesterol free and anyone with those dietary restrictions knows how difficult it is to find flavorful snacks.Two others in my household also gave these a try and both thought they were only ok. They noticed more than I did the strong taste of sugar, which is one of the first ingredients listed on the label.The 1.7 oz package serves two with 80 calories per serving. The package itself is a heavy foil pouch that would be better if it included a resealable top to help keep these fresh. As is, plan to use a bag clasp to keep the crisps from getting stale.

The Hyland's baby teething gel seems to work ok but only on mild pain. Depending on the intensity of discomfort, you may need to find something stronger. I like trying to stick with natural remedies as much as possible but this one seemed less effective than others.

The Diono Buggy Tech Tote is very well constucted and secures easily to a stroller with Velcro tabs. It can hold a decent amount of baby gear with room to spare for mom.The tech part of the tote fits my iPad well and the controls can be accessed through the case.i realize this is designed for use on a stroller but it would be more convenient if it included a shoulder strap. That would allow it to be easily carried for those times a stroller might need to be left unattended, like at a restaurant.Other than that, this is a well made, very functional tote that would also work well on the back of a wheelchair.

I like that this Hyland's baby cough syrup is homeopathic and can be used on children as young as 6 months - there are not many options for babies that youngWhile it worked ok during the day, it did not seem to help my child's cough during the night.Also, it was less effective on my older children ages 2 and 4.This is worth a try before resorting to stronger remedies but in the end that may be what you need, especially for nighttime relief.

This Solid Gold Chaser Holistic dry dog food is a healthy blend of ingredients for any adult dog.My own dog - small breed - as well as a couple that I dog sit a few days a week - medium to large breeds - all love this.I mostly serve it dry for convenience but it is also a hit when moistened with a small bit of water.I like that this is one of the healthier foods for my dog so as long as he continues to like it, I will buy more.

The XEN-TAN products are some of the priciest on the market yet I'm not sure they deliver as promised. The Moroccan Tan Ultra is supposed to be one of their longest lasting self tanners yet my experience was disappointing.Each XEN-TAN product is quite time consuming to use, both in the application and the drying time of the tanner. I probably wouldn't mind so much if the color truly lasted a long as the manufacturer claims but that has not been the case.The color itself is one of the best in the XEN-TAN line but despite following directions carefully, it wore off in less than 48 hours.When you factor in price, inconvenient application and less than expected color longevity, this is not for everyone.

I was so excited to give this planner a try and out of the box the metallic cover looks beautiful. However, as soon as I picked up the planner, I noticed the metallic layer of the front and back covers separating from the heavier stock cardboard underneath. When I went to open the planner, even more of the metallic layer separated away. The mere action of opening and closing the planner - or any bend at all of the cover - will make this even worse. I will attempt to glue down the metallic layer so that I can salvage the planner (this was sent to me as part of the Vine program and not something I can return). But if I had purchased this, especially at the current cost of more than $20, I would definitely be returning it. Perhaps the other reviewer who had this same issue and I received defective planners and your experience would be different. But as nice at it looks, unfortunately this is not a purchase I would recommend.

The Cailler milk chocolate bar with almonds, hazelnut and cranberries took me by surprise - it is a premier quality milk chocolate enhanced with the crunch of almonds and hazelnut and the added texture and flavor of cranberries. I wasn't sure what to expect but the combination is superb.I had tried the plain Callier milk chocolate bar and it was very good but a little too sweet for my taste, which leans towards dark chocolate. However, this bar is one that I loved and will definitely seek out to purchase again.It is a splurge you won't regret.

As someone who lives in our nation's capital, I spend a lot of time taking visitors to Mount Vernon - it's definitely one of the best attractions in the area. As such, I thought I knew a lot about George and Martha Washington but this book added an entirely new dimension to my knowledge of the couple.As author Flora Fraser points out, only three letters survive of the correspondence between George and Martha so she relies heavily on letters to and between others to piece together snippets of the Washington's marriage. While the information is fascinating, those letters shed little light on the feelings the two had for each other. One that stands out to me was a letter George wrote to a woman who had discovered some of his letters to Martha in a desk drawer she had purchased from Washington. She returned the letters unread, to which George replied that she would have found them "to be fraught with expressions of friendship rather than enamoured love."Another letter written between friends of the couple remarked that George "was more a respectful than tender husband."This book does provide an intimate look at the private lives of George and Martha and the challenges and heartaches they faced, albeit independently, during their years together.Fraser quotes often from various letters of that time so the result, combined with Fraser's own very formal writing style, makes this book a bit dry and academic to read.Set against the backdrop of the Revolutionary War, Fraser focuses on the everyday life of the Washington's - George's concerns about the operations of the estate and Martha's management of domestic issues.While I gained great insight into each as individuals - their feelings about slavery was particularly enlightening - it was almost as if I were reading about two parallel lives rather than getting an intimate look into their relationshipWhile I really loved this book I give it four stars - or four-and-half  if I could - rather than five because the writing style itself tends to slow down the reader's pace.Otherwise, brilliant work.

Despite thinking of myself as a chocolate conneseiuer I had never heard of the Cailler brand before.This is not your everyday chocolate bar. It is very rich, smooth and creamy and definitely a premium chocolate. While prices do fluctuate, this seems to average about $4.50 a 3.5 oz bar - not all that much more expensive than the higher end drug store brands.It is slightly sweeter than I prefer but dark chocolate is my preferred poison. Given the quality of the Callier milk chocolate, I will definitely try one of their dark chocolate bars.

The Generals by Winston Groom is the story behind three of the most remarkable generals in our nation's history - Douglas MacArthur, George Patton and George Marshall. Groom is a captivating storyteller and links together what is in essence three mini-biographies and details how these lives intersected during World War II. Groom does an excellent job of bringing the unique personalities of each general to life.Unlike some other reviewers, my prior knowledge of each of these men was limited to a few WWII highlights so I was glued to this book from beginning to end. The back story of the early years of each man was particularly insightful as were the years after their exploits in WWII made them international heroes.As the book jacket says, The Generals offers "a riveting look at the lives of America's most iconic warriors."That describes this book perfectly. Highly recommended...

I have purchased and reviewed through the Vine program several Classic Accessories covers and the Ravenna line is now my go-to cover for patio furniture and outdoor accessories.The chair cover is made of a heavy, water resistant canvas like material. Construction quality is excellent with double stitched seams and extras like side handles for easy on and off maneuvering.The leg ties are extra long and the bungee cinch drawstring helps create a nearly custom fit on your furniture.I have had this particular cover on for nearly a month with no water or mildew issues at all. Other Ravenna covers are still going strong with no fading or deterioration after nearly three years of 24/7/365 exposure to the elements.No more trying to save money on cheaper covers that need replacing every year or so.As other patio covers need replacing, Ravenna will be my first choice.

These black nitrile gloves are very durable and have been holding up well to moderately heavy use in the garage, around the house and for craftsmanship projects like pottery and clay work. The small size fits like a second skin on most woman's hands and allows for great dexterity and flexibility.They also offer protection from gardening, garage and household chemicals.You might not think so now but once you have them on hand, you'll keep finding more and more uses for them.These are excellent general purpose latex-free gloves.

Overall I liked The Survivors by Robert Palmer. The plot is particularly clever - two men who are the lone survivors of a shooting 25 years ago reunite for the first time since the incident to unravel the mystery of what really happened that fateful evening.On the surface, the shooting was a murder suicide by Cal Henderson's mother. Cal, who was unhurt in the shooting, has blocked out most of what happened. Scottie, who barely survived a gunshot would to the head, shows up on Cal's doorstep unannounced and seeks to find the truth behind the grisely murders.This is a page-turner in that I was drawn in to the mystery of what really took place when Cal and Scottie were boys. And some of the plot twists were interesting as more and more people were revealed to be part of a cover up conspiracy.But as Scottie's violent outbursts and emotional instability escalated, I was troubled that Cal and others continued to placate his desire to carry a gun, worried more about what he might do should the weapon be taken away from him rather than the safety of others, including those he has threatened over the investigation.I would give this three and a half stars if I could. Clever concept and some interesting plot twists.

In Allen Eskens' The Guise of Another, Alexander Rupert is a decorated Minnesota detective under a cloud of suspicion. While relegated to a basement desk job, Rupert stumbles upon what looks to be a case of stolen identity when a man named James Putnam is killed in an automobile accident. His last words were "find it before they find her." As Rupert begins to follow the clues, the case becomes ever more complicated involving some of the most powerful men in the world of defense contracting and a ruthless contract killer recruited from the Balkans.Eskens is an author who is new to me and I found his writing to be taunt and compelling. The plot itself takes some unique turns and even as the final pages revealed several pieces of the mystery puzzle, there were still some surprises I never saw coming.The Guise of Another is a intriguing detective thriller with fast paced action that will keep you guessing until the very end just exactly how this will play out.Loved it and highly recommend it to anyone interested in this literary genre.

The PUR 7 cup ultimate pitcher works well as a water purifier. Like other pitcher purifiers, you insert a filter into the top section of the device and fill with water. You do need to prep the filter by soaking for 15 minutes in cold water and thoroughly washing the pitcher itself before first use.The LED indicator is working well although it's too soon for the change indicator light to come on since this is a new unit.My one complaint is that the filling tank seems smaller than other PUR pitchers I have used. It took more than three tank fills for the pitcher to fill. With a new filter, the water does move through quickly but I am surprised that the tank don't hold a bit more in ratio to the pitcher itself.Otherwise, great tasting water for drinking straight or preparing coffee, tea or ice cubes. It really does make a difference when using filtered water for these other choices.

If you realize the Philips Norelco 1100 is a body groomer and not a shaver, I think you'll be happy with this.While designed for a man, it can be used by women as well. The bodygroom will not replace your shaver but give you a safer, alternative way to groom more delicate/private areas of the body. Two included heads allow you to adjust the closeness of the grooming. You won't get the same results as a razor but you also won't risk nicks and cuts in those areas either.This particular model runs on a battery and is safe to use in the shower. Best results for me though were on dry skin.Other reviewers have compared this to rechargeable models but if you are looking try out a dedicated body groomer, this is a good start before spending more on something you may not end up using on a regular basis.

I think most people have figured out that baby wipes are great for many uses, not just for changing diapers. Yes, we use them for that but also for so much more and have tried many different brands over the years.The Cuties baby wipes are thick and strong and virtually unscented. They work great when changing a diaper or when cleaning up sticky fingers with our older children. But I also use them when traveling - by car, train or plane - and also for quick and easy clean up when roasting marshmallows around our fire pit. Whatever the use, they leave your hands, face, etc... feeling clean and soft.I had not heard of Cuties before but am impressed and will be buying these again.

It has been years since I have used a headache powder - no reason in particular. They just are not as common in the US as they are in other parts of the world.In any case, I was already aware that powders act faster than tablets but I had forgotten what a difference that makes until trying Goody's Headache Powder in mixed fruit.I suffer from migraines but am able to keep them at bay if I take something non-prescription as soon as I feel even the slightest of headaches coming on. The Goody's worked noticeably faster for me in relieving my headaches and preventing them from turning into something more debilitating.My usual pain reliever is Extra Strength Excedrin but I was surprised to find that the Extra Strength Goody's has a stronger dose of both acetaminophen and aspirin compared to Excedrin:Extra Strength Goody'sAcetaminophen 325 mgAspirin 500 mgCaffeine 65 mgExtra Strength ExcedrinAcetaminophen 250 mgAspirin 250 mgCaffeine 65 mgThe extra strength Goody's is stronger and works faster for me.As for the taste? Not sure any headache powder will ever taste good but the mixed fruit flavor makes it a bit easier to swallow and does not leave as bitter an after taste. As with other headache powders, I tilt my head back, pour the powder onto the back of my tongue and take a quick gulp of water to swallow.My only complaint is that the packets are a bit difficult to tear open so you may want to have a small scissors close by. Otherwise, the powder itself works great and makes up for any complaints on the packaging.I will definitely keep these on hand....

I took the advice of other reviewers and mixed this with a bit more liquid per tablespoon of cereal than recommended in the included directions. This produced a good consistency for feeding an infant. I happen to love quinoa and am glad to see a baby food that includes it as a main ingredient.My baby liked it as well and we have mixed this with a small bit of applesauce to add variety to taste and consistency.Be sure to mix only what you need per feeding since any leftovers cannot be stored.Qunoa, while not to everyone's liking, it is healthy grain so I am glad to discover a way to introduce it to my child at an early age.

I have purchased several Ravenna covers in the past few years and have found them to be better than any others I have tried, some even at twice the price.Since I was already familiar with the quality of the Ravenna covers, I jumped at the chance to try out this double lounge cover.As with the others in this line from Classic Accessories, this cover is well constructed of a thick, waterproof material. There are click straps to keep the cover in place during storms and high winds and side handles to help with adjustments or removal.My outdoor furniture is exposed to the elements 24/7, 365 days a year so after trial and error with other covers that disintegrated after less than a year, I will only use the Ravenna covers.Yes, you can find less expensive covers but for the harshest of weather conditions, nothing beats the Ravenna line from Classic Accessories.

I have had good luck with most of the Tresemme products I have tried lately. All are good quality and reasonably priced. But as to be expected, some suit my long, color treated hair better than others.This shine lotion goes on easily and leaves my hair smooth. But results will be different for everyone.My best results by far have been with the new Tresemme Balm Get Sleek Blow Dry, which, as expected, gets mixed results from other reviewers. But it has been working miracles on my hair and will remain my go-to product.But the shine lotion does work. It's just not my first choice....

The Remington PF7300 F3 comfort series shaver is a good value compared to others on the market. While made mostly of plastic, it has a solid feel and is comfortable to hold and use.It is a bit louder than my more expensive shaver but nothing that most will notice unless you are making a side by side comparison.Included are a cover/stand and cleaning brush.I get a decent, close shave with this but not as close as with a traditional razor.But for the price and portability, this is a good choice. Perfect for high school or college students or to keep at the office or anywhere a razor and water might not be available.

Both my kids have super curly hair that somehow always turns into a tangled mess. Using the Suave detangler has helped change that. It sprays on easily and has a nice scent that is not too overpowering. New to me is that you can use this on dry hair as well as wet hair. That makes a big diffence in keeping hair under control on those days that are in between shampoos.This is a great product and good value when you can pick it up locally on sale.

I am probably not the intended user of this gel cream. I have long, color treated hair that has a slight natural wave to it but is not overly curly.When I want a natural, wavy look to my hair, I let it air dry after applying some sort of styling product. I have had good experiences with most Tresemme products but this was not my favorite. It left my hair too stiff and crunchy to touch. A cousin with shoulder length curly hair tried it and loved the results.This does have a nice, subtle scent and goes on easily so it's probably worth a try if you like "super hold" products and have curly hair.

There is more to the Normandy region of France than the D-Day beaches and this Lonely Planet guide gives you a sampling of other attractions in that area. There are four suggested road trips included in this guide: The D-Day beaches, Monet's Normandy, a tour of the region's cheese producers and a World War I tour called In Flanders Field. Each gives a good overview of the area with color photos and maps, including a pull out map of the Normandy region. Since many international travelers will be transiting through Paris, there is a section on that city as well.As with other LP guides, there is comprehensive information about general travel in France - currency, voltage, social customs such as tipping practices, etc..I have been to Normandy and the D-Day beaches and wish I had known more about the area - the Flanders Field and Monet's Normandy tour would have made nice side trips. I do plan to return next year and will definitely have this book with me.These days, most people - myself included - do their travel planning and research online so it's no longer necessary to lug around the bulky tour guide books of the past. But having a compact book such as this Lonely Planet guide still comes in handy for quick reference and especially for the maps.If you are looking for a guide book dedicated solely to the D-Day beaches, then you should look elsewhere. While those beaches and the American Cemetery are incredibly moving and places I believe every American should visit, there is so much more to appreciate if you are making a trip to Normandy.

I own several Amazon Basics Apple Certified Lightning to USB cables and each one has exceeded my expectations. Like the others, this latest cable is slightly thicker than the original Apple cables, which feels much sturdier to me and able to withstand abuse.I have no problem using this cable to charge an iPhone 6 and iPad mini without having to remove each device from its case.While I have had this particular cable for about a month, others are holding up after a couple of years of use so I expect this to be just as reliable. I can't say the same for replacement cables from other companies.Stop sorting through the dizzying array of lightning cables available. Save your time and effort and just buy the Amazon Basics cable first.You won't be disappointed.

We all have wake up calls in life and for Stuart Stevens, one was turning 60 just weeks before Mitt Romney's losing bid for the presidency in 2012. As Romney's lead political strategist, Stevens used the loss as a chance to reflect on his own life, particularly his relationship with his father, who was now 95 years old. Recalling the days of his youth and the time spent with his father attending Ole Miss football games, Stevens decides to take his parents - blessedly both still alive and in good health - to every Ole Miss game for one final season.As Stevens takes his parents on road trip after road trip in the Ole Miss schedule, he recounts the games he remembers during his younger days - days of turbulent and violent race relations in Mississippi.Stevens blends his reflections on the lessons learned from his parents during this time with the adventures they were now experiencing during this last season of Ole Miss football.This is an easy to read book that is filled with nuggets of wisdom woven between the wins and losses of the Ole Miss schedule.Football fans will appreciate the details Stevens includes on each game he attends. But  you do not need to be a fan to appreciate this poignant and beautifully written tribute by Stevens to his father.

What the Prayers of Jesus Tells Us About the Heart of God is an in-depth study on the prayer life of Jesus and the meaning behind His prayers for His followers. Author Shane Stanford uses Jesus's prayers as a guide to help readers deepen their understanding of the context of those prayers and in turn develop a more focused and powerful prayer life of their own.The book primarily uses the Common English Bible translation for reference with some King James, English Standard and Contemporary English versions as well.This is an easy to read book - less than 150 pages and not too academic.I found it very insightful and thought-provoking, both about Jesus's prayers and my own prayer habits.A simple but effective book for Christians to deepen their understanding of Jesus's prayers and developing a more powerful prayer life of their own.

These Wrangler Classic Cargo shorts are made of a thick cotton twill with sturdy seams and zippers that work smoothly.The cargo style with lots of pockets is perfect for a young boy.These also feature an adjustable waist band which allows for a perfect fit for a growing boy.As for size, the 4T fits my average-sized 4 year old perfectly.They have held up well to lots of outdoor play and many washings.These are quality shorts as well made as their adult versions.

The Boost Complete Compact nutrition drink really surprised me. At 4 oz. it has 240 calories, 10g of protein and 26 different vitamins and minerals.This is a rich, thick liquid with a smooth chocolate taste. It has no metallic aftertaste like many other nutrition and diet shakes I have tried. It really does taste great.While it is not intended to be a diet drink, I sometimes use it as a meal substitute, adding a bit of fat free milk if I want to increase the amount of liquid. Not only do I prefer the taste compared to the usual diet shakes on the market, I like the added nutritional benefits of Boost Complete.The compact 4 oz is also better for me - as rich as this is, the larger bottles are just too much for me to drink at one time. With the smaller size, I get the same nutritional punch without feeling too full.I was expecting the same old artificial tasting nutrition drink but Boost Complete is a step above any others I have tried. I will definitely continue buying this....

The Call by Adam Hamilton is a good overview of the life of the Apostle Paul. While I was expecting more of a traditional biography, I did find the author's own theological interpretations interesting.There are several black and white maps and photographs that really help put in perspective Paul's journeys and the geography of of the area.For anyone interested in the life of Paul, this is a good start.

Though it would be 20 years before I even came into the world, through Jay Winik I felt as if I were there in 1944, feeling the terror as Rudolf Vrba and Alfred Wetzler daringly escaped from Auschwitz in an attempt to alert the world of its atrocities. I could feel the naive excitement as Ann Frank wrote in her diary on D-Day of the hope a successful invasion promised. And I could feel the weariness Franklin Roosevelt shouldered as he desperately tried to hide his dangerously failing health from the rest of the world.To say Winik is a master storyteller is an understatement.This is a riveting account of the events that shaped the outcome of World War II. Even at just over 500 pages, I could not put this book down.Still, you will read this with a heavy heart. The body count of WWII is estimated at 36 million - 19 million of them civilians. While hindsight is always 20-20, it is hard to understand how more was not done by Roosevelt to put an end to the grisly death machine of the Holocaust in the face of mounting evidence. Winik does a masterful job of weaving together the events in Europe against those taking place in America in an attempt to answer the questions of how and why this was allowed to happen.Brilliant. Brilliant. Brilliant.No matter what year you were born, let Winik take you back to 1944...

Sea Salt seems to be the latest rage for hair products promising that "beachy" look of casually tousled waves.I have long, color treated hair that is only slightly wavy and this worked well for me on days when I wanted to take a break from blow drying.I think those with more waves and curls than me get even better results and less so for those with super straight hair.This has a light scent that does not linger and the foam leaves no residue behind.This is a nice choice if you are going for that beachy look...

Sea Salt sprays seems to be all the rage and this Tresemme is one of the better ones I have tried.The scent is very subtle - not too sweet and does not linger - and the results have been good on my long, color treated hair.My hair is basically straight with a light wave to it when left to air dry. I am happy with the results I get with the sea salt spray but think those with curly hair are more the intended consumer.Still, for those days when I want to give my hair a rest from blow drying, I will definitely use this spray..

With so much of our digital lives being conducted via smartphones and tablets, backing up that data has become more important.But until now - cloud storage services notwithstanding -  it has also been a clumsy process and more complicated than necessary given how fast technology is advancing.Now, with the SanDisk Connect Wireless Stick, backing up files from any device just got a whole lot easier.Set up was easy and within minutes I was able to transfer photos, videos and documents between my smartphone, iPad and computer.Everything transferred seamlessly and opened without corruption on each device.No more excuses for not backing up digital files....just link up, move your files and you are good to go.Cloud storage is not for everyone or for every document so if you need an easy way to back up files, this is a good choice.

I travel to the West Coast regularly and am somewhat familiar with the Bay Area and wine country. Even so, I found the Lonely Planet guide informative and very useful. In true LP style, it is filled with maps and lots of local information - like various ways to pay the toll on the Golden Gate Bridge if you are without an electronic toll pass. Locals would already know these options but tourists, especially foreigners, would not.At 128 pages, this is a good size to keep handy in a car or backpack. If nothing else, the maps, phone numbers and website information is worth having at your fingertips. And let's face it - there are a lot of remote areas in Northern California where cell service is spotty and no Waze or Google to rely on. Physical maps still have a place in the world....I appreciate West Coast reviewers noting what they feel is missing from this guide but for first time visitors and those of us that do not live there, this is a good visual introduction to the area. I would not use it to plan out my entire trip - that's what the Internet is for - but I still think it's a good value.

Drones for Dummies is an excellent introduction to drones. Written in an easy to understand style, it covers everything you need to know about drones. As Mark LaFay says in his introduction, he assumes nothing other than that the reader knows how to use a computer and the Internet.From the basics of understanding how a drone works to buying, flying and various uses for drones, LaFay has authored a thorough book for anyone at all interested in drones. I'm not exactly a dummy but I'm no aviation expert either so this book was perfect for me.I found it extremely informative, especially the section on understanding the laws that govern the use of drones.And anyone who has ever taken a selfie will like the section on using drones for aerial photography.While there is a wealth of information here, LaFay is also a witty writer, making this an entertaining as well as educational read.Even if you have no intention of actually buying a drone (I'm still several months away from buying my own), Drones for Dummies is a fascinating look at one of the fastest growing segments of consumer technology today.Definitely recommended .. would make a great gift as well.

There is a lot to like about the Incipio Highland Folio case - so much so that after using the white case for several months, I recently bought the black one for a second phone.The case is very sleek looking with a textured fabric cover combined with a brushed aluminum back. It is a perfect fit for the Amazon Fire phone - it holds the phone securely while allowing access to all the ports and controls. The fabric and aluminum have a nice, tactile feel when using the phone.The inside of the case is a soft suede-like material with a slot to hold an ID or credit card.The only downside, which may be a deal breaker for some, is that there is no magnet, clasp or elastic to keep the cover snapped closed. At first I was concerned but after using this case for several months, it is not an issue for me.I'm sure there is some way to modify the closure but it's just not important enough for me to bother.This is still my favorite case for looks, durability and value.

I have had many fire pits over the years and this is one of my favorites.At 30" in diameter, it is one of the largest available (and at a reasonable price). The mesh sides allow the fire to give off more light and warmth than those with enclosed fire bowls.The fire pit is easy to assemble and is sturdy without being overly heavy to move. It comes with a mesh fire screen and vinyl cover for protection from the elements when not in use. Unlike some fire pits, no poker is included.Like many fire pits, this one sits about 6" off the ground so care needs to be taken when placing it on a deck or on grass due to the risk of scorching whatever is underneath..If you place a layer of sand in the bottom of the pit before lighting a fire, it will help keep the bottom of the fire bowl from getting too hot. It also helps to buy four 18" cement pavers to use as a base if you are placing this in a yard or on a deck. Or just set each leg of the pit on a brick to raise it up. Those few inches in height along with some sand will make a big difference in protecting both your fire pit and whatever is underneath.But the size and open mesh sides are the features that set this fire pit apart.If you like a roaring bonfire, you will like this fire pit.

I had a Brita pitcher and didn't care much for it. It seemed. like too big a hassle to use. The water didn't taste as good as it should.for the amount of work I put into it. I was pleasantly surprised to discover how easy this PUR pitcher is to use.  The filter is easy to use. I soaked it in water for 15 minutes and then easily inserted. It filters my.town's lousy water. The size is perfect for me and my dog. It's not to heavy. My reward is great.tasting water and I am no longer relying on bottled water. No heavy bottles to cart in and I am saving money. It's a winner to me.

This is a terrific toy. First of all, it's a wooden toy that can be used to learn the alphabet and encourage imaginations. I just love that. Each letter of the alphabet has its own food. It comes in a puzzle box that can be used as a tea tray too. My granddaughter has a play kitchen and she likes to serve tea with her tea set. When she brings me tea in the tray I ask for a food that starts with "L"  and she brings me the lemon. How great is that? Sometimes I ask for an apple and ask her what it starts with. She has the "A" down pat right away. She is 3 and this is so perfect for her.  The toy is quite sturdy and is a puzzle too. I love a toy that is versatile and can be used many ways. I think this is great product and any toy that encourages imagination is a winner to me.

I would never have picked this book on my own as it's way out of my comfort zone but that's what book clubs do best. This was my GR Irish group read this month and, in a very odd way, I enjoyed this. It was full of peculiar characters, a macabre atmosphere and a story that is full of surprises.  Merricat lives an isolated existence with her older sister, Constance, and her Uncle Julian. There was a terrible tragedy at the house about 6 years ago and the odd family has become the village's outcasts. The simple fact of going to the grocery store and the library, terrifies 18 year old Merricat but she has to. Constance doesn't leave the house. In spite of everything they are happy and content.  Then Cousin Charles comes looking for their treasures and things must be done to restore the balance of life they had. What happens is enough to curl your toes.  For such a short book it really punches a wallop. It's a great book for Halloween.

This was an enjoyable historical mystery featuring Charles Lenox, former member of Parliament and now a part owner of a private detective agency. Yes, the aristocratic Lenox is now in "trade" for goodness sake. Meanwhile  his wife, Lady Jane, is throwing parties that Royalty attend.  Lenox is involved in investigating not one but two mysteries. In London, a German pianist disappears in very mysterious circumstances that has the entire nation speculating on what happened. This could be a real boon for the agency if they can find the pianist. Meanwhile Charles accompanies his grieving brother to their childhood home in Markethouse.  There is quite a mystery going on there with a series of small burglaries and finally a stabbing of the mayor.  Working on the cases simultaneously keeps Charles on the go.  I learned a few things from this book. The expression, Riot Act, comes from a law enacted by George I in 1714. As a Hanoverian he was afraid the Stewart faction would try to overthrow him. He made a law making it illegal for 12 or more people to engage in "tumultuous assembly."  This has evolved into our usage of reading someone the riot act.  The other thing is the term, lackluster, comes from Shakespeare.  He made it up. I love a book that teaches me new things.  I highly recommend this book as entertaining and informative.

I have always enjoyed the Mitford series and have a little crush on Father Tim. Sorry Cynthia. I was really looking forward to the story of Dooley and Lace's wedding. I thought it would just shine. Unfortunately for me, it did not. There are several reasons for this:1. I found jumping around different people's stories without any kind of preparation quite unsettling. You would be reading about Dooley's thoughts and suddenly it would be Harley. It was unsettling for a long time reader but I despair for any new reader trying to make sense of this or even how certain characters were important to the story.2. There was just too many things going on. Dooley was graduating, opening his new business, getting married all at once. It just seemed overwhelming and things kept getting add to the pot. Yet some important situations were skipped over. I would love to have been in the selection of Lace's wedding dress especially since so much time was devoted to thinking about it.3. There was just not enough Father Tim in it for me. He is the heart and soul of the books and I needed a bigger fix.  What I did like was a surprise near the end that was so sweet and right that it took my breath away. It was special enough that I raised my rating to three stars.

The picture on Amazon does no credit to this wonderfully delicate necklace.  The beautiful flower does not shine in the picture the way it does in real life. Can you tell there are sapphires that sparkle? The scroll work is delicate and if you wear on a darker item of clothes the whole necklace shines and pops. This is really a pretty necklace that has brought many compliments.  It's just so much better than you can tell from the presentation.

The first Kinsey Milhone book I read was [book:D is for Deadbeat|64857] back in 1987. I quickly went back and read the first three and have been reading them for almost 30 years now. I am despondent that there are only 2 let to go, "Y" and "Z" although Sue Grafton is probably relieved. I liked this one very much.  One of the things Grafton has done right, in my humble opinion, is to keep the series in the 1980's. It's only a couple of months between cases and I love that. I can't tell you how lovely it is to read a story without people on cell phones and computers being relatively new with many people keeping hand records. It's just so relaxing to read that time period. I also love the neighbor/landlord in his 90's, Henry, still active and churning out cinnamon rolls. California is in a bad drought, sound familiar? Henry is out to solve the problem.  In this one, Kinsey gets scammed and she just can't let it go. As she investigates why she was scammed, she stumbles into a case of missing art, dead girls and a psychotic killer. With scamming being the theme of the book, she gets some new neighbors who take your breath away with their audacity.  It's a great read with a very old friend. 30 years later and I am still entranced in Kinsey's adventures. It's good to catch up with her.  Other reviewers have mentioned the number of typos and errors in the book. They are absolutely right. I am not sure a copy editor worked on this and if they did, they should be fired. This is a major book on the best seller list and there is no excuse for it. The publishing house should be ashamed of themselves for doing Grafton such an injustice. I hope people keep talking about it and it puts pressure on publishers do a better job. This is not a cheap book and as a consumer I deserved better.  I think this is a first rate series and highly recommend it.

2.5 stars  There are times when I read a book and then the reviews, I wonder if I read the book. This is one of those books. I found this book so saccharine, so gushing, so star struck that it was barely readable to me.  I almost made an appointment for the dentist as my teeth ached from so much sweetness. I can not tell you how much this book left me cold and it was only seventy five pages near the end that saved it as an one star for me.  Let me be clear. I have read this author before and like her. I am truly disappointed.  The story centers around Truman Capote and Babe Paley's friendship in the late 1950's/early 1960's.  It is full of stories of the famous rich and famous of that time period like C.Z. Guest, Pam Churchill, Diana Vreeland and even appearances from Betty Bacall and Jackie Kennedy. They were Truman's swans who found him so amusing. He gossiped with them, flattered them and became their pet. he participated in their parties, stayed in their houses and shared their secrets.  Frankly I did not find them interesting at all. Their lives seemed so boring to me. It consisted of lunching, shopping and keeping themselves in perfect shape.  They were bored out of their minds and looking for a diversion when Capote stumbled into their lives and they all adored him. It gives you a pictures of the privileges they seemingly enjoyed but it also lays out the high price they paid for it. Their subservience to men so they could stay married to the money was just horrifying. It is terrible to envision the beautiful and stylish Babe Pauley rub her husband's feet and keeping her make-up on all night so he could never see her face bare. Shudder.  Here are some examples of the gushing writing.  "She (Babe) was a princess, a walking fairy tale."  Truman says, "You simply can't understand how glorious they were, those girls!"  Truman's supposedly last thoughts, "The splendor of belonging, being included, prized, coveted. The beauty of a perfectly tailored shirt, crisp, blinding white, just out of a box. The beauty of taffeta, the tinkling of bells, diamonds, emeralds, a pristine paper flower. Beauty."  If you are interested in the lives of the rich and famous who fill their days with shopping, eating, caring for their bodies and faces, partying and not much else then this book could be the one for you. I'm not so it wasn't the books for me.

One of my great pleasures in life is a new Precious Ramotswe book in the Number 1 Ladies Detective Agency series. I throw everything aside and settle in for a wonderful time with the calmness Mma Ramotswe brings me. The last thing I expected though was that she was going on vacation. What? Vacation? Well, sort of. It's her version of a vacation she was maneuvered into taking by her funny assistant, Mma Makutsi.  This means, of course, Grace will be in charge. Will the detective agency survive?  Precious does not do well with free time. She has a run in with a young boy who tries to get "protection" money from her to guard her van. This is both a funny and touching incident as many of her meetings are. How she handles things and people are just wonderful. Has any of them rubbed off on Mma Makutsi? You'll have to read the book to find out how well she does leading the agency.  You can't go wrong on this book and it make me feel much happier after I read it. I think Precious would like that.

These are working well for my granddaughter. They are keeping the wetness in and she is much more comfortable wearing them. She'll go to this bag first to get her diaper so she obviously likes them. Now if we could get her potty trained, like would be great. This is a great product.

These are gorgeous earrings. The black stones surrounding the diamond gives it a striking look and it  goes well with many things. It goes from work to a night on the town quite seamlessly. I have gotten quite a few compliments on them and they look well with many outfits. They have surgical posts with a nice clasp on the back. They are very comfortable and easy to wear. The price is so reasonable for such lovely earrings. I think they're great.

What a darling baby doll collection. It's the perfect start for my soon-to- be three year old granddaughter. She loves taking care of the baby by regularly feeding her and changing her clothes. She is soft and cuddly. I think she's a real cutie. I think I'll buy her a stroller and a crib to go with her  dolly for Christmas. It's really a nice beginner doll.

What a great way to learn to read. I learned from a large "Fun With Dick and Jane book" in the first grade. This is infinitely better. My grandson just lit up as he could read it himself. He didn't need his old grandma's help. The pen is easy to use and the story is great.  He loves Paw Patrol so it was a perfect fit. Now I just have to buy him more books. Luckily the prices on these books for LeapReader are pretty reasonable. They are more affordable than the game cartridges.  I love the LeapFrog product. I can always be sure of the quality I am going to get. I know my grandkids will love them and they will learn something.  It's a win-win situation for an adoring grandma.

My boys ( now in their 30's) loved TMNT so I thought my 5 year old grandson might love them too. I was right. He was right on this game and enjoyed playing with it right away. He plays games on my Kindle all the time so he's got it down pat. They are so quick now. When I was five we had a huge "Fun With Dick and Jane" book on our desks. Sigh. I am aging myself.  These kids are just so much more clever.  There are two things that I  am not crazy about. The cartridges are now cards. Even though they come in a really great tin box that my grandson loves, it would be easy to lose them or bend them. My daughter-in-law is very good about these things but I worry about that. The other thing I don't care for is that you must complete a level to move one. This may be good for adult gamers, although I admit I get frustrated with that, but for kids it doesn't take long before they get bored and put it aside. There's just so many times he's going to try before he loses interest.  He is having a wonderful time and learning math so you can't beat that. I love the LeapFrog product and have never been disappointed with the quality.

One of my favorite guilty pleasures is this series. This book doesn't disappoint. I laughed and chuckled all the way through and wished I had a glass of champagne and a box on bonbons on hand while I read it. I loved reading the gossip on the Royal Family and loved the cliff hanger. I can't wait for the next one.

I run a small business out of my home and have discovered this printer is exactly what I need. It's a big beast of a machine and has print/copy/scan/fax capabilities. It was incredibly easy to set it which is a big plus for me.  I have in the past had to have someone else install the printer for me.  I have thought for awhile it would be cheaper to buy a new printer instead of buying print cartridges. I had a $99 HP printer and would spend $35 for a black cartridge and $35 for color ones and if you did this twice the ink became more expensive than the printer. This one comes with a purported two years of ink. Instead of cartridges you refill the ink. Not only is it effective, it is also good for the environment.  That's a nice bonus.  I don't really know if I have two years of ink but I assume it depends on how much printing you do.  I think this is a terrific printer that provides you good support. It's better than running to Staples or some such place to do heavy duty printing and/or faxing. It's a winner in my book.

Serena Flanagan has returned to her job as Detective Chief Inspector with the Belfast Police Department after her fight with breast cancer.  Almost immediately she is confronted with an old case, The Schoolboy Killer. Eight years ago a 12 year old boy, Ciaran, and his fourteen year old brother, Thomas,  murdered their foster father. Ciaran is being released and his new probation officer wants to talk to her about him.  Flanagan has relied on a cancer survivor's group to help her with her struggle. When her friend, Penny, announces she has only a few months to live but wants to spend the time happily with her husband, Flanagan is saddened.  When Penny and her husband are found dead in an apparent murder-suicide, Flanagan begins to go off the tracks.  The two cases converge in one mega ending.  Although I wouldn't say it was a mystery per se, it is a very readable book that deals with cancer, sibling attachments, the foster care system and what happens to the families left behind after a violent crime. This is a perfect book for a book club because there are so many topics to discuss.  The novel is so authentic that the characters walk right off the page.  This book is so readable and interesting that I could barely put it down. I recommend it highly.

Fisher-Price has knocked it out of the ball park with this truck. For any little boy, and big ones too, who love Monster Trucks will love this toy. It's much bigger than I expected and does great tricks. He even does variations of some of them. He makes a great noise. My grandson who is 5 loves this toy and his father does too. I am not quite sure who played with it more. It's very well built, sturdy and has the Fisher Price quality you expect. If you push the Flame button, it talks. It's a really great toy and I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Giving a two year old and a five year old baths is never an easy proposition. This makes it much simpler. Having the shampoo and conditioner saves a step and that really helps. The scent is clean and soapy so when you take the kids out you just want to hug them and inhale that delicious smell. This is a great product and has an easy open top. It's priced well and does the job. How can you wrong?

I have been travelling lately. I have been to the Cajun country in Louisiana, the Highlands in Scotland and now Bruges. Of course, it was all done through books which is what makes them so lovely. I have been fond of Bruges since the wonderful movie, "In Bruges" with Colin Farrell and this book gives me such a powerful sense of place.  I love picking up on cultural differences and this book does that especially since it's translated. It was written for locals and not Americans so it gives it the added punch. One of my favorite lines was when the Inspector Van In says the name Verheye was such a common name that it was almost impossible to track down a specific one. Really? Verheye is common? Yes, my kind of book.  The book is about an influential man, Degroof, who is being targeted by someone wanting to exact revenge on him for past deeds. He is being punished through his children and grandchildren which was an unique way to go. There are plenty of twists and turns and a really surprising (to me) end.  It was quite a satisfying read and I hope to read more in the series. And the real bonus is having the city Bruges unfold before your eyes. I highly recommend this book.

This is the second book in a series set in the Highlands of Scotland. I love the sense of place and enjoy the fact that I know the little towns it talks about. I spent a week in the Highlands and enjoyed it tremendously. The book is set in the mid 1950's which is a lovely time to explore. The idea of a woman having a job outside the home is still a new concept and domestic violence against women is certainly handled differently than it is now.  This mystery concerns two separate deaths on the same estate on the same day. One is the newly married husband of the daughter of the owner of the estate. The second one is the son of the farm manager. Are they connected or just a coincident? The local newspaper is on the story and Joanne Ross, a recent reporter hire, is on the story even though she has ties to the crime. The staff at the paper is made up with interesting characters who made me laugh. I majored in journalism so I loved the story of the working newspaper.  This book captivated me from beginning to end. I love mysteries set in other places that make me feel welcome. I could really immerse myself in the local culture and the story ends on one very surprising twist. This is a series I can enjoy.

Louisiana is an interesting state and the Cajun country is a very specific cultural spot.  It's a perfect setting for this new entry into the cozy mystery market. Maggie Crozat and her family have converted their plantation into a Bed and Breakfast Inn with very interesting guests. This novel really gets the sense of place and history and gives it a wonderful dimension.  One week a group of people check in including an elderly obnoxious couple on their honeymoon, a group of fraternity brothers, a family vacationing from Australia and members of an organization called Cajun Cuties.  As in most mysteries, someone ends up dead or in this case two people and Maggie is determined to solve the crime. Along the way they turn down business for a Civil War re-enactment, very politically correct right now.  Someone is digging up the plantation looking for buried pirate treasure and someone is scheming to inherit an English castle.  This is an excellent cozy mystery and I will be happy to read more in this series.

This a book I read for my in-person book club. I didn't think I was going to like it but I really did. It is the story of the rowers for the 1936 Berlin Olympics. He tells the stories of the boys who raced for the gold but concentrates on Joe Rantz. He has a remarkable story to tell and exemplifies the resilience of the American spirit.
