In between the boys' stories are tales of training, race events and building of The Boat. He also talks about the times and the stories of the Great Depression were heart breaking. He also discusses Hitler's rise and the reason Germany wanted to host the Olympics. It was all quite interesting.  You don't have to like sports to like this one. This book is much more than that. I am so glad I read it.
These are drop dead gorgeous earrings. They dress up an outfit and yet can be worn to work. I have gotten quite a few compliments on them. They are comfortable. I really like them.

This is the princess version of Candy Land and it is cute, cute, cute. The sturdy playing pieces are Cinderella, Rapunzel and Ariel. It is quite a puzzle as to why there are only three pieces. Four would have been great and much more practical. The games are very flimsy and you have to punch them out yourself. It was a strange place for Hasbro to cut corners. Why not just put out a quality product that  will last in kids memories like the original Candy Land did for me? That's the way to build customer loyalty and the way Hasbro used to do business.  Still my  3 year old granddaughter and I have had some great times playing it. It's an easy game for her with no reading required. She loves that it is about princesses and doesn't take forever to play.  I hope it builds some memories for her with her grandma.

This toy has some challenges to it but my granddaughter loves to play with it. It's actually a very good size and the only assembly required is putting the wings on it.  That's the great part of it.  The bad part is the packaging for one thing. Whoever designed it should be sentenced to traveling around and undoing it for people. It was so frustrating and it took 15-20 minutes to get all of it out of the box. This is way to long. My horse does not speak. My granddaughter doesn't care but I think it should work as advertised. Princess Sophie does talk by pressing her amulet and my granddaughter loves this. I think it is over priced. I might have been more receptive to the price if the horse had actually talked.  The bottom line, though, is my granddaughter loves it and that's why I gave it four stars. If some of the kinks were worked out (packaging and horse talking) it would be a great toy.

I used to love a Marian Keyes. They were light and funny and a vacation for my mind. This as none of those things. I didn't find it funny and it was just one stupid thing after another. Initially I liked Stella Sweeney. She was suffering from a life threatening disease and you really had to root for it. Funny? No.  After she recovers she makes some really odd decisions. A lot of things that are preposterous happen including how she "writes" a book. She has an ex-husband that's an idiot, a daughter who lives in the clouds and a son who hates her. She makes her life so much harder for herself. Funny yet?  In the end I grew to find her so annoying and the supporting characters made of cardboard. I was so disappointed. I had expected some cheer and got a lesson on sex with lessons I had never even thought of. That was a real eye opener. I had no idea the Irish were that randy (just kidding).  I feel like Keyes, like Janet Evanovich, have exhausted their genre. I find no reason to waste your time on this.

I love these ice trays. I will never go back to the hard ones that you have to bang on the counter to get the ice out. These are so soft and supple. All you have to do is press the bottom of the ice tray and out pops the ice. Easy, breezy Artic Chill.

I really trust Fisher-Price toys and this doesn't disappoint. It is a relatively simple car set to put together and once it's done it stays together. This isn't always true on race car sets. The track can be set up in a number of different configurations which just adds to the excitement. My grandson was just thrilled that it was Blaze and the Monster. He enjoyed it even though he's five so it will grow with them. It was nice to see how happy he was playing with this.

3.5 stars  This is a debut novel about Li Du, an exiled librarian in China in 1708.  He stops in Dayan where his cousin is the magistrate as prepares to leave China for the last time. His cousin is in the throes of preparation for the emperor is coming to view an eclipse that he supposedly causes by his power.  The Jesuits actually predict the eclipse but the emperor takes the credit. During the feverish preparations, a Jesuit priest is murdered and the magistrate hires Du to discover the cause of death and really wants it to be from natural causes.  This is a fascinating historical mystery. There is a great discussion of astronomy of that age, the influence of Jesuit priests on the emperor and a lot of great tidbits about life in China at that time. I feel the author captured the time period and took me on a great journey. I love that a lot of action took place in a library and it was wonderful to read about books in that period. I love that they catalogued books by the color of the books. It made such a pleasurable sight.  I hope this becomes a series. I am anxious to catch up with Li Du's adventures and hope that Hamza, the delightful story teller, stays with him. For those who like historical mysteries this is a good one. Let's hope it continues.

Us tells the story of a disintegration of the twenty five year marriage of Douglas and Connie. There are no major blow ups but it is a just a relationship that it is worn out. There is not enough passion to be angry but Douglas is resisting the break up. He still loves his wife.  They decide to still do their month long tour with their 17 year old son, Albie, touring Europe from one corner to another. Douglas is hoping to rekindle the romance and Connie, frankly, just seems to want to travel with their little family one more time. Albie, like all teen-agers ready for college, wants to go by himself. He very grudgingly goes along.  For an American the European tour is just breathtaking. I just can't wrap my mind around how easy it is to travel in Europe. In four hours they have been flying over many countries. In four hours I can't even get out of California in any direction. I love the train travel stories and just the ease of getting around.  Douglas is a scientist and quite smug about it. He can not imagine anyone wanting to do anything else. When Albie decides he wants to be a photographer, Douglas is appalled. He tells his son anyone can do that. It's only a select few that can be a scientist and make a real difference. I thought who would be that insensitive? Then I realized that Douglas is a real life Sheldon Cooper from "The Big Bang Theory."  He has the same traits as Sheldon in not knowing how he sounds to other people, his amazement that anybody would want to be anything but him and his inability to pick up cues from other people.In one episode Douglas creates a Lego sculpture then glues it so Albie can not destroy it. He is sure he will be greeted with applause and great awe. Instead Albie cries because he can no longer use his Legos. Douglas is bewildered and I could see this scene on "Big Bang".  Needless to say Douglas and Albie have a troubled relationship and how things unfold create new stresses. It's that exploration of how to repair things that is quite interesting. None of the characters are particularly likable. Douglas is Sheldon Cooper, Connie often mocks him and helps wedge some dislike between father and son, and Albie, like most 17 year olds feels he is quite entitled.  By the end of the book, I was glad I had met them but I was very tired of them. It was just like I had spent a month with family travelling around Europe.

This is a terrific mini oven/slow cooker. It has the most amazing feature in that it browns the meat. Hallejuh! Thank you for making my life easier.  It is much bigger than the crock pot I have. Of course mine came from the stone age. I only wish I had this when I was raising my four kids. It would have been great. It also has temperature controls which is great.  The problem with it is that the handles get very hot. You have to be careful. There is no automatic shut-off which would have been nice and there is no timer. For the price of it, I would think those last two features would be included. Still those are manageable and my current crock pot doesn't have them so I'm used to it.  I have tried several of the recipes and they are delicious. The clean-up time is standard. I really love the size and the features it does have. This is a big hit for me.

These are great treats. My dog just goes crazy for them. They are small and could used be for training. I say that because at age 8 my dog really isn't thrilled about being trained but I keep trying. He does things like open doors but not things I want. Please bring in the newspaper. Ha Ha. Anyway these are made with great ingredients and they are soft. I can't say enough good things. Perfect treat for dogs.

Here's what I love about it:1. It's a Swifter Product. I love Swifter.2. It's great on floors3. It's easy to use and has a good gripHere's what I don't like:1. The charging systems takes too long to work. I have a small house and it takes two charges to do it.2. It takes awhile to charge3. This becomes frustrating.I am so used to having Swifter having top of the line products that I was disappointed in this. It needs some tweaking.

This Hot Wheel toy has some definite drawbacks. They are:1. It is a little hard to put together. It took my son about 30 minutes which is a long time to an excited 5 year old.2. All Hot Wheels do not work on it.3. It doesn't interchange with other Hot Wheel toy sets4. It only comes with one car.Still it kept my five year old grandson quite entertained for quite some time. I just don't know how many times he'll play with it. He's already frustrated that all his Hot Wheel cars don't work.

I gave this to my seven year old niece and she had a ball with it. First of all, it is hard to go wrong with a Play-Doh set. It is  great to give kids play-doh and let them go with their imaginations. This one was Ariel and Cinderella so cute and relatable to little girls. You put the play-doh on the dolls and put in the mold and out comes out dresses with beautiful designs. The castle is very cute. There's glitter. It makes every little girls dream come true. I couldn't recommend it any higher.

This book has an interesting premise. Two people are locked into a space with no way to get out. They have no food or water. They have a gun with one bullet and a message that says the survivor would be let go. What will they do? How long does it take to succumb? How long can a person go without food or water before the sense of self preservation kick in? And if you do survive, how do you live with the survivor guilt?  That being said, I found the writing very uneven. The book switched between people's stories rapidly and with abrupt transitions. It was hard to follow whose story you were reading. Sometimes in one chapter there would be 3 or 4 transitions. The protagonist, Helen Grace, is not likable. Even when you do discover her back story, it's hard to feel any empathy for her.  It's an OK book and, if you don't mind the writing style, an interesting plot.

I gave this shaver to my son so he could keep his beard under control. He is looking like Jeremiah Johnson the Mountain Man and it is quite unbecoming. He has red hair and sensitive skin. He loves it. The three heads really move with the contours of his face. He has no rash or pulling on his face which makes shaving so much better. He even keeps on it as it doesn't hurt or feel uncomfortable. The beard trimming works well and he no longer looks like he lives in the backwoods. Job well done.

This book was put out as upgrade of two of the stories by the wonderful writer John Banville. It is described as a cloth cover which mine does not have or I do not know the definition of cloth. Mine seems to be a regular paper cover but maybe I missed something. It does have a wonderful book mark made of a ribbon built in. The print in it is small. At 62, it was too small for my eyes to read comfortably. I really strained to read it. I guess I am spoiled by my Kindle.  The first story, The Book of Evidence, is the story of a man explaining himself to a magistrate. Everything is told from the protagonist's point of view and he is a piece of work. Although the story is beautifully written, I couldn't spend more that 62 pages with him. He was just creepy beyond words.  The second story, The Sea, is about a man who returns to the place of fond childhood memories and a memorable family, the Graces. It is quite lovely.  This would not be something I would buy mainly because of its print size.

These towels are beautiful to look at. I like the design and the colors. They are not functional as dish towels though. They are not absorbent and are not made for cleaning. If you had a need to dress up your kitchen (I don't)  these would be great. If you need a dish towel to work then I wouldn't recommend these. I saw another reviewer suggest using them as hand towels in the bathroom and I think that's what I'll do.

First of all, the color of this pan is stunning. It's the kind of pan you want to hang on your wall and show off. I pay replace all my pans if they come in this color. I love that you don't have to use oil in the pan to cook. That really helps out a lot. It passed the true test of pans when I cooked an omelet and it came out brilliantly. No fuss or muss. I use rubber utensils on it and have no problem washing it by hand. I want to keep it in good shape.  I recommend it highly.

3.5 stars  Although this is set in the 11th century in Japan, it is really a cozy mystery read. It is just a fun read. Akitada is a son of a noble family fallen on hard times. He is working for the Ministry of Justice when his former teacher and foster father asks him to return to his old school to solve a blackmailing scam.  In his investigation he is drawn into solving not one, not two but three murders. He also fins love. What more can you ask for in a book?

This is a wonderful water bottle. I love it with strawberries, blueberries and limes. It is easy to carry around and my water consumption has gone way up. I bought two others for gifts and they love them too. It's great.

As I closed this lengthy (573 pages) new book in the Lynley/Havers series  I breathed a sigh of relief. Oh my goodness,  I think Elizabeth George is back on track. This was actually a good installment in the series. After George killed off Lynley's wife and unborn child on their own doorstep, the series went amok. She followed that incident with a book that was truly, in my opinion, horrible "What Came Before Her" and then issued four very mediocre novels with Lynley and Havers behaving very uncharacteristically.  I had really about given up but thought that I'll give it one more try. I am glad I did.  This book goes back to the tried and true formula of being about an actual crime.  Clare Abbott, a renowned feminist writer, is found dead in her hotel suite while on a speaking tour. At first it is thought to be a heart attack but after further investigation it turns out she was poisoned.  Attention turns to her assistant ,Caroline Goldacre, and she is quite a piece of work.  Caroline has one of the most dysfunctional families around. One son commits suicide and her employer builds a monument for him. What is the relationship between these two women?  Havers is still walking a thin line with her boss, Isabelle Ardery, who desperately wants her gone. With the real threat of transfer hanging over her head, Havers must walk a very disciplined line and that is so hard for her.  Dorthea Harriman, the department secretary, tries to befriend her and this is hysterical. Harriman is such a fashion plate and Havers is, well, not. Harriman tries to take her shopping and then they try speed dating which is funny. It's Havers taste in clothes that brings her in touch with Claire Abbott, the murder victim.  Lynley meanwhile is continuing his relationship with Daidre, the zoo veterinarian.  I think this thread is still a troubling part of the book. It just doesn't fit and I find the relationship awkward. It is just so unlikely. I don't know why George keeps trying to make a square peg fit into a round hole. No matter how many times you pound that peg, you just can't make it work. It doesn't work. Stop it.  I have a lot of time invested in this series. I have read all the books as they come out. They require an investment of time as they are all over 550 pages. I have stuck to it through the very rough times when it appeared George had lost control of the series. I am glad it's back on track with a very readable book. The plot was interesting. The characters were interesting. Havers was back in form. Now if she could only stop trying to force the Lynley relationship, things would be great.  Even so, I can recommend this book to all those readers who have stuck with George. It is possible to read this as a stand alone and enjoy it but for long standing fans, it is a breath of fresh air.

These are wonderful markers for kids. They are easy to use and the best part is they wash right off. With a 2 year old and a 5 year old grandkid this is essential. The kids loved the scent and spend quite a bit of time picking out the one that smells the best. This is just a great product.

It's summer time, hot, and you want to lay out on a hammock, sip a lemonade and read a good book. This is a great one to do that.  Written  by the co-author of [book:The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society|2728527] it takes place in the small town of Macedonia, West Virginia, during the Great Depression.  Layla Beck is the spoiled daughter of an U.S. Senator who one rebels by refusing to marry the man selected for her to marry. Sen. Beck is so enraged that he cuts her off without a dime and signs her up in the WPA/Federal Writers' Project run conveniently by his brother. Layla is assigned to write a history of Macedonia to honor its sesquicentennial (150 years).  We hear much of Layla's stories in letter she writes to family and friends. Grumbling all the way, she moves into the home of Jottie Romeyn and what a house it is. Living with Jottie is her brother, Felix (a travelling salesman), and his 2 daughters, 12 year old Willa and 6 year old Bird. Jottie raises the girls as Felix is gone quite a bit. Also residing in the house are Jottie's twin sisters Minerva and Mae. They go live with their husbands on the week-ends but can't be separated any longer than that. It's a brand new world for Layla.  The Romeyn's father used to run the mill, and main employer, in town. There was a fire and a close friend of Jottie and Felix's was killed supposedly while robbing the mill. As Layla writes the town history she starts to uncover the mystery of the fire and also very funny anecdotes about the town. The story of a Confederate General hiding in a house of ill repute is a hoot.  Ultimately the story is a coming of age novel for Willa Romeyn and the power of forgiveness. It's a wonderful book that will keep you turning pages. It's a great story.

4.5 stars  This is a gem of a novel about seven year old, Elsa, who is different and picked on by the children at her school. She loves Spider Man and Harry Potter. She is precocious.  Luckily she has a wonderful and crazy grandmother who encourages her differences, creates a fairy tale kingdom to help her cope and is fiercely protective of her. The grandmother is someone you want in your corner. She even stands on her balcony, dressing gown undone, shooting paintballs at people.  Elsa's parents are divorced and her mother is pregnant with her new husband, George. Her father is remarried and lives with her new wife's children. Elsa is understandably concerned about the new baby and her place in the family. So the grandmother transports her to the Land-Of-Almost-Awake and the Kingdom of Miamas and gives her the courage to cope through fairy tale stories.  Elsa's grandmother dies and leave her a series of letters apologizing for various things and gives Elsa the quest of delivering them. Through this quest, Elsa meets a wide variety of people and learns a great deal about her wonderful, whacky grandmother and the entire family.  A wonderful book by a Swedish author who wrote [book:A Man Called Ove|18774964]. This is a delightful story that reminds you just

I really like this Nerf slingshot. It is different from a gun. The grandson had to take a minute and reload it which was nice. He got it about 15-20 ft. After that he wasn't terribly accurate. He still had fun with it, accurate or not. The only thing I didn't like is there were only two darts which really stops the play when you have to go retrieve them. We had set up a little target and two shots weren't much for knocking the empty milk cartons down.  Still he had a lot of fun and for the price it is a good toy.

This is a wonderful treat for my dog. It looks like cooked bacon and delicious. my dog turns up his nose at his dog biscuits now ad only wants the jerky. A great treat made in America. I've ordered more for my dog who is spoiled, spoiled, spoiled. Imagine turning your nose up at doggie biscuits.I couldn't recommend it more highly.

I found this book so absolutely riveting that I spent two nights up late reading it. At first I thought it was just a mesmerizing story about the Plague in 1348 but it was so much more. Nine strangers come together, all with secrets, and as they travel to avoid the Black Death, their stories slowly are told.  I don't want to spoil it for anyone but there were so many twists that I had to keep reading to find out what was coming next. A very entertaining book that was extremely well-written. I highly recommend it.

Our two mutts really enjoy this Eukanuba dog food.  We use it for their main meal and so far they take to it like a bee does to pollen.  The best part about the food is there have been no digestion problems.  There is nothing like the good smell of hard removals in the morning.The Eukanuba combination of ingredients makes for a well balanced product that they fully enjoy.  I added that mainly because these two critters are nothing but picky when it comes to what they eat.  I fully expect to see a plate full of this food because they decided time was up and it is time for another food.  So far they have chosen to placate the old folks in the home.Our vets have consistently recommended lamb as a main ingredient and Eukanuba is loaded with it.  I cannot address any of the other ingredients mainly because I am stupid when it comes to them.

This is one of those hoorah or well, hem and haw products.  To begin with, it works as described.  It just does not last long enough and the bottle is too small for two huge feet in serious need of skin replacement.  I had an attack of diabetes nerve pain in my feet and the commercials hit it on the hinky.  The pains are no where close to shingles; however, it is there and because I take a blood thinner, bleeding is oh so easy and free flowing.  I removed about 14 bandages from one foot just before spraying it with No-Sting.  No-Sting did its job as far a reducing the bleeding and covering the wounds; however, it does not have the strength nor viscosity to keep them closed.

There is nothing more tedious than having a wobbly commode especially when reaching for the roll.  You make that half turn to retrieve the roll and the commode wobbles.  I discovered these handy and almost critical little shims soon after their arrival on the retail scene and have literally worn out two of the original 6 wedges.The best part is that almost anyone can install as many as needed to stop the wobble.  I have yet to have a reason to use these for any other application; however, when that need arrives, I will be ready to install one or more.

I am delighted with Head & Shoulders Refresh (HSR),  It does more than clean my hair and scalp by removing the buildups that take place from ordinary shampoos.It took a few shampoos to find that 'just right' amount of product to do the job I sought.  I started with a half-dollar dollop and worked my way down to a nickel plop.  I tried a dime size; however, it was too small for my big head.  The nickel won and that's fine.  HSR is a thick, creamy white shampoo that leaves a pleasing but unnoticable odor on the head.  I'm not much on shopping in the grocery store, say, and asking folks if they like my shampoo's odor.  Thank goodness most others are not either.  Even though I believe I found that so called perfect dosage, it still leaves comb marks when it dries.  I usually wash my hair twice while rinsing in between each wash.  At the end, old lazy here, I simply comb my hair to the way I expect it to look when it is dry without comb marks.  I can count on one hand the number of times I have used a dryer on that mop and only in an emergency.The bottle design creates a problem for me from the standpoint of not providing a suitable holding pattern.  It needs to be more hand and holding friendly so that it does not slip out of the hand easily.  A cap on the top that requires as much pressure as this one it unsatisfactory.  Normally, shampooing is first and the rest follows.  My hands are wet and slippery when I go to open the bottle and the snap lock cap is unsatisfactory.  I leave it down but not closed and all is well.

For my humble needs this is an almost perfect box to hold specific folders.  Right now, I have loaded several with Judy's medical data from billing to EOBs and on and on.  Two boxes of medical 'stuff' are too many; however, from my heart valve replacement papers, this was a paper thin collection of 'stuff.'The Boxa will hold several folders depending on the number of pages in each folder.  I do not know if it is me or just the way the box was engineered, but in order to keep it from falling apart from repeated usage, I had to tape its bottom shut.  (I can think of several bloviating folks who would benefit from such a remedy.)  Its corrugated walls a thick enough to work quite well and not so thick to make the weight unbearable.  Thank goodness for colored folders and binders.  I would hate to think of attempting to store about 2 reams of paper without the binders.  The Boxa's picture shows what is handwritten labels and that space is welcome for repeated use and with a small circle or square they can be covered for the next project.  I have been an old time friend of what I call 'shucks' or some other word used in many law offices for holding those mysterious legal papers.  Shucks are fine for their purpose; however, they are flexible where Boxa is not.  Often the Shucks would fall to the floor and an awful mess insued.I just completed our 2014 tax organizing routine and this year I am so thankful for having a specific place for the multiple papers brought about mostly by ACA.  Yahoo, let's hear it for the bureaucrats.  Boza is a good friend and I expect to keep this iteration around for quite some time and will likely add to my present inventory.

The mirror's picture was misleading to me and I am delighted that it was.  That 7" is a well portioned looking glass from either the normal side or the 1-X magnified side.  To say that I am delighted is an understatement and I have assigned a new 'waiting space' close to my center of 'beauty' organization and application.  There has been only one problem with the mirror.  Every time I went to use it, it was gone.  Sure enough, John had it and he reluctantly returned it.  Mirrorvana makes a classical product with high quality values coupled with a competitive price point.  No burrs or rough places that could leave scratches or cuts.  All well made and well balanced with sufficient base weight to hold it upright.Not only is the mirror top quality, the folks (Joy and Karma) selling it are the same way.  They followed up at every turn to be sure that I had what I needed and was at the helm to assist should either one of us need it.  They displayed service in a manner that many of us miss from olden times and wish we had today.  I believe had we had a problem with the mirror, a simple email or even a call and we would have had a replacement in a modest time.  Maybe some of our larger retailers could take note and provide similar service.

Clorox in fact rocks.  This new Bleach Pack rocks too with one exception:  it is so much easier to use than pouring bleach from a gallon bottle.  I set up a schedule to test the packs and began with toilet bowls.  At bedtime I dropped one pack in each toilet and did not flush until morning.  The protective covering dissolved and the smell of Clorox left a hint in the air.  The tanks were fairly clean with a stain here and there.  After flushing the next day, the stains were gone.I cherish the cleanliness of t-shirts, handkerchiefs and white undies.  The packs did not let me down and provided me with the same quality of clean undies as the regular Clorox bleach does except now, I do not have to take care not to make my usual mess.  The little containers add so much by not taking up so much valuable space on the shelves.

I have been extremely pleased with Luseta and have treated the two products, shampoo and conditioner, as one product since I use them together.  Finding that just perfect shampoo for me is close to impossible and we are as close as I can expect with Luseta.  I have fine or thin hair that for the most part is still accompanying me.  With that I do not expect my hair to stay put or think it is a free style drone.  Luseta helps with that.  The shampoo does a great job at cleaning my hair and scalp while the conditioner aids with the control.The main problem with Luseta is trying to find the location where Judy hid the products.  She likes it so much, she hides them so when it is shampoo time she will be able to use them.  We will probably have a his and hers section for shampoos and other commonly used products.  It works well with tooth brushes and wash rags so why not shampoos.

No bells, no whistles:  just all light and extremely useful and powerful too.  Add to that the ability to focus up close or from a distance with the handy adjusting head with flashing along with the main beam.  Its six inch body houses a single rechargeable battery or as I am using now two C123s while waiting for the rechargeable battery.  Included in the package is the battery charger for the 18650.  (The seller does not include the battery probably because it is rechargeable lithium and customs has its rules.)I keep it on my work desk for those ever too frequent needs to find that nut or screw or SD card and it is a huge timesaver.  It also helps me read those tiny instructions that come with some items.  Even though this product did not come with any, none was needed.  Load it while remembering that the bumpy side goes in first and the spring is on the negative end.  Tighten it down and push the button on the end.  Adjust to specific needs and light up the night.

GE has been a light making provider for years and these fluorescent light bulbs are no exception.  If I had to wait until I used the box of these, most of you would have found the latest and newest type of light making products and chances are they would not be these.  Until that happens and for my simple mind, I hope it does not take place real soon.  The existing light fixture must be among the cheapest on the market; however, when this bulb is installed, there is no hint of a flicker nor misconnection.  I normally expect one bulb to last over 2 years based on usage.  We are a long time away from that; however, based on the several fixtures using these bulbs and their constant clean light, we will need replacements in 2017 or later.  That is an ultra conservative estimate, too.

Silly old humans think they know everything.  When it comes to feeding dogs, take it from the dogs first and then trust your instincts.  We dogs know you have been loyal to several brands; however, when you began serving us Eukanuba, we were delighted to say the least.  You folks know how you are and you know how we are.  No, we will vacillate between our old favorites and this new delight; however, we have a new favorite now.Old Pepper has been full of energy and the young whippersnapper, Abby, is like a new woman running around with a cigar looking treat in her mouth.  We know from what you have told us that the ingredients are superb and not packed full of filler.  We have even noticed a slight uptick in our coats except it is a little to early to detect that and especially since our winter coats are still under development.We do not know if this Breed Specific consideration is of value and frankly do not care.  Eukanuba is absolutely the right food for us and we will begin to look like the writer in terms of girth.  Thanks for your consideration and we thank you Eukanuba folks too.

During my annual pre-cancerous removal treatment, my Dermatologist suggested that I might try a shampoo with Seborrheic contents.  No, John, you do not have cooties just dry scalp from excessive washing.  After several applications all conditions were back to my normal and we could go back to playing with my mental blocks.Even though there was a slight tingling, I could not tell if that were from the shampoo cleaning my hair or just normal.  I did not care for the conditioning aspects of the shampoo and that is the major reason for downgrading it.

This is one of those first or last in a lifetime purchases we must make every now and then.  The last time I bought paper clips was when I had to buy some for our office supply locker just before we went to Vietnam in 1964.  Our trip was delayed until September and I had began a new adventure as a student in college.  Thank you G.I. Bill.  Paper clips are one of those products that people just hardly ever buy.  I specifically chose ACCO simply because they have been at the top of my supply chart for years.  They are as good as they appear to be and work as well today as they did at first.

Right now and those are keywords, this Scotts product is all that it is supposed to be.  I have and with great hope I can change that to had, a path in my poor excuse for a lawn created and tended by our deer population.  They come out of the creek and cross the road onto the banked front yard and go up the side year up the hill to the deep woods where they and the other critters frolick.  Those little hooves leave marks in the grass and soon the holes dry up and beg for care.  I could not wait to use this shaker jug to see if the contents could possibly improve the ground and its path.The process could not be easier even for me.  The jug is not heavy nor awkward.  The product comes out at a satisfactory rate and does simply leaves a neat path (in my case) to ask the deer to consider using another route.  Maybe it was the odor or the size of the pellets, but our deer family did find another route but this time it was around my neighbor's property.  Each of us enjoys sticking our heads out the back door while watching the family take a feeding break or whatever and just relax on the yard above the grassed area.I said in the beginning that the real key to this product is not only does it change the composition of the dirt and other ingredients of the yard, it make it so growth can take place with better ease.  That does not take place over night and now with winter on the way, the ground will harden and make vegetation more difficult.  I am thinking that just before springtime begins the granules will have dissolved and water plus other nutrients such as Scotts fertilizer will create a thunderous entry.  We can only hope.

At first I thought it was too late for this to grow; however, the temperature has been quite decent and the amount of rainfall has been excellent.  I have found over the years that Scott's products are first quality and very dependable.  On several occasions I took advantage of their warrenty and they came through like the champions that they are. (Often many of us take companies like Scotts for granted.  They are in the top tier of first class sellers and have few others on my list.)The leaves have been falling at normal pace and that insures my having to blow them away from the newly seeded areas.  As long as the roots develop well, I can look forward to a nice crop in the spring providing we do not have sub-zero temperatures.

For me, these are 5 star gloves with one exception.  They are too short for a size XXL.After pulling them on they only come up to my wrist bone.  When using them to rearrange engines in my blowers and mowers, there were several occasions when I needed that extra length.  I solved my problem by taking an extra long piece of latex and taping it to the end of the AMMEX glove.Otherwise, they work fairly well with no other issues.  I did not notice any increase in the fingertip weight compared to the remainder of the gloves; however, it did not matter.  Even though I have one of those long and fat fingered hands the gloves went on and off with ease and no tugging or tearing.  The liquids I had been using did not react with any part of any glove and held up to my pulling to complete my project.
This was not what I wanted and even though it provided a modicum of challenge, it did not do what I wanted.  I want a real anagram solver and not something like this.
Maybe I need to play it more often, but, I just did not care too much for it from each and every aspect.

There is a massive need for effective bandages and it appears that Curity has found that single bandage that actually works better than most.  I like the kind that are waterproof; however, they almost tear the meat off the wound when attempting to remove them.  Curity does not act like that.  Several off brands are no more than wound cover-ups with little to no holding power.  I make sure my wound is dry and apply the Curity with success each time.  No wonder one of our major hospitals uses them.In the past two weeks, I have used 2 boxes of Curity's.  One box of Kendall Healthcare and another brand's.  I am almost out and have already ordered more.  They are superb for me and that's all I need to know.

Thermometer's are one of those devices that either provide accurate results or just sit there putting out random numbers which have little use.  This VIVE is the most accurate that we have used and it makes the idea of taking your temperature valuable especially when a doctor's visit is on the schedule because of an increase in temperature.It is not just the reading that makes this device valuable to us, it is the simplicity of its construction and consistency of its readings.  A 100.3 followed by a 96.7 immediately after is not accurate unless a cold glass of water were consumed.  We like it completely.

My first meter entered the tool box in the 70's and has been a faithful companion especially when needed for its electricity measuring capabilities. I never had a chance to use all of its abilities much in the same manner that I have not for my new favorite Amprobe AMP-210 (AMP).  The few unused functions are there waiting for my use this coming summer.  For now, I have been relegated to some simple indoor projects that have been completed far better with the AMP than had I attempted to do them solo.Unlike many suppliers of complicated products and even some that intuitive are to the developer this AMP came with a complete User's Manual that even I could understand.  It still amazes me as to how they were able to put so much into this modestly sized unit.  Not only a user manual, but also, the correct connectors, one red and one black, so that there can be little chance of inserting one in the wrong hole.  All of these pieces fit perfectly into the sturdy carrying case.  Even the interior has a tie down strap to reduce damages.I was installing a new fixture and did not pay full attention to what I was doing thanks to all the noise outside.  Something was not right with what I had done and I put the AMP to it to tell me that I am about as stupid as they come.  Black to black and red to red.  Not the reverse.  Pay attention  the next time.  While I was there making a fool out of myself (alone, thank goodness) I checked the other connections on the circuit and found out that I needed to put in a new circuit.This is a terrific tool and while it is not used as much as a screwdriver or a drill, it is a tool that occupies a special place in my garage so that I can have ready access to it when needed.  This summer it will get a new set of batteries and off I go to the new projects.

Out of no where I was, seemingly, attacked by some invading critter or a wild imagination.  My feet soles were cracking and bleeding even though I knew of no reason for the actions.  I went to my stock of bandages and began covering the several wounds on each foot.  Some of the bandages fell off immediately and others stayed on overnight.  Not the Kendalls.  Thanks to atrial fibrillation and its blood thinning drugs, I bleed at the drop of a straight pin.  Kendall's covers the wound and keeps it closed for quite some time.  This box is almost empty and it already has a marked spot in our 1st bathroom.  One major feature is that most times it does not remove the skin and meat as some others do.

Hershey's found a place on my taste buds many decades ago and it remains today.  A 3 pound box of these individually wrapped goodies is next to sinful or just plain good.  Best of all the 4 variety works well for the two of us.  Two for Judy and the other two for me.  Even though Halloween is only a few days away, there is little likelihood that there will be any left.  Today's trick or treaters prefer rich neighborhoods and we keep the bears in the front yard.Seriously, this box of goodies is a good, convenient way to hold small servings of a delicious candy especially on the go type quickies.  I had to run to the drug store earlier; however, I picked up two of these at random, ate one, got my drugs and ate the other on the way home.  It is a small box and does not take up too much counter space or refrigerator space.  I could see Hershey's selling single product items in boxes of this size.  That list could last for a long time.

John beat me to the review of our watches; however, while my star rating is the same, it is that way for different reasons.  This is a watch that I can see without help and adding a magnifier to the small date wheel makes it close to perfect.  This other than looking great on my wrist, is no more than a watch that tells time in minutes, seconds and hours plus the date wheel.  That's it.  This Invicta is water resistant up to 200 meters.  The probability of my seeing that depth is close to zero.  Not even 20 meters, either.I could not find the model number on the outside of the watch and did not open it to look for it either.  As I write this the model number is irrelevant; however, at some later point I might need it.  Far more important that a model number is the fact that this watch keeps accurate time to the second.  We use about 5 different and now 7 time pieces that keep time in seconds and we set our clocks by one of them.  (Can you imagine having to set clocks in seconds accurately when the power fails?)  Just a few seconds ago, I checked the Invicta against one of the clocks with seconds and it has not lost nor gained a second since setting it several days ago.  The watch is so quiet I can barely tell it is ticking or tocking.  When I put my stethoscope to it I could not hear it at all and concluded the stethoscope is of little value.  I could hear John's regurgitation from his heart valve,I have enjoyed wearing the watch and using it for its intended purpose; however, the only drawback I can see is its bulky weight.  I seldom have had to concern myself with hitting walls or other vertical surfaces.  With the 21396, it is easy to hit a car door or an elevator's door when I am thinking about getting somewhere.  I almost need another watch of the same weight for ballast purposes but I joke.  Overall, I like the watch in spite of its weight.

This is my first Invicta watch and I am quite pleased with it.  As far as its watch functions, it is exceedingly accurate but not perfect.  In the past week it about 2 seconds slow compared to the national clock's time.  Minutes, hours and days are perfect.  I especially like the sweep second hand and the fact that it is visible to most folks.  The hands are large enough to be seen.  For all practical aspects, this the end of this product's timekeeping attributes.I downgraded this Invicta for several reasons.  It is big and heavy relatively speaking.  I am used to lightweight unobtrusive time keeping devices and ones that do not have a plethora of features.  I have one full feature do-it-all watch that almost does everything except take the garbage out and it is not gaudy or heavy.  This dial appears to have multiple time keeping features; however, it is stationary and just sits there in full view (a nice feature for those of us who need sight assistance.)  It's weight is merely a distraction more than any other factor and not too significant.  The strap is sufficiently large enough to fit most wrists and nothing special.For me, it is nice to have a watch that does not have all those available bells and whistles found on many more expensive watches.  When I look at the watch, I get what I see without having to wonder what the time is in another time zone or wonder what the elevation is in the location I am standing on.  Simply, it's a watch and a pretty good watch at that.

I (Judy here) really like this razor for the simple fact that it does what I expect it to do.  It removes all those unwanted stragglers with ease.  Best of all there is no pulling or leaving body parts with blotchy red spots where used.  I normally use this in the shower so I do not have to soap up all over again.  Instead, I use a little hair conditioner to add to the smoothness of the Panasonic.  At no time did the battery run out or even low.The main feature aside from cutting smoothly and properly is that it fits my hand so well I do not have to be concerned about dropping it and therefore reducing or eliminating the probability of damaging it.  Typical of Panasonic's 'add a little extra' is the inclusion of a nice white carrying bag.  I can reach in our utility bag and see the Panasonic white bag and know 'there it is.'  I will sometimes use it while watching a TV program and the sounds are so low, it does not disturb any one else in the room.

This did not work with my existing Honeywell and I could not find one that did.  I sent this one back and Amazon credited my account.  Instead of giving it a one star I chose three simply because it did work when batteried up but not with my unit.

Ammex Nitrile Gloves are a major gain to cleanliness program.  Each of us practices using gloves as much as necessary and so far have not backed off from them.  We did not realize how many times we are engaged in going to the bin for another pair to clean wounds caused by a surgeon's scalpel or a pile of dogs' necessaries.They are true to size and neither of us has found production faults.  Even the length is sufficient so as not to permit runoff from excessive liquids or whatevers.  They are sufficiently thick so as not to tear easily, especially standing up to lots of heavy duty use.

I planned to return this; however, the hassle was more unproductive than giving it to a 501c3 organization.  It was bought specifically for its front buttoning feature.  It would not even button before Judy's mastectomy and even after the procedure it still did not button.  I sure hope this is not the new Lee method of selling.

As can be seen from Woods' Surge Protector, it is not among the big boys and all their bells and whistles; however, this simple device is effective and works well.  I mainly use it for multiple slot HDMI charger and 20 Volt battery charger.  I hooked up a 10 device HDMI charger and 5 20 Volt batteries.  Each device works beautifully and guarantees a fully charged battery when I need it.  It is lightweight but no pushover or as many say, it does what you expect and does not call attention to itself.

To a degree I have been hampered in my intent to write a complete review.  I want to start with my failure to own a device that permits me to download from Google Play an Android app for the NuYu.  Of the 8 computers, tablets, notebooks and cellphones, not one of them will permit pairing the NuYu.  Not even the two smart TVs will permit the pairing.  Nor could I get the Fire HDX to pair with it.  It appears the only device I could use to use this watch is a smartphone and right now my budget does not have space for a $50 per month marginal increase.In spite of my inability to update and sync this device in the manner described by the instructions and the Google's website where the app resides but unavailable to me, probably due to my really low threshold in apps for devices.  The clock works but, I do not know how to set it to today's time.  The dial is small; however, the numbers show quite clearly.  I have not attempted to use it in the sunlight.  We have not had any recently and I am tired of all the rain and warnings.  Several other features appear to work such as distance, calories burned steps and exercise timer.  Each changes when I do something, but without a means to use the features, it is mostly just for personal satisfaction.Until I receive a large inheritance or some new capability for pairing the device, it will sit on my arm looking good.  While waiting for my doctor to see me, another patient wanted to know about it.  I told him what I know and he said, "Wow, I can use something like that especially since I have a fairly new iPhone."
Totally unsatisfactory.

I sent them back and received my refund.  I will not ever buy any pants from any supplier unless the length of the pants is shown in the description.  I am 6'3" and these pants at my waist are at least 5" too long.  Neither of us is a seamstress and none is nearby.  The waist and seat are comparably larger than expected.

EDIT on September 20, 2015:This is a meager edit to this terrific product.  I noticed when scanning other reviews of this item that one poster mentioned how the interior space was reduced by the addition of the blue cover and, therefore did not leave room for a charger.  That is true.  I found an alternative solution to this condition.  I try to carry at least two fully charged cigar shaped chargers at all times so I'll be ready.  I use a sunglass case of similar construction as the Case Logic and it works well and if not in the way while hanging off the side of the case.I knew little about Case Logic until last year and fully enjoy the quality of workmanship and versatility of the case.  I emptied another camera case and began using the DSH-101 instead.  My camera fits perfectly with a small amount of play on the sides.  With the lens pointing down, the extra padding on the bottom adds more protection.It sports extras many other cases do not have.  I had already located a cloth to clean the lens and one was included in the package.  The water resistant case cover is a nice touch especially if I ever need protection.  I never think about it, but a little protection from the rain or snow is a good thing.  The strap is double for the most part; however, it does not have a shoulder pad to ease pains that work their way in when least expected.Unlike other cases, this one has a zipper that has not got caught on fabric when attempting to open or close.  That is absolutely an unimportant issue; however, when that just perfect shot is on its way, I do not want to be delayed because of a stuck zipper.  Last winter a deer died in our creek and in a few days the buzzards began to gather for a meal or two.  I went for my camera and the zipper got jammed.  I missed most of them arriving; however, by the time I opened the case, there were about 30 buzzards roosting in a single tree, waiting for a taste.  No clogged zippers yet with Case Logic.

Years ago my PCP said to take these for my brand of congestion.  I did not follow his specific rule; however, I tried another brand.  Not too long ago I ordered these and began taking them to the point of emptying the bottles.  I only take one a day and usually at night time.  They go down easy and as work well as the expensive prescription brands and better than other OTC types.  I liked them so much, I bought a 6-pack with a good expiration date.

When I opened the frame's box to begin using it, I did not expect to find 8 pieces that fit beautifully together.  I saw a mix of plastic, metal strips and four feet.  I am so glad initial opinions are often useless.  They were this time, too.  Smead provided really great instructions and it is critical that the user reads them first.  Well, o.k. for me to read them first.  I took the time to read them and see exactly what had to be done and much to my surprise, they are easy to work with and produce a quality Hanging Frame.I had a few hanging folders to use and they work well.  I will fill the frame with other folders as soon as I can get to them.  Unlike the brand I grew up with, this frame is attractive to the eye and is not a royal pain to put together even though the old frames only had 4 pieces instead of this one's 8.  I congratulate the Smead engineers for coming out with a new and practical heavy duty frame.

This TRENDnet 10-Port High=Speed USB 2.0 Hub is my new best friend.  At different times during the day and night I have some sort of USB device plugged into an electrical outlet to charge the device.  Now, I can charge 10 at one time (only 5 are connected now)  and that saves me time and energy in addition to having all  the devices ready to go.It uses a small footprint of about 6" X 3" X " and is quite light. It does not interfere with TV, internet or router signals.  Some devices will send signals that interfere with UFH or VHF signals.  I have TRENDnet attached to a surge protector that tells me when I have too many connections and with the 5 I currently have, it is o.k. for more.Without equivocation, this is the best device I have in my inventory of devices.

These are gloves of top notch quality and use.  We have found more uses for them than we have for any of the other latex gloves we have used in the past.  Admittedly, they are somewhat large for Judy's size 8 and just right for my size 13.  She found that picking up dog mess is so much easier and I enjoy having a glove that actually fits my hand without moving all over the place.They are thicker than the regular latex gloves previously used and a lot more sturdy.  When the old dog (16 years old) got upset and did not approve of what either of us was attempting, it was nothing for his teeth to tear the previously used gloves.  Not now.  He could not tear a finger even though he tried and realized he lost this bout.  Heavy Duty is accurate.  I eliminated an outdoor project with ease and these gloves that I could not do much with unless I had these.This is one of those products that will occupy its own spot on the shelf that is used for immediate access.

I had a specific reason for this robe and it worked better than expected.  It fit perfectly and kept Judy's body parts comfortable and warm while she spent some time getting a little mastectomy work done.  The robe and the surgery went hand in hand after the procedure and all is well.  The robe makes for a wonderful cover up when such things as staples or body drains need to be hidden.  I expected it to be warmer than it was; however, that is a good thing in the long run.  I just wish other elements could work as well as this and the surgery.

It's simply a bracket that holds a router or almost whatever needs to be held out of the way but in a convenient location such as under my desk.  It is out of the way and easy to see or make changes to the settings or reboot the modem.  It is typical of the quality products we receive from Belkin and I see this bracket as a forever device even though many other items will change.

Lea & Perrins Worcestershire Sauce was placed on our dinner table along with the salt and pepper routinely from the early 1940s until now.  Now, that routine will not change.  There may have been internal changes to the product; however, I am not smart enough to know what they might have been if at all.  For our household, this is a superb product and we see no reason to change our 8 decades of use.

Amazing may be too understated for this NO3 Pump.  I rapidly admit to ignorance when it comes to these types of products and seldom can see results from the supplements.  Cellucor is already showing signs of working for me.  Please understand my results may not be similar to another person's results.In May, I visited our local emergency room for what turned out to be congestive heart failure among other things that were not quite as ominous sounding.  A few weeks later I received Cellucor's NO3 Chrome.  Being somewhat of a coward when it comes to taking pills and medicines, I discussed NO3 with my doctor and he gave me the go ahead sign and I did.  The changes have been modest and modestly slow.  I dropped almost 20 pounds or about 8% of my body weight.  (You are right, I am a chubby crank.)  I put my canes away on August 31st and only use them now as balance items and not for crutches.  My blood pressure dropped to a normal range along with the other items on my metabolic list.  Overall, I feel better than before using Cellucor and will keep track until the bottle is empty.When the bottom is near, I will review my results and report changes that may taken place.  I would expect more of the same improvements in muscularity and other vital items.

John asked me to write this for obvious reasons.  When I found out I have breast cancer and had to have a mastectomy in August, I looked back at my purchase of Carole Martin's Comfort Bras.  While wearing them before the removal, they were wonderfully comfortable and provided support without looking silly.  Some so-called comfort bras are no more than cloth of various materials that were designed to make a sale and not provide a useful product.  This was one useful bra and after all has settled down with the new look, I will be in the market for a uni.

Philips is making its presence known in many different areas of health-related products.  My first extensive use of their products took place over 12 years ago when I began using one of their BiPAP breathing machines.  I had already been using Norelco cordless razors since 1985 and still use it.  The newer ones, however, work a lot better than that first of its kind..This Bodygroom is made for most parts of the body except for face hair.  It fits my hand perfectly and is easy to turn on and off with the practically located switch.  The hanging device is suitable but unnecessary if the properly sized nail or other protruding holder is available.  I just keep mine in the bathroom drawer. Included in the package are the battery, brush and protective head.  To compliment the razor is a missing handy cloth bag but I am a picky shaver.

Hardly a day goes by without using this little 5" bright light with a zoom in and out feature.  It claims to be 900 Lumens; however, I do not have a method to measure it.  It is not as bright as some of the other small hand lights we have; however, most of them use C-123 batteries and not 3-AAAs.  It works quite well in a short distance situation; however, for long distances, I have to revert to more powerful lights.  Sadly, they cost 3 or more times more than this one and they take at least 4 C-123 batteries.  For the less than 10 foot needs, this light is perfect for my uses.

In the middle of the last century, toilet paper consisted of one sheet of paper that might or might not be perforated, but we could count on its tearing apart while using it.  Forget absorbency or any other frills.  Along came some wonderful companies who no more liked those flat sheets of near nothing and provided us with real toilet paper that goes beyond just cleaning our personal habits,The market is full of several real toilet paper companies and my favorite is Charmin.  I normally choose the soft variety; however, I am using UItra Strong now and now I have a problem:  which one or just alternate between the two?  These double, durable sheets work better than any other TP  I have used, even the Soft Charmin but not by much.  While there are no standards in this industry, the sheets and size of the rolls will vary with the wind.  Every time I measured the size of a sheet or the content of a roll, I would come back with different sizes depending on the product or when I bought it.  I sure hope the size is not reduced much more.  Mage Roll is not definitive either, but it is a point for comparison.One big deal matter for us is suitability for use with a septic system.  We cleaned our septic tank out a few months ago and all was well including no backups caused by anything and especially Charmin TP.Overall, this is a 5-star product and will rank #1 or #2 on our house depending on the user and circumstances.

Mpow is moderately new to the electronics field I play in; however, of the several items I have recently received as a sample to test free of charge, I am delighted with their quality of workmanship and technology.  Additionally, they are staffed by a team of caring customer interfaces.This wireless speaker is a chunky handful of power with an expansive range of sound and versatility.  I forgot to bring it in a few nights ago and of course, it rained on it.  So what?  It's waterproof and did not miss a beat.  Its output comes close to some expensive speakers; however, for limited  entertainment value, this is an excellent speaker.  The speaker sound range is sufficient most listening and it produces clear and crisp notes.

Our dogs really liked these lamb puffs for a few days and then they came down with a superior case of diarrhea.  I do not blame the Bully Sticks.  The dogs are quite persnickety and prone to eating lots of things that cause problems.  One brand of lamb treats works well and another one does not and the buyer (yours truely) does not know until it's too late.

This little gem has been a real pleasure to fiddle with.  It works and works well for me.  I do not have any tool to measure the speeds of those elements residing inside of my desktop other than the "John Test" which is nothing more that a subjective measure of my attitude about its quickness to go from one tab or file to another.  The original configuration of my desktop provided a satisfactory speed. With the addition of TRENDnet TEW-820AP, I am a really happy computer user.After using it for a couple of weeks, it has become a shadow on my desk while sitting on top of my modem and router.  I only notice it when I am fussing about the ISP's slow speed or my excessive open applications.  Since originally installing it, the amount of fussing has diminished.  Other than the increase in processing speed, I am quite impressed with the ease of installation.

I have 7 different types of these 'floor cushions' and can solidly say that this one is the best of the lot.  The previous 6 pads have a several year jump start on this brand and that affords a direct comparison ..The one thing I learned is that one person's softness is not necessarily the same softness as mine.  Each mat (pad, cushion, etc) has its own attributes.  Imprint Cumulus9 is the best in terms of all around suitability.  Even though that is a completely subjective statement, it matches my needs best.  Some pads are too soft or too hard and this one is, you got it, in between and just right.  This pad's Viscosity is most suitable for me and it receives a lot of footsteps during the course of a day.  It occupies that space in between the garage and mudroom/pantry.For most persons the height of this mat is just right for me.  I am in a position where I have to be careful how I step forward and often do not lift my foot enough to get over the higher mats.  It's just about ", but when you kick a stationary item that " can be a major pain maker.

This is what I will call a binary product.  It either works, i.e. kills ants, or it does not.  A few years ago, I had a visit from a fire ant family and they enjoyed their stay so much, they took out a lease on the far end of our back yard and began raising a family and who knows what else. We did not pay much attention to them since they were about 40 yards away from habitation.  We watched the deer get ancy when the ants apparently attacked.  The skink and other unwanted critters chose to live elsewhere.  This spring they found their way down the hill and into the viewable area of the yard.That invasion and Ortho's MAX Fire Ant Killer prompted a generous broadcasting.  I applied one application and in a month applied another.  Today, I have about half a bag for future use or application to a friend's yard.  Ortho is a killer and for me 'ant lives do not matter.'  The bag is sturdy and seals well with an air tight seal that keeps smells out of the air.  As those old guys on The A Team said, I really like it when a plan comes together.  Or something like that.

The VIVE Health folks were kind enough to send these as a sample in return for an unbiased review.  I do so with vigor and as unbiased as a review can be.These little separators and bunion pads work better than any other solution I have used in the past.  Those aggravating pains are almost all gone and I blame it on the Gel Pads from VIVE and as soon as the toe tissue replaces itself, I expect full recovery.  I am still amazed that they can be so soft and resilient while they perform their job.

This Mirror and Push Pin Board has no place in a locker.  It is Refrigerator quality and looks great hanging on the side of the big box. especially with its blue and white colors.  Most folks will use the portrait layout; however, for us, landscape works better.  That's minor and says there are several iterations for a display that works best for the user.  The little round magnets could be stronger and have a propensity to fall off if there is excessive movement around the board.  The push pins fit perfectly and I offer one caveat:  keep them together.  It would be so easy to drop one or misplace it and step on it later.Before this Board, we more or less used a hit or miss 'system' of posting items to the fridge.  Now we post only those items that take place during the week in chronological order.  Lately, there have been a whole gaggle of postings thanks to our using our healthcare solutions.  For me it is so nice to have a functional, useful helper that actually looks good and works well.

These are worth every fraction of a cent.  Best of all they do what the manufacturer promises:  they work.  Best of all, they are so handy.  I usually have a pad in my shirt pocket along with a pen so that I can use the note for jotting down an idea or a vacuous thought.  Almost every room has a pad and almost every day we will use several and we send a silent thank you to 3M for these among many other quality products.

I chose a 5 star rating simply because this Samsung 50" 4K Ultra TV has the best picture I have ever seen.  While I fully understand that no output is better than its source, this TV has taken my cable output and makes it appear life-like.  On my older Samsung, I can see pixels when close to the screen; however, with this 4K I have to get unnaturally close while attempting to identify the many pixels.  I had hoped to have FIOS installed by now; however, my provider thwarted attempts to get a better source or not.  It's just as well.  The final location for this fantastic set is in our secluded quiet zone with only one cable source and multiple other connections that work quite well with 4K.Out of the box setup is simple.  Screw the stand on and set it on the table where it will reside until it is time to move it.  Even though the TV weighs about 30 pounds, I would suggest having an assistant who can manage handling a similar weight.  Allocate about one to two hours to set the TV fully and then sit back and enjoy.The two 10 watt speakers only handle minimum sounds and with most of today's TVs the sound system is less than satisfactory.  That is the reason for my less than 5 stars.  I would consider adding a simple 5.1 surround system or no less than a soundbar with subwoofer.Unlike every other HD TV in the home, this TV was calibrated for me right out of the box.  I am sorry that Samsung did not include a printed calibration sheet for nurd-heads like me.

I was lucky enough to receive this Chin Strap for free providing that I write an unbiased review.  Since 2003, I have used a BiPap Breathing assistant and frankly I am able to write these meager words mainly to the machine's keeping me alive.  Right now I am too big of a coward to relinquish my BiPap.  I guess I prefer life to some other alternative.Enter Anti Snoring Chin Strap from stage left.  At no point did I consider using this in place of BiPap but as a nap time assistant.  Usually, around 2 p.m. the phones go busy, the dogs know to hush and the two old folks take a 15" to 60" nap.  As soon as the chin strap arrived I got it ready for the 2 p.m. routine and please permit an extremely loud WOW favoring the strap.  I expected a break in time; however, I must have been extremely tired and in no time I was fast asleep.  The strap, itself, is a tad tight even though I ordered a large.  I did not nor do I now care.  It works and it works well.I wish I had taken time to take my camera with me.  One of the dogs thought a stranger had plopped on the chair with a blue contraption on his head.  She started barking and that was followed by the blind and deaf male.  Then it was quiet on the western front.  ZZZzzz

Assigning a star value to this griddle was tough for me.  Based on my use so far, the George Foreman 240X has all the makings for a 5-star unit; however, it does not present the quality workmanship of George's original grill. On the other hand, however, the original is just a simple grill and has no where the superlative features as does this griddler.  I reexamined my feelings about this tool and it really is a 5 star unit.We eat breakfast foods a lot and time is not a delimiter.  Bacon or sausage for dinner is just right especially after recent events with our health care providers.  Bacon and or sausage on the side ramps with almost any other goody in the center.  One of my favorites is chile con queso with sausage pieces.  When using the center surface we can cook-up batches of hot and another of medium or mix them together.  The point of these examples is that 240Z is very versatile with fewer cooking pots and pans to manage or clean.Cleaning is a breeze too.  When I begin with a non-stick surface it is hard to make mistakes even though not necessarily for me.  The drain holes are located up front and not in the back as with original GF.  When there are lots of greasy meats draining fat, it is nice to be able to remove the grease trap with few hassles.The unit is lightweight and even though it is larger than I expected, it is handy and easy to move along with use for its purposes. (Addendum:  as soon as I typed the last period ( . ) the power was interrupted and some genious did not permit its elimination.  Whom ever did it:  thank you.)  I'd better go now just in case the next hit sticks and I have to start over.

The picture is not an illusion.  It is real.  Between my thumb and forefinger is a full-blown speaker without the bulk of one but with the capability of reproducing quality sounds.  No, it does not reproduce sounds like a three-way $500 speaker but it comes close.  With its bluetooth and normal adjusting buttons it has become an internal speaker for our land and cell phones.  So far most callers do not know it is on speaker phone nor do they care.  I move all around the house and outside too talking and enjoy the flexibility.  This is one of several Mengo products we have received recently and not one has failed nor provided anything less than superior output.

I used each piece of this set and in some instances 3 were used several times and without equivocation SilverStone is a superior way to cook more than just baked goods.  Forget the seamless construction even though it makes cleanup a whizz-bang or the colorful red color that most of us will want to use during the upcoming holiday season.  Do not worry about making temperature adjustments for a snarky oven.  I am a dark baking pan and therefore I have to adjust the temp a few degrees lower and so forth.  This honest non-stick set is a quality product that has been moved to the front bins of the oven and elsewhere and several of the older, less helpful cooking utensils have been discarded.  Instead of asking for an oval cake pan, I just say 2 Red Ovals and there is no ifs, ands or buts.  I look forward to the next few months to see how well they hold up to use that will exceed the normal.  Will the ceramic continue its nonstick capabilities?  And so forth.  We'll see and if the quality changes from today, I will update all.

We are so fortunate to have access to quality products and Sentinel fits that category.  When I opened the boxes it arrived in each was well constructed and assured safety for the contents.  I thought that the contents would be similar and I was not deflated by a well packaged piece of plastic.  I have a first class shredder, that literally makes turns paper and other office supplies into tiny bits of useless waste.It is well made.  The 4 wheels, while small manage to get around hard surface floors with ease and with carpeted flooring it is a slightly difficult since the wheels are somewhat small for carpeted floors.  Caution:  it is top heavy and if not handled carefully, it will tip over.  I pull it by the bottom or remove the cutting head for transportation.  The basket is large and will hold 25% to 50% longer than other similar devices.  That is nice for me and it took some effort on my part to fill the basket because of its large cavity.  In the month I have had this, I failed at shredding sufficient paper to fill it one time.The shredder head while somewhat loud, it works fast and well.  Those little pieces of paper and stuff would be a heck of a problem to piece together; however, the odds of my doing such a job are close to zero unless the prices is right.  I really like the controls on the top with one exception.  I prefer a slightly raised area behind the paper feed throat so that I can place the 'to be shredded' pieces can be fed more easily.  No big deal, just my weirdness.

These filters amaze me by the amount of dust they take out of the air and prevent it from entering our bodies.  No, it does not clean every single particle; however, it removes what it can detect and holds each little piece until discarded.  The purifier has to come close to removing all of the particles; however, if it does, it would fill up so fast the supplier could not match the demand nor be in a position to resupply at the heavy useage.  It has struck that happy and overused middle ground so the average user can benefit from it.  Whirlpool does the job and does it better than I thought it would.

Avery is setting the bookmark for binders and dividers.  I still look back to recall how dismal binders and their dividers were little more than two flaps made of paper or top grain leather with all materials in between.  Dividers were at best 25# vanilla colored paper with possibly tabs for the user to write a letter, number or short descriptor.The 5 different colored tabs are opaque so the written document's main idea can be seen through the plastic.  The sheets are heavy duty so the product can be used over and over or the user can take home a binder filled with memorable and keepable subject matter.  Unlike of last century's  "throw-away" products, Avery has made a line that will last with time and use.  It does not end here.  Avery includes templates (from their online sources) to take advantage of the user's skill sets and intention of excellence.  We have already filled a binder with material for a surgical procedure at the end of this month and after surgery we will have additional space for follow-up and more information.

Hey, John, I like your old man shoes said the young whippersnapper.  I replied, Thank You and when you get old and cannot bend to tie those young men's shoes do not forget Propet.'  These are so simple and easy that it makes going out a fun time instead another dreaded 'oh, do we have to do there.'  Slip them on with either socks or none and the hook and loop closure cinches the job for each shoe.  No retying or slipping on the untied string.  They have non-slip soles ranging in height from " to 1" with a conservative full leather upper.They may not be youth oriented; however, they are a fine pair of walking and usable shoes that should last from wear and even fashion.  It is interesting to me how the older one gets the greater the gap between fashion and utility opens.

I was so delighted to download this rendition of our National Anthem by Ms. Houston.  Unlike so many performers of today, she adds that special touch and it makes arm hair stand at attention while she is singing.

If I were reviewing this vacuum a year later and it still performed as well as it performs today, I would have given it a 5 star; however, it is a 4 Star with a strong probability of increasing in stardom.  The Bug Vacuum really works and works well even for the two coots living here.  Most of the successful 'kills' are from the interior since our exterior is constantly cleaned by birds.I try to find alternate uses for many products and this one has more than the single purpose of bug collecting.  Our two dogs are about as sloppy as I am and just about as messy.  Stooping to pick up food pellets is not in my book of abilities; however, this Bug Vacuum resolves that issue.  It's amazing how those few extra inches make the task easier.  Even though the suction is not as powerful as the cheapest vacuum cleaner, this device will pick up dog hair and extra-light dust in general.

If you had asked me several months ago how I felt about wearing orthotics, I would have shuttered and laughed.  Today, I am a believer and use mine every time I go out or have extra steps to take at home.  They added just the right amount of bilateral support and I can get a lot more steps because of them.  For those with good genes and feet, that is meaningless; however, to us with problems in those areas. it is a big deal.  I just love removing those big deals in favor of none; however, these are far better than the none is.

The days of not having a helper are almost gone.  This shoe horn by Vive is just that perfect tool and has claimed its own place readily available to each user.  When it is time to go out, to the mailbox or to the store, I go to the Vive Horn and use it instead of hopping around the garage trying to get one shoe on and then the other.  Too bad we did not capture that on the SD Card.  It is made of first class plastic that is smooth as 10-30W oil and is the perfect size for this old 75" frame.  The oval holder at the top fits 3 of my fingers and bends just enough to make slipping on a shoe easy.
