She meets people along the way; people who become friends.I loved the descriptions in this book, along with character development. It was well written, and definitely sets the tone for book 2, which I cant wait to read. Highly recommend this one to anyone.

The Absolute Truth: Grace of God, by Amrik Binapal, is not a novel as others may perceive it to be. I do agree that from the cover, along with the description, it can be a bit misleading, but I gave it a chance and read it anyway, and I was pleasantly surprised by what I found. Instead of being a novel, it is a collection of different poems and quotes. I happen to enjoy poetry and quotes, so I didnt mind it. However, if youre expecting an actual storyline, you wont find it here.Amrik Binapal is clearly a religious man, and it shows through each collection. I like how he breaks them down into sections; there is a social section, political, religious, etc. Each one has a theme of offering yourself up to God in one way or the other. As I was reading through each one, I did feel a bit powerful. These are inspirational writings, that can really touch your heart if you allow them to. I did end up having my favorites, but I enjoyed the collection overall.I would recommend this one to anyone of the religious faith.

Joseph Ray is one of the best authors that Ive come across in a long time. His writing is superb, way better than the rest. This particular Sons of Abraham collection is the entire series, composing of volumes 1, 2 and 3. At around 550 pages, this is a pretty long read, but worth every second of your time.The year is 3026. which is way more ahead in the future than most books in this particular genre. During the 2500s, mankind had issues with maintaining their populations, due to the fact that resources were quickly vanishing while the population continued to grow as a massive amount. When you have more people than you have food supply, the natural occurance is, people begin to starve. Even the most brilliant minds couldnt figure out this problem, so they decided to build something that would; the Cybers. The Cybers were built by scientists, and the first generation of them were able to solve the issues and save mankind.Over 500 years later, the human race is still facing some issues that they cant seem to solve on their own. The population is quickly dying out, and people are unable to feed themselves. New planets begin to arise and form their own civilization, learning from the mistakes of the Earth. However, with anything else, new planets also have their own set of problems to deal with. In come the Cybers, who once again are summoned to save the human race.A lot of action and suspense in this collection, but it kept me turning the pages for more. I was sad when Volume 3 was over, but in a good way. This author clearly has a lot of talent, and I look forward to reading more of his work in the future.

Time is Relative for a Knight of Time, by Brett Matthew Williams, is one of the best novels I've read in awhile. The story line was unique, and definitely different than what I first thought it would be when I jumped into it. It's one of those books that you can't put down until you reach the end. Very well done.Rolland Wright is a seventeen year old orphan, who is living out of his car in Woodland Hills, CA. Having a drunken father who abandoned him two years ago is hard enough, but trying to live an actual normal social life is even tougher. On top of that, his mother was murdered, which truly puts him in a state of being completely alone. One day he gets attacked by someone who claimed to of killed his father, and that's really where his life changes. He quickly realizes that he has the ability to slow down time, and he reverts back to the 19th century. Here, we get to see a lot of familiar characters, such as Joan of Arc and Jesse James. Rolland goes on a journey of his lifetime, trying to solve his mothers murder while falling in love, competing in battles, and finally finding a home in Eden.All in all, a lot was happening in this novel and I couldn't help but to be enchanted by it. I truly can't wait for Brett Matthew William's next installment, and have no doubt it will be just as good as this one.

First of all, I am extremely impressed by the writing of J.M. Taylor. You can just tell through this novel that he's an expert on this subject matter, and the story really comes alive. He has passion for what he is writing about, and that's the best part. One Stick and a Waco has a lot going for it, and keeps you fascinated until the very end. I am a huge history buff, so I enjoy reading anything and everything involving History. This is a story about World War II, and the military in general. Set in Europe, the story truly comes alive. The characters are fictitious, but are extremely relatable and make you feel as if you are along side with them. The best part is, there are dogs involved!Even though the characters are fiction, Taylor does an excellent job with keeping history alive. He got his facts right on this one, and most things in this book are spot on to what it was really like. That's the best that I enjoyed most of all. I would highly recommend this one; especially to all of you history buffs out there.

Blood Bond, by Alicia Ryan, is a paranormal vampire read. It is well written, extremely enjoyable, and a definite page turner. The characters were all extremely intriguing, and I couldn't help but to be sucked in by them. I wasn't too familiar with Alicia Ryan's other works, but after reading this one, I'm definitely going to have to look into her more.In Blood Bond, Roxanna Collins is stuck in a rot. She's a Vegas singer, but feels as if her career is going nowhere. Everything suddenly changes for her, when she's sucked back in time by a vampire to Regency England. Darren enters her life, trying his best to convince her that vampires actually do exist. He wants to be with her desperately, but she's more focused on becoming a singer in a gentleman's club. Phillip Branham gets thrown into the mix, and he's willing to do anything for Roxanna. This is where the ultimate love triangle comes into play, and Roxanne must choose between the two - or try to have them both.The time travel aspect of this novel made it even more enjoyable to me than other novels in this genre. I loved her triangle with both Philip and Darren, but I was secretly cheering on Philip. This was a great read, one that I would highly recommend.

Carla Prince has done it again! I absolutely loved her first novel, and enjoyed this one just as much. These are such quick reads (mainly due to the fact that I get addicted and won't quit until I'm finished). I love the fact that both novels have animals in them, more specifically, dogs. The dog plays a pretty huge role in Love in a cala, because he's how Tessa and Luke meet. These two have SO much chemistry together, It's unbelievable. Tessa doesn't even want a man since she's been so burnt in the past. Luke would NEVER give someone like Tessa a chance. Yet they meet, and sparks fly. I love reading stories with substance to them, and this one does have a lot of substance. Tessa actually helps Luke along the way to become a better person than who he is. Excellent all around, really did not want to put this one down. Five stars all the way. If you're a romance junkie the way that I am, then you definitely need to read Love in a cala.

Yes, this book really did make me feel good! I have been going through some difficult times lately, so I look for books that will help to cheer me up a bit. This one definitely did it. I appreciate Carla Prince's writing style; It's fresh. Love in a boat is a Mediterranean Romance novel that will keep you wanting more. It's definitely a romance novel, but not your typical type of romance. The writing for both of the main characters is great! Each has their own unique personality, and after awhile, you'll feel as if you're friends with them. Kate and Flynn really have nothing in common, expect for both enjoying boats. Kate has a passion for old boats, and Flynn owns a high luxury yacht. They are complete opposites of each other, but you know what they say, opposites attract. This is an excellent summer read, one that I would highly recommend. Kudos to Carla Prince for writing such an enchanting novel!

The Blue African, by L.W. Samuelson, was a different kind of read for me. Completely unexpected and something I don't normally read, I found it to be incredibly eye opening. The author intended the storyline for this novel to be different than what it actually came out to be; a little fact that I appreciated.This book is part historical, part science fiction, and part religious. I think all three of these elements combined makes for one excellent read. Like I said, I don't normally read books like this, but I was surprised as to how sucked in I got after chapter one. This is a novel with a purpose, and a message to be told. You definitely need to read this one with an open mind, but I promise, you will gain a lot from it and come to appreciate it for what it is.I won't give too much away, but I will say that even after reading this one, I am still thinking about it. L.W. Samuelson did an excellent job, and It's evident that he is filled with talent. I highly recommend it to anyone.

Right to Kill, by Jim McGinty, is a touching read that I believe everyone should take the time to read. It really touched me, but that could be because my Grandfather was part of the Vietnam war. This is a story about what marine life is all about, and how it effects those poor people who suffer. As the author states, war was not the same way back then as it is now. There was no outpouring of support for our soldiers, but instead, there were protests against them. It was really a different way of life, and the mentality of people was not so much like it is today.This story focuses on Sean Cercone; a man who puts his entire life on hold in order to serve. During a leave period, he meets and falls in love with a woman named Sandy Gold. After she confronts an antiwar activist at college, tragedy begins to happen. Sean begins to lose his entire hope and faith in humanity, especially after learning about what's happening back home. He is a broken spirit, at the point of no return. This is where people begin to pitch him to try and help him rebuild his life yet again, and gain a sense of hope.This was extremely touching, and I would highly recommend it. McGinty did an excellent job.

I have read so many dating books in the past, but nothing has even come close to The Love Magnet Rules, by Chad Stone. Everyone should read this book, regardless if you're in a relationship or not. There are so many helpful tips in this one that will not only enlighten you, but give you the skills and confidence that you need in order to have a successful relationship.As we all know, relationships are tough. We all want love, that is just reality. Most of us are able to find it, but It's the keeping it part that poses the biggest challenge. I think the most important thing that Stone stresses about is not just the act of falling in love, but the act of falling in love with the right person for you. In order for love to last, you need to be able to find it with a person who is perfectly suited for you. The tips being portrayed in this are extremely straight forward and easy to follow. He teaches you how to become a love magnet, so to speak, and how to keep that energy alive.I thoroughly enjoyed this one, and would highly recommend it.

Erotic Encounters, by Robyn Ooh, definitely took me by surprise. It's a very short read, but a good one at that. In most cases, erotica's don't need to be very long; short and simple is what works best. This is a pretty hot read, with a lot of expressive, and "explosive" scenes. There was a bit of a storyline behind it as well, which I found to be equally as interesting.Roxy has always been faithful to her cheating girlfriend. However, everyone reaches a breaking point and Roxy is reaching hers when she finds out that she's cheating yet again. She finally decides it's time to start anew, and teach her cheating ex a lesson during the process. I enjoyed the entire scenario a lot, and really wanted more when it was over. In story two, Sam, a butch, is newly single and ready to have some fun. She embraces her new status by getting a piercing. Kiara enters, and is about to take Sam on a wild ride, one unlike any that she's ever been on before.Both of these stories had everything that a perfect erotica should contain. I found them to be equally as enjoyable, and I can't wait to see what Robyn Ooh has to offer next. Highly recommend.

Lenten Reflections, by Milton E. Lopes, is a very interesting read. If you're even a tiny bit spiritual, this is definitely one that you're going to want to look into a bit. I found it to be extremely enlightening and fulfilling; not to mention, well written and easy to follow. This is not just strictly a spiritual novel either, which is something I appreciate. There's also a lot to do with philosophies, Shakespeare, etc. I believe that if you have an open mind, this could be a book for anyone to follow.If you have ever had a difficult time period in your life (which most of us have), then you will understand exactly where the author is coming from. The main reason I purchased this one was because I have been looking for ways to be a bit more spiritual in my life. It goes into detail about the historics behind Lent, and why it started and what it really means. The book poses questions that you will need to think long and hard about before answering; I am still pondering those questions.I enjoyed this thoroughly, and will be using it to refer back to whenever I hit some rough patches in my life. Highly recommend.

Wow, what a mystery! Queensboro, by Thomas Drago, will absolutely suck you right in! A good mystery novel is hard to come by, but this one definitely exceeded my expectations by a lot. It's more than just a good mystery novel; it also contains elements of suspense, crime, and horror. It wasn't so horrific that I was anxious reading it, but it had an excellent balance that wanted me to just keep on reading. There was also a supernatural feel to it, which I found refreshing.Ashley Smith is the brightest student in her 4th grade class at Crow Creek Elementary. She volunteers for the task of line leader, is the captain of the book club, spelling bee champion, and will never be absent from school. She is the dream student, along with the perfect child any parent could ever ask for. One morning, gravedigger Schreck, snatches her from a bus stop. Sheriff Brad Gleason immediately steps in to help aid the search effort for Ashley, but more chaos is erupting. Several locals are being killed in the woods. Mrs. Scott and Curly both witness these attacks, and are absolutely shocked by what they see. The chase ends up leading all the way to Queensboro, which is a town along the Haw River. It's also home to a medical research lab which is run by Margaret Ganis. Due to her appearance, she is nicknamed Red Queen. The main question is, how does she tie into this story and where is all of this bad coming from? Will Ashley ever be found? These are questions that had me turning the page as the story went on.I enjoyed the ending a lot! There was still a bit of mystery involved, which proves that there will probably be a 2nd part to this story - I hope so, anyway. Definitely recommend!

Silent Swing, by Robert Fowler, really did touch me a lot. It was a beautiful story with a lot of vivid scenes and vibrant character development. I wasn't really expecting what I got after reading this novel, but I mean that in the best way possible. This one really took me by surprise, and had me thinking about it long after I was finished reading it. Both the pacing and the balance of this novel kept me interested and engaged, and I'm beyond grateful that I stumbled across it.Jimmy Carter, recently divorced, decides to travel to Tuscany to sell the family Villa. Shortly after arriving, he meets Carla (a 19 year old girl), who completely takes him by surprise. Immediately, he is captivated by her. The issue with Carla is, she is pregnant, and the father of the baby died in a motorcycle accident. Jimmy is determined to find out everything about her, and he digs deep. He finds out her baby father's name is Salvadore, who was a hero in the village. It doesn't make sense to Jimmy why the two of them would be together, considering the fact that they seemed to be complete opposites. The story between the two of them is told from Carla's flashbacks, and also the bar owner who Jimmy comes across. What readers will be most surprised about is the secret that Carla is holding inside of her.I was definitely surprised by the twist in the book, I love when authors can take a usual type of story and turn it into something more unique. I give a lot of credit to Fowler, who drew me right in and didn't let me go until the very end. Five stars all the way.

Bar Nights: The Mire Man Triology Book 1, by Dave Matthes, is an excellent debut novel to this collection. It contains elements of intrigue, drama, and a bit of tragedy as well. This is not an uplifting story by any means; in fact, Its quite sad. However, the characters are extremely interesting, and the storyline just sucks you right in. I couldnt seem to put this one down and by the end, I was wishing Book 2 would be released already.Main character Arlo has had enough. He walks in to find his wife sleeping with another man, and is pretty much fed up with the way his life is turning out. He decides he needs an escape, so he abandons his wife, out of control teenaged daughter and her fiance, and his job all behind and hits the road. Shortly after leaving, his car dies on him, leaving him stranded without many options. He decides to stay in a room for rent above a dive bar called Purgatory, and things start to get interesting. He takes a job working in the bar in order to pay off his rent. One night, he wanders off into the night and gets hit by many realizations; one of which, why he ended up in a place called Purgatory.I dont want to give too much away, but It gets pretty intense after that. Matthes does an excellent job with this novel, and I commend him greatly. I truly cant wait for Book 2 of this trilogy to be released.

Rational Polemics, by Richard Todd Devens is definitely a different kind of a read. You have to jump into this one with an open mind, but I promise it will be worth it. I found it to be extremely interesting and engaging as well, and I did learn a lot from it. Devens has a unique take on a number of different topics, and I found his voice to be refreshing.You need an open mind when it comes to this one because Devends delves into a lot of different controversial issues. You need to be able to take in alternative viewpoints to certain subject matters, such as religion, politics, and performance enhancing drugs. These are topics that we all have our own opinions on, but it never hurts to read about, or experience, other viewpoints. Even though some parts of this book made me annoyed at times, I couldnt help but to shake my head on a lot of points that Devens brings up, a lot of which makes sense.If youre willing to be open minded and get new ideas on topics that you think you know everything about, then Rational Polemics is definitely one worth reading. I would highly recommend it.

First off let me start out by saying that I am a fan of William Graham and his writing. I have read The Red Planet novellas, and have been absolutely fascinated by them. When I saw that he wrote a different kind of novel, entiled Greenfields: A Novella, I knew I just had to have it. As I expected, Its a wonderful novel that kept me captivated from start to finish. This is another science fiction, which is something that I thoroughly enjoy.I love the characters in this one. We have James and Helena, whom we follow throughout the story. The two of them and their family struggle to live in a world that isnt exactly just; unless you are a wealthy Titan, youre life isnt worth too much. This relates so much to our modern day society, unfortunately. Thats why I found the premise so interesting, because Its almost reality like.I loved the imaginery in this novel, the character descriptions provided, and the way that the story just jumps out at you. I felt like I was in the novel as a part of James and Helenas family throughout the whole story. Highly recommend.

Franklin Bean Secrets of the Bay is book 2 in the Franklin Bean series, and another one on the top of my daughters list of favorite books. This entire series is wonderful, and incredibly adorable as well. Franklin Bean, his buddy Kirby and superhero Pancho Frijoles are back to save the day yet again. The mystery this time is, why isn't Franklin Bean ever around at the same time as Pancho Frijoles is? That's the main mystery in this book that my daughter loves to try and figure out. I love the fact that this story helps her to use her imagination to come up with different scenarios. I also love the fact that these books revolve around the fact that bullies are bad. John faces the bullies in both of these books, and It's up to the superheros to save the day. Love the concept, the pictures, and the characters. Definitely recommend.

This is such a wonderful Superhero collection that any child will enjoy. I stumbled across Meet Franklin Bean while doing a search for good beach books for my daughter. I loved the premise of this one, and how it revolves around teaching a lesson while still being enjoyable. Emmy Swain is an excellent children's author, and I hope she continues to write. In this first book, John and his mother move to a new town where they don't know anyone. They adopt a dog and name him Franklin Bean, and he becomes John's closest friend. When the bullies start bothering John, it will be up to a true superhero to stop it and to save the day. My daughter enjoyed this book tremendously and after reading it myself, I can fully understand why. The pictures in it are amazing as well, really help to draw attention. Great read!

F.O.R.C.E., by Sam B Miller II, was such a fantastic and refreshing Sci/Fi read. Being a huge fan of this genre, I have a lot of knowledge and experience when it comes to this topic, and I found this book to be mind blowing. Miller puts a new spin on the average alien invasion subject, and by the end, I definitely wanted more. I love the fact that in the opening of this book, Miller delves into a real unsolved mystery that most people will be familiar with. That gives this novel more of an actual feel, as opposed to just another science fiction read.All of the characters in this one are intriguing, my favorite being Whatsit. Earth's future is threatened, but Earth has a chance to plan a response in order to stop any threats from happening. There are a lot of secrets involved here, not to mention planning and strategizing. A special group of people are chosen to save humanity from an invasion, and they will pull out all the stops to make that happen. Brilliant read, and definitely sets the stage for a sequel to be written.I thoroughly enjoyed this one, and would highly recommend it to anyone, whether you're a Scifi fan or not.

The Angel of Antioch, by Daniel Molyneux, was a new type of read for me. When I read the premise I knew I had to give it a try, but didn't expect it to be as good as it actually was. Molyneux's writing style simply blew me away, and this story was extremely easy to follow from start to finish. Very interesting characters, and extremely interesting plot. This novel contains all the elements that a good novel should contain and for that, I'm giving it five stars.Elias is a stranger who shows up in the Great Synagogue. His great talent is his ability to recite the scripture from memory, and once he speaks to the assembly, he disappears. He reappears, recites the Scripture, and then disappears once more. By this point, people are extremely curious about him, trying to figure out who he may be and where he goes. Of course, some people think he's a complete fraud, but others people that he truly is a spiritual leader who should be worshiped. I found his character to be extremely intriguing, and I myself desperately wanted to find out who he really was.Great read, would highly recommend it.

The Giggling Boy, by RaLynn LoneWalker, had me so intrigued that I couldnt seem to put this down. Im not too familar with this author, but I am very impressed by her writing style and ability to tie everything together into one.This is a story about children who have been stolen from their parents. What they face is pure horror; a parents worst nightmare. The ones who captured them have now forced them to go to a mission school, where they face cruel and unusual punishment. They are desperate for someone to rescue them and take them back to safety.Smiley, age 11, was also taken and forced to live at the mission school. Smiley is no longer alive, but tells his story of the way he was forced to live, and the way that he eventually died.Mission school superintendant Francis Malachi Pratt did unthinkable and horrific things to the students of the school. Even though he did these things, he still does feel as if it was his fault. He is currently dying, and his destination is hell.Very dark storyline, very sad at times as well. However, all of these characters are extremely interesting and will keep you wanting to keep reading for more. I highly reocmmend this one, Its a definite must read.

Kill The Lights: A Mystery, by David Wahlberg was not what I expected when I jumped into it. Instead, it was an interesting take on your regular mystery story. With so many characters involved in this one, Its hard not to get completely engrossed into it. The overall storyline really captured my attention, and the character descriptions made me feel as if I was in the book, a part of the story.A young woman is found raped and murdered at Fatmans Cove in Malibu, which immediately starts the murder mystery of this novel. Ty Malone and his tenants are extremely concerned, since the property he owns is home to small time crooks. They normally look out for those who cant help/defend themselves, and pride themselves on righting the wrongs of the world, since they dont trust cops.This story involves a seedy fashion industry, money laundering crimes, and sweat shops all in one. A lot is involved in the overall storyline, which is why I enjoyed it as much as I did.If youre in the mood for a good mystery with a twist, I would definitely give this one a try. Highly recommend.

Secret Not Forgotten: The DNA of JESUS; Eighteen missing years, by Edward Morris, is a different type of read. Definitely very interested, and held my interest from the very first page up until the last. Morris did an excellent job with the writing of this book.This book focuses on a hypothesis about the missing 18 years of Jesuss life, during his ages of 12 to 30. Most of us dont know what happened during those years; how can we, when nothing has been documented? Professor Homer Paulus, the head of the DNA lab at the University of California, is the one who came up with this theory and is driven to prove it. Did Jesus stay in Nazareth, or did he travel to India and Tibet?Yes, some can say that this is a controversial novel, but I found it to be an interesting take on the life of Jesus. Its something new that we havent really seen done before, which is why I was into it as much as I was. Definitely out of the box, but worth reading nonetheless. I would highly recommend.

Duilleog, by Donald D. Allan, is Book 1 in A New Druids Series. For being a debut novel, I was very impressed. This is a story about discovery, which is a topic that I can definitely appreciate. Many people may not remember what Druids means, but Druids basically are members of an educated professional class who live among the Celtic people during the Iron Age. This is a difficult subject matter to write about, due to the fact that It's unknown to a lot of people, with no much history to go by. Allan did an excellent job creating a storyline about Druids, and I commend him for that.Will Arbor is the main character in Duilleog, one that the author decided to focus heavily on. He is the last in the long line of druids, and he discovers that he has healing powers, which sets him off on his journey to discover himself and also to reclaim the past that was once his. During this journey, he comes across the Archbishop of the Church of the New Order whose main objective is to destroy the druids in order to regain control over the Realm of Turgany; on the other hand, the Protector of the Realm is committing horrible acts in order to ensure his authority stays in tact.During his journey, Will Arbor will not only see the bad and evil in the world; he will also come across great joy, a world of magic, beauty in nature, and of course, the druids who are now long gone. He is an amazing character, one that I grew to appreciate as I kept reading the book. The plot of this book is something original; something that most authors wouldn't dream of even touching upon. I found it to be fascinating and intriguing, and I truly do look forward for Book 2 to be released. Excellent writing, especially for a debut novel. I would highly recommend.

I have finished Chasing Joseph, by Jamall Joseph D. Robinson, and I am at a loss of words. This is such a heart felt read, that pulled on my heart strings. This is a story that needed to be told, the author makes that very clear and I can't help but to agree. What people must remember is that there are always two sides of every story, and the media doesn't always get things right. If they want to run with a story to make a certain look bad, that's what they are going to do. Not all of it is factual, and not all of it is fair. The public should know every side of a story before making rash judgements against people, and crucifying them. Were all human, we all make mistakes. I think that's one reason why he felt the need to release his story; to share himself with all of us. I commend him for that, truly.Joseph feels trapped in his life. He made mistakes, and those mistakes follow him throughout his life. He refers many times to, "Jamall", the person in which he is trying to escape. Jamall made a lot of bad choices during his life, choices that he wishes he could undue but can't. He was sucked into a violent world, a world that his mother introduced him to. He had such a promising life for himself. He was a good boy, a boy who had a lot of great successes in his life. He was an associate of Yusuf Bey IV, and owner of Your Black Muslim Bakery. He was well respected by the community, until he took a turn into the dark side. He then became someone unrecognizable; between his scandals of welfare fraud and murder, somewhere, something went terribly wrong in his life. Joseph now recognizes and feels remorse for all that he has done in his past life, and everyday he is trying to rectify his mistakes. The problem is, the media does not print the positive sides of him, but instead, keeps on reflecting on the negatives.I do believe that there are some people in this world who can never be forgiven; however, there are those who truly do deserve our forgiveness because they see the wrongs that they have done and they work hard to try and correct them. Those people we must respect, not condemn. I am happy that I read this one, because it was truly insightful and gave me an alternate view of this man's life and views. It was touching, for sure. I would highly recommend it.

Finally, For Me is Book 1 in The Finally Book Duo series. This is Roseanne Burke's debut work, and I must say, I am very impressed. Her writing style is excellent, and the plot of this book sucked me right in. I love the characters and the interactions between them, I felt like I was a part of the book at times, engrossed with them.Lacey Singer is a victim of an abusive relationship, but finally breaks free of it. She moves to a new town to escape, where she really doesn't know anyone. She meets Ben Anderson, who is an incredibly handsome lawyer, and they instantly connect. Everything seems to be going perfect for Lacey now, but the only problem is, Ben is about to get engaged. This means that there are certain boundaries that can't be crossed, and they will have to remain just friends. However, this proves to be an extremely difficult task. I found myself rooting for the two of them the entire time.It's a very spicy read, but still manages to have an excellent storyline behind it. Kudos to Burke for an excellent debut novel; I will definitely be on the lookout for her next one.

We have been using this cup with my 20-month-old to try to teach him how to drink out of a cup.  He can drink well out of this cup, but he still has to suck a bit on the spout, so it's not really teaching him about drinking out of a regular cup. I would describe this as a half-way point between a traditional sippy cup and a regular cup. We are considering trying to make the holes in the spout bigger so that the liquid is more free-flowing. The tilted design is nice because it allows easy drinking without having to have a big head tilt.

Here is a summary of this book, straight from the introduction: "I'll show you how to break the rules just enough ... to get on the road to great health, great energy, and great lives. This journey is all about eating well, moving well, chilling out, and feeling amazing without having to give up the things you really, truly don't want to live without. This approach is guilt free. Don't think kale, not coffee. Think kale and coffee."There are short chapters on eating meat, exercise, sugar and carbs, salt, coffee, and alcohol. Each chapter is short enough to give you the very basics, but you won't get too much detail or science. All in all, the approach is about moderation and not overdoing it, including with eating that is too healthy (Extreme vegan diet) or exercise that is too intense. I liked this commonsense approach, and it was nice to have all of these topics handled in a brief, readable way. This book will not give you very much detail, though, or much scientific research, so if you're looking for something more in depth. Look elsewhere.

I love this tank top. It fits very smoothly and works well under sweaters or see-through tops. I would suggest ordering one size up, though, because I think it fits a little small. One thing I like about the design is that the top is quite long-waisted, and that keeps it from riding up.
My five-year-old daughter loves these. They fit well and wash well and have a cute design. They stand up to multiple washings over and over again.

This is a pretty low quality trivet Not what I would expect from the Lenox brand. The silver color is painted on, and it is chipping off in places. Out of the six snowflake points, only three have feet that touch the table top. This means that the trivet tips if you're not careful to place the dish exactly on the center. All in all, this is fine if you're spending $10 or less. I wouldn't spend more than that on this.

This is a beautiful square casserole dish. You can use this to cook something that would go into an 8x8 or 9x9 pan. The sides are deep enough to hold a generous recipe. This would also be great as a 1.5 quart casserole dish that can go straight from the oven to the holiday table. The design is simple and classy and elegant. I love this dish and plan to use it many times during the holidays.

Pros:1.  Aesthetics:  This fitness monitor is able to be worn in several different ways.  It can be worn over a waistband or clipped onto a bra for a more subtle look, or there are four different colors of wrist bands that can be used to make this look more like a watch.  I love this flexibility, and the wristband is more attractive and sleeker (less bulky) than the other wrist monitors Ive used (Garmin/Jawbone).  All in all, this fitness monitor is the most attractive one available on the market, I think.2. The internal watch battery means this tracker doesnt need to be plugged in to recharge (unlike the Jawbone UP).  This is very convenient.3. Bluetooth technology:  The fitness monitor uploads to an app you can have on your phone.  Its wireless and automatic and very convenient.  Its also extremely easy to set up.Cons:1. The biggest and most important con is that this fitness monitor isnt very accurate.  It overcounts my steps and overestimates my sleep.  In order to test the accuracy, I wore this monitor at the exact same time that I wore my other trusted monitors (FitBit and Jawbone).  The FitBit and Jawbone recorded very similar numbers for steps and sleep, but the Nuyu added about 30% more steps and about 20% more sleep consistently.  Thats a big problem, at least for me.  I suppose if youre not very interested in actual numbers of steps but more interested in relative trends from day to day, then this monitor would be fine for you.  If youre trying to get the recommended number of 10,000 steps per day, though, youd better shoot for about 13,000 with the Nuyu.2. In order to read the time and number of steps (and other metrics) on the monitor, you have to swipe the face.  But the touch screen is not very sensitive, and it requires a very deliberate swipe in just the right place.  It took me some time to figure out how to read the screen reliably, and I thought my touch screen was broken at first.  It wasnt, but it isnt a very good touch screen.3. Lacks bells and whistles.  Keep in mind that this fitness monitor is at a lower price point, so youre not going to get very many bells and whistles.  If you want silent alarms or vibrations to remind you to be more active, or if you want to track number of workouts or glasses of water, then youll need to spend more and get a different monitor (like the Jawbone UP).

These towels are a nice large size, and I love the lively pattern. The cloth is very thin, though.  I find that these towels get very wet quickly because they are so thin. I was expecting something a bit plusher and more absorbent. I haven't had them very long, and the description says they become more absorbent over time, so I will update this review if I notice a positive difference over time.

This novel is an unsentimental love story between an illegal immigrant and a mentally ill war veteran.  Its gritty, violent, sad, and powerful, and some of the writing is brilliant.  Atticus Lish's metaphors are particularly surprising and perfect. I can't wait to read what he writes next. However, this is not a perfect book. There is a perfect book buried in here, and my main complaint is that the book is overlong and loses quite a bit of its momentum as a result.  Id chop off 100 pages to make this an excellent novel.

Bryan Stevenson is a lawyer who heads up the Equal Justice Initiative, a non-profit organization established to provide legal defense to wrongly condemned death row inmates, mentally ill people, and children. The cases in this book are astonishing in their malpractice and unfairness, and Stevenson and EJI are doing everything they can with a limited budget to help overcome injustice in the deep South.  Id describe Stevenson as a real-life Atticus Finch, and I learned a lot from hearing his story.  I wont say I exactly enjoyed listening to this audiobook because the cases are tragic and surprising, but Im glad I had the experience.
These are okay.  They taste like most other seaweed crisps Ive had.  They are thin and crispy and have a strong seaweed flavor.  My kids love them.

This toy is so much more than a standard puzzle.  3-4 year olds will have fun trying to get all the pieces to fit neatly into the box (like a standard puzzle), but these wooden pieces also work for imaginary play with food.  The puzzle base converts into a cook top, so the set works perfectly for playing short order cook (yes, this is something young children like to play!).  The pieces also work well when used with a standard play kitchen.  The wooden pieces are nicely constructed and durable.  The edges are smooth and wont cause pesky splinters.

This BB cream goes on easily and helps skin to look smoother and more finished.  I use this product on top of my normal light daily moisturizer, and I find that I do not need to add any foundation on top.  The finish is not greasy or oily, so it does not leave my skin looking too shiny.  Also, this cream has a light scent, but it is very light and not overpowering at all.  Kind of like the light scent that most foundations have.It is important to know that this BB cream has the color of a light foundation for a light complexion (I ordered the "light" color).  That works perfectly for my skin tone, but it wont work for olive or brown skin tones.  In those cases, you would want a darker color BB cream.

My 18-month-old loves this card set. He particularly loves inserting the cards into the container through the slot. This is a great way to develop fine motor skills, and it also teaches him how to clean up his toys. The cards are made out of thick hard plastic, so they are very durable. The cards are a great way to teach vocabulary as well. Some of the drawings could be improved (less cartoonish), but that's a small complaint.

This is a fun messaging toy, but I think its a bit misleading to call it a science lab.  There are code wheels and special pens/markers.  There are enough supplies to share with a friend so that friends can exchange messages back and forth.  The booklet explains some of the science behind the messaging tools and includes instructions for making other inks, etc.  This is a pretty cool kit for exchanging secret messages, but it falls far short of a science lab.  My other complaint is that I dont like gender-directed marketing for these kinds of toys.  Why not make a gender-neutral kit that can be enjoyed by both girls and boys?

Many of these types of building sets are quite complicated with a lot of small pieces.  Those are great for older kids but difficult for younger kids to manage.  This set, however, is made up of relatively large pieces of roller coaster track that can be put together in a lot of interesting ways.  My 5-year-old enjoys playing with this, and the book with instructions is easy enough for her to understand and follow.  The step-by-step instructions are depicted in easy to understand illustrations that are high-quality and colorful.  In fact, the instruction booklet is set up like a story book, so it isnt intimidating at all, even for quite young children.  The pieces are made from durable, high-quality plastic, and they fit together easily.  The roller coaster cart mechanism is well-designed and glides smoothly along the track.  All in all, this is a great toy for the 5-7 year old crowd that encourages engineering skills and imaginative play.
Great control and precision. I love these and will never use cheap tweezers again. These are very easy to grip.

I love this powder by Neutrogena. Shade 10 is my favorite for everyday use. It is a translucent powder.  It seems to last a long time and keeps my skin from becoming shiny or oily. Shade 20 is a bit pink and probably is best on fair skin. It works OK for me as a blush, but I think the color will be a little bit too pink for some skin tones. Shade 30 is the bronzing shade, and it is a little dark for my fair skin. That color is probably best for darker skin tones.

I really enjoyed this farming family saga.  Its gorgeously written and is perfectly balanced between character study and well-paced plot.  This is a reimagining of Shakespeares King Lear, but Jane Smiley doesnt hold too close to the King Lear story, so the link didnt reveal anything in advance except that I didnt expect things to go well for the family in general.  Ive read a few novels by Smiley, and this one is my favorite by far.

This granola is fine.  It has good flavor and a pretty good nutritional profile.  My main complaint is that the granola is made up of very small bits and pieces.  Perhaps its a bit more like muesli than granola but without the satisfying chewiness of most mueslis.  With this quality, Id say this granola would be best as a topping for yogurt rather than eaten as a cereal with milk.  The other strange thing is that the Nutrition Facts seem to contain an error.  The Facts say that a serving is 1 cup and that contains 220 calories.  The Facts also say there are 6 servings per box.  None of this is true.  There is about 2-3 full cups in each box, so Im guessing the serving size should really be  or 1/3 cup.  Anyone who knows granola knows its fairly caloric, so theres no way a full cup serving is only 220 calories.  Im sure this mistake will be fixed quickly if it hasnt already been fixed.

This mix was simple to use and made great pancakes. They tasted just as good as the pancake mixes I usually use with gluten. Also, the texture of the pancakes was exactly as I expected, light and fluffy. I would recommend these for anyone trying to minimize or eliminate gluten from their diet. The only downside is that these require a bit more effort to make than simple mixes where you just add water. Here you need to add milk, and an egg, and a tablespoon of oil.

I have this surge protector/charger plugged in next to my bedside table, and its very handy to charge my electronic devices overnight.  I love the dual-USB charging stations.  That is what distinguishes this surge protector from the others I have.  I also like the safety feature of the rotating outlet covers.  I have an 18-month-old toddler, so this safety feature is necessary.  All in all, a great product.

My 18-month-old enjoys interacting with DJ the Dinosaur, but this puppet is very simplistic.  The dinosaur says only six simple phrases, so it doesnt hold his interest for long.  Also, the neck part of the puppet is a bit tight, so I find my hand getting tired and cramped after using it for just a few minutes.  This wouldnt work at all for people with large hands, and my hands are fairly narrow, and I still have this problem.  I think this would be best used as a way to get a childs attention quicklyfor example, like a photographer might want to get young children to look at a camera and smile.  That seems like a better use for this puppet than anything else.

This "encyclopedia" is very visual and fun for children who love animals.  The photographs are of a very high quality, and the book is printed on nice, thick paper.  It is organized into chapters based on animal classes (mammals, amphibians, etc.).  Each chapter contains specific examples of that class of animals.  For example, the mammal chapter includes pages on "small cats," "large cats," "dogs," etc.  My daughter loves flipping through this and asking me to read parts of it to her.  The book also comes with a large fold-out poster that can be hung on the wall in a kid's room.

My 18-month-old enjoys playing with this barn set.  He particularly enjoys pushing the chicken down the slide and putting it away in the barn.  However, it is very annoying that the pieces of this set fit together like puzzle pieces.  I understand that the manufacturer is trying to give greater flexibility.  The puzzle pieces can be rearranged in different ways to keep the toy interesting.  The problem is that the puzzle pieces easily fall apart, so the slides are always falling off and becoming disconnected.  The silo also becomes disconnected very easily.  This frustrates my son (and hence me) to no end.  Eventually, I used a tube of super glue to glue everything together.  Problem solved.

This book is marketed as a short story collection, but it's really a short novel with three short stories thrown in as extras.  The main work is a novel titled "Thirteen Ways of Looking," and it's about an 82-year-old trial court judge in New York City--Mr. Mendelssohn.  In my copy (an ARC), the novel is 143 pages long, so fairly slender but still a novel, I think.  This story is a beautiful character study of an elderly man and his struggle to come to terms with his failing body and unreliable mind.  I loved this story, and McCann's writing is sensitive and illuminating.  This novel is well worth reading and needn't be packaged with other stories to make it worthwhile (although the stories are great too).

There are a lot of things I like about this watch. For one thing, is pretty cool looking with the clear band and monochrome coloring. I also like how easy it is to use and program. It is very intuitive, and I did not even need to refer to the instruction booklet. There are a few odd things with this watch, however. It is bizarre to me that a quarter of the face is taken up with the days of the week (Monday, Tuesday,). Do people often forget what day of the week it is? I don't. That space could be better used for something else. Also, the indicator for Wednesday is "Wen"... Clearly not how a native English speaker would indicate "Wednesday". My other complaint is that the beep sound that indicates changing settings is annoyingly loud. That is a small complaint, though do not expect to be able to adjust the settings when there are other people around (e.g., in an office setting). All in all, I am happy with this watch, particularly at this price point.

My dinosaur-crazed daughter was very excited to try putting these models together.  What actually happened, however, is that I put them together for her.  As others have noted, these models are fairly tricky to put together as many pieces look alike, and the instructions arent very clear at all.  I will say that my daughter really enjoyed watching me get quite frustrated while putting these together, so it was a good lesson for her in patience and perseverance.  Also, the finished models are quite nice, and she really enjoys playing with them. I like that the models arent made up of tiny, tiny pieces falling off all the time, so were both happy.  If you get this for a child in the 6-12 age range, be prepared for some significant adult involvement in the construction phase!

My kids (ages 5 years and 18 months) love bubbles.  Because they always end up spilling the bubble solution every time we play with bubbles, Ive been wanting to get them a bubble container.  This bubble bucket is very sturdy and quite heavy for something made out of plastic.  That ensures that it is stable on the ground and doesnt tip over easily, which means we dont lose as much bubble solution.  The bucket comes with three bubble wands that insert into slits on the top of the bucket.  The fit is pretty tight (probably to avoid bubble spillage), so both of my kids sometimes have trouble getting the wands to go back into the bucket completely.  This takes a bit of coordination, and I often have to help out.  I think this problem could be solved by making the slits a bit bigger so the fit isnt as tight.  The result would be a little more bubble spillage, but its probably worth it.  Also, the wands themselves are not great at producing good bubbles.  They are sturdy but too thick.  All in all, this bucket is a good way to save bubble solution, but we prefer to use it with long, skinnier wands.

This is a bit of a thriller and a bit of a morality tale, mixed together with a touch of politics (mainly around the issue of drone warfare).  Owen Sheers explores how one bad decision based on incomplete information ripples outwards to cause a lot of other things to happen, some good and some bad.  Sheers very ingeniously manufactures suspense.  The method felt contrived and perhaps a bit cheap to me, but it did result in a very suspenseful read that kept me rushing through the pages.  My other complaint is that certain parts of this narrative are extremely far-fetched, but I was mostly able to set all that aside while reading and enjoying this novel.

This Jot Script pen has been useful for turning my iPad into a good device for note taking.  The fine point of the pen makes it easy to make precision notes.  I also enjoy the functionality of the pen: it can erase and highlight and does a good job ignoring my palm when I am resting it on the iPad while writing.  There is a slight delay in the notes that I write, but that is a relatively small complaint.  My biggest complaint is that I have to resync the pen every time I want to use it, and that takes some time.  I wish I could skip that step.  Im not familiar enough with other tablet pens to know if this is a universal problem, and perhaps it is.

Im revisiting this one for the first time since high school.  Its an undeniable classic, and I appreciated it so much more this time around. Ward's translation is perfect for an American audience, and it doesn't get in the way of the original text.

This was an interesting character study of an American housewife living with her husband in Switzerland.  For nine years, Anna has coasted along basically ignoring the fact that shes in another country.  She never manages to learn the language or make any real friends.  Her passivity is annoying but understandable too.  Certain aspects of this story seem true to life while I had a hard time believing other aspects, so Id describe this novel as having missed success.  Id still recommend it, though, if only as a lesson in what traps to avoid.

I love Tom McCarthys books, so I was excited to read this new novel.  In Satin Island, the protagonist is an anthropologist employed by a big corporation, and he is tasked with the impossible project of writing a book that captures everything about our current times. This is an ideas book without a cohesive narrative.  Instead, there are real-life experiences mixed with dreams mixed with philosophical mental meanderings mixed with stories told by others.  Very postmodern.  Some parts captured my attention more than others.  Theres a chapter, for example, that tracks the protagonists thoughts as he crafts a speech in his head.  Its a masterful depiction of a thought process many of us have been through, and I loved it.  Other sections were too obscure or overblown.  All in all, Id give this 3.5 stars (an average of 2 stars for the mediocre parts and 5 stars for the brilliant parts).

This is a very versatile notebook. The sturdy construction will stand up to rough treatment, including banging around in a backpack or in the back of a car. The dividers can also be folders to handle loose papers, and they are movable. This means you can have five areas that aren't equal in size. I love this flexibility. All in all, a great product.

This is another winning book from Brene Brown.  This one is about getting up after challenges and jumping back into the game.  This is a pretty unusual angle as most of these types of books focus on taking enough risks, so I was happy to read something from a different angle and focused on a different part of the process.  Here is how Brene Brown describes the three books she's written:The Gifts of Imperfection--Be you.Daring Greatly--Be all in.Rising Strong--Fall. Get up. Try again.I strongly encourage reading these books in order as they build on each other.

I love the tight fit of these earbuds.  They stay on through the most high-impact activities, even when there's plenty of sweating happening.  They also fit close enough to the head that I was able to wear them lying on my back for exercises like the chest press.  Sound quality is fine for a pair of exercise headphones.  For me, sound quality is usually hampered by slippage and movement, but that doesn't seem to happen with these earbuds.  My only complaint, and it's a pretty significant one, is that my ears get sore (the outer parts) after wearing these for more than an hour.  So, don't plan to run a marathon in these or anything like that.  For most usual workouts, they feel fine, and the tight slip-free fit is wore a bit of ear soreness to me.

This is a very difficult book to describe.  Its organized as a series of numbered paragraphs in sections titled A Few Things I Know About my Grandfather and A Few Things I Know About Myself.  Its not a traditional novel in the sense that theres very little narrative arc.  Its more of a close examination of the key episodes of a life.  The first-person narrator tells about his grandfather who survived Auschwitz, his father who has recently been diagnosed with Alzheimers, and his own childhood and adult struggles.  Im not sure exactly how he does it, but this protagonist manages to cram a great deal of the most important things about being a human into these slender 200 pages.  This book reaffirms the strong connection between who we are today and the parents we came from, even when we dont realize the connection ourselves.  This is a great antidote to the disjointedness of our modern lives.

This is a light-weight all-purpose lotion.  It doesn't have any scent or other harsh additives.  Both of my children have eczema (dry skin), and this lotion works well for them for daily use.  I do have to use something richer and thicker for particularly dry patches as this lotion has a fairly high water content.

This is a great delivery device for super rich moisturizer, basically the consistency of lip balm.  My four year old has eczema on her cheeks, and she has fun using this stick to put some moisturizer on before bedtime. Her sensitive skin has had no adverse reaction. I also use this with my baby with great results.

These paper towels are different from the Bounty paper towels I buy at my grocery store.  The ones at the grocery store are softer and more flexible and also more expensive.  This strong variety are a bit scratchier and not as cloth-like.  They seem more institutional, but they still perform well as paper towels.  They soak up a lot of liquid, do not tear easily, and they also do not leave bits of lint behind.

This baby soap performs well for cleaning babys hair and body.  The scent is nice, but the most important thing for me is that the soap washes off easily and doesnt leave a residue.  My squirmy baby doesnt sit still for very long in the bath, so I dont want to have to pour too much water on his head to get the soap off his hair.  This soap is perfect for that, and I also like that it contains natural and organic ingredients.

Im a big fan of Bertolli pasta sauces because I like the natural ingredients, the fresh taste, and the relatively low sodium.  Most pasta sauces that are meat and/or cheese flavored are super salty with lots of additional fat and preservatives, and these Bertolli sauces are not like that.  These sauces retain all the best qualities I associate with Bertolli, and the meaty flavor really comes through, but without any added salt or fat.  Keep in mind, though, that these are meat flavored sauces.  They do not actually contain chunks of meat in them. I still added ground beef to these sauces to serve over spaghetti.

These soft caramels taste just like what good soft caramels should taste like.  They have a nice consistency and a flavor that is buttery and not waxy.  These dont have that distinctive Werthers taste, though, so if thats what youre looking for, Id suggest the traditional Werthers candies.

We love this version of checkers in my house!  The original checkers is a great strategy game, and its simple enough for young children (unlike Chess or Risk or more complicated games).  I think the game of checkers can teach important skills to kids about thinking ahead, planning, and using patience to implement a strategy.  However, the plain, basic checkers game often seems boring to kids.  This game of Cupcake Checkers introduces colors and other fun aspects (popping dice and candles for kinging) so that kids feel like they are playing a fun kids game.  At the same time, the game retains many of its original elements so that it continues to be a great learning tool (and fun for adults too).  All in all, this is a great game for kids.  My 4.5 year old loves it.

These diapers are soft, flexible, and absorbent. I also really like that they are completely white without any cartoon characters or other designs on them. They look more classy as a result, at least to the extent that a diaper can look classy. I would say though, that these diapers have a similar feel and texture to high-quality disposable diapers. They seem to feel very much like the pampers that I usually use, so I am not sure that the added cost makes sense in this context. I do like using a product that is a bit more environmentally friendly though.

This is a nice dish towel that is very absorbent. I like the pattern of the stripes as well, but my one issue is that the light background color is a little bit too yellowy for my taste. It ends up looking a bit dirty, even when it is completely new and clean.

This training sippy cup is the only one my baby will accept.  He drinks out of Avent bottles normally, and Ive been trying to get him to learn to take a sippy cup since hes 13 months old now.  Until this one, he rejected every cup Ive tried.  I used this one with the nipple attachment for awhile to get him used to it, and then I tricked him one day by switching to the sippy cup attachment, and it worked.  He didnt love it, but he did drink a bit from the cup.  Baby steps

I appreciate that these gummy vitamins include high-quality ingredients and bio-available forms of vitamins.  The DHA is made from anchovies and sardines, which is a sustainable source that is generally low in mercury.  However, there are certain key nutrients lacking here, notably calcium and iron.  Also, there are a host of minerals that are absent (e.g. magnesium).  That means that to truly get everything you need from a multi-vitamin, youll need to take another one to supplement what is in these gummies.  As for the flavor, I find these to be rather vitamin-y tasting, leaving an unpleasant aftertaste in my mouth.  Further, the serving size is 6 gummies, which add up to 50 calories.  If you were to eat an additional 50 calories per day without adjusting downwards your calorie intake, you would gain more than 7 pound per year.  No thank you!

This is a slender but substantial novel of ideas that is structured as a series of ten encounters or conversations over the course of a week in Athens.  The narrator is a writer who travels to Athens to make some extra money by teaching a writing seminar.  Through conversations on the plane, with friends, a fellow teacher, and her students, life is explored in all its many facets.  The biggest topics of conversation include relationships and all the many types of failure.  I found highlight-worthy ideas on nearly every page of this novel.  It's very heady (i.e. for the head) and seems a bit cold and detached (like the narrator herself).  Nevertheless, the novel is beautifully written, thought-provoking, and structurally daring.

OOSILK Sleep Mask, 100% Mulberry Silk Eye Mask, 100% Silk Filling, Hypoallergenic, Facial Beauty, Adjustable (1, Black)Sometimes I like to take a nap in the afternoon, when possible. Well, its usually still pretty bright and not having blackout curtains I cant get my bedroom dark enough. This eye mask solves that problem and is very soft and comfortable, too boot.Made from 100% Silk it is extremely soft and smooth. It is held on my and adjustable elastic strap. I adjusted it so it was slightly snug but not tight. I didnt want to be distracted by a too tight feeling. When you have it adjusted to your liking it gently envelops you in total darkness. It feels like sleeping at night. This is what you want and the silk feels so great on tour face. I absolutely love this mask and it serves my purpose perfectly. This will make a great holiday gift or stocking stuffer and its beautifully packaged already with a ribbon.This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review.

Scharffen Berger Tasting Squares Assortment Gift Jar, 21.16 OunceThis four flavor assortment of wonderful chocolate squares will make a great gift for the holidays or the chocolate lover in your life. It is delivered in a beautiful display/serving jar with a brown, chocolate brown, ribbon. It is beautifully packaged for travel on delivery trucks. It is essentially secured in a cardboard brace and floats in the packing box. Its going to arrive in fine shape.For reference heres my rundown of the four flavors in the jar:Milk 41% Cacao; Soft to the bite, melts fairly rapidly and has a wonderful mouth feel. I feel no bitterness and just a very smooth chocolaty velvet in my mouth. A slight caramel note is there too.Semisweet 62% Cacao; A harder bite than Milk. It melts a touch slower and we are entering the dark realm. It is not as rich on the tongue but rather seems to make itself known further back in your mouth. An almost woodsy note and an excellent entry to dark chocolate if youre uses to standard supermarket candy bars.Bittersweet 70% Cacao; Bites a little softer than the semisweet, and melts a little smoother. It envelops your tongue with a joyous chocolate sensation. My favorite as Im sequentially tasting with palate cleansing and breaks. So far this one has the most intense chocolate feel and best texture and purest taste.Extra Dark 82%; This one has a hard bite and slow melt. Very intense dark taste. A hint of a burnt note that is pleasant. I taste a hint of cherry/fruit in the chocolate. It feels as if its going to the sides of your mouth as it melts. Contrary to the percentage I get a burst of sweetness as it is finished melting in my mouth. Maybe the most intense experience of the four varieties.I totally enjoyed tasting the four flavors and think the recipient will just be blown over. This is the gift for a chocolate lover.

San Francisco 49ers Stapler, NFL, Swingline 747, Staples 25 SheetsI still dont get why most staplers, including this one, dont come preloaded with a row of staples. Would it kill them to spring for a row, a half row? If you want to use this right away, be sure to have some staples ready to go. This is a nice stapler and it is available in all the NFL team colors and logo. So as the Football season gets into the Red-Zone you can be ready to root for your team at the office.It is an all steel constructed body sitting on a rubber base to protect your desk. It is very heavy duty and feels like a top quality build. It will go through 25 sheets but isnt power driven, you need to push down hard. It can be opened for flat tacking and you can spin the anvil for the flat open staple shape. It also has a peek hole to see when you are running low on staples. This is a top notch office product and a must have gift for the football fan in your life. Other than the missing staples, this is a great stapler with team pride.This Vine review product was not free but attained for a tax liability charge.

iMobi4 Apple Watch Stand Docking Station & iPhone Holder Dual CradleI have a major problem with this charging stand. I ran into the same design flaw in another wooden stand from a different company. The space where the charging disk for the Apple Watch goes is both too tight and has no access hole from beneath to push up on the disk to remove it. This leads to a trapped disk and the only way to remove it is pull very hard on the cable or chisel away at the area around the disk or in my case with the wooden stand, both. I would up cosmetically ruining my charger that came with my Sport Watch. I bought a replacement from the Apple web site and the one the sent is ringed in chrome. This makes it ever so slightly wider which leads to the iMobi4 stand.It is made of plastic and lined with a soft material at the circle top. It is impossible to easily put in the disk. I reported this to the company and was instructed to push harder. I know where that goes and Im not damaging or destroying a second charger. This is a failed product. From my experience, if you do not see a finger hole below where the disk will seat, do not buy it. I do not recommend this product or any stand without an access hole.This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review.

Pomarks 4in1 Multi-function Business Pen, 32GB OTG USB Flash Drive with Micro USB Port, Stylus & Ballpoint Pen & Flash Light  BlackThis is a very good gift for the technology geek in your life. This pen does about everything this person would love to have all in one compact device. First its a pen (with a refill) for those times when you actually have to write something. Then its a stylus for use on your phone or tablet and thats going to be used more than the pen, for sure. Next its a thumb drive with 32GB of storage. Its double sided so it connects to a MicroUSB port or a standard port. Its also a LED flashlight. Could it do anymore? I think not, but it certainly does enough.It comes in black or white for your styling choice, mine is the black one and Im uploading a bunch of pictures. Like I mentioned it comes with an extra pen refill. I wish the stylus tip was replaceable but hopefully it will last a good long time. If it came with more refills, or a link to where more can be bought and a replaceable stylus, this would be perfect. Still, with the upcoming holiday season, as I write this, its beautifully packaged and will make a great gift. Its just beautiful too.This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review.

Codream Micro Perforated Stainless Steel Colander 5 Quart with HandlesI love my new colander. Ive been using plastic ones which the truth be said are on the flimsy side. This is a solid stainless steel colander and it is big and it is tough. It is wide with a large circular base so it is very stable in the sink. My main uses are for washing produce and straining pasta. It did those jobs perfectly. I took pictures of me washing grapes, Im posting them. The handles on the sides are big and easy to grip with or without kitchen gloves on. The massive amount of holes makes for quick draining but is more durable then the mesh type.It is a very fine addition to any kitchen and it will serve you well. The quality of construction is excellent. It isnt heavy at all, for its size. It is made entirely of 18/10 stainless steel so it will keep its good looks, long term. I think you will enjoy using this colander and do recommend it.This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review.

Jabra Eclipse HeadsetThe first thing I did was plug the charger in and made sure it and the headset were fully charged. In the box you get the charging dock, the headset, three more different sized gels, a MicroUSB charging cable and all the paperwork. When you then press the button on the bottom of the charger and put the headset in your ear, you are instructed to go to your phones Bluetooth menu and the pairing happens easily. All this worked well. I was also instructed to download the Jabra app. I did that and went through the settings and updated the firmware. Here you will also find the full manual and the ability to change the talking language of the headset.This is a very impressive Bluetooth headset, I just wished it worked better. It is unique in its design in that there are no buttons to press to do things. Instead, you get to tap the logo area ion the microphone bar. Great I thought, just tap or double tap to answer a call, summon Siri (I have an iPhone) or some other features. I tapped and tapped and sometimes I got one tap right and heard the lady tell me the battery level. Then I had success and actually got two taps right, Siri came up and I had her make a call. I called a friend and started testing the voice quality. At first my friend sounded very good and clear. Then after a while he was complaining of my voice digitizing. Then a little later he was digitizing on my side. We called back and forth and I went out of my home to change location. The digitizing continued until I placed the Eclipse back in the dock and went to the iPhone directly. Our connection was good the Eclipse was the source. It didnt happen all the time but was annoying enough to make it troublesome to use. Compound that with the wonky tapping system, the volume controlled by your phone not the device in your ear and always having to carry the charger to be able to turn it off. Im a bit frustrated.This should be a much better more reliable headset, Jabra has a good reputation. I just dont think this is as good as the price level deems it be. I think you may want to look further.Amazon Vine provided this demo unit for a tax liability fee, it is not free as listed in the green description.

Syllable D700 Bluetooth 4.1 in Ear HeadsetsI previously tested a similar headset to these. For whatever reason these sound better and fit me better, maybe a revision? They looked identical but seemingly arent. I was able to get a good fit for my ears and having three sets of buds helped. I liked that it came with three sizes. I got all the volume loudness I could hope for, high enough for pain, but I could level off to a good loud level. If you are getting a tinny sound you need to reseat the buds. They need to really seal in your ear canal. Once they do you get a rich and deep sound. Very good for this price point. Experiment with positioning and the different sized buds. I like the ear-hook design for stability on the ears. Also included is a MicroUSB short cable for charging.It comes in a nice package suitable for gifting. It certainly will make a great stocking stuffer for the upcoming season. I think these are a very good value.This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review.

Syllable A6 Necklace Neckband Running Wireless Bluetooth EarbudsThese earbuds are a decent performer but has some exclusions I have trouble overlooking. First the good. These earbuds are well built and have some unique features. The first one is the magnetic section that opens up to reveal the MicroUSB charging port. You open the magnet to wrap the cable cord around your neck. The earbuds go up to your ears and the control dongle/mic rests on your upper chest area. It wears fairly comfortable but this leads to my first issue. There is only one set of earbud covers included. So many now at least include three sets of different sizes I have to note this as an omission. If you usually use the mid-sized set you should be OK as they fit me and thats what I usually use. If you change out the normal standard ones you may want to look elsewhere.I then tested the sound quality and it was reasonably good for this price point. My second problem is here, I could not get the volume to increase to a loud level. Ive not had this issue in a long time and thought it might be my iPhone at first. I tested with another BT set and it was loud. The music I listened to sounded good but I always wanted more. I made some phone calls and for that it was loud enough. Its a generic Bluetooth and isnt specific to iPhone so I couldnt summon Siri but its not designed for that. If you have an iOS device you may want a more compatible set. Even so it worked for the basics of answering and disconnecting calls.Overall this is a decent but flawed earbud set. If the limitations dont phase you it has some unique features that are good.This product was provided at or nearly no cost for the purpose of evaluation and review.

OtterBox DEFENDER iPhone 6 Plus/6s Plus Case - Frustration-Free Packaging - BLACKI have an iPhone 6 Plus and previously tried the Otterbox Defender for it. I totally hated it and was hoping against hope that some revisions would be made to the version for the 6S+/6+ combo version. Sadly I cant see or feel any difference. Yes its very protective but it makes my 6+ feel even more gigantic than it actually is. If there is any difference it is only microscopic as the case is rated for both phones. I was so hoping it would be slimmed down yet still be protective. I still feel the space between the screen and the plastic cover. I never had any of these issues with the Defender for my iPhone 5. That one was trim and tight compared to this series. Im very sad. Im quoting my previous review as nothing has changed and I see no reason to say anything different other than the color is different and the packaging is a Frustration Free cardboard box that was more difficult to open than the standard Otterbox box.>>>I have had Otterbox Defenders on my iPhones since the 4. I like to trade in my phones after two years and want them to be as pristine as can be and those Defenders did their job very well. Now I have an iPhone 6+ and was disappointed that unlike my 5 the Defender was not ready to go on day one. I was also disheartened to learn that the 6+ Defender was going to cost seventy dollars? Thats twenty more than the regular Defender for the 6 or 5 or 4. {Its down to a more reasonable $60 list price}  Most Defenders come out at about the fifty dollar price point so Otterbox must be using gold infused silicon to make up the twenty dollar difference for what is essentially an extra ounce or two of plastic. Seems exorbitant to me. Luckily the price is dropping and Amazon had the Glacier color for thirty seven dollars, a much more reasonable price. My iPhone in the case weighs just under 10 ounces. But what really gets me is the size. It makes the 6+ huge! Oxymoronic, I know, but there is a tunnel leading to the speaker at the bottom, a tunnel. I know you can drop the iPhone from staggering heights and it will survive but my iPhone 5 was intentionally thrown across a room with a hard floor and no damage. That Defender was darn near svelte compared to this one and was very very protective.This version is curvier and I think thats why there is extra bulk. The covers on the ports are all curved and make for deep pockets to get through. Though I see that just about any connector will get access to the headphone jack and thats a good thing. Another improvement I can see from my 5 series is how the belt clip latches to the case. The old way was to latch through the silicone to the plastic, which wound up wearing out the silicone and Otterbox replaced a skin for me that became ugly. Now there is a notch in the silicon letting the snap pass right over the silicone and latch into the hard plastic. That should make for a cleaner and long term good looking edge.I have a lot of problems with this new case and dont think Im going to keep it. That will be the first Defender I didnt love and keep. First up, and many have said this, the screen protector is a nightmare. It rests above the screen and absolutely kills sensitivity of the screen and Ive been making more mistakes since I put on the case. An easy example is; start the Facebook app and try to quickly scroll down the list of posts. You can see the screen stop even as you are swiping on the screen. There is no contact to give the command. Typing is a pain and leaves way too much for Auto-Correct to handle.  There is also much more reflectivity and finger print smearing then the naked screen or when I had a glass shield on it. I had to remove the glass to fit the Defender. In a somewhat related problem, there is a double cover over the home button which doesnt let you feel the feedback of clicking the button. Also the area seems to especially like to attract air bubbles. So the button looks weird. Amazingly it can read my fingerprint just fine, so thats good.All three buttons are covered with button bumps on the main silicone body. The silicone is much stiffer than the 5 series I had previously. That makes for a very difficult button press.
