It's really easy to toggle between which weight I want the scale to measure in, after pushing the button initially to the right of the screen to turn it on, I just push the button again to change the read out of the weight.The scale comes with a battery I to insert in the back of the handle by sliding off the white end piece, sliding in the battery with the flat side up, and then sliding the battery cap back on to snap in place. The luggage scale I ordered came with a plastic luggage tag as well, which has a ID tag that I can slide out from the left side of the tag, and write my information on the paper, then slide it back into the tag. I really like that the window of the ID tag only shows my name, and doesn't expose my other personal information that I'd rather not share with others traveling that may glance at the tag. Overall, I really enjoy this digital luggage scale. It's easy to use, works well, and it's the perfect size to put in the front pouch of my carry on bag for when I need to check, and recheck the weight of my bags.Purchased at a reduced cost for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

This 20800mah portable power bank is unrealistically impressive! I am truly in awe at the output and power this power bank has. Let me start of by saying, I have a few large power banks, and I also have an ipad 3 that for some reason, my ipad 3 takes a long time to charge with a wall charger and no power bank has ever charged my ipad past 50% charged before the power bank needed recharged again, until now. Not only did this power bank fully charge my ipad 3 from at the point where it wouldn't power on to 100% charged, I was able to charge my iphone 6 from 1% to 25% afterwards before this power bank needed recharged again!I charged this power bank over night with the provided usb cable, then in a weeks time, I charged my iphone 6 five times, using the dual usb ports on the power bank, my old iphone 4 and my husbands old iphone 4s twice to full charge while running video apps on both of them, both my sons and my ipod 4 at the same time twice to full charge, and after all that, this power bank still had 2 LED lights fully lit (50% charged). This would be awesome to take on a camping trip with us!This power bank also has an LED flashlight that sits just below the charging port on the front that shines really bright to see my way in the dark, and has 4 LED lights on the top black surface to indicate the amount of power it has. Above the 4 LED lights is a button that if pushed once illuminates the 4 LED lights, or to work the flashlight just hold the button down for a few seconds. I really like the soft cloth pouch to carry the power bank around, as the power bank fits in it well and also has room in it to add my charging cable for my iphone 6, as well as the cable to charge the power bank itself. I like the feel of this power bank on the outside, it's easy to grip and I haven't dropped it once while using it. It is on the larger side, but so well worth it for the amount of power and charges this power bank puts out. I definitely recommend this power bank!Purchased at a reduced cost for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

This is a lovely little tea pot! I love trying different flower teas and loose leaf teas, and enjoy a good cup of tea to relax. I have some different tea strainers to make one cup of tea at a time or even an entire pot, but this one is definitely very unique to me.There wasn't instructions that came with this tea pot, but after looking it over for less than a minute, it's pretty straight forward on how to use it. There is a plastic tea strainer cup in the center of the glass tea pot, that I twisted counter clockwise to separate it from the tea pot. I put in one of my tea flower and then pour hot water in it. After a few minutes of letting the tea steep to my liking, I screwed the plastic strainer/infuser back onto the glass tea pot, pushed the red button on the top of the black cap and the tea streamed out into the tea pot. It was that easy!The strainer is large enough to hold about 4 ounces of water, so  I added more hot water into the strainer when I wanted more of the tea to drink. I also tried this with a lavender loose leaf tea I have, and when done steeping, neither the tea flower nor the loose leaf tea fell through into the tea pot after pushing the button to strain the tea. I don't particularly mind the smaller size of this strainer, as I don't always want a large cup of tea to drink. However, the glass tea pot will actually hold 16 ounces, so if I wanted a full pot of tea, there is plenty of room in the strainer area to add more loose leaf tea, let it steep longer to get a strong infusion, and then add more hot water to the tea pot itself once the strainer is drained. I can then either remove the strainer or just let it sit in the tea pot as is.When done with drinking tea, this tea pot and strainer was really easy to clean. I am not sure if it's dishwasher safe, but I just rinsed it clean in my kitchen since, and set it on the counter to air dry. Overall, I really love this tea pot, and yes, the little red button is fun to push and watch the tea strain out, but unlike any tea infuser/strainer I have, this strainer does not leak when taking it out of the tea pot itself. There is definitely a no mess, no fuss tea pot set. I would definitely recommend for people who enjoy loose leaf and flower tea.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

Loving these solar string lights! I am going away for the holidays, and wanted something to go around my windows while away so it looks like someone is home, especially at night. I didn't want to have to use a timer, nor did I want to have something plugged into an electrical outlet while away.These solar string lights are small in size, and are placed on a thin, clear wire that reminds me a bit of fishing line. The wire didn't look really strong at first, but it held up well to my moving it around, and tugging/pulling on it. I wanted to test this set of string lights out well before I needed them, to see that the solar panel worked over a weeks time, and also that the lights would continue to work.The solar panel has a clear plastic film on it to protect the panel, that peels off easily before using it. On the back is a sturdy plastic holder where you can mount the panel onto a wall or removable plastic spike to put it in the ground. I decided to spike this solar panel into the ground, which goes down almost seven inches to keep it still. I like that the mount on the back move the solar panel to the left or right side of the spike without having to move the entire spike so it faces the correct path of the sun. I stretched these string lights out the length of my pathway in the front of the house at night, after leaving the solar panel out in the sun for the day. Although they didn't give off a strong enough light to illuminate the entire pathway, it did give off enough to stay on the path without the need of another light outside.On the back of the panel is an on/off button to toggle between the lights settings, push once for steady on, push again to turn them off, again to have them come on and blinking, and push again to turn them off entirely. I love these string lights will go off when it sense daylight, and comes on when it's night to save the energy left in the solar panel, and there is no need for me to set a timer or use an electrical outlet with this set. However, I'd be aware of where they are placed depending on what their intended use is, as when I brought them under my porch light at night, and my son turned the outside porch light on, the string lights went off, and after turning the porch light off the string lights came back on again. Overall I am very pleased with these lights for my intended use. I am a big fan of solar energy, and these string lights work very well for my needs!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I ordered these swim goggles for my nephew, who just turned 4 years old and has been taking swim lessons over the summer. He hasn't been using goggles so far because he hasn't liked the few my sister has tried on him, and you can see the chlorine has been irritating his eyes by the slight redness of them after swim lessons.These goggles have a thick silicone band that go around the back of the head to reduce the pull on kids hair while putting them on, taking them off and wearing them, as well as keeping them more securely in place during use. The have a clear film to protect the lenses over the front of the goggles that peel off easily before first use. The back of the goggle lenses are outlined in a soft, flexible silicone to keep the water out of the eyes and the lenses in place while swimming to keep the water out. I like that these goggles have a flexible nose piece, as not all kids have the same size nose, and they can easily be used for a longer time as the kids grow. There are two clips, one on each side, where you can adjust the strap to fit snug around the head. I had my son, who is 11 yrs old, test these goggles for comfort level as well as to see if he can see clearly under water, and if they keep the water out of his eyes. My son does swim competitions so he's worn a lot of goggles, and is really picky when it comes to goggles. These goggles were a little too small to fit him perfectly, they did suction cup well around his eyes to keep the water out why swimming around, and he said they were fairly comfortable to wear. He was able to see clearly under water as well without the lenses blurring or fogging up.Although the goggles do not appeal much to my 11 yr old with the cute dolphins on top, my nephew just loves them and wanted to wear them everywhere. They stayed on his head well and didn't slip off, and the nose piece worked for him without needing adjustments. They come in a nice clear carrying case to keep the goggles clean and the lenses safe from scratches. My sister and nephew are just thrilled with these goggles. I would recommend them for kids 3 yrs old up to about 9 yrs old for comfortable fit and wear.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I ordered these for my two nieces who are 5 yrs and 8 yrs old, and taking swimming lessons over the summer. Both of their hair is about shoulder length and the one older one models professionally. Keeping her hair in great condition and away from the harm of the chlorine from swimming is ideal for both the girls as it can really dry out their hair.I like that these silicone swim caps come in a two pack, which I have in the girl colors, pink and purple. One of my nieces loves pink and one loves purple so it works out great for them. To test these swim caps before giving them to my nieces to use I brought them along with us to the end of the year swim club pool party and asked the girls of the swim team to give me their opinions of them. All three girls, ages 6, 8, and 16 put their hair in a pony tail, and then held the front of the cap close to their fore head, while someone else pulled it up over their head and to the back of their necks. The girls thought that these swim caps fit really nice on their head, and they really liked the sides of these swim caps because there is extra room for their ears and not so much pressure on them. The swim caps kept their hair dry while swimming in the pool and they didn't have any trouble taking them off afterwords.I like these swim caps have a little design around the edges of the caps to make them look a bit more appealing to wear and look nicer going around their faces, instead of that straight line that is usually around the edge of swim caps. I didn't notice an odor when opening up this bag of swim caps, but when putting them up to my nose individually I got a small hint of silicone smell. This smell, of course, dissipated after being used in the pool. Overall, these are great swim caps for my nieces to use to keep their hair dry and their ears comfortable.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

The old saying "don't put all your eggs in one basket" is what came to mind while ordering this dictionary book safe. I wanted this for my son to keep his money inside of instead of the standard piggy bank. He's 11 years old, and now instead of toys often gets money as gifts for his birthday and Christmas from relatives. Like most boys, he has a close circle of friends and then makes new friends on and off. He usually just sits his money on his dresser in his room, and I'd like to think that no one would touch it, but now a days you just don't know. With kids going in and out of the house all day long, I thought it would just be better to have a place for him to keep it safe and away from temptation of others.The feel of this book safe is really nice, because it actually has a cloth exterior to it, and looks and feels like a real book even down the the inside realistic cover!  It comes with two keys to open the safe inside, which I really enjoy so my son can keep one, and I can keep one in case he misplaces his at some point. The safe inside is a sturdy steel metal box that easily holds off of his dollar bills, and a few extra items he feels needs to be in there for safe keeping. I have tugged hard on the metal door when locked shut and it didn't open. I've stuck this on our bookshelf along with other books, and I think it blends in with the rest of the books beautifully! Love it!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

Great 6 inch beach balls to play with and have fun! We took these to the pool with us for a end of season swim club fun and all the kids had a great time with them in the pool and outside the pool. Every so often the lifeguards ask to clear the pool for safety reasons for about ten minutes, and this gave the kids something fun and easy to do while they waited to go back into the water. All of them stayed inflated and kept their shape through the entire evening, in and out of the pool.These mini beach balls come with a few different designs and patterns on them, including smiley faces, rainbow, pastel, clown fish, sea turtle, blue hawaiian, and pink flamingo, so there was enough variety to please the entire crowd of kids. These are the kind you need to squeeze a little on the valve you blow into to blow them up, but even the smaller kids were able to do that easily with one big breath. Once inflated the valve can be pushed down flush with the beach ball so it doesn't stick up while playing with them. Each ball comes individually wrapped in a clear plastic bag so they are easy to give as party favors individually as well. So much fun!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I often like to listen to music while I am cleaning my house, but not always does my son want to hear my music. I am not a big fan of earbuds, but thought I would give these bluetooth ones by Mosiso a try. After charging them initially for a few hours with the provided usb cable, it was time to check them out.I often like to see if I can figure out how to work items without reading the instructions first, and although it took me a second or two to find the button to pair these earphones with my iphone 6, I did find the small button on the inside of the right earphone. After holding the button for a few seconds, a little LED light came on that switched from blue to red and finally stayed blue once paired with my iphone 6. The earbuds themselves have a soft, flexible and comfortable black silicone piece that are removable, and the set comes with three different sizes to fit different sized ears. I had removed the round silicone piece that were on them by giving them a slight pull, and then changed to the smallest pair, which fit in my ears nicely. There is also a neon blue silicone piece that reminds me somewhat of a waffle in a tear drop shape behind the earbuds, which at first I wasn't sure how that worked, but found as I put the earbuds in my ears the neon blue silicone just sort of melted/molded to the shape of my ear keeping the earbud comfortably in place. There are three different sizes of the blue silicone piece to change to fit just about any ear size.I didn't think these earbuds would stay in my ears as I cleaned around the house, as they felt light as a feather, but didn't even budge the three hours I cleaned. These earphones have a flat neon blue cord that is about a foot and a half long that connects them. Now, normally I would have put this behind my head and underneath my hair, but I had the cord instead in front of me and it didn't interfere with my moving around or get caught by my hands to make the earphones come out at all. I left my iphone sit in the middle of my house and had no issues with keeping the bluetooth connection.On the right earphone piece there is an L shaped button that runs along the top and the side to turn the volume up and down easily, however, when I went to adjust the volume, I accidentally hit the button on the bottom of the right ear piece, which controls taking calls on my iphone, and it called the last number I dialed unintentionally. Since it called a friend I decided to test the quality of the mic while making calls, and she said she could hear me just fine, and I had no trouble hearing what she said either the few minutes we talked.The only thing I didn't like about these bluetooth earphones is that the earbud piece that sits inside the ear doesn't move, and therefore I can not switch the earphones the other way around if I wanted to, and wear the right in the left ear. I am left handed, and would prefer to have the controls on the left side instead of the right side. Regardless, I gave these bluetooth earphones a 5 star rating, I didn't need the instructions to use them easily, and because not only is the quality of sound coming from them great, but there was a construction crew taking down a wooden garage piece by piece behind my house, and I did not hear anything but music while wearing these earphones.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

When giving gifts, for some reason what to put them in or wrap them with is always a last minute thought for me. Usually that means I am running to the store for a gift bag or wrapping paper, and don't always remember to buy tissue paper to stuff in the bag as well.This is a nice pack of neon colored paper party bags. Since it comes with 12 in all, and two of each color I'm bound to have enough to last for a while for just about any occasion. These bags measure 9 inches tall, and a bit over 7 inches wide, so there is plenty of room to fit a small gift inside and have room to add a card too. There are 2 of each color, orange, purple, yellow, green, red, and blue, and I like that these party bags have rope cord handles, as I have tossed a gift into a paper party bag with paper handles and they have broke at the handle, not a nice way to give a gift. On one side of the rope handle is a flat paper square that matches the color of the bag on one side, and is white on the other side to write a note or name onto.Also included is a pack of 15 sheets of white tissue paper. For paper these bags are rather sturdy feeling, and they stand up well on their own with their flat bottoms. These will be nice when I'm traveling on an airplane to see family, as they won't take up much room in my suitcase since they fold up flat, as TSA rules do not allow travel with a wrapped gift.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I really like this men's leather flip tri fold wallet. My husband was in need of a new wallet, as his is falling apart. He prefers a leather wallet over nylon or other material, and something rather simple and easy to use as well.This leather wallet came in thin but soft, foam pouch to keep the leather protected. When taking it out of the pouch it has that nice, new leather smell. The black leather is extremely soft and smooth and the fine stitching that goes all around the edges of the wallet are straight and nicely done. When opening it up on the left side are three slots for store cards, credit cards, or other cards of that size, and underneath is enough room to slide a few more cards if needed. There is a middle see through pocket that moves from right to left and is attached, that will fit my husbands work ID on one side, and his drivers license on the other side. On the right side of the wallet is another see through pocket to hold a picture of our son. This wallet doesn't have any slots for pictures other than the one, but we have a plastic insert that can be slide under the right side pocket to add more pictures if he wanted to.My favorite part is that this wallet has two soft lined bill compartments in the back. We're going to head to Europe to visit family for the holidays, and my husband will be carrying both currency for the US and for Europe. Having a place to keep both currencies separated is a big plus for us! There is also enough room for receipts to keep in the back as we're traveling to keep track of all our purchases. Overall, we're both really happy with the look and feel of this wallet. It's functional and will work wonderful for my husbands needs!Purchased at a reduced cost for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

This French Lavender Essential oil by Sun Organic is my favorite of all the lavender essential oils I have tried! I am a big fan of the lavender scent, and the smell right out of the bottle is heavenly! Some lavender essential oils are pretty strong smelling, even when used in a diffuser, but this one is not over powering at all.I placed a few drops in my diffuser that is filled with water, and set it in the bathroom yesterday after my son commented I probably didn't want to use the bathroom after he just did. After a few minutes this lovely scent came drifting down the hall way and into the living room. Instead of the usual strong lavender smell that can get a bit over powering, this french lavender reminds me more of a fresh linen smell with a hint of lavender in it. I ordered this french lavender essential oil in a 2 ounce bottle, which doesn't seem like much, but in reality I only need a few drops to add to the water in the diffuser to get a great lovely scent throughout my house, and it will last me quite a long time. Please note, I have only used this as an aromatherapy oil in my diffuser, and would not recommend using it as a therapeutic (on the skin, or ingesting) oil.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I ordered this 10 LED 180 Lumen Solar Motion Lights for my sister, who sometimes comes home late from puppy training classes with her dog. While the dog sees well to go up her front steps in the dark, she often stumbles her way up them with dog leash in hand. There isn't a light pole from the street near by or one at the end of her yard to light her way, and I thought this would be a perfect fit for her.This LED solar light came in an instructional manual, a pin to change the settings on the light itself, and some screws to be able to mount the light outside. The light has a clear plastic film on the solar panel at the top, and the LED lights at the bottom front to keep them protected, which were easy to remove. Before giving it to her to use, I tested it at my home to see that it works well. I put it out in my porch to get some sun during the day time, and then once dark I was able to use the provided pin to change the settings on the LED wall light. This was really easy to do. The hole to change the settings is located on the front of the panel by the motion sensor button, and I've also provided a picture for a visual guide. It has three settings, one to keep the light on all the time, one to change to motion sensor mode, and one to completely shut the light off. I left it on the sensor mode, as her neighbors probably wouldn't appreciate it on all the time.The light comes on when it senses movement in a 10 foot (3 meters) radius around it, and testing this outside it worked really well. After about 30 seconds of non movement, the light will go off on it's own. There is a wooden railing beside her steps that my sister attached this light to, and she found it really easy to attach the light by herself, and didn't run into any problems. The brightness is most excellent for her to see up all her steps, up her pathway a bit, and even over to her neighbors steps as well. She had thought initially she would need four lights, one for each step she has, but was so please to see this one LED light was enough to see the entire area and more. She's had this LED light installed for a few days now, and even though her front steps only gets the morning sun, it is enough to charge this LED light to shine brightly each and every night she's had it. Her and I both are absolutely thrilled with this LED wall light! I would definitely recommend this light!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

My niece, who is 5, will be starting her first day of school this fall. She is so excited and can not wait for summer to be over! To make her school days, especially the first day, feel more special I order her this Disney Frozen Backpack, by Ruz, with Elsa, Anna and Olaf the front of it. Right away she fell in love with this backpack, as most girls would.This is a large 16 inch backpack so it is a slightly big looking on her right now, although she didn't really notice and was strutting around the house with it on. The straps that go around her shoulders are a light blue, with purple edging. The are very well padded, and wide enough to where it won't dig into her shoulders and hurt her skin like some of the older kids have with the drawstring bags. We were able to adjust it so it fits her well enough to wear comfortably with little effort.There are two front pockets. The top pocket is large enough to fit her pencils, erasers, markers, crayons, and also her "makeup" as she likes to call it, a must and essential for big girl school she says. Both of these front pockets have one easy glide zipper pull. The front bottom pocket is large enough to fit a pair of shorts and a top for her gym clothes, and a small notebook as well. There two mesh pockets, one on either side of this bag, for her to carry a water bottle, and some juice for her lunch. Then there is a larger pocket in the middle of the backpack, that can fit all her homework, books, and school notes from the teacher, as well as her lunch and a light jacket. I like that this larger pocket has a double zipper pull that glides easily across the bag, so she can open and close it from either end and be ready for class to start quickly. It has nice stitching around the edges, and is very durable. It should last her many years through school. Overall, this backpack has made my niece really happy and she can not wait to go to school with it on!Purchased at a reduced cost for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I love the scent of this Lemon Essential oil by Sun Organic. It smells just like the lemon zest I use from a fresh lemon while baking up something good to eat. I like to use this in my diffuser when the air in my house smells a bit stale and not so fresh, mostly in the winter time when the windows aren't opened to let in fresh air. I don't care much for the plastic dropper that came with this oil, as it was bent upon arrival and seems to be a one time use dropper, but I have some glass droppers around the house I used instead. I am no expert on essential oils, and in fact only begun using them recently. I've been reading about how to test if it's a true EO or if it's synthetic, by adding a drop to white paper, then if it's leaves a residue after evaporation it's not a true EO, but rather a synthetic made oil. After doing a paper test, this lemon oil did leave a residue on the paper days after evaporation. Because of that, I would do your own research before using this oil to see if this is the one for you.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I ordered this active mesh tank top for my son, who is 11 years old and a very active boy. He gets sweaty a lot in the summer time and enjoys muscle shirts as well. Looking at the size charting on the page site, I order this mesh tank top in a size 14, which my son usually wears a 12 on the top, but thought I'd order it a little bigger after reading some of the reviews that were already posted.I like the feel of this shirt, for a mesh material it is soft, light weight and my son said the material feels comfortable against his skin. All of the seams of this shirt have a great zig zag stitching that is nicely done, including around the arm pit and neck areas. I ordered this shirt in blue, and the color that arrived is in between a medium and sky blue, which is a very nice color on my son.The only thing that needs adjusting is the size chart for ordering. A size 14 on the size chart has 14  L(14-16)  (Age)11-12 Years  (height) 61-63  (waist)26.5-28, my son is 56 inches tall, and has a 28 inch waist. The length of this shirt fit him perfectly, and also around his mid section, but if he were any taller it would have been too short on him. Also, it was somewhat tight fitting around his arm pits and the neckline, which he said wasn't very comfortable. I'm not quite sure, as I don't have one in a size 16 if that would alleviate the tight fit of around the neckline and armpit area. While nicely made and the quality of the material is there for this shirt, I would recommend ordering in 2 sizes larger than one would normally wear. Had the size of the shirt I received matched the size of the chart, this would have received a 5 star rating.Purchased at a reduced cost for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

We have own an old house, and with that comes an old pair of cement steps outside coming up the front pathway. I'm often worried about someone tripping as their isn't a light out there to see with when it's dark outside. I've tried some landscaping lights that go into the ground and while they light up the pathway well, they do not light the stairs up well enough. Also, I find my dogs trip over them quite often while running in the yard and knock them over, and my husband isn't fond of going around these landscaping lights with the lawn mower either.This solar powered LED motion sensor wall light by Elivebuy is just what I was looking for and works well for my needs. It was really easy to attach the wall light to my wooden mailbox post with the screws provided. The mailbox is close to the steps and the sun shines from early afternoon and a good part of the evening hours. There is a plastic film that needs removed from the front led panel and also the top of the wall light where the solar panel sits.I figured this wall light was pretty straight forward to use, and didn't read the instructions that comes with this wall light at first. My mistake, as there is a pin hole beside the motion sensor light on the front to change the settings of the light. One push with the pin provided on the wall light sets the wall light to on with sensor mode, another push to keep the light on all the time, and yet another to turn it all off completely.While the light is on sensor mode, it turns on whenever it detects movement in a 3 meter (10 feet) area around the wall light. My mailbox isn't far from the steps, so I was very happy the light detected my movement from the bottom step and illuminated the stairs and the landing by the mailbox very well for me to be able to see in the dark. After about 30 seconds of no motion sensed this wall light shut off on it's own. We've had a lot of thunderstorms here lately, and this LED wall light doesn't seem to have an issue with getting wet and continues to work each time. Overall, I'm happy with this light. It's easy to install, use, and works well to light up my steps out front.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

This 13000mAh portable charger by Staroc is incredible and an impressive power bank! Between my husband, son, and myself we own a lot of portable electronics that charges via usb. We're also on the go a lot and always bring a lot of our electronics with us, but not always are we near an outlet to charge them.I ordered this power bank in white and green, which I enjoy as it is a different look from the other black power banks I own. When it arrived I pushed the power button on the side and the four LED lights on the side of the power bank lit up to show it was fully charged, excellent! My iphone 6 was at 12% battery and needed a charge. This power bank comes with a short charging cable for charging the power bank, so I used the lightning cable that came with my iphone 6 to charge the phone. It went from 12% to a full charge in a little over an hour, which is really quick. After charging my iphone 6 I used the power bank to try and charge my ipad 3, which is a 10 inch ipad. It wasn't able to charge it fully but, did charge it from 10% to 65% charged in a few hours before the battery drained from the power bank. I recharged the power bank plugged into a usb wall outlet using the provided usb charging cable, and it took about 8 hours to fully charge again.I've had this portable charger for a little over a week now. After recharging this power bank fully, I charged my iphone 6 from 20% to full charge, the next day charged my iphone 6 again from 30% to full charge and at the same time since this has a dual usb ports, charge my ipad 3 while my son used the ipad 3 for a little over an hour playing games, and then charged my iphone 6 a few days later from 17% to full charge as well as my husbands Nexus 6 phone at the same time. After all that,  I still have half power (two LED lights lit) on the power bank. That's pretty impressive to me!This power bank also has a built in flashlight on the top next to the dual usb ports. Pushing the power button on the side twice activates the flashlight. The flashlight is very bright, and also has three different levels of brightness, as well as a strobe light (will blink off and on) which can be adjusted by pushing the power button once each time. The only thing I'd like to see improved on this power bank is the outside surface is really smooth, and I've dropped it three times so far by accident while using it. Although the power bank didn't break or damage any of those times, so it's pretty durable. The power bank also had a little weight and bulk to it, as I'd expect from a 13000mAh power bank. Overall, I'm really impressed with the flashlights brightness and that the level of brightness can be adjusted. The amount of times and speed at which I can charge our electronic devices on one full charge of this power bank is extremely impressive! I would definitely recommend this portable power bank!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

Chalk markers are so much fun and easy to use. I enjoy using this set of 18 chalk markers by Stardom Crafts on my Jeep windows for when we have swim meets to encourage my son and his team to do well, for reminder notes to my husband on a chalk board we have, as he never seems to see any sticky notes I have used, and also for easy decorations during the holidays on my house windows.The markers are easy to prime for first use by shaking them up and down for about 20-30 seconds, then pushing down on the tips of them until you start to see the white tip fill with the colored liquid chalk, which I just use a tissue or piece of paper to push the tip onto. I enjoy that I can just write and draw what I want on a non porous surface such as glass, and they easily wipe off with a wet paper towel to clean up the area. This saves me on wasting paper to write notes on that my husband doesn't seem to notice any way, and also having to store decorations like window clings somewhere and later forget where I put them for the next year. I also like that there is a removable tip to these chalk markers, which I haven't seen in other chalk markers I've used, so I can write in bold lines or use the other end that is chiseled for more thin lines.I would have liked to see more darker primary colors, such as dark blue, in this set instead of two different lighter blue shades, and also my box did not contain the colors that match the picture on the site page, which I would have loved to have had a red one for the 4th of July. Regardless of the colors, my son and I had a great time with these chalk markers and we look forward to continue using them around the house. They are easy to use and easy to clean up afterwards.Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

I order this foldable travel duffel bag for my in laws who visit us one a year from Europe. They always are buying things to take home for their grandkids and other family members, as well as themselves, and then they need to buy another suitcase to put these items in.This foldable travel duffel bag is perfect for them and their travel needs. It comes folded in a compact size in a zip locked reusable storage bag, so it wouldn't take up much room in their suitcase to start with, and it is very light weight as well. On the inside this bag has a zippered nylon pocket inside, a spacious zippered mesh pocket, and also a side pocket to tuck some extra things into. On the top is a single zipper pull the glides across the bag easily to keep it securely shut. This is a very large duffel bag when unfolded, even though the size I ordered is a medium sized bag.On the outside is a zippered nylon pocket that is as deep as the bag is tall, and then another zipper pocket on the other side that isn't sewn into the bag so they can easily tote this page on top of their suitcases through the airport by sliding the suitcase handle between the pocket and the duffel bag itself. There are two grey nylon handles that are double stitched to the top of the bag for easy carrying, and also a grey shoulder strap made of the same material as the handles. I really enjoy that both the handles and the shoulder strap are adjustable, and have a clip that connect to the bag to make them removable for when not in use.  Overall, for this being a medium sized bag sure is huge and able to carry a lot of items. It's durable and the fact that it folds up into a compact size when not in use is a perfect fit for my in laws while traveling!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

To me this 60 pack of Gel Pens set is the adult/older kid version of a big box of crayons for really little kids. I can remember being younger and writing on my notebooks in school, and there were very few colors to choose from, so if you were lucky enough to get a red pen, (back then used by teachers mainly for marking up your errors on your school papers), then you treated it like gold and kept it hidden and to yourself.This Gel pen set is completely awesome! There are a lot of colors and variety of pens to pick from like metallic and glitter, so everyone in the household can enjoy them, even the pickiest of the bunch! These are great for art projects for school, for the talented artist or even just to have fun with doodling. While using these pens they didn't leave ink blots on the paper, nor did they stop working or stutter in drawing the lines on the page with ink. I am left handed, and the best part of these pens, I think, is the ink dries quickly, so when I'm using them I don't get some ink transferred onto the side of my hand as other pens I've used do. Since it dries quickly, I also don't get a big smear mark going across the paper as well. That in itself is a huge plus in my book!! I would definitely recommend these Gel pens to anyone that is looking for a variety of colors and styles for serious work or even just to have some fun with!Sample provided for the purpose of inspection and honest, unbiased review.

Since following the Digestive Health with REAL Food diet I wanted a way to gauge how I was doing regarding my blood sugar/ketosis.  So far I'm not where I should be but thanks to this test, I know where I stand.  It isn't a quick & easy test to take (it requires a decent amount of blowing & some time).  The way I look at it, the effort I put into all that blowing will hopefully give me a good idea how I'm doing physically as well as I work on improving my fitness level along with my low carb REAL food diet.

After trying the eye cream I was pretty excited to have the opportunity to try this facial cream.  I find that it doesn't seem to provide the same results as the eye cream.  I've noticed no improvement to the tone of my skin or any fine lines.  Also, unlike the eye cream this has a very noticeable fragrance.  I do not like fragrance added to my facial products & do not care for the perfume smell.  What I like is this goes on very smooth, it absorbs quickly & is not the least bit greasy.  My skin feels moisturized unlike other products I've used that have made my skin greasy, dry or oddly a combination of the two.  Overall it's a nice lotion but there are other brands I like better.  Juice beauty's stem cellular line is one of my favorites esp. in the winter.

This is an okay cat food if you are wanting something that doesn't feature corn as the first ingredient & is free from dyes.  Personally I find the price point rather high when considering the ingredients.  Meat is first immediately followed by corn & while we humans like to focus on muscle meat being prime for our kitties, a cats natural diet does include more than muscle meat.  Just watch them hunt.  They will devour nearly the entire body.  Some may leave behind wings or heads, some eat it all.  Those are "by products".  Now I'm not saying that poultry litter scooped up off of some filthy CFO is okay in pet food, just pointing out that the extra stuff is actually good for a cat if it's acquired naturally.For my crazy cat household, the outdoor kitties get the less expensive kibble because they are hunters & do not have the same needs as the indoor kitties.  For the barn cats I typically get them WHISKAS MEATY SELECTIONS Chicken and Turkey Flavors Dry Cat Food.  It's not the best but meat is the first ingredient, it is free from dyes & is much more reasonably priced than this brand.  For the house cats I typically get Hill's Ideal Balance Grain Free Natural Chicken and Potato Recipe Adult Cat Dry Food.  I also feed the indoor kitties canned food.  The Nutro Company 24 Count Food Variety Chunky Loaf  Pack for Cats is one of my absolute favorite canned foods.What do the cats think of Pro Plan Savor Shredded Blend?  They don't like it.  They eat it but grudgingly.  They will sit by the bowl & stare at me clearly hoping I will put something else into their bowl.  They like Whiskas Meaty Selections better & love Ideal Balance the best.  While this is an okay cat food, it's not one I'm likely to buy in the future.

I've tried a lot of gluten free flour mixes over the years (organic & not).  Out of all of them my go to choice has been Pamela's Products Gluten Free Artisan Flour Blend.  It works well enough.  I never thought it was fabulous, but I was getting by.  When the opportunity arose to try out bona dea's gluten free all purpose flour, I jumped at the chance & I'm glad I did.  This brand uses organic ingredients (not all are organic) & is Non GMO verified.  Pamela's Artisan Flour by comparison has no organic ingredients & is not non GMO verified.  Pamela's is cheaper, but in this case & many others, you get what you pay for.  I find bona dea is the better flour.  I made my back up brownie recipe for when I'm out of baking chocolate & it turned out great!  Nice chewy edges, not a crumbly mess that I get with the other brand.  I can't wait to try out my all time favorite brownie recipe once my baking chocolate arrives via Subscribe & Save!  I'm also curious to see how well this performs as pie crust.The one thing I don't like is the lack of recipes.  I guess I've been spoiled by Pamela's products as all of their various mixes contain lots of recipes all over the bags.  There isn't a single recipe included on the bag of bona dea.  You have to go the their website.  The website needs some work & is not fun to negotiate.  The heading bar is so big it takes up nearly half the page so it makes viewing the recipes a real pain.  If I was rating the website & not the product it would get one star.  Thankfully you shouldn't need their recipes as the claim is this can be used as you normally would in place of regular flour.  So far, that has been the case for me.  I will be back to update my review as needed.Overall I am very pleased with this flour.UPDATE 9-25-15My baking chocolate arrived & I made my favorite brownie recipe with this flour.  It turned out fabulous!  I'm so happy to finally have a decent gluten free flour!Recipes:Chewy Brownies (all time family favorite)1/2 C Unsalted Butter4 oz. Baking Chocolate1 1/2 C Sugar1/4 tsp. Salt2 tsp. Vanilla2 lg. Eggs (duck eggs are the best if you can get them)1 C Flour (this flour works fabulous)2 Tbsp Cocoa PowderHeat oven to 350.  Grease 8" square pan.  Melt butter & chocolate.  Remove from heat.  Stir in sugar, salt & vanilla.  Mix in eggs one at a time.  Add flour & cocoa.  Bake 35min for metal pan or 45 min for a glass pan or until tooth pick comes out almost clean.Best Brownies (back up recipe for when we are out of baking chocolate)1/2 C Unsalted Butter1 C Sugar2 Eggs (duck eggs are the best if you can get them)1 tsp. Vanilla1/3 C cocoa powder1/2 C Flour (this flour works fabulous)1/4 tsp. Salt1/4 tsp. baking powderHeat oven to 350.  Grease 8" square pan.  Melt butter.  Remove from heat.  Stir in sugar, eggs & vanilla.  Beat in cocoa, flour, salt & baking powder.  Bake for 25 - 30 min.Note:  You can use coconut oil in place of the butter in either recipe if you have a dairy allergy.  I've done it many times but keep in mind that while they are still tasty they are never as good as they are with butter.  Another option is to use shortening but personally I don't think it tastes very good.  If you are allergic to eggs try a different breed such as guinea, duck or turkey.  You might find you can eat them if you go with another type rather than the most commonly used chicken egg.  Good luck & enjoy!

I was really excited to try this product after using this brands all-purpose flour but unlike the all-purpose flour, this pancake mix isn't as great. I found the texture to be a bit gritty & had a taste that reminded me of corn muffins.  Personally, I prefer Pamela's Products Gluten Free Baking and Pancake Mix taste over bona dea. To be fair, I prefer Bona Dea Gluten Free All Purpose Flour over Pamela's all-purpose.  Either way, both brands are pretty good.  Bona dea is Non GMO certifed & has some certified organic ingredients which is a huge plus.

I have been taking Great Lakes Gelatin, Collagen Hydrolysate for the past three years or so & have become a firm believer in the power of collagen.  My hair has never been healthier.  At first I wasn't sure why my hair was so fantastic.  It actually took me a few years until the light bulb went off & I realized my amazing hair started after taking collagen.  Prior my very long pin straight hair would get terrible split ends despite my constant visits to the salon.  Now my hair is to my butt, I have it trimmed once a year.  You heard that, once a year, to my butt & no split ends!  Trying to find split ends is like looking for a needle in a hay stack.  Collagen works!  Add to that each year I get older (obviously), yet my hair is glorious & I'm always getting compliments on my locks.With this said, I have to say that if you want to take Seeds Of Beauty (stupid name), go for it.  I'm sure it will work.  The problem I have with Seeds of Beauty is it's unnecessary, tastes awful, contains fructose, & costs 4 times more than the brand I mentioned above in the link.  I typically take around 3 tsp. a day or more of Great Lakes.  My preferred choice is to add one tsp. to each cup of tea.  It instantly dissolves & has no taste.  I sometimes add it to my milk kefir & yogurt as well.  I'm not knocking Seeds of Beauty, I just don't think it's necessary.  Personally I think Great Lakes Collagen is the better deal.  For the record I took one pkt. of Seeds of Beauty for 21 days (one box provides 21 days or 3 weeks of product) in addition to my usual amount of Great Lakes Collagen.  I have noticed no new improvements nor did I expect to, but as already mentioned I do firmly believe in the power of Collagen.  However you want it, get it - it's worth it.

The amazon product page didn't show the full details on this bottle, but from what information I could gather it seemed like a pretty good supplement.  My husband has crazy hours so I was thinking this supplement would be great for him when he is recovering from his over nights & needs to get back into a more normal wake/sleep schedule.  His schedule along with a crazy cat family, means none of us ever really gets uninterrupted sleep.I decided to take one capsule (instructions say to take two) before bed.  Imagine my utter shock & dismay when I first opened the bottle to see electric blue capsules inside this bottle of "natural" rest.  I did a double take & then a closer look at the ingredients on the bottle.  Sure enough it contains toxic FD&C Blue #1 & Titanium Dioxide.  Thankfully I have my own plain empty gelatin capsules.  I dumped the contents out of one electric blue capsule onto a piece of paper & then dumped the contents into one of my clear empty gelatin capsules.  Only then did I take the supplement.  The now empty toxic blue capsule went into the trash where it belongs.So how does it work?  It worked great.  I was out for the night until the alarm went off.  I woke up to a dead mouse & never heard a thing (the kitties make a racket when they catch critters so this is a huge testament to the ability of this product to help one sleep).  On the down side I have been groggy all day which is not typical for me.  I can only assume this is a side effect of taking Natural Rest.  My husband will be taking this tonight to reset his clock after this weeks shift of overnights.  I'll be back to post an update if there is anything relevant to report - good or bad.Supplement Facts:Serving Size: 2 capsulesServings Per Container: 30Vitamin B-12 (Cyanocobalamin) 50 mcg  %DV: 833Calcium (Calcium Carbonate) 25 mg %DV: 2.5Magnesium (Oxide) 75 mg %DV: 19Zinc (Zinc Oxide) 25 mg %DV: 167Proprietary Blend 403 mg:  Ashwaganda powder, hops flower powder, lavender powder, valerian root powder, melatoninOther Ingredients:  Gelatin, Microcrystalline Cellulose, Rice Flour, Magnesium Stearate, FD&C Blue #1 & Titanium Dioxide.0 stars for the bad ingredients.  5 stars for effectiveness.  =  3 stars total.

The first two things I noticed when applying this eye cream were: The cream felt velvety smooth & that it had a bite to it.  The bite, or burn if you will was not severe but was very unexpected.  It went away almost as fast as it came on.  Aside from that oddity I have experienced no negative side effects.  For about two weeks I only used this on one of my eyes to see if there was a difference.  When I became convinced that I was in fact seeing a very very slight improvement; plumper fuller looking skin around my aging eye, I decided to start using it on both eyes.  Again, on the other eye at the first application I experienced the burning, but again it went away within mere moments.This eye cream feels absolutely wonderful in comparison to my other brand which went on very "wet" aka watery & thin.  My highly sensitive skin while prone to breaking out is also prone to dryness.  This makes things pretty frustrating, but when it comes to the thin delicate skin around my eyes, the more moisturizing the better.I expect this will last a very long time, as only the teeniest amount is needed, making the price seem more realistic.  I'm thinking this should easily last me a year or longer.  I will be sure to update my review if I feel there is anything relevant to report - good or bad.  As it things stand now I'm very happy with this eye cream.

If you like very sweet chocolate you will probably love this milk chocolate.  After reading some of the negative reviews I was concerned it would taste like that fake chocolate that doesn't even have chocolate in the ingredients or on the plus side it would taste like white chocolate which my sugar crazed self is addicted to.  Without having the ingredients provided I really had no idea what I was in store for.  So my chocolate bar arrived.  It was very soft due to the heat, but thankfully not ruined.  I put it in the freezer for a few minutes, pulled it out & took a bite.  My taste buds sang the sugar song as the smooth chocolate melted in my mouth.  Needless to say the bar is gone.  Good thing they didn't send me a case of 16.  Personally this isn't something I would buy due to my lack of control & the possibility of wheat contamination.I've included pictures of the back of the packaging so that you can see what's what since it isn't provided as of this review.  Thankfully there is no soy or artificial flavoring.  This isn't as good as Theo or Vivani but better in my opinion than some certified organic brands that still use soy lecithin.Ingredients:Sweetened condensed milk (milk, nonfat milk, sugar), sugar, cocoa butter, chocolate, milk fat, sunflower lecithin, vanilla extract.  May contain nuts, egg, wheat.10-30-15 UPDATED Was 5 starsThis company is a Nestle company known for slave labor.  Hershey, Nestle & Mars have all been using child slaves.  I posted the link in the comments.0 stars for slave labor.  5 stars for taste.  =  3 stars (although it really deserves 0 stars for the slave labor)

In our area we have pollen alerts even in the winter.  It makes not sense to me but it is what it is.  My husband is the biggest allergy sufferer out of all of my family.  The rest of us get bouts only when pollen is very very high.  This is wonderful for reducing our misery.  It is easy to administer thanks to it's sweet taste. A dose cup is included. Overall, I love this & am not surprised as I've been buying homeopathic remedies for many years to keep my family healthy sans prescription drugs.Another option esp. for headaches with sinus pain is Boiron Homeopathic Medicine Kali Iodatum, 30C Pellets

Every time I change the kitties water, I add three pumps/squirts of this to their fresh water.  The cats & kittens don't seem to mind it at all as they drink their water the same as they do without the drops.  Now when my felines are in my face, sleeping on my chest/head &/or licking me, I don't notice their breath as much.  It's not a fix to stinky breath, but it does seem to help diminish it a bit which is nice.

During the winter my home is very dry due to having a wood stove as my only source of heat.  I keep a cast iron water kettle on the stove, adding cinnamon sticks as well as using a little aromatherapy unit in the upper level of my home: AromaFresh Ripple Handmade Ceramic Aromatherapy Essential Oil Diffuser.  I like to add clove essential oil to the aromatherapy unit to compliment the cinnamon simmering on the stove.  Despite having these two items in place (and even occasionally cooking on the stove as well as heating water for tea & coffee) my home is still overly dry.  I decided to try out the Vicks humidifier in hopes it would solve this problem.  The filter & essential oil pads were a plus I was really looking forward to as well.Now that I've been using the unit I have to say it is even better than I'd hoped.  Unlike my ancient humidifier that I got rid of in frustration, it doesn't soak the area around it & the mist is invisible.  It feels like cool air, not wet at all.  On high the fan runs produces white noise.  I wake up very easily & as a result have to use ear plugs in order to get a good nights rest.  The problem with the ear plugs is eventually they cause eczema in my ears & I have to take a break from them.  Having this unit running provides not only the much needed humidity but also the soothing white noise to help me sleep.  Granted it's not as effective as ear plugs, but it is very helpful.  On low the unit hardly makes a sound & is not useful if white noise is desired, but if you want it running quiet it's the perfect setting.  Overall I am very pleased.

Wonderful for reducing the misery of dry coughing, esp. at night.  It is easy to administer thanks to it's sweet taste. A dose cup is included. Overall, I love this & am not surprised as I've been buying Hyland's for many years to keep my family healthy sans prescription drugs.

I've been taking this for the past month & have notice no improvement to the health of my eyes.  About five years ago when I was stressed out & moving to another state, I discovered the little veins in one of my eyes burst & had a white bulge.  This discovery was when we finally arrived at our new home after driving in winter conditions for over 8 hours & it was about one in the morning.  Ever since then, I have had oddities with my eyes & this year started getting floaters.  I already eat about 1 lb of spinach a week, eat wild sockeye salmon two to four times a week, & I eat organic.  I am frustrated by the health of my eyes & disappointed that this product has not been helpful.  To be fair I have only consumed one months worth & have half the bottle to go.  That's why I gave it a three star review.  I will be sure to report back if there is anything worth mentioning once I finish the bottle.I've been looking into other brand & came across Gaia Herbs Vision Enhancement Liquid Phyto-Capsules, 60 Count  Not only is it substantially cheaper it also includes bilberry, grape seed, & astaxathin as well as lutein.  I plan on trying it next - hopefully with better results

I've passed on this brand of cat food so many times when at the store & now that I've had the opportunity to try it out I wish I hadn't selected other brands.  The size of the kibble is very small, small enough for kittens which is a huge plus in my multiple cat/kitten crazy cat lady household.  With my kitties, smaller kibble also means less waste.  With the larger kibble little bits crumble as they chew & fall into the bowl & onto floor.  They refuse to eat these bits creating a lot of waste.  This is not an issue with smaller kibble.  My most fussy cat loves the food which is another plus.  Overall I think this is a fantastic grain free dry food.  Thanks to the kitties gusto & the tiny sized kibble, this has become my new favorite out of all the grain free foods I've tried for my kitties.

This is really convenient.  The small size is perfect for bringing to the farmers market & fiber festivals where hand washing isn't readily available.  It smells lovely as well.  Overall I'm thrilled to be able to get an organic hand sanitizer thanks to Amazon because I can't find any natural hand sanitizers in my remote part of Appalachia.

Overall this is an okay thermometer.  It performs as advertised but you must have your device on hand otherwise the thermometer is worthless.  It (the thermometer) doesn't have any readings on it at all.  The big blank thing that says "Vicks" in the picture, that's what it looks like, no digital read-outs etc.  Also the cover mine came with to protect the probe when not in use literally didn't stay on.  It just fell off.  Absolutely 100% useless.  I don't understand how they didn't notice this obvious flaw.  I threw the cover away as it serves no purpose if I can't get it to stay on.  If you want to keep track of your families temps (I use this for my goats, it's great.), then you should be pretty happy with it.  If you just want something you can read in a hurry & don't need or want to keep track via technology, then a cheaper fast digital thermometer is the way to go.

Wonderful for reducing the misery of having a cold.  It is easy to administer thanks to it's sweet taste.  A dose cup is included.  Overall, I love this & am not surprised as I've been buying Hyland's for many years to keep my family healthy sans prescription drugs.

Works great!  I love how easy it is to administer homeopathic medicines.  This is calming & great to use in place of warm milk & honey before bedtime to assist with falling asleep.  Overall, I love this & am not surprised as I've been buying Hyland's for many years to keep my family healthy sans prescription drugs.

I have fed my cats the chicken dinner in the past & they all went nuts for it.  This variety pack is even better.  As expected, all of this Crazy Cat Ladies cats love these smooth pate's from Nutro.  Even though this is geared towards adult cats, it is simply perfect for kittens. Despite the name, it is smooth with no chunks or bits at all. It's kind of like a super duper thick pudding which is exactly what tiny kitten mouths love! I mix dry kitten kibble in with this food & they go nuts over it! My mama cat as well as the other adult cats all eat it with gusto. The chunk-less consistency also makes it great for when you have a sick kitty & need to syringe feed them.  Overall I'm beyond pleased.  This has quickly become my favorite canned cat food for all my fur balls.

I wasn't too sure how the dogs would react to this type of food (I normally feed them grain free kibble).  At first it was odd to be adding water to a powdered mix & then feeding it to the dogs rather than dumping kibble into bowls.  In the end it proved to be worth it.  The results were fantastic.  The dogs dug right in.  No gas, vomiting or any other nasty side effects resulting from such a huge change in food.  Overall I & my dogs are thrilled with this food.  I've often wondered about the effectiveness of limited ingredient foods & now I know - they are worth it.  Healthy happy dogs are a joy to own.

I'm so frustrated with this litter.  Every time I add fresh litter to the box, I dump out the old, wash & dry the box, then add the new litter.  I added this litter to a small litter box that the kittens use.  Now the box sits untouched.  I have been cleaning up urine & feces from all over the house spraying Bi-O-Kleen pretty much on every surface of the floor.  Prior to this I was using Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter with no issues.  There was the occasional accident outside of the box as the kittens learned where to go but 90% of the time they were using it regularly, not untouched like it is now.  When I say untouched, I mean exactly that, the box is not used at all thanks to this litter.  I have a total of three cat boxes in my home.  Two are too big for the kittens to use, the adult cats are still using the bigger litter boxes which both contain Precious Cat, NOT Cats Pride.  None of the animals will use the box containing Cats Pride.To make matters worse, the litter doesn't clump!  All you can do is sift out the solid waste.  The urine clumps disintegrate the moment you scoop them.  It's awful!*Update*  Was One Star, Changed To Two StarsAfter a lot of effort I was finally able to get the kittens to use the box.  The litter tracks a lot so along with that & the initial refusal to use the box, I'm not thrilled with this litter at all.  I bought Precious Cat Ultra Litter Attractant & it seems to be helping but it's not a 100% effective.  If you are looking for a great cat litter I highly recommend Precious Cat (linked to above) or Advance High Performance Scented Lightweight Multi-Cat Litter (note for some reason the price doubled for this on Amazon, not sure why, hopefully it goes back down).  If you have a problem with your cat using the box in general I highly recommend Precious Cat Cat Attract Problem Cat Training Litter  I used it a few years ago with 100% success.  For cost & performance I like the Precious Cat Ultra Premium the best followed by the Advance brand.  I'm not at all impressed with Cat's Pride & don't recommend it at all.

Tomato is by far my favorite type of soup so I've tried a lot of the various organic brands over the years & have to say that after trying this new organic soup from Campbell's I'm not impressed.  The flavor isn't as good as many of the other organic brands & even though it contains cream it wasn't enough to cut out the acidic bite.  Personally I prefer my local grocery stores organic brand with Pacific following a close second.  This soup by Campbell's isn't something I'm likely to get again.  Also, the boxes are very small (smaller than other brands) so you don't get as much for the cost as you do the other brands.

The Hunted continues where The Living left off.  The Living's ending was more like stopping the book mid chapter so The Hunted thankfully finishes the story.  Really this should have been one book.  Shy is now on land & as the title says, being hunted.  There are a lot of unbelievable circumstances & too many coincidences to make this a great book, but despite this it is a very entertaining read.  Shy & his companions find themselves on a very dangerous & difficult journey.  Along the way Shy learns a few things about himself.  Most of Shy's stupid decisions are stopped by something (much to his benefit) although at some point there is a huge drama scene with his companions.  This was over the top & the end results were a predictable.  It is possible that another book could be written regarding Shy's journey but it doesn't seem likely.  For the most part the books stick with somewhat realistic events as in "it could happen" except for one point that was completely out of character with the book having a wacky supernatural feel.  Don't get me wrong, I like plenty of supernatural books, but here it was nonsensical.  I was shaking my heading thinking the good ol', "What the..."  With that said, this is a book worth grabbing at the library for a quick & easy read, but not worth buying.  Whatever you do, make sure you read The Living first.

These wiper blades are fantastic.  I put a Bosch blade on the drivers-side & put this cheaper blade on the passenger side to see if there is any real difference between high-end & low-end blades.  I have to say that so far they perform exactly the same.  Easy to install & works great!  Now to see which one lasts longer...

This novel is a heck of a crazy ride.  Told from several points of view, it all starts to come together in one very bizarre tale of horror & suffering that has lasted for centuries.  The main character Galvan aka "The Righteous Messenger" must deliver a beating heart into the hands of evil.  All sorts of odd things happen along the way, an army of zombie virgins, demons, bikers, good cops, bad cops, teenage kids in the crossfire, cults, &  more.  In the end, the fate of the world depends on the decisions Galvan makes while on his wild run across the desert to his final destination.

This is a very nice lotion that goes on very soft, smooth & non greasy.  It doesn't tug at the skin or dry before it can be properly massaged in, nor does it take too long to dry or leave any sticky or greasy residue.  It absorbs well & is wonderfully soothing to the skin.Even though there doesn't appear to be any added fragrance, it does have a strong rose perfume smell thanks to the essential oils.  The smell dissipates rather quickly so it isn't a problem.The packaging is odd.  I can't figure out if I like it or not.  It is square shaped & sits very nicely, but requires two hands to open & close.  Once open it is easy to use thanks to it's wide, low & stable stance.  In the product picture you are actually viewing the package (can't call it a bottle or tube because it's not) on it's side.I cannot make up my mind if I like Spotty Tots better than Weleda Baby White Mallow Cream.  They are both excellent all natural baby creams that are wonderful for delicate skin.

This is a super fast paced horror slasher novel that leaves you eagerly turning the pages all the way to the end.  The only real downside was how often the heroine seemed to be hitting her head (doesn't she have the sense to put her hands out when she is falling?) & gulping in lungfuls of water (seriously anyone gulping in that much water into their lungs that often would have either choked to death or at the very least not been able to continue on as they did).  Despite these annoying occurrences I quite thoroughly enjoyed this novel.  I found the characters & their actions pretty realistic.  For those who've never had friends like this, it might seem over the top & unbelievable, but for others, they will be able to relate to not only the conflicting emotions, but also the decisions that are not always intelligently made.  Overall a very entertaining read.

I rarely bother with cat treats because most are junk food & the cats don't seem overly enthusiastic about most of the treats I've bought on a whim.  They've always preferred their regular grain free kibble over any of the treats I've brought home.  Therefore these treats are a pleasant surprise.  Every one of my lovely bundles of purr love them.  The minute I pick up the bag they know.  Even if the brats are sleeping.  Next thing I know they perk right up & come running & meowing.  The shapes are adorable; the hearts are my favorite.  No junk ingredients & no dyes.  There is nothing not to like.

This is a long entertaining novel but the entire premise hinges on a trained killers failure.  The failure in light of the assassins normally robot like (aka unfeeling) killing precision didn't fit, but if the assassin had killed like normal, the rest of the story simply couldn't happen.  This was a real fault in the novel for me.  It is highly entertaining, sometimes totally & ridiculously unbelievable but still a fun read.  Imagine traveling back in time (but not really), visiting another world a whole heck of a lot like Earth in order to complete a mission & make it back to your own time/world before you forget everything.  Also imagine that this is our future so a lot of the technology is pretty cool & "out there".  Zero World definitely fits the bill as a Sci-Fi thriller.  The end is left wide open for a sequel.  It doesn't leave the reader hanging with an abrupt ending but it was a bit frustrating to realize that the remaining pages were for a novella based on The Darwin Elevator rather than a continuation of Zero World.

I love the convince & ease of use of this machine but I am extremely disappointed in the very limited variety of K-Cups the 2.0 & later will accept.  Keurig made it so inconvenient that their own older style K-Cups will not work in this machine.  Thankfully there is a way around their desire to monopolize the K-Cup industry.  First, if you have some K-Cups that are 2.0 compliant, save the lid & put it over your non compliant K-Cup & then you can use your non approved K-Cup.  You can also buy special stickers (I haven't tried this).  Last you can order a re-usable brewer cup to brew your own loose coffees & teas.  I ordered the Keurig Reuseable Kup for 2.0 & 1.0 Brewers & can happily tell you that it works perfectly.  I love it!Once you get past the K-Cup situation, the Keurig really is fantastic for it's convenience, ease of use, & space saving abilities.  The touch screen is very sensitive, even with wet fingers.  I love having one machine for coffee, tea & cocoa.  This means no more separate machines to satisfy everyone's tastes.  This frees up precious counter space in my teeny tiny kitchen, so this is a big deal in my household.  You can even purchase K-cup Storage 2 Drawers Holder for Keurig K-cup Coffee Pods that the brewer sits on, saving even more space.Overall (aside from the proprietary nonsense with the cups) the whole family loves this machine.

I decided to try this for when I'm at the farmers market without any help & as a result cannot leave my booth to get to the bathroom during my monthly & also so that I can actually sleep through the night rather than have to get up within 4 hours replace an overfilled sanitary product.  Even though they are listed as a size small (and don't come any size smaller), they are still a bit too big for my petite frame.  The waist is rather high, so a long shirt is a must.  I find they are not very comfortable but it is either that or risk embarrassing myself when I have an accident & as already mentioned cannot get to the bathroom to remedy the situation.  I usually wear a nice long, loose & flowing gypsy skirt on the days I have to wear this bit of uncomfortable back up as I feel it is the best way to hide the fact that I'm wearing a diaper.  When wearing to bed, I like to wear a tight pair of yoga type shorts to keep the "underwear" snug.

This is a beautiful over sized kitchen towel.  The colors are very rich, much more so than pictured (which appears lighter).  It feels like a bathroom hand towel vs. a kitchen towel - it's that nice.  With a home full of coffee & tea drinkers, the kitchen is often like a rustic little coffee room.  Therefore the theme of the towel is a perfect fit.  Overall I'm very pleased.

The dog absolutely loves this food so it gets 5 stars on that point.  I knocked off a star thanks to corn being an ingredient (GMO anyone?).  Chicken, brewers rice & poultry by product meal are the first 3 ingredients followed by corn.  Seeing how well received the food has been, I have no complaints (other than the corn - the dogs love corn btw, they will steal the organic poultry feed we special order from the birds if they get the opportunity but at least it's organic aka Non GMO).  Animals!Bottom line: The kibble is of a good size, the bag was really easy to open & the dog seems to prefer it over his usual brand.  I can only hope that over the long term it will help with his mind as advertised.

Despite having a list of amazing figures in history like Tesla, Thomas Edison, Goodrich, Earhart & more this novel fell flat.  None of the characters are well developed.  For the most part the book was rather boring & unbelievable.  The author failed miserably in creating characters I could care about.  Bad guy or good guy so what?  They were totally flat & one dimensional.  So much could have been done to make this into a great book.  All the elements are there, but alas it's a dud.  Mary's Jujutsu skills reminded me of 'Pride Prejuduce & Zombies' but rather than find her unconventional ability interesting, all it did was point out how poor a job the author did with the character when I reflected on PP&Z which I found hilarious & highly entertaining.While there are no paranormal aspects to this novel, I recommended the Souless series by Gail Carriger if you enjoy witty unconventional Victorian women.I am thrilled to be finally done slogging through 'Second Street Station'.  I have no intentions of picking up the next book in the series & recommend everyone gives the Mary Handley series a pass.

I was thrilled to see that Traditional Medicinals made a few of their awesome teas for the Keurig.  I read the questions from customers asking if these fit the newer 2.0 model & the response was, "Yes."  I want to let others know that this is not true.  Unfortunately I learned about Keurig's tactics after getting my 250 model.  Thankfully there is a way around Keurig's greedy BS.  You have to save the lid from a Keurig approved K-cup.  Put it directly on top of the non approved K-cup & then you can enjoy your brew.  I ordered a Keurig Reuseable Kup for 2.0 and 1.0 Brewers that is supposed to let you brew your own without needing any K-cups but it hasn't arrived yet.  Hopefully it works.  Personally I only consume organic & as a result the Keurig approved organic options are extremely limited.  My opinion of Keurig is not very high no matter how nice the machine is now that I have to jump through hoops just to enjoy my favorite organics.Regarding the Dandelion Root tea, it is one of my favorites.  It can make you poo so don't over do it.  It makes for an excellent herbal caffeine free coffee alternative.  The flavor is strong & bitter.  I like to dress it up with honey & MCT oil (aka Bullet Proof), coconut milk or cream.  If you use an oil you will need to use a blender to emulsify the oil otherwise it will float on top which is not pleasant.  You can even add cocoa powder to it (with or without the fat & honey) for an extra rich treat.It is my understanding that for dandelion root to truly be able to do it's job as a healthful bitter herb, you shouldn't sweeten it or add anything to it as you need to taste the bitter for your body to respond in kind.  I have drank it this way & find it is very unpleasant.  If you can tolerate it or like drinking your coffee &/or tea black, you will probably love it.

These are plump & sticky; similar to raisins.  The flavor & texture is much better than the organic goji berries I've had in the past.  I typically eat them in trail mix or as a dessert with dark chocolate.  These arrived vacuum sealed so they were all stuck together in one big mass.  The taste is slightly sweet with a slightly bitter aftertaste.  They are good alone as well as added to loose leaf tea (brew as usual).  If you add them to yogurt the night before, they will plump up a bit making them even softer as well as adding some flavor variety to the yogurt.  Overall, I'm pleasantly surprised as I don't consider Viva to be a high quality organic brand.

These are perfect for the plants I sell at the farmers market.  They are big enough to add all the information needed on the front.  On the back I write the price & provide our web address (gotta promote yourself however you can).  Thanks to being bright white, they stand out in the pots & my customers can easily read them (I write on them with a black sharpie).  There isn't a logo or branding printed anywhere on the tags to get in the way unlike many other plant tags I've come across.  I'm not a fan of plastic, but these are definitely worth it.

These are a lovely modern update to my old vintage sheer lace curtains.  They really freshened up my windows (I use one panel per window, always have, it's just what I do).  Admittedly they are nowhere near as beautiful as my old curtains once were, but they do look much prettier than my vintage curtains thanks to how crisp & brilliantly white they are in comparison to the old curtains which became dingy & suffered much abuse by the animals.  When viewed from outside of the house, the bold somewhat Celtic looking design can clearly be seen through the windows dressing up the outside of the house as well as the inside. I know they are not luxury curtains, but I still think they are great.  A little change was long over due.

This cooler was not able to keep my bottle cold while I was at the farmers market.  The ice pack is very small & unfroze quickly.  The cooler managed to keep the bottle from getting hot, but the liquid was only slightly cool.  Note this was kept out of direct sunlight the entire day.  The only way I believe this makes for safe transport of any perishable liquids is to use it for under 3 hours.  Two hours is probably better.  I do like the convenience of having something small to tote about, but unless you use one small bottle & are able to fit in extra ice packs, it won't last for a day out & about during warm weather.

The squeaker sounds this ball makes are great.  I think I might have initially had more fun with it than the dogs.  I even managed to get the cats all riled up over the various high pitched squeaks.
