It is divided into different phases, each with a purpose.Phase 1 - Unwind Stress. High glycemic, moderate protein, low fat phase.Phase 2 - Unlock Fat Stores. High protein, high vegetable, low carb, low fat phase.Phase 3 - Hormones, Heart & Heat. High healthy fat, moderate carb, moderate protein, low glycemic fruit.Each phase has a list of foods to select from with recommended exercise type.I receievd this item in exchange for a review.

Bunions have made doing any kind of exercise without shoes on (or without those prescription insoles) mostly impossible because of balance issues. I don't have too much pain from my bunions, thank god, but they have made doing some activities pretty difficult, especially yoga, which has been the only form of exercise that I've ever enjoyed. Since I have limited mobility in my big toe, I can't use it to balance like most people can, and this became a problem when I did yoga because I would just keep on falling over, and doing balancing positions seemed to make the bunion worse because it meant more time was spent in the misaligned position. This is where the Bunion Aid comes in. I started wearing it to classes, and it has made the biggest difference! I can balance, I don't have to constantly re-position my toes, and the hinge offers enough rotation to do most positions comfortably. It does get pretty sweaty, but the cloth parts are pretty small so washing is not an issue.As the title suggests, there is a false claim, in my opinion - the one regarding wearing it inside your shoes. Unless you are wearing massive shoes that are 3 sizes too big and too wide for you, you will not fit this contraption inside your shoes in any comfortable way. This is especially the case if you are only wearing one, because then the other foot would feel uncomfortable because you'd be wearing too-big shoes (which would be fine for the foot with the splint, but way too big for the other foot).This is a minor issue for me, and the BunionAid has helped me out so much and has improved my overall comfort in such a significant way that the inability to wear it inside my shoes just seems so insignificant in comparison, which is why I am not taking a star off for it.I recevied this item in exchange for a review.

This grill brush is such a nice big size!I was afforded the opportunity to try this in exchange for my opinion and since we have a very dirty grill, i was very happy to give it a try.The Clean Grill Brush worked great on our super dirty grill, didn't scratch it and wasn't harsh on it in any way. It actually cleaned the grill grates on the top and bottom at the same time and made it somewhat shiny again.The long handle made it easy to use and easy to prevent burns as we heat our grill up for easier cleaning.The bristles are very stiff, yet very gentle on your grill at the same time and it is surprisingly light weight to use.I received this item in exchange for a review.

I was supper lucky to have won these for free for my honest opinion and this sample pack comes with a great variety of 12 different colors that includes a BONUS glow-in-the-dark color to give you more options when creating your artistic masterpiece.This sample pack can be used for all types of 3D printing and is excellent for detailed and demanding applications. 3d pen will make anything you want to make! Characters, names, designs just about anything you can create, you can make! And as soon as i get my pen in the mail i will upload a picture and a video of how it works i highly recommend buying them for your 3d pen. I receievd in exchange for a review.

The following review is provided by both my wife AND myself. Trust me, at this point in my life I have no further "beauty issues"....It is also a short but sweet review for ME anyway as this is a very limited use device in my opinion. And my wife and I both come at this review from a somewhat unorthodox and different perspective. Scar Tissue. OK, this is for beauty & "rejuvenation". Say what you will but essentially we all will find our own particular use for it. The review below is addressing the common purpose this was designed for but also from the standpoint of use from Cancer survivors....It is too soon to know if any benefit will be gained for THAT purpose but will update as time passes. This was the preface to the review. Now from my wife who has very large scars on her face, forehead up through the upper scalp area. HER "scar tissue" is mostly referring to a physical scar, one you SEE on the skin when looking at it it. This is the predominate area that she address it for her scar tissue. She LOVES use of it all over her remaining facial area from the standpoint it makes her feel so relaxed and pampered. You know, that ICKY Girlie stuff...HER words below:5 starsThis massager is great, my face feels so soft and relaxed. It requires 2 AA batteries and works fine with rechargeable's. The directions are very easy to follow as to what head to use for each treatment including picture of head to match with directions. It felt wonderful to use and made my skin feel so soft and clean. In particular, I'm working to smooth out scar tissue on my forehead and it seems to be working. Great product and I look forward to each use of it. The brushes are amazingly soft and enjoyable to use.----------------------------------------------------------------------------MY words below:5 starsI have had several HUNDRED staples removed from my throat, my entire spine and in both vertical and horizontal directions. I look very much like many of the jigsaw puzzles reviewed by my fellow reviewer Joseph Dewey reviews (check his review of this very item here as well- he does a GREAT demonstration!) that has gotten my wife hooked on jigsaw puzzles:-) I don't need to be beautiful, too late! But I am trying very much to survive the many surgeries I just completed with more on the horizons if I can regain enough strength to survive those surgeries. At this point, I am too weak after 6 spinal fusions and a Mastectomy in just 5 months (yes I AM male but it happens to us too) and the loss of 60 pounds of muscle....Now the scar tissue I want to work on is across my entire back and up my entire back. In MY case, not to try to eliminate the physical scar you see, NOTHING will or could ever erase the deep scars I have. But MY scar tissue is one 2 plastic surgeons have even helped remove for me surgically by opening me up and literally grinding them out. If you run your fingers across my back, anywhere over several FEET of visible scars you will feel jagged, reef like material. THAT is my scar tissue (very long story, no point in telling it here). The problem with my scar tissue its it feels like a serrated knife trying to SAW its way OUT of my back through my skin. THIS is what I want to use this item for. I am attempting to break down this tissue to be absorbed within my body for pain relief. Between using assorted pain rubs bought here at Amazon, along with this, I hope to little by little "possibly" break down some of this massive amount of internal scar tissue. Too soon for me to know if I will achieve any measure of success. Time will tell. So for me, the only item on this (by item I mean the attachment) I use is the "Rolling massager: To make better blood circumstances from skin aging" as it is described with poor Chinese translation in the included manual.----------------------------------------------------------------------------End of MY part of the review. This item for only around $10.00 delivered at the time of my review is so well worth the investment. If it succeeds or not at reducing MY type of internal scar tissue, or my wife's external type scar tissue is really not of huge importance. It is a device that offers ME a degree of hope, it makes my wife feel pampered. An SHE IS BEAUTIFUL so I'd like to see her stay that way. For all that women have to endure in there day to day lives under the best of circumstances, I love to find a product like this that can give them at least a few minutes of 'ME" time. Time to take a breath, relax, feel pampered. For just a few dollars? How can you not try this?

I have a small army of toys and other fun adult items because I like to try different things, mix things up a bit, look at new things on the market, etc. It's fun and informative and it keeps me well-versed in what products are out there. It gives me a good grasp on how to evaluate toys and determine usefulness, not just for myself and my partner, but to make recommendations to others who know I have specific knowledge in this field and look to me to help them. When this vibrator came up as part of a promotion, I was really eager to get it and evaluate it and I received it at a discount in exchange for a genuine critique.In the range of Beginner to Experienced, this is definitely on the low-cost side of an upper-end Beginner, lower-end Intermediate. The design is fun and funky with several creative ways to use it (this is a good toy to use imaginatively) although the intention of design hits both a vaginal G-spot and provides external stimulation. It takes two AAA batteries and the vibration has an adjustable range of strength although the lowest setting is fairly strong also. It's easy to clean and small enough to store fairly discretely.That said, in view that this is definitely an ideal product for those on the cusp of Intermediate, there are a few things of which to be aware: this is NOT a silent toy. If you live alone (or with your partner, or open-minded people, or people who just don't care, etc), it's not a problem. But for those who live in spaces where you don't want others in residence to know what you're doing, this isn't going to be your best option. The packaging also left something to be desired. Unlike the picture of the product, this was not in a molded plastic case. It was in a sealed bag and mailed in a bubble envelop, thus anyone who picked it up knew EXACTLY what it was, which is not discrete packaging at all. Fortunately, I am not embarrassed by anyone knowing what I get in the mail, but others might be and I have contacted the seller about it and hopefully that will get resolved on future parcels. Also, the fact that it came in a plastic bag and not in a molded plastic product case means that it did not come with any literature on materials, on cleaning or care, etc. If you're on the cusp of Intermediate, this is still invaluable information to have (especially if you have an allergy)!My final evaluation is that this is great for someone who has started out in the world of physical gratification but who still has a lot of experimenting to do. Thus, you don't want to spend a lot of money on a toy until you know it's The One You Love. It's cost effective, clean, easy to use, I would just recommend having a good grasp on toy materials and toy care. I would also recommend this for anyone who likes to have a traveling selection, not high end so if it gets lost in the luggage it's okay, but small enough for packing and powerful enough to help you at the end of a hard day.I received this in exchange for an honest review

This is my third expandable hose. The best thing about these hoses are how easy they are to work with. They are light and when they have no water they are much shorter and easier to store (it stretches to about 50 feet and retracts to 17 feet for storage). The worst thing about them is that they are fairly fragile and don't last a long time. They easily burst and develop leaks.Ohuhu hose has brass rather than plastic connectors. This is better than my previous hoses which used all plastic connectors that leaked more. It uses standard male/female connectors, one of the old hoses used some sort of quick connect system which I did not like. The package includes a spray nozzle with 8 pattern.From my experience I learned a few tricks that help me keep these hoses working longer.I take the following precautions:1. When I use the hose I do not put the water pressure all the way up, I open the faucet at about half force (my water pressure is quite strong).2. When I store the hose, I store it in the shade under the deck3. I make sure there it has no pressure on any part of the hose, I store laying loose in a plastic tab, it is not hung4. Before storing it I drain it completely5. When I use it I make sure I don't step on it and it does not tangle on anything. I lay it out straight toward the area that I need to water.6. To make better connections I use teflon tape on every connection.Yeah, it is a lot of extra care but I really like that it is so light which makes it easier on my bad back.This hose is provided for a review

I am completely in love with these labels. The day I got them I immediately opened them and began finding places I could stick them and label things. I used some to label drawers of snacks and some to label breakfast foods in my freezer. I was very impressed that they have stayed sticking good even after a few days in the freezer. They aren't falling off at all. Now my kids don't have to pull out all the containers to find what they want to eat. I've even make a few labels with our names on them. Sometimes the kids have a jug of juice of something that was purchased specifically for them, and now they can label it! I also like that the marker dries nicely so it doesn't rub off if you touch the label once it's dry. It easily cleans off with a wet napkin for re-use too. (I will note that I did cut a few labels in half for my freezer containers.) So they are super versatile for any size needs. I received this item in exchange for an honest review

I teach yoga to my friends and family and ordered five of these straps. I would definitely recommend these because they are affordable and non-slip, with a good tight weave and a generous length. Importantly, the D-ring does not slip, tighten the loop, and cuff off circulation to your foot when you are in a pose. In fact, I have done PNF stretches using these straps (where you push against it for several seconds) and the D-ring has stayed exactly where I adjusted it. This is definitely something I look for in a strap, because I have paid double in the past for straps that were both shorter and prone to slipping D-rings. I received thsi item in exchange for a review.

Love this flag and all it's colors. It is very windy here in TX and the flag got ripped off the flag stand and blew way down the street and lodged in a drain! Through all of that not a single tear. It's seems thin but it's very sturdy highly recommend. I received this item in exchange for an honest review.

Amazing deal! My daughter has been needing a carrying case w/ cartridge slots for her leappad 2 power Doc McStuffins edition and a new charger since her wall charger got left at her dad's a few wks ago. I was shopping for a charger when I found this bundle with both plus a $15 Download card for under 12 bucks!When I was reading reviews I couldn't find any remarks on the LP2 Power , only that it worked as an adapter(doesn't charge) for the regular leappad 2, this car adapter DOES charge the Power, just like the wall charger that comes with the LP2 Power, you can plug it in and play and it charges while you play.

When I was reading most of the negative reviews for this toy organizer, almost everyone mentioned that it was because it doesn't stay on.Here is what I did (very simple) and it does NOT come off and stays put!Scrub clean your tiles with comet and then wash off. Let dry and then I wiped the wall again with windex and also cleaned off the round suction part of the toy organizer. After it dries off, stick the organizer and press hard a couple times and thats it. It stays on really well. I have no problems with it, my 2 year old son would try to yank the mesh bag off sometimes and it still stays on strong.This toy organizer looks great on our bathroom wall :)I received this item in exchange for a honest review.

This is such a great muddler. As soon a s you hold it, you can tell right away just how sturdy it really is. It was made of very high quality material and I know that it will last me a very long time.I really like that it is stainless steel because it looks like a real fancy piece of drinking equipment but it comes at such a great price! It is the perfect size too! Not too big and not too small, just right. The teeth on the muddler do its job! They work really well with all kinds of fruit and even herbs. I would without a doubt recommend this product to anyone looking for an item of this sort. I received this product in exchange for my honest unbiased review.

8:05 MinsIt is easy to install & use.  It was pretty quick to install any of 3 ways -- base with latch/ISOPOS, base with seat-belt, carrier-only with seat-belt.  The handle feels comfortable, rubber grip, and can be easily moved and locked into 4 positions.  It effortlessly releases and attaches back to the base with a single release handle.  It has variable harness positions as the infant grows and a single pull strap to tighten down the harness.  And the cover can be easily extended or pushed back.  The extra cushion for the smaller infants can be removed as it grows.  You can remove and hand-wash the cover and the insert.  It seemed flexible, sturdy, and easy to use.  We are happy with ours.It was pretty quick to install any of 3 ways - (1) base with latch / ISOPOS system, (2) base with seat-belt, or (3) carrier-only with seat-belt.  Plus it gives you instructions everywhere with pictures that were easy to follow.  The instruction book itself was pretty good, and even has a spot on the carrier itself to store the book if you ever need it.  Then without the book there are instruction stickers on the carrier itself and in two places on the base.  So you or anyone should be able to install it into any situation.  It only installs rear facing.  Do consult your car's manual too so you know for sure how your seat-belts work and what it recommends for car seat installation, as well as the car seat's manual.It is hard to think of something missing.  It is only for infants up to 35lbs and 32" tall, so it is designed specifically for infants, so you'll need another car seat once they outgrow it.  Color/style depends on your preference.  The cushions are only hand-washable, but that is better than some that you can only wipe down, and I'm not sure any are machine washable.

Reliable brand, fast, and plenty of room for HD video and pictures.  I record a HD video in my Sony HD Camcorders and already have several SanDisk SDHC Extreme cards (a few 16GB and a 32GB) that I have been very happy with.  High end device manuals will list the write rate (in MB/s) for different resolution choices.  It should also identify a minimum SD card speed, often "Class 10" or "UHS-I" (both of which this more than supports), which guarantee minimums like 10 MB/s for "class 10".  But you will notice your device may be attempting to write much faster than that for higher resolutions.  The device is supposed to manage, but it could mean slower times between shots or dropped frames or resolution scaling depending on how it manages a slower card than its write rate.  This card's 40MB/s write (which is "up to" not guaranteed rate) should mean it can handle your video or photos effortlessly.  I have never had a problem with video quality or delays using SanDisk Extreme cards.  The "Extreme" is actually not their top tier, which is the "Extreme Pro", but this should be great for most people.  Just check your manual to know your write rates.  I am very happy with mine.It is an SDXC (XC = extreme capacity) which isn't necessarily compatible with everything that accepts SDHC (HC = high capacity), although it might work fine.  Just beware if your older device doesn't mention SDXC support, it may not support the size.  Although my camcorder's manual only listed SDHC, it recognized, formatted, and used this SDXC card just fine.Size-wise, it is great for HD video.  At my usual HD resolution, I could record 3.5 hours or so on 16GB, so I just had a few 16GB cards.  But this 64GB card can record over 15 hours, which seems luxurious compared to using 16GB cards.  Of course higher resolutions and newer devices (4K resolutions) will make this seem smaller like how my 16GB card feels today.  But honestly, I'm happy with even the 16GB card, and they are so small you can carry extras with you.  But with 64GB I can just forget about it.

9:46 MinsIt worked easily on my iPhone 5S, but failed to configure on my Android Galaxy Note 3 (which doesn't seem to be reported by anyone else).  It is quite easy to configure.  Once you download the NEO app by Ankuoo it will walk you through it as well.  Once configured, it does what you expect.  You can remotely turn it on and off, configure a countdown timer, scheduled timer, or security timer.  My interest was in remote control on/off to turn on a light in a dark house when we arrive home after dark, and to easily configure a security timer more easily than the old style manual timers.  It claims 15A 1800W support, which is about the max you would do on a normal home circuit.The biggest drawback was that it failed to configure on my Android Galaxy Note 3.  I contacted Ankuoo by email support and they were very friendly, responded the next day, and continued to follow up with me. They said they specifically tested with a Galaxy Note 3 too.  I don't see other reports of configuration failures, so maybe this isn't a common issue.  Just try it within the return policy period.  Second, there was a minor bug that caused 3 instances of the same switch to appear in the app, but was easily fixed by completely closing the app and re-opening.  Otherwise just make sure it matches your decor if it is going to be visible.

9:56 MinsIt is a decent home phone system with the standard set of features you expect in this price range, some advantages, and a few disadvantages.  The buttons are the rubber squishy feel (which is a matter of opinion).  It has rather good button placement (also a matter of opinion).  I really like the mute button on the upper left next to my thumb to use without looking.  Unique to this phone is volume up/down and audio boost on the sides that are easy to adjust while on a call.  The battery lasts slightly over a week (when new).  I like that these phones are thick enough to stand upright on their end, which is easy to grab.  The audio sounds fine, standard for a digital phone, better than a cell phone.  You can adjust audio with equalizer setting buried in menus, but not easily while on a call.  The LCD screen is the standard black & white, nothing special, back-lit only by the orange glow.  I like the large easy buttons on the answering system.Drawbacks: (1) The answering system has an extra light that shines when the handset rests in it, not so great in a bedroom at night.  I just put a picture frame in front.  (2) There is no headset mini-jack port which once used to be common among cordless phones but has disappeared on most.  No Bluetooth headset support either.  (3) You cannot listen to messages from the handsets, unlike some systems.  (4) A light blue energy star logo on the front of the answering system stands out from the black look.  Rest is preference.The K70 series offers models that come with varied numbers of handsets as identified in the last digit - K701, K702, K703, & K704 which come with 1, 2, 3, & 4 handsets respectively.  This is the K702 that has 2 handsets. I haven't found a truly excellent cordless home phone system in 8 years or more, probably due to impact of smart phones.  It doesn't have everything, but it has enough, a few things I like more, and little I will miss.  It replaced my AT&T CL82 series whose batteries were dying.

9:58 MinsThis is a great, economical, high performing printer.  It is noticeably improved from the previous model, the Epson WP-4530 / WP-4540.  I owned and loved the WP-4540 as my primary printer.  This WF-4630/WF-4640 improves upon the 4530/4540 by: (1) A noticeably better color touch screen that is more colorful, more responsive, better audio cues.  (2) Has more options and features.  (3) Scans faster at higher resolution levels.  It continues the benefits of fast printing, duplex (2-sided) printing, fast scanning, duplex (2-sided) scanning, easy setup and software, great wireless, economical printing with large capacity 786 & 786XL ink cartridge support, great print quality, and just being a power house.  This seems to be a decent upgrade.The only difference in the WF-4640 vs WF-4630 is whether or not it comes with an optional second paper tray to place under the unit that is the same otherwise.  I have the WP-4540 that has the extra tray, and decided not to use it because it made the printer larger and I just didn't need the capacity before reloading in my home office.  I use duplex printing and scanning a lot on the previous model (WP-4540).  I love that it just mounts the USB port as a remote drive, so I just leave a USB key plugged in and copy the files from my PC.  Scanning directly to PC (on the old model at least) was significantly slower and didn't offer many of the options for some reason.  After a short while, scanning would sometimes pull in too many pages at a time, so I just feed them one at a time when I hear the audible click when the existing page is pulled in far enough.  Two sided scanning works sell, but if too many pages pile up in the output, it can suck some previous pages back in from the output tray as it pulls the current page back for a second pass or to flip it.The only concern I have is whether or not the 4630/4640 fixes the common internal defect that plagued the 4530/4540.  After a year, many 4530/4540s would leak yellow ink in a single line down the center of the page until exhausted, ruining output for a while, until you ended up with a high quality black & white printer.  Mine was affected by that, but Epson replaced mine free of charge after the warranty expired.  My WP-4540 still has some banding on color output sometimes.  I am just hoping the 4630/4640 has rooted out the problem.  Btw, my Epson Workforce 840 that I infrequently print to has never had a problem.  Only time will tell.  But everything else about it shows me that they improved a number of things.

9:58 MinsThis shredder gives you more in basic shred capability than smaller, cheaper under the desk shredders.  It is surprisingly movable, more than any shredder I own, with (1) rollers (that roll easily on hard surfaces), (2) handles that make it easy enough to carry (not all larger shredders do), and (3) doesn't weigh too much to carry.  Its power cord is nicely oriented downward out the back so it can easily hug the wall.  The 7-gallon bin is much larger than under the desk models, easily opens and closes, supports a bag, and has a bag catch to help with holding the bag tightly.  Its slot is oriented so that you need to push paper in from the front, not straight down, which is actually a bit more natural to hit it straight on.  It has 3 buttons, on/off, force forward or reverse, and automatically runs as paper is inserted.  Overall it has a lot to like if compared to smaller, cheaper alternatives.Drawbacks are: (1) The manual says never to insert envelopes with windows (of which I get plenty of such in junk mail).  (2) It feels a bit basic, plastic feel, and not as refined as some (especially compared to significantly more expensive shredders), most notably with the buttons.  (3) It still audibly stresses a bit as you pack more in it (like most shredders of its caliber).  (4) It doesn't automatically turn off like some energy efficient models (but it is easy enough to use the big button).  (5) It is not 100% jam-proof, so don't expect miracles, but it has jam prevention features that should help.  (6) The bin isn't as big as you might think looking at the front door because the door extends a bit higher than the bin itself.  These are not really flaws in its design, just what to expect at its tier.  It is still 1/3 the price of more expensive tiers that may offer more refinement.I own and love my Fellowes 125Ci at the next tier, but that is in another league and price point.  This strikes a balance in the middle.  It seems much better than my old Royal Confetti Cut under-the-desk shredder that it will replace in another room.  Remember to oil your shredder routinely (once a month or every time you empty the bin).  I use Fellowes Shredder Oil (35250) that came with my Fellowes shredder.  The AmazonBasics shredder didn't come with oil or bags out of the box, but it says you can use shredder oil or just vegetable oil.Remember to oil your shredder.

9:00 MinsIf you like Sequence, you will probably like this game.  It is fun, plays fairly quickly so you can play several times rather than one marathon game.  It has some strategy (defensive and offensive) so it isn't just random and can keep you engaged and thinking a little bit.  But it isn't really a strategy game.  It has a good amount of luck.  So it never feels like the same person always wins and isn't very serious.  Game length are fairly short, so you can easily play several rounds, so it seems like everyone has a chance.  If one person draws a bunch of pairs, it can be over pretty quickly.  Other times by luck and defensive strategies it can take a little longer.The instructions are very nice, large, colorful with good examples, so it is much easier to read than the usual back of the cardboard box.  It actually suggests a number of optional rules, but you can easily come up with more on your own too.  So the game is very flexible.  For example, you can decide that only the top color on a stack counts, so you can block more often and make games run longer.  I think it is nice that there is more ways you can play it so you can change it up if it gets stale.You basically draw 5 cards, and make one play per turn.  Playing a single card can place a piece on one of two spaces for that card value and color.  Pair, triples, or more of the same value will let you play 2,3, or more pieces on any space.  Runs (sequences of 2 or more in same suit) can remove the number of pieces as cards played.  You just need to build a snake across the board in either direction using horizontal and vertical connections (diagonal doesn't count).  You can play on top of others, but level doesn't matter (at least not by standard rules).

8:05 MinsIt is easy to install & use.  It was pretty quick to install any of 3 ways -- base with latch/ISOPOS, base with seat-belt, carrier-only with seat-belt.  The handle feels comfortable, rubber grip, and can be easily moved and locked into 4 positions.  It effortlessly releases and attaches back to the base with a single release handle.  It has variable harness positions as the infant grows and a single pull strap to tighten down the harness.  And the cover can be easily extended or pushed back.  The extra cushion for the smaller infants can be removed as it grows.  You can remove and hand-wash the cover and the insert.  It seemed flexible, sturdy, and easy to use.  We are happy with ours.It was pretty quick to install any of 3 ways - (1) base with latch / ISOPOS system, (2) base with seat-belt, or (3) carrier-only with seat-belt.  Plus it gives you instructions everywhere with pictures that were easy to follow.  The instruction book itself was pretty good, and even has a spot on the carrier itself to store the book if you ever need it.  Then without the book there are instruction stickers on the carrier itself and in two places on the base.  So you or anyone should be able to install it into any situation.  It only installs rear facing.  Do consult your car's manual too so you know for sure how your seat-belts work and what it recommends for car seat installation, as well as the car seat's manual.It is hard to think of something missing.  It is only for infants up to 35lbs and 32" tall, so it is designed specifically for infants, so you'll need another car seat once they outgrow it.  Color/style depends on your preference.  The cushions are only hand-washable, but that is better than some that you can only wipe down, and I'm not sure any are machine washable.

9:53 MinsThis is a stellar large shredder that eats everything you can fit into the opening faster than you can shove more in.  Whether it is 1 page or a stack, it sounds effortless while other shredders whine and slow.  It shreds faster than I can pick up and fit another stack into the opening.  The opening is actually a great design.  It can take nearly anything you can fit in, but it will show you green/yellow/red indicators as feedback about the load before it automatically stops and reverses if too much.  But it takes real effort to overload it because it is hard to fit more than it can handle without carefully aligning and inserting a thicker stack.  I love being able to throw unopened envelopes into it.  I really like the auto on/off energy efficiency so that I never have to turn it on or off again, it is always ready, wakes up instantly, and goes to sleep on its own.  It is narrow so it fits more snugly too.  It holds a good amount before you have to compress it or empty it.  It comes with oil and bags (just oil it every time you empty it).Minor Drawbacks: (1) It is noisier than implied by the description "ultra-quiet".  I really thought it would be very quiet.  It isn't silent.  Someone in the next room can definitely hear it is running, especially on wood floors.  Compared to my previous small shredder, it sounds similar, or slightly better due to no stressing sounds.  But I might not shred while someone is on the phone in the room out of politeness.  (2) You can't fit many envelopes width-wise if you want to avoid fractional readable text appearing on the shreds, but you can just pull out the contents and drop them together.  (3) It does mound up inside under the opening like any shredder, but its size gives it a lot of room before it reaches the top.  (4) I went through 3 damaged units before settling on my 4th.The first 3 units I received all had cracks in the plastic molding, one dented in on the back near the rear handle and power port.  I recommend opening from the bottom and sliding off the box in a way that it would be easy to piece back together to ship back if you find a problem.  Amazon was superb, quickly sending 3 in sequence until temporarily pulling the item to inspect inventory, finding no problem, and a week or two later called to send me my 4th.  My 4th actually had a loose plastic screw that doesn't seem to belong to anything.  But it works great, so I'm happy with it.  Just inspect and exchange within the return period if you have a problem like mine.  I am still happy I bought mine.

9:29 MinsIt is the easiest way to cut armored / shielded cable in 10 seconds.  With the quick-release lever, just adjust the nut once for the size of your cable, then just insert the cable, hold the clamp, squeeze and turn the arm a few times until you feel it spin free, release, and just twist off the armor (as shown towards the end of my video).  It cuts only deep enough to cut the armor without cutting the wires within.  Although it doesn't hurt to tug on the wires and peek to make sure they are fine, but after repeated use I found they were always perfect.  You can try to cut by hand using wire snips (horrible) or by hacksaw (makes me uneasy to risk nicking a wire), but having the right tool like this make it like cutting butter.  I would buy this over and over again for cutting shielded cable.  It save me so much time and effort.We did a lot of cutting with this for a home improvement project on my own home, as I am an avid handyman in my own home.  Actually my wife did most of the cutting with this one.  We made a lot of cuts, and this made it easy and fast.  I first tried to use wire snips like I do with normal electrical wire, and I spent an hour making slow, painful progress before giving up figuring there had to be another way.  I don't trust the depth control by manually cutting with a hack saw.  Having so many cuts ahead of us, we searched for and found this tool.  And wow are we happy.  I cannot attest to whether it will hold up to a pro using it every hour of every day, but for doing a lot of cutting for electrical work (outlets & lighting) that I was doing in my garage, it was perfect.The cutting blade rides the edge of the slot that it sticks through on mine.  At first it seems to be a problem, but that is because there is a bunch of wax on the wheel or in the assembly that doesn't fit between the edge when you push it through at first, and seems like you are grinding the edge.  But it easily works itself off, doesn't really even hinder the first cut you do, and by the end it is spinning freely without a problem at all.  Even if it were to be a problem, I would happily just buy another because it saved us so much time and effort.The RS-101A has the quick release lever instead of only a nut that you have to re-tighten and loosen each time, which is great for cutting the same size cable over and over again.

8:50 MinsAt first I thought this was decent light-weight drill that was up to the job.  I got this as a gift and am very happy with it as a second drill to augment my existing 8-year old Ryobi ONE Plus drill (that I recently dropped and bent).  There is a lot to like.  It seems plenty of power (at first), it is smaller, lighter, has a light, and is easier to use when it comes to weight, size, & light.  I especially like the light, which is quite useful when drilling / screwing in corners and out of the way places without great lighting.  It fits into more spaces than my old drill, which is useful in cramped spaces that the other drill might not even fit.  The charger is very small too, which means you could fit the whole thing in a drawer or small space.  Overall, is a light duty drill for light work, or small spaces.It is missing some conveniences, that kept it from being my one and only primary drill when I first bought it.  (1) It doesn't have a magnetic strip for holding loose items.  It has been so convenient with my Ryobi to have screws & drill bits stuck right on the base of the drill.  (2) The screwdriver is not magnetic to hold a screw on.  This is a huge deal, but easily replaced by just using any screwdriver insert that is magnetic.  It is so convenient on my Ryobi to place a screw on it without having to hold the screw with a second hand.  But the magnetic part is not actually the drill itself, so you should be able to buy one.  (3) It comes with only one battery.  It is very convenient to have two so you never have to stop your work.  You can buy them separately, but they aren't cheap.  (4) The screw direction in/out arrows are hard to see at a glance.  It is much nicer when the arrow is plain and clear right on the button. (5) It doesn't come with a case, so you may have to find a box to put it in if not going in a drawer.  (6) The trigger sensitivity seems a little faster than I would prefer to really control the speed.  It just doesn't seem as natural to vary the speed as it did with my Ryobi that seemed to have more degrees of freedom in acceleration.I do a lot of handy work and home projects around my own house, and I absolutely loved my Ryobi ONE Plus I bought 8 years ago.  I was happy with this drill as a second drill.  It is great for when my Ryobi will not fit or runs out of battery.  If you are an avid handyman around your house, you might really miss some of the features I mentioned if this were your only drill.  But if you just need a drill for occasional light work, this one should be fine.  I could recommend it for light use.  But more real power and conveniences would be better for extended heavy use.UPDATE: This is really a light-duty drill.  I recently did a lot of work in my garage, and this drill did not perform.  It couldn't drill through wood studs that I would normally easily do with my Ryobi.  It just wouldn't drill wood sometimes.  Furthermore, the trigger is too sensitive for my preference with screws.  I feel much more control on my other drills than I have with this.  It ramps up its speed too quickly and feels like it has less control.  This is truly a light-duty drill, okay as a backup, but did not perform when I needed it for a project with more than just a few screws or holes.

2:13 MinsI am very happy with my Kleenex Ultra 8-pack, which is the Kleenex you expect, convenient, and better than standard Kleenex.  Kleenex Ultra is nicer than Kleenex standard, which seems thicker, sturdier, and softer (but less absorbent if used for minor spills).  I just put this on subscription every 2 months, is usually a good value, and very convenient to keep stocked.  You get a variety of colors, which vary by shipment, and you might get multiple of the same design in a box.  I have received 3 orders of this now, and am very happy.The main drawback is that you cannot pick your colors.  You get a random selection, which is usually just fine.  But there may be colors you dislike.  You might end up with multiple of your least favorite design in a box.  I once got several boxes where the sheets were not fully cut and would pull multiple and had to tear them, which I figure could happen at the store as well.  I once noticed a slight funky smell when using a few boxes, which I am rather sensitive to, but it isn't always the case as I haven't noticed it recently.Overall, it is Kleenex Ultra, the same as you would find at the store (as far as I can tell), in a convenient box.

5:16 MinsThis is a perfect switch.  I own many of both the 3-prong grounded 52149 and the 2-prong 5365 (both shown in video), and I love them.  I bought a number of these to deal with vampire electronics that draw power even when off, such as my laptop power brick, old speakers, xbox, and a rarely used satellite receiver.  I also use them to easily toggle lights on/off from the same location.  The construction feels great, holds sufficiently tight but not too tight, is easy to tell when is on or off by a noticeable lever, has a good solid click on/off that I like, and are clean looking white.Just pay attention to the orientation of your plug to make sure the switch will be on the side you want.  Honestly, either way works for me, but it is more convenient when the switches face outward or upward.  As long as the ground is on the bottom, you are fine.  For a flat surface, like on a power strip, then you need to pay more close attention so that the ground is oriented away from you.  But even so, I have some reversed and don't mind reaching around to toggle them.  But it might matter to you.  Also they are white and large enough to be noticeable if you were trying to hide them.I actually like it more than my Belkin Power Conserve grounded switch because I can have several of these on the same power strip.

This is a remarkable camera.  I was very impressed by its features, ease of use, and quality.  Its image stabilization is superb, great easy to use LCD, easy intuitive buttons, and surprisingly impressive projector.  Sony camcorders are remarkable, and significantly better than smart phone video.  The image stabilization, wide angle lens that catches so much more without backing away, ease of use, handling all kinds of lighting, and accurate capture of what you see with your naked eye keep me thoroughly impressed.  Specifically the HDR-PJ810 improves on an already stellar situation.  It just seems like an impressive piece of elegant machinery.  It is impressive to see the stabilization at work, or the projector work so well.  The projector is brighter and more useful than I expected, and automatically adapts to the angle on the wall to attempt to make it most square and viewable.  It is impressive to see it recognize and adjust.I own 3 Sony camcorders now: (1) CM160 after thoroughly researching and purchasing my first, which I love to this day and still take it as my preferred camera on vacations and to theme parks, (2) CX580, & (3) this HDR-PJ810.  Starting from the awesome quality, light & compact CX160, the CX580 wasn't a noticeable improvement upon the CX160.  But now this HDR-PJ810 really impressed me out of the box.  It seemed more refined, responsive, more full featured, wonderful stabilization, supports wireless/NFC transfers, dual format recording, and a surprisingly good projector.The drawbacks are its size and weight compared to my CX580 and CX160.  It doesn't fit in the standard small camcorder cases, only by a bit, but too much that you can't cram it in if you tried.  I prefer to take a tiny case on vacation and to theme parks and nearly forget it is even with me.  This is also heavier by enough to be noticeable.  When holding for long periods, you will get tired with even the smallest cameras, so it could be a factor if you use for long periods without a tri-pod.  But it is still nothing in size or weight compared to what people are buying in expensive SLRs.  Instead, you get a lot more features for the added weight & size.  Regardless, this is easy to recommend if leaving the standard small camcorder case isn't an issue.Recommended: Sony BC-TRV travel charger (see my video review), extra FV50 battery (when you want to pack light), & FV70 battery (when you want one charge to last longer).

10:00 MinsI was really impressed with how light this was.  Out of the box it felt like a feather, then you wrap the cord which seems like half the weight.  Going up and down stairs will be a dream with this one, with one hand.  I was also very impressed by the warranty and 5 free tune-ups (according to the paperwork).  I can easily forgive the lack of attachments for the simplification of such a lightweight swiveling vacuum.  The carry handle is a nice touch.  Buttons on the handles are nice (as long as they work).  It is louder than I expected, but no louder than my old Kenmore upright.  I like that it works on all floors without frequent adjustments.  The swivel feature helps you reach edges, corners, and around things without moving your feet as much.  It easily stands without being tipping, easily releases for use, and can lay flat (in use or for storage).  It is a lot easier to store than my canister, and easier than my Kenmore upright.  I also liked the cord clip that helps hold the cord out of your way.  I was very impressed out of the box, and after some use, I still think it is quite good.Its drawbacks are: (1) It is noisier than you might think, but it makes no claim of being ultra-quiet.  (2) The light on the front is weak, so it isn't a headlight for going into dark closets.  (3) It isn't as wide as some uprights, so it may take slightly more passes, but that can be a pro too to fit into smaller spaces as I found with my equally sized canister vacuum.  (4) No attachments (but I completely forgive this for the design benefits it enables).Mine came with a defect with its power buttons.  It turned on the first time, but immediately stopped working.  I had to pull the plug to turn it off, and then couldn't turn it on anymore.  The power buttons are entirely wireless, backed by a battery.  My battery compartment seems to have a defect where the battery doesn't stay in place, connected to both terminals.  Moving it with my finger a little got it to make sufficient connections to continue working for now.  That was a disappointment.  Otherwise I was pretty impressed.

9:55 MinsThis is a simple, big, durable flashlight.  If you want a big, heavy, flashlight that should last longer on one set of batteries and be more durable than most, then this is a good bet.  It offers decent light output, better than cheap alternatives, with a high and low setting, and a bright center surrounded by a fairly clean even flood.  There are smaller, lighter, equally bright alternatives out there, but in the space targeted for this size and use, it is decent.  Personally, I prefer my much smaller, lighter high powered Coast flashlights.  But you just have to decide on whether larger or smaller it better for you.  There are many garage or trunk applications that this is suited for.Its drawbacks are its (1) size, (2) weight, and (3) single focus beam compared to some alternatives.  Its top benefits are (1) longer lasting on a single set of D batteries, (2) durability, (3) you aren't going to lose it.  It is so much bigger and heavier than my equally powered Coast HP2, HP5, & HP6 flashlights.  You cannot throw it in your pocket or on your belt.  I often throw a Coast flashlight in my pocket and use it off and on throughout handyman jobs around the house.  I also prefer the option for a clean even flood, which is my default until I need to focus on something small.  I find the bright center distracting when an even flood is better, such as searching for something in the dark, or lighting your path.  But the batteries on my others dim over time, which you solve by just having more batteries on hand.  But if it is in the trunk of you car or in the garage, you might prefer longer lasting so that it is always ready.So it is loads better than incandescent flashlights of similar size in the past, and better than some cheap alternatives.  But the size & weight are significant drawbacks.  But according to a picture on the box, it is so durable you could use it as a tire stop for your car :).

5:32 MinsI have used this dispenser for 17-18 years, and I absolutely love it.  I found one 17-18 years ago, I found it so easy to use, and I kept it ever since.  I used it at a job, used it for 3 moves, and still use it to pack any box that I need to ship.  My wife loves it too.  We recently moved, and had more stuff than ever, and constructing and sealing boxes was trivial with this.  Sharing just one, we would have to go find who had it last when we needed it, so I just got a second one.  The 17+ year old one is still as good as ever.  The only servicing I ever had to do was to trivially pinch gunk off the cutter maybe 3 times in 17 years.  Compared to no-dispenser and most other dispensers that I have tried, this is a dream.It is easy to pop on and off rolls of tape, and they will never fall off.  You run the tape out sticky-side up, unlike the little scotch tape dispensers for your desk.  It has prongs that hold the tape out so it is always ready and never gets stuck back on the roll.  The cutter works very well, and doesn't get as gunked up with the sticky side facing away from the cutter.  It is easy to hold with the plastic through the hole.  It has a hand brake on top that you really don't even think about but works to control the rate you dispense as you naturally squeeze when you hold it.  It is very easy to attach the tape to start, just pull to the end of the strip, and push down on the cutter (as shown in the video).  It is also small and compact so it easily stores on a shelf in the office without taking much space.  I honestly can't think of anything wrong with it.

4:53 MinsIt is a decent 6 foot micro USB cable.  The connectors holds on pretty well, tighter than my existing cable, but not overly tightly either.  I've had some cables that held too tightly that seemed to require too much force to remove, but this strikes a good balance.  The cable is a little thicker than some, which might help protect the cable when strung out 6 feet.  The plastic connectors are a bit bulky.  The underlying metal connectors themselves seemed identical to any others that I have had, except about the tightness which I think it strikes a good balance.  The cable overall seems like a decent cable that does the job, but doesn't seem special or supple like some premium cables if you wanted it to feel elegant.The plastic grip at the connectors is slightly bulky compared to some other cables.  The plastic on the micro connector is as thick as my Nokia Lumia 910.  On both ends, the plastic grip is overall larger (longer and ticker) than the cable that came with my phone.  It might be a positive for some if you wanted more to grip onto.  For others, it just makes the cable feel a bit less elegant than some cables.But make sure you actually need a micro USB 2.0.  It is very close in size to mini USB 2.0.  Micro USB 3.0 is not the same connector as micro USB 2.0.  I compare and show the ports & connectors in the video if you are unsure.  But at the time of this review, most non-Apple smart phones seem to use micro USB 2.0.

4:49 MinsThey are identical replacement blades & foil for the Remington FR-730, recommended every 6 months.  If you just need to replace worn out blades & foil, then this does it.  At first I loved my Remington FR-730 which seemed effortless compared to my previous worn out rotary.  In time as the blades dulled it took more and more work on the same area and pressing harder.  You aren't supposed to press hard.  So replacing the blades should restore the cutting performance.  In reality it didn't restore to my original effortless impression, but it was noticeably better, and I didn't have to press hard anymore.  Especially on short hair (like upper lip) it catches it with fewer passes and lighter touch than the dull blades.  But I do still have to cover the same area more than I recall in my first impression, just not quite as much.  I do believe they are the identical replacements, and I expect it probably does technically restore it to nearly new condition, but your shaving behavior with dull blades might continue to hold influence in your daily routine.As a package, it is just a small box with 1 bubble wrap bag of 3 pieces, slightly separated to not damage each other.  There are no instructions, but the box says to see the website for instructions.  At the time of my purchase, the website had no such instructions on either the part or even the shaver anymore.  But it is really easy to do.  You just pull up on the blades and they come right off.  I just didn't want to break it by assuming to pull.  I show in the video exactly how to do it if you need to see.

This is essentially an upgraded Harmony Touch, with RF control, and tweaks.  For the remote itself and software, please see my video review of the Touch.  The Ultimate has all the pros & cons of the Touch, but adds some nice features that are only positive over the Touch.  But the touch-screen oriented remote itself is still the biggest point of debate depending on your preference.  Like the Touch, the bottom line is that if you are a physical remote power user -- hold the remote one-handed & frequently use press physical buttons without looking, it is nowhere near as easy as the One or 900 were, so I say 3-star.  But if you prefer touch screens and don't mind two-handing it to play/pause/forward/back, I'd say 5-star.  The Harmony Smart Control is an interesting alternative with RF and usable physical buttons.  Compared to the Touch, you have to like RF enhancements and tweaks.  For me, I'm torn between the Smart Control and Ultimate as two polar choices about what to do about the touch screen, integrate or use your existing.  Aside from one-handed use preferences, there is a lot to like about the Ultimate.I have the One (discontinued), 900 (discontinued), Simple Control, Touch, & (this) Ultimate.  See my Touch video review for a contrast to the One & 900 which when one-handed buttons were ergonomically perfect.  The new line of remotes have their advantages over the One & 900, including much better online software, easy on-remote configuration without having to connect to a PC, and a much bigger main IR blaster.  For the Ultimate, you can still optionally use IR from the remote depending on device, they improved the RF to IR, no line-of-sight for IR needed, and the return of lots of configurable choices.  Drawbacks are: (1) Limited one-handed physical button usage (same as Touch).  (2?) Compared to the 900, you still have mini-IR blasters and can buy precision IR cables, but I haven't seen the ability (yet) to pair additional main blasters like you can for the 900.  So for my existing 900 setup with 2 main blasters and 4 mini-IR, I would have to reposition my devices to share the fewer blasters, or just rely on IR from the remote to cover the ones.  They didn't advertise the 900's ability to pair additional main blasters, so perhaps it is the same for Ultimate if you were to try another.For reliable operation, you want a straight line of sight from the IR emitters to the IR receiver on each device.  And you might have to tinker with some devices that are finicky such as by altering power on wait timing before more commands like changing input.  If you have trouble, it is most likely a line-of-sight issue (relying on bouncing signals) or device delays.  My TV starts missing commands after we dust and move the emitter without realizing it, and the default power-on timing for my TV causes it to miss the input change by default, so it needs to wait longer after power-on or add a button command to set input again at end.Related Reviews:Touch (video): http://www.amazon.com/review/R1J5EF6N8ZEFLY/ref=cm_cr_rdp_permSimple Control: http://www.amazon.com/review/R3TDLD0ITMONOU/ref=cm_cr_rdp_permOne (video): http://www.amazon.com/review/RH9NV6NMTOWVK/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm900 (video): http://www.amazon.com/review/R2GPJD72HKV7HC/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm

Simpler is better in this case, if you like the idea of still having a physical remote, and an option for touch screen for advanced control.  Rather than integrating its own inferior touch screen, it just uses your existing stellar touch screen (phone or tablet).  That leaves the remote with just physical buttons without having to fit a touch screen that affects button layout, weight, battery, and natural button to thumb alignment while holding it.  If you have your phone or tablet always next to you while watching TV anyway, you might as well leverage it.  The Touch and Ultimate integrate a touch screen on the remote, and if you like using physical buttons, it significantly reduces ergonomic use of the buttons you use frequently at the top (see my Touch video review).  For those like me who really want to use physical buttons with one hand, the Simple Control is much better.  For those who like touch screens for everything, this utilizes a superior touch screen that you already have.  It simply marries the back-end pieces you need to translate to IR signals your equipment understands.I have the One (discontinued), 900 (discontinued), (this) Simple Control, Touch, & Ultimate.  See my Touch video review for a contrast to the One & 900 which when one-handed buttons were ergonomically perfect.  The new line of remotes have their advantages over the One & 900, including much better online software, easy on-remote configuration without having to connect to a PC, and a much bigger main IR blaster.  For the Smart Control, you don't have to charge the remote weekly (just replace battery yearly or so), you get a usable one-handed remote (although not as supreme as One/900), no line-of-sight for IR needed, and buttons are usable one-handed.  Drawbacks are: (1) No optional IR so you must ensure you line up IR blasters to every device. (2) Only one mini-IR repeater provided, so all your devices much have line of sight to the huge main blaster or the one mini repeater.  It does have one repeater port available so you can buy 1 more mini-IR or precision cables.  With my existing 900 setup of 2 main blasters and 4 mini-IRs, I have to reconfigure to reach anything without an option for IR from the remote itself.  But this main blaster is huge and should work for the majority of people.For reliable operation, you want a straight line of sight from the IR emitters to the IR receiver on each device.  And you might have to tinker with some devices that are finicky such as by altering power on wait timing before more commands like changing input.  If you have trouble, it is most likely a line-of-sight issue (relying on bouncing signals) or device delays.  My TV starts missing commands after we dust and move the emitter without realizing it, and the default power-on timing for my TV causes it to miss the input change by default, so it needs to wait longer after power-on or add a button command to set input again at end.Related Video Reviews:Touch: http://www.amazon.com/review/R1J5EF6N8ZEFLY/ref=cm_cr_rdp_permOne: http://www.amazon.com/review/RH9NV6NMTOWVK/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm900: http://www.amazon.com/review/R2GPJD72HKV7HC/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm

2:34 MinsIt is an assortment of supposedly common washers for faucet repair.  It makes it very convenient to just grab a pack, and figure any washers you need are likely in there.  It saves you time from waiting to identify exactly the washers you need and time hunting around to find exact replacements, and depending on how many you need it might or might not be cheaper.  For sheer convenience, it is nice to have a pack that should have all the usual washers related to faucet repair.  But of course all that really matters is whether it actually has the washers you actually need.  It did have exactly the washers I needed.I was replacing an old faucet with a new one.  Generally you should replace existing washers to ensure no leaks.  My existing shutoffs had washers.  They looked okay at first, but upon further inspection the hot supply washer was falling apart.  To play it safe I just replaced both.I had a tiny bit of leakage at first.  But I think that is more my line and nut than the washer.  I applied some teflon tape (that you use in any threaded plumbing situation), with some extra by the washer, and it doesn't leak.  I am very happy with it being a perfect fit for what I needed.

2:15 Mins(based on 1-pack) It is an excellent adapter that perfectly solved my problem to convert between two sizes.  It seems perfectly constructed, was a perfect fit, and didn't leak at all.  You can use it for just its threaded ends (3/8-inch thread to 1/2-in thread) or you can optionally use the 3/8-inch compression fitting nut.  Remember to use teflon tape on the threads like any plumbing situation.  And you might need to replace worn out washers if existing connections use them (I used the Danco 80817 Washer Assortment). I really couldn't expect more out of this.I needed it to convert a new 3/8-inch threaded faucet hose to my existing 1/2-inch threaded shutoff.  The alternative was to replace my shutoff, which is a lot more work and risk.  I was so happy to find this adapter to just connect the new faucet to the existing shutoff.  It perfectly solved my problem.

You can use it for just its threaded ends (3/8-inch thread to 1/2-in thread) or you can optionally use the 3/8-inch compression fitting nut.  Remember to use teflon tape on the threads like any plumbing situation.  And you might need to replace worn out washers if existing connections use them (I used the Danco 80817 Washer Assortment). I really couldn't expect more out of this.I needed it to convert a new 3/8-inch threaded faucet hose to my existing 1/2-inch threaded shutoff.  The alternative was to replace my shutoff, which is a lot more work and risk.  I was so happy to find this adapter to just connect the new faucet to the existing shutoff.  It perfectly solved my problem.

8:37 MinsThis faucet is very functional and looks great.  The combined hose sprayer and main faucet works great.  It is really easy to just grab and spray around and slip back.  It has 3 easy controls - stream (default), shower, and pause.  The stream mode doesn't seem as powerful as my old faucet, but doesn't seem like a bad thing, but might take longer to fill a sink.  It seems more aerated with less actual water volume.  It always reverts back to stream when you turn off or pause.  The shower mode is wide and full bodied which is noticeably better than my old faucet so it makes for quick rinsing (better than stream).  It stays on with one press until you turn off or pause.  The pause mode is great (hold to pause) so you can quickly stop the water for a short bit, such as while you pull out the hose and move to fill a pan to the side of the sink without spraying the counter.  I especially like the way the handle operates.  You can easily turn on/off and warm/cold with very good fluid control over granularity and you can do it with the side of your hand or arm if your hands are dirty and you don't want to contaminate the handle.  Lastly the soap dispenser works well and you can fill it from the top so you don't have to unscrew the reservoir to fill in the future.  Overall I am very happy with it.Installation is really easy.  But it doesn't come with universal adapters to fit just any existing shutoff.  So if your existing shutoffs do not take a 3/8 inch threaded connector, you will need to find an adapter to convert to fit or replace your shutoffs.  I spent most of my time shopping for the right adapter to convert from this 3/8 inch threaded connector to my existing 1/2 inch threaded shutoff.  I ended up buying the Watts LFA124 3/8 to 1/2 adapter and Danco 80817 replacement washers.  Also you will have to clean up around the holes after removing your existing faucet, which can take some time.  For me a bathroom cleaning block (a stone) make extremely quick work of removing old hard water deposits & grime.  The back of the box says you need plumbers putty, but the instructions never have you use it.  It comes with a gasket that seems to make a good seal without the need for plumbers putty (or clear silicon caulk) to seal around the holes.  If it weren't for not fitting my shutoff, installation would have seemed trivial.It does fit 1,2,3, or 4 hole designs, depending on whether you use the 3-hole base plate or use as a single post, and whether you use the soap dispenser.  Some people report the need to use the base plate for added stability if the sink isn't sturdy on its own.  My porcelain sink didn't need it.  However, note that the handle will still extend out to the side over a hole, so you cannot literally have existing things in both holes on either side.  But you can install the handle in either direction.

5:03 MinsI couldn't be happier with this.  It is extremely easy to use.  You just turn it on, it immediately tells you to go to your phone settings for Bluetooth, and select it, and then it just remembers.  The buttons easily work as you would expect, and the visual display for things like power, bluetooth connection work well.  Just remember to hold for 2 seconds for power or to re-pair bluetooth because it saves you from accidentally touching them.  Most importantly, I think it sounds great from both ends.  Listing from the Jabra end sounded as good as any speakerphone that I've ever used.  Listening from the other end (talking to someone else using the Jabra speakerphone) couldn't even tell they were on speakerphone.  I thought it actually sounded better in person than it comes across in the video.  The case is a nice touch to help tote it too.  I never got any echo at all from either end.  I really couldn't be happier.I can hardly find anything not to like.  I don't understand the battery level status when I press the battery button.  And I might have preferred if the USB cable end had a notched area in the bottom plastic to hold it rather than just squeezing it slightly in the gap.  But really, that's it.  This is a no-brainer recommendation for me.

Microsoft office is still the best overall office suite out there.  It is always stable and reliable.  If you have used other office suites at length, you probably know what I mean.  Among Microsoft Office releases, 2013 is largely similar to 2010, but tweaks the UI to be more tablet oriented, UI color style simplified (for better or worse), & more sky drive enablement (probably for more interoperability with Office 365).  With this retail license, you can install on one system at a time, but can transfer if you buy a new computer (every 90 days) or if there is a failure.  Office 365 on the other hand is a yearly fee but lets you install onto up to 5 PCs at the same time aside from online "on-demand" remote access.  Overall it is still the #1 leader, it is robust and reliable, and perhaps the most competent overall office suite out there.The UI has changed slightly to be more tablet friendly.  It works fine for mouse users, but mouse uses are likely to find the style a little less elegant.  This means start up, choices, and menus seem more boxy for swiping and selecting with your finger.  This is most noticeable on the start-up for Word when you can select types of new documents.  The color pallet is the biggest non-functional difference that makes for a more simplistic feeling monotone display.  Perhaps it is supposed to look better on a tablet this way.  But if upgrading from 2010 on mouse-based PC, you are likely to think it lost the color and texture and find it harder on your eyes.  The default all-white layout is harder on my eyes.  It is the #1 reason that if only upgrading from 2010 on a normal mouse-based PC that I'd stick with 2010.  But remember this is just visual style. The underlying functionality is still the same as ever.  Although the color pallet definitely bothers some (just see all the reviews that take issue with it).  It seems trivial for Microsoft to address it, so I hope they offer some more options in a future service pack.So if needing a new office suite, this is still one of the best choices.  They did make some style choices that I like less, but if you have a tablet it might be more ideal.  If you already have Office 2010 on a mouse-based PC, I'd probably stick with 2010 for now.

9:57 MinsIf you are are looking for a good, decent router, with lots of features, this one does the job.  Also check for updated firmware that can add more features (like guest network) and fix some issues.  It has a lot of features, more than what any average person to moderate techie needs.  It is quite easy to set up and doesn't need a lot of tinkering.  I set mine up in less than 10 minutes, which was mostly just picking and writing down choices (SSID x 2, network key, & admin password.  Its range and performance is decent, but is not the top of the line range or performance, but should be good enough for most.  For laptops, tablets, and smartphone usage around the home, including upstairs, it gives decent coverage.  But my previous Buffalo N300 router was a bit stronger and did better (although still not perfect) for my xbox in an upstairs bedroom within a wooden cabinet with a glass door (an unreasonable expectation).  But regardless, the Buffalo router got 4-bars in that cabinet where this gets 3-bars.  Either are loads better than the cheap Westell DSL router that came with my DSL.  For normal usage around even upstairs rooms, it does the job reliably.There are a few drawbacks.  (1) It didn't quite have the power to get through every obstacle (but was respectable) that my Buffalo N300 could.  (2) Its LEDs are very bright compared to my other 2 routers, and can be a little distracting.  (3) The 5.0 GHz range wasn't as strong upstairs (although that is expected of 5.0 GHz vs 2.4 GHz).  (4) It is large and cannot be stood up.  (5) The 2.4 GHz ping was double (102ms) that of the 5.0 GHz (52ms).  Realistically, the only 2 things that disappointed me was that it didn't beat my Buffalo N300 router on my upstairs Xbox in a cabinet, and the LED lights are a little bright (maybe they can be configured in the settings?).Otherwise it has a lot of features and capabilities.  I would recommend it anyone who wants more features than my Buffalo N300 offers.  But if you are looking to push the range and performance to extremes, then there are more expensive better routers out there.  But I can still recommend this one for normal needs.

4:02 MinsIf you have a USB *3.0* micro port, then this is a good quality cable.  But make sure you actually have a 3.0 micro port, which is wider with a notch, and is *not* the same as a tiny USB 2.0 micro port.  I show some port comparisons in the video at the 1 minute mark.  Most cell phones and tiny portable devices use tiny USB 2.0 micro ports (at least as of 2013), and cannot be used with this.  But most USB 3.0 external drives will use this port.  So just verify what port you actually have before ordering, and compare to the pictured micro end of the cable (or compared in the video).It is a good quality USB 3.0 micro connector cable.  It seems slightly more sturdy than the stock cable that came with my external drive.  As a relatively short (3 feet) digital cable, signal quality shouldn't be a problem on any digital cable.  The micro end is colored blue, which isn't always the case.  The connectors otherwise seem standard.  The thickness is where you feel like it is more sturdy.  It does the job.Beware the Amazon description (if they haven't fixed it yet) about it being a USB *3.0* micro port, not your usual micro USB of the past.  The actual packaging is clear.

2:34 MinsIt is an assortment of supposedly common washers for faucet repair.  It makes it very convenient to just grab a pack, and figure any washers you need are likely in there.  It saves you time from waiting to identify exactly the washers you need and time hunting around to find exact replacements, and depending on how many you need it might or might not be cheaper.  For sheer convenience, it is nice to have a pack that should have all the usual washers related to faucet repair.  But of course all that really matters is whether it actually has the washers you actually need.  It did have exactly the washers I needed.I was replacing an old faucet with a new one.  Generally you should replace existing washers to ensure no leaks.  My existing shutoffs had washers.  They looked okay at first, but upon further inspection the hot supply washer was falling apart.  To play it safe I just replaced both.I had a tiny bit of leakage at first.  But I think that is more my line and nut than the washer.  I applied some teflon tape (that you use in any threaded plumbing situation), with some extra by the washer, and it doesn't leak.  I am very happy with it being a perfect fit for what I needed.

4:48 MinsThis contains (1) a generic USB charger, plus (2) a USB to Apple 30-pin connector cable.  So if you have an iPhone 4S or below, or iPod with 30-pin connector, then this kit is really for you.  Others can still make use of the USB charger, but bring your own cable.  It is a small, compact charger that doesn't stick out of your cigarette lighter very far, which is nice to have a low profile.  The light is surprisingly bright (as shown in the video).  For some, it might be too bright.  For others it is a welcome bright light you can actually see in the sunlight.  A small piece of electrical tape would do to cover it partially if it really bothers you.  But is bright enough that you will know for sure it is on, especially at night.  The bottom line is that it works, is a nice low profile, and has a light bright enough to see in the sunshine, but some may not like the brightness at night.You can use the USB charger with nearly any device provided you use your own USB charging cable.  Most phone chargers are just a USB plug for a power outet plus the USB cable to whatever port the device has.  The cable they provide is for the older Apple connector prior to the iPhone 5, such as the iPhone 4S or below.  Otherwise you need to remember to bring your existing cable with you.  In my case, I have an iPhone 5 and a Nokia Lumia 920 Windows 8 Phone, both with USB wall chargers and cables.  So I can just use those existing cables.  But if you want to leave the cable in the car, you will need to buy the cable separately, or buy a car charger that comes with the correct extra cable to match your device.

9:39 MinsOf small massage cushions (meaning not full back chair cushions), I think it is possibly the best of its type.  It is very well constructed, seems like a quality product right out of the box, and does a good job doing what it does.  It is larger than many small cushions, so it fits better on your back and stays in place better than some.  It has larger rollers than many others I've tried, including Sharper Image full back massage cushions, which is nice because you really feel it more, but not in a painful way.  I prefer these larger rollers.  There is no heat, but that is okay unless you were expecting it.  You can reverse the direction of the rotation, which is nice, and not all others do this (including Sharper Image).  There are 3 intensity settings, which just means they rotate faster, not deeper.  I really like the slowest rotation setting.  The remote cord is plenty long enough, as well as the power cord.  For its type, I think it is a quality product.  Plus you can use it on more than just your back.  I particularly like using it on my feet.It does have two main drawbacks.  (1) All cushions that do not fill your whole back cause back strain where they leave your back unsupported.  You cannot just lean back and relax.  This is the largest failing of this cushion, or any of its type.  One part of your back feels better, but the other unsupported part aches from no support.  You can supplement this by placing additional pillows to fill the gaps, but then that also makes it harder to reposition the cushion.  At least this cushion is rather large compared to many of its type, and leaves you more supported than some others.  (2) Second, like any others of this type, it doesn't move up or down at all.  This means you have to constantly reposition it.  So you cannot just sit back and relax before you find yourself moving it again.  It it nice to work one spot sometimes when you really need it.  But the cushion is large, and the rollers are in the top half.  You can flip it over to get the lower part of your back.  But you do need to do a lot of repositioning.In terms of amount of relaxation and muscle soothing, after the added strain of the drawbacks, the net affect is just "okay".  I cannot highly recommend any cushion.  For the price, I think it is okay to keep.  I never yearn to use it, but I grab it once in a while.  After this I bought the Sharper Image full back massage cushion and was equally unimpressed and returned it.  If you are set on a small cushion, this seems to be one of the best of its type, and is well constructed.  But don't expect to be impressed with the result of any of its type.

9:58 MinsI think this is the best of over-the-chair massage seat cushions, but it just wasn't relaxing.  The bottom line is at the end of the day, I expect to feel better, more relaxed and eased muscles, for having used this.  But it just didn't make me feel any better.  It has a lot of advantages over a small massage cushion that only rotates.  This is a full back cushion, so (1) you can lean back without the strain of leaning against only a partial smaller cushion, and (2) it traverses your back for you instead of you having to constantly reposition a fixed rotating cushion.  It is slightly better than a fixed cushion, but still did not do the job.  I really liked this more than other full-back massage chair cushions I tried, such as those from HoMedics and cheaper ones from Sharper Image.  So if you are set on one, I would suggest this as a best-of-available choices candidate, but any of them are hard to recommend for a good relaxing experience.  Due to the price, and it doesn't really do the job for me, I am returning mine.  I am going to start considering a real, full massage chair.  The net relaxing experience was just "okay".The heat aspect was very faint, if it even heated at all.  I expected the "heat" mode to actually feel warm or hot.
