Our previous household pillow situation was pretty bleak.  We had only (1) hand-me-down goose down pillows from my in-laws, circa 1977, that had about five feathers left in them, or (2) cheapo pillows that felt like they were stuffed with cotton balls.  Both options were flimsy and left my body (particularly my neck) in pain.Therefore, it was no surprise that I woke up every morning with a huge crick in my neck.  After I bought this pillow, the pain went away after about a week.  It has not returned since.My wife then started trying to steal my pillow, so we bought one for her.  She never had the neck pain that I had, but she reports sleeping better and moving around less in her sleep (and I can confirm that she sleeps like a rock now).The memory foam is awesome.  The pillow has kept its shape for a long time now, and the cooling effect of the pillow is a great feature.  We no longer have to worry about flipping the pillow because the pillow stays cool.The only thing we both would change about this pillow is that its just a smidge thicker that we would like.  It always feels a little high upon trying to fall asleep.  So, if we could change it, we would make it one 1/2 inch to an inch shorter, but this is minor.  I am pain free now, so I really cant complain.

We've been hosting gluten free holidays these days and have been trying to make gluten free recipes that taste as close to the real thing as possible.  This is *especially* hard with stuffing: it's pretty easy for people to sniff out a fake stuffing, given that bread plays such a prominent role.For the first such holiday, my wife and I were up for a challenge: we chose to make a somewhat difficult stuffing recipe, Emeril Lagasse's Savory Spinach and Artichoke Stuffing, even though we had never made stuffing before, and gluten free to boot.  We knew that we needed to choose a very soft bread (which many gluten free breads are not).These Udi's baguettes were perfect for the job.  They were soft, and ended up retaining the right amount of softness even after leaving them out for a few days for the recipe.  The stuffing turned out perfectly.  We've ended up making this recipe many times since, and we wouldn't consider making it with anything else other than these baguettes.Of note: it has been very hard to find these baguettes in our local stores--even at Whole Foods and even at our specialty mom and pop health foods store that carries a wide selection of gluten free foods and used to carry these baguettes.  Even if you can find these baguettes locally in the freezer section, I would recommend buying these fresh because the bread will be softer this way and will taste better in your recipes.  Bon appetit!

We bought this steamer to save money on dry cleaning.Initially, we did save money on dry cleaning because it worked all right: it would put out steam for about 1-2 minutes, which was enough time to steam a shirt or a suit quickly before the steam stopped.  I wasn't thrilled, but I knew from research that (1) other, less expensive steamers didn't work at all, and (2) more expensive steamers might do a better job, but we weren't in the position to spend several hundred dollars on a steamer.I am disappointed to say that now the steamer doesn't work at all.  It turns on, it makes noise as if it's going to put out some steam, but it doesn't do anything at all.  I have cleaned out the reservoir and the tubing, but this hasn't made a difference whatsoever.  Now that the steamer is out of warranty--after very little time has passed--we are stuck with an expensive, worthless steamer.  This happened after approximately 25 mediocre uses--mediocre in that the steam function lasted only for 1-2 minutes per steaming session.My regret is that I ignored the strong warnings on here before I ordered this steamer and listened only to the glowing reviews.  I, unfortunately, now find myself in the camp of those who must try to steer you away from this product.

I'll never forget the day I thought I was doing a good husbandly deed by taking my wife to a birthday weekend at the spa.  Everything seemed like a good idea upon booking the trip, during the trip, and all the way up until my wife went to her last class: a pilates reformer class.  At the time of her class, I was sunning at the pool (not particularly wanting to work out my muscles).  When she exited her class 90 minutes later, she was beaming.She described being reformed by a pilates reformer.  She described hanging nearly upside-down on the "Cadillac of reformers."  She described feeling much more toned--just after that one workout--and feeling refreshed.  But I'm no fool.  I saw the look on her face.  She wanted one at home, given that running had been giving her some trouble those days.  The price tag for one of those things?  Oh, you know, just $5-10k.So we both researched what types of machines might be even remotely affordable; might fit into our home; and might come close to offering a true pilates reformer workout.  Fortunately, we found this machine, and at a fraction of the cost of the "Cadillac" reformer, and it has all of the qualities we were looking for--and more (e.g. the "total gym" elements like a fixed pulling bar).  It's such a nifty machine that I've started doing my workouts there and now we have fights over who gets to use the machine.As for the pilates-specific features, the machine offers tons of different exercises, and a DVD to show you various types of workouts.  My wife actually has been able to wing several of the workouts just from her one pilates class, and I've been able to do the same just from watching her (or quick searches on the internet).  It's an intuitive machine with easy-to-use features but tons of options.  I love that I can adjust the machine to a higher angle (therefore making it harder) while my wife can adjust the machine to a lower angle (therefore making it easier).  I also like that the numbers on the side of the machine at the adjustment sites allow me to track my progress.Our machine has been going strong for almost four years now and works just as well as it did the day it arrived at our home.  We have never folded it up, so I can't comment meaningfully on how well it folds up and stores.  To note: there's a slight bump in the sliding feature (when you're, say, lying on your back and sliding up and down on the cushion), and that sensation and noise can be a little annoying, but I've learned to live with that given the multi-thousand-dollar costs savings.If you like pilates or any sort of resistance strength training, and if you think you'll use this machine at least 2-3 days a week and have the space for it (it's about 8 feet long!), then I would recommend this product wholeheartedly.  My wife and I have both seen small but important changes in our bodies just from using his machine.

This mac and cheese is stupendous.  I had never had any until I came home the other day and my wife handed me a bowl of white cheddar mac and cheese for dinner.  I knew it would be gluten free because we don't eat gluten, so I wasn't sure if the noodles would be good, given that some GF products can be hit-or-miss.I was shocked when I ate the first bite of this.  It is creamy and the noodles taste like real noodles--none of that stiff taste that some GF noodles are known to taste like.  Another thing that makes this mac and cheese so delicious is that the cheese doesn't clump up like the cheese in other mac and cheeses do.  Finally, the cheese has the perfect mix of richness and tartness.  It has a nice taste and is a bit unusual (in a good and welcome way) for a mac and cheese mix.The icing on the cake: buying this 12-pack turns out to be $2 cheaper per box than our local grocery store.Downsides (there are a couple):(1) We're down to box 2 of 12.  This shipment arrived within the past seven days, folks.(2) I've started making it for dinner now on more nights than I'd like to admit (see #1 immediately above for the result of that).  Sadly, when I hand my wife her bowl of macaroni, she always asks with a glimmer of hope, "This isn't the WHOLE box, is it?"  But it always is.  It's darn near impossible to eat just one serving.  So, we end up wasting 80% of our daily calories on whey, cultured pasteurized milk, non-animal enzymes, and sodium phosphate.Essentially, we can't go back to any other brand!  It's delicious!  And there's no comparison between this and Annie's single-serving microwave mac and cheese; this one is the clear winner.

Once we started finding the telltale little teeth marks on the backs of our iPhones and iPads, we knew it was time to buy our son his own "smartphone," the cautionary tales of "screentime for children under two" be damned.  No--we bought him this "faux" smartphone, and this purchase has been a pretty good one overall.Here's what we like:1) It's designed like a regular smartphone--rectangular shape, home button in the bottom middle, and nine "apps"--to make your child think that this is his own smartphone.  So far, it has kept our child's interest, though he still lunges for our devices sometimes. His interest in our devices has definitely waned.2) The characters are engaging.  Each character says something different, and each character says up to three (or more) different sayings, depending on when you press their buttons.  Some of their sayings aren't necessarily grammatical (e.g. Cookie Monster: "me favorite color is blue"; Elmo: "What's your favorite thing to do today?"), but my memory doesn't go far back enough to know if this is in line with Sesame Street, and certainly I'm not worried my son is going to say "me favorite color is _________," at least not through adulthood.  (And I just wrote what was probably the worst run-on sentence in the history of mankind, so what was that expression about not throwing rocks if you live in a glass house?)3) The lights and colors keep our son fascinated for a pretty decent amount of time.4) The touch screen is quite sensitive, which allows our son to manipulate the touch screen himself--and it seems to amuse him to no end that he's able to elicit these noises from the phone.5) The phone is quite sturdy.  We haven't had any major accidents with it yet, but it looks like it will last.Here's what we'd improve upon:1) The home button is what activates the nine "apps" on the touch screen.  If your child doesn't press the apps frequently enough, then your child has to "reactivate" the touch screen by pressing the home button.  This is, of course, all lost on our under-one child; all he cares about is that the Sweet Lil Elmo who was talking to him (ungrammatically) about weekend activities all of a sudden went away.  So, as it turns out, the toy ends up being much more mom-and-dad interactive than I hoped it would be.  On the other hand, it is supposed to be a toy for older kids, so this is all pretty understandable.2) The phone is pretty bulky.  It's approximately three times the thickness of a regular iPhone, so if the Sesame Street characters belting out ABCs didn't already scream out to your kid that "hey! This is NOT a real iPhone!", then the bulkiness of this toy will definitely give it away.These two things above are minor, however.  This toy keeps our little guy entertained--even if only for a few minutes at a time--and he lights up when he hears Elmo "calling" him.  For $13, the price is well worth it.A few final notes:1) We find the noise is perfectly adequate.  This is a huge con for lots of other reviewers--maybe they're living in louder houses with more children, which would then make it understandable that they can't hear this smartphone over the din of the other noises in their house, but this phone seems like the perfect volume.  It's definitely not quiet enough that I would take it on an airplane or anything like that--it's basically just a regular volume.  I actually like that it's regular volume and not loud, both for my child's ears and our sanity as parents.2) The item description says that there are some small parts that could be a choking hazard for children under three.  Maybe I'm missing something, but I'm not seeing anything like that.  Our child is well under one and we let him munch on this phone for snacks in between meals.  The battery cover is encased in recessed screws, and I can't see how the home button would pop out.  So, if you're looking for this product for a child who is under the age of three, I'm not your attorney, and I'm not your torts attorney, but I can't see why you wouldn't be fine purchasing it.

I have to admit, it feels a little bit like Fight Club every time I talk about these mints.  Everyone else is either pretending as if they've never heard about these mints or they've actually never heard about these mints.  Does nobody else remember those 1990s commercials with George Kennedy (Captain Ed Hocken in the Naked Gun series) for Breath Asure?  I don't know what the difference is between Breath Asure and Mint Asure, but I do know that I used to be able to find them in skeezy convenience stores, circa 2000, until one day I couldn't.  Thank god for the internet.Essentially, in the aforementioned 1990s commercials, George Kennedy used to discuss how bad breath was really down deep and not just in your mouth.  There was even a picture of an esophagus and an intestinal tract.  Well, I've come to believe that he was so right.  Every time I've ever had onions or garlic and then brushed my teeth, I've still had bad breath, presumably because the onions or garlic have traveled beyond my mouth and I can't get to them.  (This is a gross but necessary way of putting it: your burp doesn't smell like mint just because you've brushed your teeth, right?)  These little suckers, however, are amazing.  They're just parsley seed oil capsules, coated in something better tasting--parsley seed oil itself is extremely bitter, so don't bite through the capsule out of curiosity; I made that mistake one time.Here's what you do with the mints: anytime you've had a garlicky meal, take 1-3 of these mints and roll them around in your mouth for approximately 30 seconds to 1.5 minutes.  Then swallow them.  That's it!  They last for about 12 hours for me.  For instance, if I have a really garlicky dinner and take a few mints, I'll notice the next morning that everything is great, but then that later in the day, a little bit of bad breath can come creeping back.  However, this is only for meals that are extremely garlicky.Note that you'll still want to brush your teeth.  If you do both of those things (these mints + tooth brushing), you'll be golden.  If you aren't around a toothbrush because you're out and about, these mints plus a regular mint or gum will also do the trick.  But these mints are NOT equal to gum.  These mints are a completely different animal than anything else.  Again, these mints go down into your body and neutralize the smell of the garlic or onions.  Gum or a peppermint in your mouth cannot do this.  This cannot be overstated enough.These mints truly are genius.  I don't eat garlic or onions that much, but when I do, I cannot be without these mints.

When I was young, my parents had this book and used to (gently) demand that we "play" this book from time to time.  It was always thought provoking and always an ice breaker.Fast forward to when I moved into my own apartment in college: they were delighted to dump many of their well-worn possessions--including this book--into my lap.  I used this book many a time with new and old friends to get to know them better, both in college, in my 20s and beyond.  It's a great after dinner activity at a dinner party when the conversation has lulled, because everybody gets to know a lot about everybody else and everybody seems to like it.  The questions, a mix of "what would you do in this situation" and "what's more important to you: x or y?" and other psychological questions, are thought provoking and entertaining.  Of course, there's no right or wrong answer and every time I've used the book, people have seemed to enjoy it quite a bit.I recently ordered this revised version and was really happy with the changes.  First, there are more questions: 291, up from 217.  Next, and perhaps more importantly, the "follow up" questions that some of the questions had have been moved from the back of the book to a light blue font below the relevant questions.  This way, you don't have to clumsily flip back and forth and find the question number.  It's a small change but a definite improvement.  Finally, and most importantly, the questions are fresher, updated for today.In sum, if you already have The Book of Questions, I highly recommend buying the revised and updated version, and if you don't already haven't the Book of Questions, I highly recommend buying this revised and updated version and trying it out with your spouse, your family, your friends--it's a great way to get to know people and quite fun!

Like anyone else who registered for their wedding, my wife and I have one of those gargantuan slow cookers that collects dust in the pantry because (1) it weighs approximately 24 pounds; (2) it has miscellaneous splatter stains on it, circa 2007; and (3) the fights we get into over who will scrub it and who will heave it back into the corner of the pantry are, over time, quite damaging to our relationship.So, needless to say, we were looking for a more manageable slow cooker to use for holidays and dinner parties so that our guests could nibble on my wife's famous spinach-and-artichoke dip, buying us some time to scrub some misc. splatter stains off of some other serveware.We found this on Amazon, and aside from a few issues some people have had with cooking temps and not getting the pictured item (for the record, our red cooker says "Proctor Silex" and not "Texas Chili"), our experience has been in accord with most: it's a great, powerful little cooker that does the trick.Downsides?  There are a couple.First, the cord is ridiculously short, perhaps to match the cooker's small size.  (I kid you not, the cord is exactly two feet long.)  So, you can plan on having your guests sit cross-legged on the floor and shovel spinach-and-artichoke dip into their mouths, or you can do what we do and have the (inelegant and bulkier) solution of an extension cord.Next--and this is admittedly minor--the lid doesn't attach to the cooker.  This is a bit frustrating when the lid is wet with condensation and your guests clumsily put said lid face-down onto, say, a nice, new wood table.  You can awkwardly wipe up after them, or sigh and watch your new table slowly begin to warp.As for the cooking power, I cannot offer too much insight into this.  What we do is "preheat" the cooker on "high" while our appetizer of choice is cooking in the oven (so that there's not any warm up time in the slow cooker that would cool down the food).  We then take our appetizer straight from the oven and put it into the slow cooker.  The "high" setting keeps the food piping hot for hours and hasn't scalded it, in our experience.  However, as for the "keep warm" setting, we did recently use this for the aforementioned spinach-and-artichoke dip, and the cooker didn't do the best job.  It kept the dip somewhere between "warm" and "lukewarm"--slightly more toward lukewarm.  So, if you use this cooker, keep in mind that the cooker probably does a better job on the higher settings than the "keep warm" setting.All in all, despite its few flaws, this cooker is a delight to have.  At its small size, it's so convenient, has saved us many a heartache and marital discord, and has kept our guests happy and well fed.

After our son discovered yet another non-child-friendly item on the floor of our home and hoarded it in his mouth for hours (unbeknownst to us), my wife and I decided we wanted another prison--I mean "play yard"--for our son to roam around in because apparently we're terrible at the whole concept of baby-proofing.So I found this item on Amazon and, through my sleeplessness, thought the dimensions were 9' x 9'--sounded like a steal for $90.  We ordered this one and I was a bit dismayed when the box showed up and it turned out to be another pack n' play.  Like probably most other parents, we already have the obligatory pack n' play.  It's small and cozy and our son likes it fine.  I told my wife and she was more than a bit dismayed: another pack n' play she did not want.  (She also wondered how I thought the dimensions were 9' by 9', but that's another story.)Well, we could have returned it with the free returns, but after we got it set up and plopped our son it in, we were hooked and so was he.  Here's why it's ten times better than your average pack n' play:  1.  The colors are so vibrant--reds, blue, green, yellow--as opposed to the muted colors you often see on a pack n' play.  2.  Each wall of the pack n' play has a different feature: for instance, one wall has a ladybug that squeaks; another has a butterfly that moves and rustles; another has a bee that also moves and rustles; and another has a sun with a mirror on it.  Although the mirror is not the fanciest mirror I've ever seen, it keeps our budding narcissist fascinated for minutes at a time.  3.  It's sturdier than any pack n' play I've seen, and the walls don't budge when he stands up in it, but it's also squishy enough to withstand falls.  I've seen my son fall plenty of times inside of it, and he hasn't seemed bothered.  Perhaps he caught his reflection on the way down.  4.  Though not 9' x 9', it's bigger than any pack n' play I've ever seen.  (Note: I've heard this can cause problems if you're using it for sleep, because it can be harder to find sheets that fit, though apparently you can find people who make special square sheets instead of the standard rectangular sheets.)  5.  Our son actually likes going in there, unlike his other pack n' play (or--god forbid--his North States Superyard play yard--you'd think we'd sent him to Guantanamo Bay).Overall, it really just looks like a fun, happy, and bright place to be in, and it's well made and looks like it will last for a while, and perhaps most importantly, our son doesn't fuss when we put him in there, and, to state the obvious, putting him in there keeps him away from the unmentionable hazards on the floors of our home.  So although I don't think you need TWO pack n' plays, I'm not too sad that I made the reading error and ordered this one by mistake, because this particular pack n' play is awesome.To sum it up, if you're going to buy one pack 'n play, buy this one, because it's the clear winner.

I've had many mouse pads over the years, ranging from cheapo promotional giveaway pads to higher end ones such as the Razer SWTOR pad and the jumbo Steelseries QcK pad, but I always felt like there was room for improvement in each of the pads.  The Razer SWTOR pad got me hooked back on solid surfaces (I had a pad with a hard, gel-like surface back in the day that I also liked, but I don't recall the brand or model), but the SWTOR pad had a ridiculous gamer aesthetic and was too small of a surface area.  The jumbo QcK pad was just too huge, and even though they make smaller versions, once I got back to quality hard gaming mats I didn't want to go back to the softer surface of the QcK.After extensive research I decided to give this mat a try.  It's about halfway between the size of the SWTOR pad and the jumbo QcK pad, and the size seems just about right.  It has an understated, all black aesthetic that can fit in either a gamer or professional environment.  My mouse easily glides across the surface, but there is also just the right amount of tension between the surface of the pad and mouse.  Give this mat a try - I don't think you will be disappointed.

Great price (and Prime-eligible), and works great on basketballs.  Despite the low price, there is nothing to complain about regarding the quality of the materials or the workmanship.  The package is rather large but comes with a small clear plastic bag that can easily contain the pump, pins, and cables.  I couldn't find any directions but it's pretty obvious how everything works.Tip - at the very top of the pump handle, there is a small piece of recessed black plastic that can be removed and a pin (or contraband?) can be stealthily stored inside the handle - pretty cool.

Just two weeks after we started reading this book to our son every other night, he started jerking his head to the side and smiling so widely if we'd quote a line from it during the day time.  I think it's because this book is so memorable due to the repetition.  Each page starts off with an attempt to get an animal as a pet, and the discovery of that pet (behind a shipping box, zoo bars, basket, etc.), and then why it won't work out.For example:"I wrote to the zoo to send me a pet.They sent me an...[turn page to open large flap with a box pictured on it and hiding an elephant behind it][child or you screams out "ELEPHANT!"]"He was too big!I sent him back."And the list of other animals goes on until the perfect animal is found...It is true that there is no rhyming on each page.  However, there is some rhyming.  For instance, the camel is described as too grumpy, and then a couple of animals later, the frog is described as too jumpy.  Further, the repetition of the book sets up the child's expectation--every page is the same except for the animal's name and the one adjective characteristic as to why the animal didn't work out.  As mentioned, at least in our case, our child clearly knew this book just based on a handful of readings, and he continues to love reading it to this day.  This, along with Little Blue Truck, are still are go-to books and are absolutely recommended even for the smallest of babies.Also, I totally didn't get the point of "board books" until this book came along... but now I get it.  We bought the regular book (not the board book), and here's the problem with that: our son LOVES to grab at the "doors" that hide the animals, so much so that the doors are starting to rip off.  So, my suggestion is that you buy the board book version so that you won't have to worry about little fingers prying off flimsy little doors!

"I expect we'll both harden like old bread.  I expectwe'll have seen each hoodlum and attendantto the point we'll naturally shrink away.  We willhave had so many good figs and the green grapes.So much soap, we'll have stung our tender openings.Bearing against one another, in the opaque spray."(from "Dying in a Turkish Bath")The stanzas above are just two of the many wonderful stanzas in Useless Landscape.  In my opinion, this is Doug's best work, by far.  I've read Lunch, Tea, and Cocktails, and now, years later, stumbled upon this one by chance.  I read the whole book within a couple of days--I couldn't put it down.  It is stunning, powerful, inspiring: a must-read.

We were having a stink problem with our cloth diapers.  Turns out we have the bad combination of hard water plus a high efficiency washer--both of these things mean that our diapers don't get rinsed out as much as they should so the ammonia smell from urine builds up over time.As for the high efficiency washer problem, we've solved this problem by "tricking" our washer into using more water by putting a couple of wet towels in there with the diapers.And as for the hard water problem, we've solved this problem by pouring a tablespoon of Calgon into each hot water cycle (we do a cold rinse first, then a hot water cycle with detergent and the Calgon, then a cold water rinse again). We couldn't be happier to have gotten rid of the stink problem.As a bonus, now that we know we have a hard water problem, we've also started using the Calgon in our dishwasher and our dishes have come out much cleaner and with less built-up and cloudiness.

Our son has come around to the prune flavor, and it gets things going.  Our only gripe is that it is very watery, so every time it spills down his bib and onto the rest of his body and then it ends up looking like he got into a bloody massacre, all by mid-morning.  But otherwise, good stuff, and we will be re-ordering.

First off, this is almost nothing like Harry Potter.It deals with a pleasant looking town filled with unpleasant people who, for the most part, seem to hate one another. There are a myriad of negative emotions as the various people try to one up each other.I got through 8 of the 15 discs before realizing I wasn't quite enjoying it enough to continue. It was a borderline experience for me.
I suspect the book works better than the audio one.This had its moments as I'm a big fan of Harris but most of the time it wasn't that amusing or interesting for me.
Excellent artwork. The Phoenix is back. Jean Grey is back. There were some good surprises in this one but if you're tired of the Phoenix tales skip this one.

Funky artwork with some obvious sexual jabs at Emma Frost makes this a different X-Men tale. An unusual outbreak of mutant babies in an African country sends some of the X-Men over with some social remarks about how nobody really cares about happenings on said continent.

This audio book was narrated by Gerber himself. He covers his life choices, doubts and victories in business. He also gives input on to awaken and thrive as an entrepreneur mostly with real life examples.
Wolverine and some other X-Men try to get board approval to run a new school amidst somewhat good to weak attempts at comic relief.
Children of the Vault and the focus on Indras are arguably the fresher focuses compared to the usual X-Men tales. Rogue gets some actual spotlight but this is more of the Indras' story.
Good enough for those who want a review of the origin tales for some and more valuable to those who don't know much about it.

Bigby follows a lead in middle America, finding a community of werewolves and ties to his past during World War II.Of course there are problems and of course it means lots of wolf vs. wolf (the cover gives it away some). Artwork varied on this one but I'll still give it a borderline four stars.

Sinestro is back and things are told from his point of view so look out, Green Lantern lovers. Sure, Hal Jordan and other Green Lanterns make appearances but they're in the background.This is Sinestro's tale and even if he's a bad guy most of the time the universe needs him. He'll explain why in this book or have his PR people handle the matter.Good artwork that nails some of the Green Lantern stuff nicely.Questions?

The American Vampire legends continue.In this installment we witness vampires in hiding similar to the Underground Railway to get slaves out of slave states in America back in the day and tales of something deep underground which might hint to the origins of vampires yet is arguably too horrible to contemplate.Vibrant, shadowy and bloody artwork as usual.

Arguably one of the best dramatizations of Ancient Rome focusing upon Claudius as he reflects upon his long life amidst the glory of Rome yet also amidst a web of malicious intrigue.Get it.I quite enjoyed the audio version though I am biased towards the television presentation.
Some of the X-Men and Spidey have to deal with an infestation down in the sewers which includes saving super nerdy kids.
This post apocalyptic world has the X-Men fighting against a variety of foes. I found the artwork panels hit or miss in driving the story at times. A nice twist at the end.

Complex clue trail told in flashbacks with a wide variety of characters particularly focused over the generations. Definite nods to the Jews of WWII which is arguably becoming a worn out topic.The audio person, Susan Ericksen, for this was amazing with some of her voices/accents. I really like how she did the Old School Chicago neighbor. That was awesome.Now, why am I only giving this a B? It had a slow start and the clue trails and flashbacks were a mixed bag at times.Still I recommend it, especially for the fans.

What if visionary Charles Xavier died far earlier than expected. This Dystopian X-Men world focuses on Magneto as the underdog hero leader fighting against evil mutants who uses humans as test subjects and worse.Look for Blink and her special romance.

Bruce Wayne is a new Batman who is making some mistakes but not when they count. This is a grittier take on Batman so the recurring characters are similar yet different.Gorgeous artwork as well as paneling.

The Midgard Serpent has been set loose and with Thor sort of leading it's up to the Avengers to stop it and something far worse. This turned out to be better than expected though that doesn't mean I felt it was perfect.Nice artwork especially of Captain Marvel.

The new Batgirl of 52 is no longer Oracle nor bound to a wheelchair.In this installment she deals with a ton of personal issues and follows on the heels of a female villain with a dangerous, talking puppet.Wonderful artwork with grittiness and shadow applications.

This one focuses on the Comedian and especially his time with the Kennedys and Vietnam. The latter part is on Rorschach and his earlier years on his own and dealing with a dangerous gang.I especially likes this one for its themes and character focuses. It didn't cop out on the tough topics.Artwork is great as usual.

Dr. Strange is out and a new Sorcerer Supreme is going to be picked by an ancient relic. Toss in the New Avengers and we might have a loose story here. The best part are the introductions of mostly unknown heroes/villains.
Written for kids almost with an Arthurian focus.
The X-men are splitting up. This tale focuses on its culmination and the rationales of various characters. The ending was the best part.

A steady debut novel in which we meet V.I. Warshawski, a female P.I., who sets out to handle her first case dealing with rich people and (you guessed it) . . . treachery!The clue trails are solid, the characters are well developed and the pacing is a tad slow at times.That said, this novel was written in the 80s when pacing wasn't as big as it is now.
Off to a good start. Promises to unlock some new venues for the Wonderland Mythos.The artwork will be hit or miss for some people. The latter group will feel lost if they don't stick with it.

The new 52 takes a look at Batman as a relatively new Batman. His nemesis, who seems to have defeated him in the past, is The Riddler. As Gotham is put in tech peril Batman tries to save the day.Snyder delivers a solid story with the usual artwork level.OVERALL GRADE: B to B plus.
Beautiful artwork and a somewhat predictable yet engaging tale. Would read the next one in the series.

The quintessential magazine for anything related to Delta Green a la the RPG.The scenario within "Cold Dead Hand" by Adam Scott Glancy makes it worth the price of admission alone. I've run that one three times now as a Keeper.MY GRADE: B plus to A minus.

First off you need the basic SAVAGE WORLDS to play this game. The book does a good job of updating the Deadlands franchise keeping some of the original content yet blending it with the Savage Worlds model. By the way, you should like Savage Worlds (which has several similarities to Deadlands like dice exploding, poker initiative, etc) or this game won't fly for you. Think of the Wild West with a twist in History and then toss in steampunk, horror, monsters and all types of Western cliches.I really like the poker method for initiative, the poker chips (which are like the Fate/Action Points in other games), the dueling, and, of course, the world of Deadlands, especially the extended American Civil War as I'm a big time enthusiast. Deadlands purists may not like this as its condensed down into one hardback (the original Deadlands was books upon books).CONCEPT: A minus; MECHANICS: B plus to A minus; PUTTING IT ALL TOGETHER: B to B plus; ARTWORK: B to B plus; THE EXTRA TOUCHES: B to B plus; WHEN READ: November to December 2011 (revised review January 2013); OVERALL GRADE: B plus.

The new 52 Batgirl has recovered from her wheelchair after a few years and is out fighting crime. In this installment she deals with the Joker and her crazed brother.Almost a five star but not quite.MY GRADE: B plus.

I was hesitant purchasing this remote. I have the kinect so I use voice commands for nearly everything on the Xbone. However, at night, I found myself reaching for a controller to avoid talking out loud and waking the wife. This was annoying being that my controllers are on a charger far from the couch. I would solve this dilemma by opening up the Xbox One Windows 10 app on my Surface or Smartglass on my phone to change channels/volume/etc. The annoyance with that is that you have to wake up your device, open the app, wait for it to load, etc. I am lazy and I wanted something quicker. This remote is perfect. It is always on and just works well. This is definitely not a needed accessory for the Xbone but if you use it as your main entertainment hub, I would highly recommend.

Stunning case for my SP3. It fits perfectly. The material seems of high quality and durable as well as soft. The magnet is actually surprisingly stronger than I thought (in a good way). I really like the pen loop on the inside of the case. Very well thought out. There is a zippered pocket on the back that may hold somehting like flash drives, paper, keys, etc. I have not tried but I doubt the charger would be able to fit in the pocket.The color looks great with my SP4 Teal type cover!! It is a dark green or teal and just looks great (assuming you like green or teal).

So far so good. It is working with my SP3 without issues. It actually looks like a genuine Microsoft charger. It came in a Microsoft box but had Chinese lettering instead of English. The picture shows Hippo and Hippo written on the charger but I definitely received one in Microsoft packaging (or so it seems). There is not Microsoft written anywhere on the actual charger so this could very well be a knock-off but it works and was half the price of an original Microsoft charger.Only time will tell if it hold up like an original but so far, I am very very pleased and I would highly recommend this for anyone that needs an extra or replacement charger.

Wow, this is a fantastic bag at an even better price. Very well built and deigned.The canvas (I purchased the black) is very thick and the stitching is top quality.The zippers seem extremely durable and feel great when zipping/unzipping. There are plenty of pockets to store everything for a day out on the town. I currently have my surface pro 3, external HDD, diary/notebook, extra cords for phone/sp3/etc, umbrella, and a bunch of pens/leatherman tools/etc. There is plenty of room to spare. There is a zippered pocket on the front flap and on the back of the bag. Two pockets when you open the flap that shut (not completely) with velcro. The main compartment is zippered (I wanted this) and has a small zippered pocket on the inside with two pen pockets and two small pockets (to hold gum or business cards). I really wanted a bag that had a zippered main compartment and that had latches to hold down the flap. I live in Manhattan and I needed a semi-secure bag. The magnetic flaps would not hold up well with pick-pockets.ProsDurableConstructionZippersThick CanvasPlenty of room for up to a 14inch laptop and accessoriesConsI am not a fan of the two side mesh pockets. To me it looks kinda tacky but many people like these pockets for water bottles or umbrellasI do not like the strap and how it is connected to the bag. Most messenger bags have a removable strap. I like this design because I can change or replace the straps if needed. This bag has a permanent strap. If/when the strap breaks, you will be out of luck.Bottom lineI would highly recommend this bag. It looks and feels superb. My only real complaint is the strap but for the price it cannot be beat.
Very soft and great for the price. I was concerned that they would be see-through or too thin but they are perfect. Not too thick and not too thin.
Works as advertised and looks fantastic. Much better than the traditional round cables.
Fits well (as expected) and looks great for the price.

Great window unit. Cools my entire railroad one bedroom apartment. It is noisy (not terribly) but a lot less than other brands I have compared. The remote is great and you can connect your Logitech Harmony remote to it for easy access.
Best tubing for PC watercooling. I use only this any NEVER had issues. No plastercizer, no staing from using dye, no algae, etc.This is THE standard when it comes to tubing for watercooling.
Dyed my coolant black. Did not stain my tubing. What else could you ask for?

Just awful connection and horrible lag. I used (or attempted to use) this device when traveling so I could quickly connect my Surface Pro 3 to TV's in meetings/hotel rooms/etc. This device would worked on one of the 7 TV's I tried at various locations (all different models and manufacturers). If the connection was made, it was horribly laggy and unusable. I upgraded to the most recent firmware but still had so many problemsI returned it and instead purchased the Microsoft Wireless Display Adapter (Miracast dongle) and have been so much happier. This dongly is half the size of the Netgear and works flawless without ANY lag. It is more expensive but is so much better quality.
This Surface Pro 3 keyboard is so much better than the previous generations. I have no complaints and it fits perfectly for the Surface Pro 3.
This is ideal for work and travel. I pair this with a travel electric kettle when staying in hotels and it is fantastic. I also use this at work often and works just as well. Highly recommend.
I love this French press!! It works great and looks even better. This is a perfect French press for a single person. It makes one cup of coffee and nothing more. Great for single use and travel.

Great budget camera. If you can find these on sale and you need a budget camera, I would not hesitate to grab these. However, if you need/want HD picture (or a really clear picture for that matter) look elsewhere. The cameras do everything they are designed to do. I have them attached to my Synology Surveillance Station and they work really well. My only reservation is that the picture quality is a little grainy. However, this is not rated at 720p or 1080p so this should be known before the purchase is made.I would recommend this camera and would definitely purchase again.

Perfect slim external HDD for my Xbox One. I needed more storage on my Xbox One and wanted a small and slim form factor without the need for external power. This uses one USB 3.0 and works great. Plug and play on the Xbox One.

Yes!!!Finally I can pit cherries quickly and frustration free. It is such a simple task and took but it really does make a HUGE difference if you eat cherries a lot. It is simple, straight forward and simple to use. No complaints.
Perfect passport cover and protector. It does the job very well and looks great (colors are true to the pictures). I purchased the green for him and the purple/pink for her.

Works fantastic after a week of tinkering with all settings.I use this with 2 X 3tb WD Red NAS drives. I wanted additional storage at home on my network and wanted to be able to access it anywhere at anytime. I also have two Foscam cameras that I wanted attached to my NAS. Finally, I wanted a multimedia box to store and play all my movies. I have a lifetime subscription to Plex but unfortunately, this model Synology does not support Plex (this was a mistake on my end for not researching). This Synology NAS fits the bill almost perfectly.As a storage that I can access anywhere, this setup is perfect and absolutely no complaints. I enabled port forwarding on my router but otherwise there are apps and internet to access any and all your files from any device (smartphone, tablet, computer, etc.). Personally I have a Surface RT, Surface Pro 3, and Windows Phone 8.1 and I have had zero issues (apps or otherwise).My two Foscam F18910W cameras were a bit tricky. Synology uses its own surveillance software called Surveillance Station. This piece of software (or app on your Disk Station) is very useful and powerful. However, it took about a week to finally adjust everything so that it was working properly (motion detection, detection strength, motion timer/scheduler, etc.). There are a ton of options you can choose and sometimes instructions are lacking so there was often many internet searches to find solutions. I had to set many different clocks and settings on both the camera themselves and the Surveillance Station. It was time consuming and frustrating at times, but I think I finally figured it out and everything is running smoothly.I wanted to install Plex on my NAS and have it play/transcode. This Synology model is not compatible with Plex. This is an error on my end. Synology does provide their own media/video app so that you can still use it for a "media server". Alternatively, I use my HTPC for my Plex server and link this NAS for all the media and that works just fine. The only downside is that I must have my HTPC on at all times if I need/want to access the server. I cannot fault this NAS a star for the Plex issue as it was clearly my fault.For the price, this is the best and most user friendly NAS you can get. I highly recommend this NAS.

Not sure what is with the design but from far away (6+ feet) the blue letters are unrecognizable. They are blurry and you cannot read them. Otherwise, this definitely needs a power source and not batteries. For the price, I would not recommend this alarm clock.Cannot read it from a distance of more than 5 feetNeeds a constant power source (not included)
These are the best slider seal-able bags on the market. I have never had them open or malfunction (unlike  Hefty). The ability to stand them upright is also really useful and unique.

This USB HUB is perfect for a desktop. To properly charge/use all the USB 3.0 ports, it needs the additional AC adapter so that is why it is perfect for a desktop. I can now have all my flash drives, chargers (for phones and tablets), and any other USB dongle attached at once. Everything charges and works flawless and having the 3.0 speeds for devices (HDD's) is just fantastic.If you are looking for a USB HUB to carry around or travel, this is not for you as it is pretty large and has the added AC adapter. This is better suited for a desktop or permanent workstation. I have one at my desk in my office and one at my office at home.Would definitely recommend.

I was initially hesitant to jump on the "mechanical keyboard" bandwagon. In fact, I had put it off for many years thinking it was ridiculous and a down right waste of money. I, however, think that the Logiteh G710+ is a great piece of computing hardware.The keyboard itself is made rugged. It feels like a durable and heavy keyboard that should last a long time. I was very pleasantly surprised with the rubber o-rings on the keys so that the "clicky" noise is muffled. The backlight is bright and looks great (has essentially 6 settings). I wanted a new keyboard that had volume control, a USB port and limited G-keys and this fit the bill perfectly. Typing and gaming on this keyboard is very nice and just feels right.My only real complain or critique is that awful orange border around the G-keys. I have no idea what Logitech was thinking with this. It sticks out like a sore thumb and I can't imagine the color fitting anyone's color scheme. I have found some tutorials on how to disassemble the keyboard (fairly easy) and I will paint it black.Despite what others may say, a mechanical keyboard will not make you magically better at gaming. To be honest it is pretty gimmicky. That being said, this keyboard is a quality product that I am sure will last a long time.

My girlfriend is a purest when it comes to coffee.  She likes nothing else but french pressed.  The mention of an electric grinder disgusted her (past experience?).  I purchased this grinder in hopes that she would like it and.......it worked.  This was just hipster enough to be good.  Not many people use a ceramic manual coffee grinder so the coffee must taste better, right??  Who knows.  She really likes it despite me being the one doing the grinding....In all seriousness this grinder works really well.  You can easily adjust it for coarse or fine grinds and it does not take a lot of force or frustration to operate.  The base is a perfect storage container for a few days of coffee for one or two people.  If you are a coffee purest, you will enjoy this grinder.
My girlfriend loved this curling wand.  It worked really well and heated thoroughly but she ended up returning it for a tapered curling wand which she decided she liked so much more.

I use these for the Dirt Devil SD20005RED Scorpion Quick Flip 7 AMP Hand Vac - RED.  These filters fit perfect and I use one when the other is drying from being washed.  Works great and at a great price!!

The shoes fit great and arrived earlier than expected.  They look great.  I regularly wear a size 12 but find that I need 11.5 when I wear Converse.  The fit is always nice and very comfortable.My complaint is that I ordered BLACK Converse and received grayish colored Converse.  I have another pair of laces Converse and compared the colors and these looked as though they were bleached.  The color was so far off that I had to return them.I love Converse but the ones I received were not what was described.  No fault of Converse.  It was a poor seller that I chose.

This watch looks very nice and the matching bracelet looks just as nice.  I have received many compliments while wearing the watch (usually with suits).  It holds the time very well and I would recommend this watch.
This fits perfectly on our Dirt Devil stick-vac.  They are reasonably priced and work well.  Not much else to say.
Fits my i7-3930k perfect.  Not much else to say other than it works.  I would recommend this product if you need it.
Nice sheets at a nice price.  They look just like the picture.  They are very comfortable and fit the mattress very well.  What else........  just buy them........
Nice sheets at a nice price.  They look just like the picture.  They are very comfortable and fit the mattress very well.  What else........  just buy them........

Fantastic printer!!  Super easy setup.  I was able to purchase this when it was a lightning deal,  What a great bargain.  The setup was a breeze although it was slightly lengthy.  The printer had to align itself a couple times and that took around 7 minutes per alignment.  Regardless, the wait was worth it.  Having a wireless printer on your network is a must.  The printer looks very clean and classy with the black high gloss finish.  The touch screen is nice and photo quality is fantastic.  I cannot comment on how long the ink will last but I have read some positive reviews and for the price that I paid for this, I am not worried.Great wireless printer and it prints great photos/pictures.FYI - I am using this on my network and it has printed flawlessly and wireless from a Windows 8 machine, Windows 7 (64-bit) machine, Windows 7 (32-bit) machine, ipad, and Surface RT (Windows 8 RT).

Very sturdy belt and does the job very well.  The material is very strong and thick.  The clip seems also very well built and I don't anticipate any problems in the future with the design or durability of the product.

great small knives.  I purchased a couple of these to throw in some coats during winter.  They are very sharp and hold an edge relatively well.  Keep in mind that they are very small (fits perfectly in my fifth pocket in my jeans).  That being said, they are knives and are dangerous and should be treated as such.If you need a small everyday carry pocket knife then look no further!

For the price (please keep this in mind) this knife is fantastic.  A lot of reviewers are saying that the knife is garbage or "not what the expected" or comparing it to other knives like Ka-bar.  Look at the price!!!  For the price, this knife is outstanding.  It is full tang, sharp and reasonably durable.  I use this for just about anything around the house that needs an edge and I don't want to damage other higher priced knives.Highly recommend

I love Pyrex and who doesn't???  This product is great as is any Pyrex product (almost).ProsConvieneint handlesIncluded coversNice red color (not orange like the picture shows)ConsYou need to take into account that the overall length of these because of the large handles on either end.The smaller dish had a "chunk" taken out of the bottomThe smaller dish had a "chunk" of glass taken out of the bottom with a black mark going over it.  It looks as though it was marked on the production line but they forgot to pull it before boxing.  I did not return the piece because it does not affect the useability of the dish.  Pyrex is made so that if a chip occurs, it will not compromise the integrity of the rest of the product.  My other problem is that the handles make the dish a lot longer than previous versions of this dish.  I cannot fit the small fish in my toaster oven despite other dishes of the same capacity fitting just fine.I would recommend this product but took off one star for the obvious defect and another star for the length.

I purchased these for my girlfriend after finding that brick and mortar stores sold these for $20-$30 more.My SO absolutely loves these.  She claims they are very comfortable and are extremely warm when she wears them.  She ordinary wear a 7 but found that the 7 was a little snug so she got a 7.5 and it fit perfect.  Because these come in half sizes, I would recommend a half size larger of your normal shoe size (you will likely be wearing thick winter socks).Lastly, the waterproofing is superb.  Trudging through Chicago snow and rain and her feet have stayed completely dry!!  Highly recommend.

If you can get this sd card on special or discount, please grab it up!!  I currently have this in my Surface RT and this has become an instant (fast) 64g of storage.  SanDisk makes very reliable products.  I would highly recommend.

I wanted an extremely sharp everyday utility knife that I can carry.  This knife is perfect for my needs.  It is very sharp, quickly flips out and fits in my pockets.  For the price, you will not be disappointed.  If you are looking for exactly what I was looking for, I would highly recommend this knife.

I LOVE this! I happened to get it at a great price ($28) and could not be happier. The dress fits great. I will definitely need to hem it but that is no big deal. It comes with the gloves, choker, dress, hoop skirt (with wire included to help it circle out at the bottom) and tiara. I thought the tiara was ugly but I have my wedding tiara I was planning to wear anyway. This is well made and even came in a garment bag. I am so surprised the quality and what all is included is possible at the price. Can't wait to wear it for every Halloween and even my nieces princess parties. Definitely worth the money, plus some.

I love this! It's sturdy enough for me to stand on and prop me feet up. I like that I can fold it up and get it out of the way if needed. I bought it so I could put a few blankets in so when i get cold they are right there. It works great for this

I enjoyed this book; however, I will say it was hard for me to read. I can't put my finger on why though. It wasn't gory or poorly written. There was just something about it that made it hard for me to get through. I think it was the way it was written and the words used. I don't know how to explain it. It took me a lot longer to read than most books of the same size. I liked the story and it kept me entertained. The plot had twists and you couldn't really solve it until the very end. It was a good book, but just takes a while to get through it.

I have had the same hair dryer for years. A blue Conair 1875 watt that has lasted me at least 8 years. It was my second one. I couldn't find it so I decided to purchase this and I love it. I love that it comes with the directional nozzle, 3 speeds and 3 heat settings. It dried my hair a little bit faster and I swear it looks shinier. I don't think I will need my straightener either on the days I blow dry my hair. I have pretty straight hair but sometimes need a straightener for the back bc it gets a little wavy, but not with this dryer. My hair feels light and healthy like I just went to the salon. I used the medium heat setting and the high dry setting. It really makes me happy to have this now
I enjoyed reading this book. I usually don't like romances but I like that there was a hidden theme. As in, she was hiding something that she didn't want this boy to know.

I really enjoyed this book. At times it could be a little slow, but then something would happen and the action would start back up. I liked the writing and the way it kept me entertained. There was always something about to happen and it was just a good story about a man trying to find a killer.

My husband needed new jeans and when we went to Kohls they didn't have his size so we came home and ordered them. These were cheaper online anyway. They fit him great. This color is not one of the ones he tried on at Kohl's. It actually has a little bit of a dirty yellow tinge to it. I like jeans that look like they are not dirty and when they have that yellow tinge sometimes they can look dirty. My husband likes them though and says that they fit great and are comfortable for him.

I already owned this brush for at least 7 years. The top of my first one fell off after only a short time of having it, but it actually helped when I would clean it. I recently decided my old one needed replacing and couldn't imagine getting a different brush. I have fine hair and this brush doesn't make my hair frizzy, it gives it volume when I properly blow dry it and it is gentle with my hair. I am not tender headed, but even if I was I don't think this brush would bother me. The brush runs about $9-10 at regular stores so getting this for $6 with add-on is a steal.
My husband bought this as a joke for a friend. I really can't review it well.
This book kept me entertained and it was really easy to read. It didn't take me long to read it

This book kept me entertained. At times it was a little slow, but once we got to the part where things were being discovered it picked up. I liked how easy it was to read. It was a good mystery that had you wondering how they would find the killer for most of the book. It dealt with shady small town politics and police matters. I liked it
I enjoyed this book. I like mystery type books and this was definitely one of them. It was interesting as it was written from different points of view and it was a great story.

I bought this for my laptop that often has a mouse pad that sticks. This is a great addition when I need it. It's not too big and plugs right in with my usb. I don't even have to download any kind of software to make it work.

I love these. Some of the bigger brush holes had room for me to fit brushes I already had. I bought the silver and I wish they had what kind of brush they are on them. They are a good thickness, don't shed and stiff enough to actually apply makeup. I don't feel like they "eat" my makeup like some other brushes. I like how many there are.
I have the blue iphone 5c and this looks so cute with the color phone. I wish it would have come with a screen protector but it is still a good deal.

So glad this has Blu Ray, DVD and Digital. I adore Cinderella and had chills the whole time I watched this movie in theaters. I needed DVD for my DVD player, but my husband's xbox plays blu Ray so i was glad to get different copies.

I love this! I have a very small apartment (526 sq feet) with hardwood floors in the living room/kitchen but I have a rug and carpet in the bedroom. This helps me keep all of it clean easily. It's so much easier to pull this out and sweep really quick without having to plug it in and then move and plug it in somewhere else. It also is very convenient that it swivels so well and that the handle bends so I can get under my entertainment system. I charged it the first time I used it and haven't had to since (I have only used it 2 other times) but it is quiet and works great for my small space.

I did not have issues that others had with my fingers not fitting. I could fit two fingers inside to hold onto this. It definitely helped get my foundation brush clean (which is usually the dirtiest and hardest to clean).

I love this navy color. I like that there is no sparkle to it and it's flat. I can make this a pretty matte with matte top coat or shiny with the normal top coat. I was looking for a color that was dark navy and this is perfect.

I bought the blush one first because I liked the colors, but this one is great too. I like how many brown tones there are in this and they go great with my brown eyes. I like that the back of it has different diagrams to show different color combinations you can use.

I love the look of these but they were very long. I ended up cutting off the chain that was hanging past the big part where you hook it together. I am 5'3" 135 pounds so I guess I have smaller wrists. Once I cut off the ends I like them much better. They still are not tight so they don't stay in place all pretty in order but they are cute and at this price I still like them
The colors need a lot to show up well, but I find if I add a primer they show up better and stick longer. I like the different colors and needed something with some accent colors.

They arrived later then planned but I couldn't beat the price anywhere else. They fit my watches. I have a lot of cheaper Xoxo and Geneva watches and watches from Rue 21. They all have these batteries so it's nice to have backups.

I was taking these with another daily vitamin and noticed my nails were so strong and growing well. I found wearing my fitbit bracelet was not very fashionable even though I have different bands. So I bought this to put on my pants belt loop. It is easily hidden and by the end of the day I do have a lot of steps so I know it is counting, I am just not sure how accurate. However, it does the job and I like it. The magnet is very strong.

My nails have been brittle lately and when I apply this they seem to be staying longer. This is a great product. At first a drop per finger felt like a lot, but it soaks in easily and doesn't leave a mess. Also, the smell is pleasant.

I wanted a cheaper highlighting/contouring kit. This was good for the price. The highlighter is what I was mainly purchasing this for and it does the job well. The other colors are darker then I was expecting, but as long as I use a light hand it's ok.

I loved the relationship between these sisters and how they work together. It made me want to live like them and work with my sisters. This book we well written and an easy read. I have already purchased the second book

I bought this because after  years of my dog being an outside dog, her paws were really rough and it would hurt me if she put them on me. I have used this for about a week solid (once a day) and her paws have become less rough. She likes it when I rub it in and she doesn't try to lick it off. I like that it feels like it is really sinking in.
I have always found earbuds to be very uncomfortable. They would hurt my ears, but these fit great. They have a great sound and they don't hurt my ears

I have an ipod touch 4 so I had to put this in upside down so the hole for headphones would be in the correct place. I was fine with that. It still stays in and still fits my arm well. I like the key holder, but my water bottle has a key holder as well so I just use that since I have to wear the armband upside down. I will say it is a little long. I am a petite girl and when I put the arm band up as high on my arm as I can it still is very close to my elbow area so sometimes lifting weights it pokes my arm. However, I knew this could be an issue because of my size. It does hold sweat but it also protects the ipod from getting wet.

We have only used it one time, but I got so tired of renting apartments having to clean the oven and it never being up to standards. We cook a lot of Digiorno pizza and we would find mainly olives on the bottom of the oven. This caught 3 olives the first time we cooked one and it was so easy to get them off. I think I will really appreciate this when it comes to moving in a year

These fit great. As it says, once size fits all and I can feel the stretch in these. I am a 34B and they feel great. I love the fact that they have padding in them. A lot of people have said that the pads get messed up when they wash them. As soon as I received them I tacked each pad in 3 places so that they could not scrunch up during washing. I have washed 2 so far and no issues. They are incredibly soft, keep things in place and have adjustable straps. I have a small torso so a lot of straps often slide off of my shoulders if I cannot adjust them. The price is great. 4 for $18 is amazing considering most retail stores want that amount for just 1. I think they are great!

I am obsessed with Disney and I wanted to do a fun page. I did one and it looks great! The size of this is perfect. I wish I had the book with me and I would post what I did with it. The punch works great and the paper comes right out and clean.
These work great with my scrapbook. I love the price as well

My Dad is a 6'3" man and his feet touch the water but that is all. He wanted a float that had cup holders and would keep him out of the water (he has another of those mesh floats that practically keep him in the water but still floating). He really enjoys the shape of this float and the fact that it fits his long body. I also enjoy it and I am 5'3". I have to splash water on my body but it's a nice relaxing float

My husband bought a used car and the previous owner did not have these in the car when he turned them in. The first time we got a can of coke they were sliding all over the place and tipping so my husband ordered these. They are awesome because they hold a can of coke and a regular to-go cup but if you have something larger you can still remove them and the size that came in the car works.

My husband bought a used car and the tailgate would not stay up. We were using a broom handle. He ordered these for a good price, installed them in less than 5 minutes and now we have a working tailgate.

I used this with Sinful Colors "Cinderella" which is a light blue glittered polish. I find that this brand (even though it's the cheapest) stays on the longest with my nails. I did a base coat of this, the color, this, the color, this, and a top coat of Seche Vite fast dry. I painted them on Thursday and they started peeling by Tuesday. I liked that i could peel this off in a whole piece because once my nails start to chip I peel off my polish. It was easy to peel off in full pieces. I really want to try this with OPI Neon nail polishes because those chip on my nails within a day. I want to put it to the test and then hopefully update this and let you know if it works well. I wish it would have lasted closer to a week, but I still thought it did well. since it kept my nails shiny and they feel hardened.

This book was a great easy read. It kept me entertained, has a great story line and was something I wanted to read to find out the ending. I have already downloaded some of the other books from the series
I have at least 6 of these puzzles now and just LOVE the Thomas Kinkade colors and lights. They are challenging but not too hard to do and a lot of fun

I love this thing. I no longer have to carry a purse. I can fit my license and 3 cards in it and its super cute. I like that the magnetic flap goes around the phone and not the cards so I don't have to worry about them being de-magnetized like i have had to deal with on other phone cases

I have a LOT of China Glaze neon colors. First of all, Pool Party is not bubblegum pink it is actually what I would call Neon Watermelon if that helps anyone. I just got my nails done and what is showing on my computer is NOT what color it is. It's neon orangish-pink and if you have ever had a neon watermelon bathing suit you will know what this color is. Flip Flop Fantasy is actually what I would call neon coral. It's more pink than orange but it's one of my favorites. Orange knockout shows it as very diluted here but trust me, it is incredibly bright bright bright orange. And finally shocking pink is neon light pink. I wanted to comment because the colors showing are not the colors. I am sitting here with my nail polish next to me and it's not showing the vibrancy or even hue they are. Yes, the neons do chip easier and they also need 2-3 coats to even out and a top coat to make it glossy and not matted. I have found that even getting a manicure at the nail salon my fingers will chip after 2 days. However, when i get these colors on my toes they last at least 2 weeks because my toes experience less contact.

I was really excited about this, but the moves are just very simple and only really involves your hands. I have most of the Just Dance games and often use them as workouts. I learn the foot and hand movements and even though the hands are all that matters i still get in a full workout. The song selection on this was great, but the moves didn't seem to match what I imagined (like the Boot Scootin Boogy is not the moves you learned in elementary school gym class). I of course will keep it and I will probably add my own movements, but it's not as interactive as i was hoping it would be.

These have been on my wish list for a while. I finally gave in and bought them. Not a bad price for two holders. I love that the top closes so that my sunglasses are not going to fall out. Great color too. I got the purple.

Although it gets off to a fantastic start with the groundbreaking animated opening credits sequence presenting the Pink Panther; and it contains a brilliant Henry Mancini original musical score (with an unforgettable instrumental theme song); and it introduces the classic comic character, the bumbling French police inspector Jacques Clouseau (Peter Sellers); and it boasts some enticing European locations, sumptuous sets and costumes, this film never really gains momentum.  Other than several bits of semi-inspired comedy involving Clouseau, most of the movie is on the creaky and somewhat creepy side.Peter Sellers turned out to have been an extremely lucky casting coup.  Co-screenwriter/director Blake Edwards originally intended the part of Clouseau for Peter Ustinov, a serious actor who could handle sophisticated comedy, but he belatedly turned the role down to do another project.Forgotten by many is that Clouseau is in the secondary male role and that this film is actually a romantic comedy vehicle for David Niven, of the bedroom farce genre, which has him romancing a pair of international beauties played by Claudia Cardinale and Capucine.  Edwards was infatuated with Niven as a suave and romantic leading man (his supposedly ideal dashing jewel thief for this picture) and badly wanted to work with him.  But the problem, as one can plainly see, is that Niven was way too long in the tooth at this point in his career, making his love affairs with the much younger women seem more pathetic (and creepy) than humorously charming (not to mention halfway believable).  Nor did it help that Cardinale (as the princess) couldn't speak comprehensible English and had to have all her dialogue dubbed.  Edwards also thought that having the police detective's wife (Capucine) be the the jewel thief's partner-in-crime and lover (making the police inspector Clouseau a classic comic cuckold) was an unbeatably hilarious premise in and of itself.  Only none of this is convincing, even in the context of comedy where the credibility bar need not be all that high.  The additional character of Niven's nephew (Robert Wagner), who suddenly materializes for no good reason, only clutters matters as he attempts to steal his uncle's thunder, producing no comic payoff - just a dull thud.If you are amused by the type of bedroom farce that has an aging David Niven repeatedly crawling under a bed to hide from his lover's husband, you will be in seventh heaven watching this movie.  For me, without the occasional improvised departures from the script by Sellers (who had to push Edwards to up the wacky slapstick quotient), this is a rather lifeless and laughless film (nor is there any suspense in the diamond heist sequence) despite all the excellent surrounding features I listed previously - most memorably the Mancini music and the first appearance of the animated Pink Panther.As for the DVD extras, Blake Edwards' commentary is a snorefest, Robert Wagner's interview is moderately engaging, and the feature about the creation of the Pink Panther carton will only interest hardcore fans of the rose-colored feline.

Impressive!  100 tracks over 4 discs, featuring excellent sound (make that VERY impressive, given the age of these records and the rarity of most of them).  The two years receiving by far the most focus are 1961 and 1962, when the various influences that would eventually coalesce into the soul genre (as it came to be known later in the 1960s) were clearly in evidence.  You can hear the echoes of the harmony-group era, both the bluesier and more rocking sides of R&B, gospel-style singing (which really gave soul its soul), as well as pop - especially the kind that appealed to young people.  Put it all together and you can sense that something remarkable was happening.  These are well produced (but never overproduced) records that still sound amazingly vibrant and appealing today, especially for fans of '60s soul.While quite a few of the recording artists in this collection were hardly heard from again (making this collection all the more essential historically), it was not for lack of talent.  You may be amazed at how good the persistently propulsive and emphatic "She'll Be Gone" by Betty O'Brian is.  (I never heard of her or this record before and now can't stop listening to it.)  And on the other side of the equation, there is a wealth of artists who were either already well established (Sam Cooke, Roy Hamilton, Etta James [the great "Seven Day Fool" is here!], The 5 Royales), peaking at the time (Dee Clark, Little Eva, Chuck Jackson, Marv Johnson, Benny Spellman), just starting to make their names (Bobby Bland, Jerry Butler, Gene Chandler, Gladys Knight & the Pips, Baby Washington, Dee Dee Sharp, Mitty Collier, Sugar Pie De Santo), and later break-out stars (Wilson Pickett, Irma Thomas, Maxine Brown, Lou Rawls, The O'Jays, Johnny Nash, Johnnie Taylor, Joe Simon, Jimmy Ruffin, The Tams, Major Lance, Ted Taylor, Dobie Gray).  Early Motown is represented by the Miracles, Barrett Strong, Eddie Holland, LaBrenda Ben, The Marvelettes, The Temptations, and Marvin Gaye.Of added value for me was hearing for the first time records by later favorites of mine on their earlier labels that I had never heard before: Jimmy Ruffin's one-off dbut recording on the Miracle label from 1961 ("Don't Feel Sorry for Me"), Joe Simon on the Hush label from 1961 ("I See Your Face"), and Johnnie Taylor on Sam Cooke's SAR label from 1962 ("Rome Wasn't Built in a Day").  Before listening to this collection I never knew of anything by Robert Knight prior to "Everlasting Love" (1967); and here he is on the powerfully pleading, well-orchestrated "Free Me" from 1962.What we don't get here is a booklet with notes or musical credits.  Real Gone obviously wanted to keep the cost down while providing the most extensive array of great early soul music in a single package.  They have succeeded.Best record in this collection by a one-hit wonder (IMO): Timmy "Gonna Send You Back to Georgia" Shaw's shudder-inducing slow blues "Thunder in My Heart."Excellent find on CD:  Sugar Pie DeSanto's first (and biggest, reaching #4) R&B hit, the funky soul blues "I Want to Know" on the Veltone label.And how about the first record ever released by Berry Gordy and Tamla-Motown (Tamla 101):  Marv Johnson's "Come to Me," which after a distribution deal was subsequently made with United Artists, rose to #6 R&B / #30 pop in early 1959.Also of historical note concerning Motown is the appearance of the original version of "Someday We'll Be Together" (obviously best known as the 1969-70 #1 pop and soul smash that was Diana Ross & the Supremes' swan song before going their separate ways) by Jackey (Beavers) and Johnny (Bristol) from 1961 on Harvey Fuqua's Tri-Phi label.  "Someday" co-writer Johnny Bristol would later team with the song's co-writer/producer Fuqua at Motown where they produced (and sometimes also co-wrote for) a number of acts, including Marvin Gaye and Tammi Terrell, Jr. Walker & the All Stars, and Gladys Knight & the Pips.  Bristol, who had a significant solo recording career after Motown (with the national top ten soul and pop crossover smash "Hang On in There Baby" in 1974), was the male voice on the hit Motown version of "Someday We'll Be Together."  The Jackey & Johnny original is instantly recognizable but sounds rather primitive compared to its exquisitely produced (by Johnny Bristol!) famous cover.Leaving aside the star-powered major hits "Turn On Your Love Light" (Bobby Bland), "Bye Bye Baby" (Mary Wells's dbut, with the raspy voice later emulated by John Lennon on "Twist and Shout") and "Any Day Now" (Chuck Jackson), the best record of the whole one hundred can be found on Disc Two, Track 15: Nolan Strong & the Diablos' exciting "Mind Over Matter" from 1962.  Don't miss this one (by that I mean this track and this entire collection)!

Most series would be losing steam or on their last legs this far along - and would be contemplating shutting down - but this one is locked in and just keeps the laughter coming like few other shows.  The writing is brilliant, the direction is spot on, and the ensemble cast is unmatched for a family sitcom.  I would put Ty Burrell and Eric Stonestreet up there in the top ten of sitcom actors in this century.  And Ed O'Neill as family elder Jay Pritchett has accomplished the nearly impossible by making us forget that he once played the irrepressible Al Bundy.This show contains a dazzling mix of character-driven, verbal and physical comedy that almost always surprises.  With about four minutes left in the final episode, very possibly the single most outrageously clever, daring and hilarious play on words I've ever heard on TV is uncorked in a deftly delivered verbal exchange between Mitch (Jesse Tyler Ferguson) and Cam (Eric Stonestreet).  How it got past network Standards and Practices is anybody's guess.If there is a weakness in the writing, in my opinion it is that Manny's (Rico Rodriguez) and Lilly's (Aubrey Anderson-Emmons) lines tend to be one-note and predictable.  Little Lily speaks in wisecracks that are too cute by half; and there has always been a problem with the forced and overwritten nature of Manny's lines, which feel stilted, unnatural, and too obviously scripted.  It's not the young actor's fault that the writers saddled him with an unbelievably quirky character.
